div0.head: *g
div0.entryFree:
g, third letter in Gr. alphabet; as Numeral g/ =
three, third, thrice: also, with pr. n., *ba/ssos g/
B., son and grandson of B., IGRom.4.1587 (ii A. D.), etc.: but g' = 3,000 written for v, freq. in Hsch., as ganda/nein: a)re/skein, etc.
ga^, Dor. for ge, Ar.Ach.775, etc.; cf. e^gwga, tu/ga.
ga=, Dor. and Aeol. for gh=.
gabaqo/n: tru/blion, Hsch.; cf. za/batos.

gabala/n: e)gke/falon h)\ kefalh/, Id. ga/bena: o)cuba/fia h)/toi tru/blia, Id. gabergo/r (= ga_vergo/s),
labourer (Lacon.), Id.

*ga^ga/ths (sc. li/qos), ou, o(,
lignite, Orph.L.474, Plin.HN36.141, Dsc.5.128, Gal.12.203, Gp.15.1.32.
jet, Solin.22.11. = a)stra/galos, cj. in Ps.-Dsc.4.61. (From *ga/gas or *ga/ggai, a town and river in Lycia.)
gaggai/nein: to\ meta\ ge/lwtos prospai/zein, Hsch.
gagga^l-ia/w, = -i/zesqai, Hsch.
gagga^l-i/zw, later form of Att. gargali/zw, Phryn.77, Anacreont.5.7 (but the contrary is stated in Phryn. PSp.56 B.).
gagga^l-i/des: gelasi=noi, Hsch.

ga/gga^l-os, o(,
fickle person, Id.

gagga^m-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
fisher, Hsch.
gagga^m-euth/s, ou=, o(, = foreg., prob. in EM219.25.

ga/gga^m-on, to/,
small round net, esp. for oystercatching, Opp.H.3.81: metaph., me/ga doulei/as g. A.Ag.361(anap.): —also gagga/mh, h(, Str.7.3.18.
umbilical region, Poll.2.169 (gaggamw/n is f.l.).

gagga^m-oulko/s, o/n, (e(/lkw)
dragging an oyster-net, EM<*>19.23.
gaggali/as (leg. gaggali/das）: oi( me\n gelasi=non, oi( de\ th\n tw=n neu/rwn （e)ri/wn cod.) sustrofh/n, a)/lloi u(posta/qmhn, Hsch.
*gaggi=tis or *gaggh=tis li/qos, = *gaga/ths, Str.16.1.24: also *g. na/rdos, = *gagghtikh\ na/rdos, Dsc.1.7, Damocr. ap. Gal.13.1057.

gaggli/on, to/,
encysted tumour on a tendon or
aponeurosis, Philagr. ap.Aët.15.9 (*)aqhna= 21.29), Heras ap.Gal.13.815, etc.; also on the head, Paul.Aeg.6.39; the nerve-knots now called
ganglia are compared to such a tumour, Gal.UP16.5.

gaggliw/dhs, es,
of the ganglion kind, Hp.Art.40:—also gagglioeidh/s, e/s, Hsch.

ga/ggrain-a, h(, (gra/w ?)
gangrene, Hp.Mochl.33, 2 Ep.Ti.2.17, Dsc.1.61, Plu.2.65d, Gal.18(1).687.

gaggrain-iko/s, h/, o/n,
gangrenous, nomai/ Dsc.2.107: -ka/, ta/, Id.4.93. Adv. -kw=s Heliod.(?)ap.Orib. 47.16.1.

gaggrain-o/omai, Pass.,
become gangrenous, Hp.Art.63, Gal.18 (1).156.

gaggrain-w/dhs, es,
of the gangrene kind, Hp.Epid.7.110, Gal. 11.818.
gaggrai/n-wma, to/, = sq., Pall.Febr.7.

gaggrai/n-wsis, ews, h(,
becoming gangrenous: gangrenous affection, flebw=n Hp.Fract.11 (pl.), Mochl. 30 (pl.), Aret.SA2.10 (pl.).
*ga/da^ra [*ga^], wn, ta/, a town in Palestine, Str.16.2.29:—*ga^da^reu/s or *ga^da^rhno/s, o(, an inhabitant, Ev.Matt.8.28:—*ga^da^ri/s (sc. gh=), h(, the country, Str.l.c.
ga/daros, = gai+da/rion, Diogenian.5.36.
gadei=n, ga/desqai, = vad- (vhd-), Hsch.:—also gadeda=n: xai/rein, and gadew/: xara/, Id.

*ga/deira [*ga^], wn, ta/, Cadiz, Pi.N.4.69, etc.; Ion.*gh/deira Hdt.4.8: *ga^deiri/ths [i_], *ga^deireu/s, o(,
a man of Cadiz, St.Byz.:—Adj. *ga^deiriko/s, h/, o/n, ta/rixos Eup.186, Pl.Criti.114b; or *ga^deirai=os, a, on, as *g. porqmo/s the Straits
of Gibraltar, Plu.Sert.8. Adv. *ga^deiro/qen AP 14.121 (Metrod.), Euthyd. ap. Ath.3.116c.

*ga^deita/na, h(,
woman of Cadiz, courtesan, PGrenf.1.53.28（iv A. D.: gaeit- Pap.).
gadh/: ki/bwtos, Hsch.
ga/dic<is>: o(mologi/a, Hsch. (va/d-). ga=dos: ga/la, a)/lloi o)/cos, Id.

ga/dos, a
fish, = o)/nos, Dorio ap.Ath.7.315f. = ga/ndos (q.v.).
gaew/n, w=nos, o(, v. gaiw/n.

ga/za [ga_], h(,
treasure, Thphr.HP8.11.5, OGI54.22(iii B. C.), Epigr. ap.Str.14.1.39, LXX 2 Es.5.17, Act.Ap.8.27, etc.; e)k th=s basilikh=s g. D.S.17.35.
large sum of money, Plb.11.34.12. (Persian word.)

ga/zas, a
fish, Hsch.

*gazi/tion, to/,
Gaza measure, POxy.1924.8 (v/vi A. D.).

ga_zo-fu^la^ke/w,
to be a treasurer, D.S.17.74.

ga_zo-fu^la/kion [la^], to/,
treasury, OGI225.16 (Didyma, iii B. C.), LXX 4 Ki.23.11, Str.7.6.1, Ev.Luc.21.1, al.

ga_zo-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
treasurer, Phylarch.29, LXX 1 Ch.28.1, Str.16.2.40, J.AJ11.1.3, Plu.Demetr.25; written gazzo-, Syria 5.347 (Dura).
ga/qeudon: e)k gh=s r(e/on, Hsch.
ga_qe/w, ga/qw, Dor. for ghqe/w, gh/qw. gaqi/a: a)llanti/a, Hsch.

gai=a, h(, gen. gai/hs Hom. (and Antiph., v. infr.), Trag. gai/as, dat. gai/a| A.Pers.618, S.Aj.659, E.Med.736, etc., acc. gai=an: nom. gai/h only in late Poets, IG14.1935, etc.; Dor. gai/a_ ib.803 (Naples): pl. gai=ai Od. (v. infr.), LXX 4 Ki.18.35, al.:—poet. for gh=,
land, country, fi/lhn e)s patri/da gai=an to one's dear father
land, Il.2.140, al.; gai=a/n te teh\n dh=mo/n te Od.8.555: pl., ou)de/ tis a)/llh fai/neto gaia/wn 12.404, D.P.882.
earth, xuth\ g.
earth thrown up to form a cairn, Il.23.256; w)= g. kerami/, of potters'
earth, Eub.43, cf. Sannyr.4; ku/tos plasto\n e)k gai/hs Antiph.52.3; the forms gaiw=n, gai/ais, gai/as in codd. of LXX are written for gew=n, etc.
earth, as an element, u(mei=s . . u(/dwr kai\ g. ge/noisqe Il.7.99; e)mou= qano/ntos g. meixqh/tw puri/ Trag.Adesp.513; gai/hs kai\ u(/datos e)kgeno/mesqa Xenoph.33, cf. Emp.17.18, 109.1, etc.
the earth, Theoc.18.20: elsewh. *gai=a, as pr. n., Earth, Hes. Th.45, A.Eu.2, etc. (The usu. form in Hom.; used in Trag. metri gr. and by Com. in paratrag., v. supr.)
gaia/das: o( dh=mos (Lacon.), Hsch. gaia=tai: kertomei=, Id. (leg. glia=tai).

gai+da/rion, to/,
donkey, PAmh.2.153(vi/vii A. D.). (Arabic word.)
gaih-genh/s, e/s, poet. for ghgenh/s, A.R.3.1186.

gai/h-qen, Adv.
from the land, Opp.H.1.39.
out of the earth, e)kfu/etai g. Orac. ap.Eus.PE6.2（App.Anth.6.113);
from the earth, a)nasth/santes Orac. ib.5.9 (App.Anth.6.162).

gaih/-i+os, a, on,
sprung from Gaia or Earth, *tituo/n, *gaih/i+on ui(o/n Od.7.324, cf. AP14.23.
earthly, bi/ou brote/ou g. desma/ Nonn.D.37.4; mele/wn g. a)/xqos Eranos 13.88.

gaih/-oxos (also gaih-ou=xos, Hsch.), Dor. gaia/oxos, on, gaia/voxos IG5(1).213 (Sparta, v B. C.):—epith. of Poseidon,
earth-moving, earth-carrying, Il.13.43, al., A.Th.310(lyr.), cf. S.OC1072(lyr.): *gaia/oxos, abs., Il. 13.125, Pi.O.13.81, and so *gaia/voxos (v. supr.): also in pl., *gaa/oxoi, name of a contest, IG5(1).296.11 (Sparta). w)keano\s g. App.Anth.3.209.
protecting the country, gaia/oxe pagkrate\s *zeu= A.Supp.816(lyr.); gaia/oxo/n t' *)/artemin S.OT160(lyr.). = h)peirw/ths, Hsch. (In signf. 1 from gai=a and vex-: vox-, cf. o)/xea, Lat.
veho, Skt.
váhati, Germ.
be-wegen, etc. In signf. 11 from e)/xw (q. v.).)

gaih-fa/gos [a^], on,
earth-eating, of worms, Numen. ap. Ath. 7.305a; cf. gafa/gas.
gaiqula (d supra scr.): a)mpelo/prasa, Hsch.; cf. ghqulli/s.

gai+ko/s, h/, o/n,
concerning land, kri/ma SIG421.44(Thermon, iii B. C.).
gai/netai: a)nu/ei, Hsch.
ga/i+nos, Dor. = gh/i+nos (q. v.).
gaio-gra/fos [a^], o(, = gewgra/fos, Hsch.
gaio-do/ths, f.l. for gewdai/ths in Call.Fr.158.
gaio-me/trhs, ou, o(, = gewm-, Man.4.210.

gaio-no/mos, on,
dwelling in the land: inhabitant, A.Supp.54(anap.).
gaio/s: makroke/nths h)\ ko/ntos h)\ kolobo/s, Cyr., cf. Hsch.
gaio-fa/gos [a^], on, = gaihfa/gos, Nic.Th.784.

gaio-fa^nh/s, e/s,
earth-coloured, in Comp., Archig. ap. Orib.8.2.4（v.l. gew-）; to\ g.
the earthy appearance of the moon, Placit.2.30.1 codd.

gaio/w,
make land, make solid, Tz.H.1.907, al.

gai=sos, o( (or gai=son, to/, Ph.Bel.99.16, cf.AB88), a sort of
javelin, LXX Jo.8.18, Ju.9.7, Plb.6.39.3, 18.18.4, PTeb.230 (ii B. C.), D.S.13.57:—hence prob. Celtic pr. n. *gaisa/tai or gai/o-oi, oi(, expld. by Plb. as
mercenaries, 2.22.1. (Iberian word acc. to Ath.6.273f.)
gai+=tai: gewrgoi/, Hsch., EM223.29.

gai+tana/, ta/,
aseptic ligaments made in Gaul, Gal.10.942, Marcell. Empir.8.27.

gai/w, impf. gai/eskon Hsch.:—
rejoice, exult, Hom. only in Il., in phrase, ku/dei+ gai/wn Il.1.405, 5.906, 8.51; [*sfai=ros] moni/h| gai/wn Emp. 27.4. (ga/v-yw, v. ga/numai.)
gaiw/dhs, f.l. for gew/dhs in Plb.2.15.8.

gaiw/n, w=nos, o(,
heap of earth, boundary-heap, Tab.Heracl.1.136: gaew/n IG14.352ii 83 (Halaesa, pl.).

ga/ka: h(de/ws, gakei=ai: glukei=ai, ga/kou: h(du/, gluku/, gakou/dia: h(du/smata, and gakoupw/nhs: h(dupo/ths, Hsch. ga_ki/nas [i_], o(,
earthquake, Id., Eust.890.38:—also ga_ki_ni/as, o(, Hsch., and ga/ki_nos, o(, Att. acc. to EM219.41. gakto/s: kla/sma, Hsch. (vak-, cf. va/g-numi).

ga/la [^^], to/, gen. ga/laktos (also ga/lakos, dat. ga/laki Call.Hec. 1.4.4, prob. in Pherecr.108.18, cf. An.Ox.4.338), also tou= ga/la indecl., Pl.Com.238: dat. pl. ga/laci Pl.Lg.887d. (For glakt-, cf. Lat.
lac for
glact):—milk, a)melgo/menoi g. leuko/n Il.4.434, cf. Od.4.88, etc.; eu)/poton g., eu)trafe\s g., A.Pers.611, Ch.898; e)n ga/lakti w)/n, teqramme/nh, at
the breast, E.HF1266, Pl.Ti.81c; e)n ga/laci tre/fesqai Id.Lg.l.c. (so metaph., e)n sparga/nois kai\ ga/lacin ei)=nai, of art, Ael.VH 8.8); dido/nai ga/la X.Cyn.7.4; e)mplh=sai ga/laktos to fill full of
milk, Theoc.24.3: metaph., oi=)nos, *)afrodi/ths g. Ar.Fr.596. o)rni/qwn g. （o)/rniqos ga/la, = o)rniqo/galon, Nic.Fr.71.5, Dsc.2.144), prov. of rare and dainty things, Ar.V.508, Av.734, Mcn.936; to\ lego/menon, spaniw/taton pa/restin o)rni/qwn g. Mnesim.9, cf. Ach. Tat.Intr.Arat. 4 (expld. by Anaxag.22 as
white of egg, cf. Sch.Luc.Merc.Cond. 13). a)gaqo\n g. a good
wet-nurse, Call.Epigr.51; ou)d' ei) g. lagou=
ei)=xon . . kai\ taw(=s, kath/sqion Alex.123.
milky sap of plants, Thphr.HP6.3.4, etc.
the milky way, Parm.11, Arist.Mete. 345a12, Arat.476; but o( tou= ga/laktos ku/klos Euc.Phaen.p.4M., Gem.5.69.

ga/lagga,
galingale, Alpinia officinarum, Aët.1.131.

ga^la^qhno/s, h/, o/n,
sucking, young, tender, nebroi/ Od.4.336, cf. Anacr.51; te/kos Simon.52; a)/rnes Theoc.18.41, J.AJ6.2.2; galaqhna/ (sc. pro/bata) Hdt.1.183; (sc. xoiri/a) opp. te/leia, Pherecr.44, cf. Hp.Aff.43, SIG1015.32 (Halic., written galaqeino/s）; a)rnw=n kai\ xoi/rwn Crates Com.1; u(=s Pherecr.28, cf. Arist.HA603b25; bre/fh Clearch.17, cf. Theoc.24.31. (ga/la, qh=sqai.)
galai/rion, to/, and gala/tion, to/, = ga/lion, Dsc.4.95.

galakoqre/mmwn, on, gen. onos, (tre/fw)
milk-fed, prob. in Antiph. 52.4 for galakto-. galako/xrws, = galakto/xrws, nom.pl. -xroes Opp.C.3.478.
galakthfo/ros, on, = galakto-, BCH37.97 (ii/iii A. D.).
ga^lakt-i/as, ou, o(, with and without ku/klos, = galaci/as, Ptol.Alm. 8.2.

ga^lakt-ia/w,
give no milk, Poll.3.50; but galaktiw=ntes: ga/laktos mestoi/, Hsch.

ga^lakt-i/zw,
to be milky in appearance, Dsc.2.144, 175.
form a milky way, Phlp.in Mete.117.20.

ga^la/kt-ion, to/, Dim. of ga/la, M.Ant.5.4: in pl.,
fancy bread made with milk, Alciphr.Fr. 6.10.

ga^lakt-ismo/s, o(,
suckling, paidi/ou Mnesith. Cyz. ap. Orib.inc.15.17.

ga^lakt-i/ths [i_] li/qos, stone
which makes water milky, Dsc.5.132. galakti/ths, = galakti/s 11, Gloss.

ga^lakto-do/xos, on,
receiving, holding milk, Sch.Theoc.1.25.

ga^lakto-eidh/s, e/s,
like milk, milk-white, xrw=ma Placit.3.1.4.
ga^lakto-qre/mmwn, v. galakoqr-.
ga^lakto-ko/mos: poimh/n, Hsch.

ga^lakto-kra/s, gen. -kra=tos,
mixed with milk, Hdn.Gr.1.51, 2.759.

ga^lakto/omai, Pass.,
become milk or
milky, Thphr.CP1.7.3, Dsc. 3.48; th=| xroi/a| Antyll. ap. Orib.4.11.6, cf. Plu.2.968a.

ga^lakto-pa^gh/s, e/s,
like curdled milk, xrw/s AP5.59 (Rufin.); a)/rna ib.12.204 (Strat.).

ga^lakto-poie/w,
convert into sap, Tz.ad Hes.Op. 72.

ga^lakto-poihtiko/s, h/, o/n,
milk-producing, bota/nh EM232.37.

ga^lakto-poii/+a, h(,
production of milk, Sch. Vat. Nic.Th.944.

ga^lakto-posi/a, h(,
drinking of milk, Hp.Int.16.

ga^lakto-pote/w,
drink milk, Id.Morb.2.51, Int. 16, Thphr.HP9.15.4, Str.17.3.8. (Written ga^lakto-pwte/w by Ammon. p.111 V.)

ga^lakto-po/ths, ou, o(,
milk-drinker, Hdt.1.216, 4.186, E.El.169 (lyr.).

ga^lakto-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
milkseller, Gloss.

ga^lakto/-ru^tos, on,
flowing with milk, krh=nai Lyr.Alex.Adesp.37.11.

ga^lakto-trofe/w,
nourish with milk, LXX 4 Ma.13.21, Ph.2.82 (Pass.), PTeb.399.4 (ii A. D.).

ga^lakto-tro/fhsis, ews, h(,
nourishment with milk, Sch.rec.S.Aj.506.
ga^lakto-trofi/a, h(, = foreg., LXX 4 Ma.16.7, Ph.2.83, BGU297.14 (i A. D.).

ga^lakt-ourge/w,
make of milk, as cheese, Poll.1.251.
make milk, as a nursing woman, Sor.2.5.

ga^lakt-ourgo/s, o/n,
making milkdishes, Parmenion ap.Ath.13.608a.

ga^lakt-ouxe/w,
have or
suck milk, Poll.3.50; galaktouxou/shs prob. in Plu.2.64 of (galaktou/shs codd.).

ga^lakt-ou=xos, on, (e)/xw)
having or
sucking milk, Poll.3.50.

ga^lakto-fa^ge/w,
live on milk, Philostr.VS2.1.7. fa/gos [fa^], on,
milk-fed, Str.7.4.6, S.E.P.1.56.

ga^lakto-fori/a, h(,
giving milk, BGU 297.14 (i A. D.).

ga^lakto-fo/ros, on,
giving milk, PLond.1.3.22 (ii B. C.), J.BJ3.3.4, Opp.C.1.443; of food,
causing an abundant flow of milk, Sch.Nic.Th.553.

ga^lakto/-xrws, wtos, o(, h(,
milk-coloured, Philyll.4, Nausicr.2: neut. pl., galakto/xroa Dsc.3.47: nom. pl. galakto/xroes in Opp.C.3.478 is f.l. for galako/xroes.

ga^lakt-w/dhs, es, = galaktoeidh/s, u(gro/ths Arist.HA540b32; g. trofh/ Id.PA692a15; xumo/s Thphr.CP6.4.1.
milk-warm, tepid, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.5.30.38, Antyll.ib.9.23.9, Alex.Trall.Febr. 4.
mixed with milk, oi)=nos Hp.Epid.7.101.

ga^la/kt-wsis, ews, h(,
changing into milk, Thphr.CP4.4.7.
ga^l-a/na, ga^l-a_no/s, Dor. for -h/nh, -hno/s. galao/s, v. ga/lis.

ga/lac, akos, h(, a kind of
shell-fish, prob.
Mactra lactea, Arist.HA 528a23.

galac-ai=os, a, on,
milky, milk-white, Nonn.D.6.338, al.
galac-h/eis, essa, en, = foreg., r(e/eqra v.l. ib.22.18.

gala/c-ia, ta/,
festival at Athens in honour of Cybele,
at which a kind of milk-frumenty (galaci/a, h()
was eaten, IG22.1011.13, Thphr.Char.21.11, Hsch.

galac-i/as, ou, o(: (sc. ku/klos)
the milky way, D.S.5.23, Luc.VH1.16, Man.2.116, etc.; in full, g. ku/klos Placit.2.7.1, Sallust.4. (sc. li/qos) = li/qos mo/roxqos,
tailor's chalk, Dsc.5.134. = galeo/s 1, Gal.6.727 (v.l. galec-).
galac-iw/n, w=nos, o(, name of a Delian month, IG11 (2).203 A31, al. (Delos, iii B. C.).
galari/as, ou, o(, = o)ni/skos, Hsch.
ga/las: gh= (Cypr.), Euclus ap. Hsch.: gala/sion: e)nhro/sion, Hsch.

*ga^la/tai [la^], oi(, = *keltoi/ (but *keltoi\ kai\ *g. Arist.Fr.35), Plb.1.6.2, etc.: fem. sg. *gala/tissa, GDI2154.7 (Delph., ii B. C.):—Adj. *ga^la^tiko/s, h/, o/n, pe/lagos Arist.Mu.393a27; xw/ra Act.Ap.16.6; e)/rga ba/rbara kai\ *g. Plu.2.1049b. Adv. -kw=s, e)neskeuasme/nos Id.Oth.6.

*ga^la^ta/rxhs, ou, o(,
president of the provincial council of Galatia, OGI547.11 (Ancyra), etc.
gala/tion, v. galai/rion. galatmo/n: la/xanon a)/grion, Hsch.

ga/lbina xrw/mata, (Lat.
galbus) greenish-yellow shades of colour, PHolm.25.2.
galea/gkwn, v.l. for galia/gkwn (q. v.).

ga^lea/gra, h(,
weasel-trap or
weasel-cage, Hyp.Fr.34,239: metaph., ploi=on a)new|gme/nh g. Secund.Sent.17: generally,
cage for beasts, LXX Ez.19.9, cf. Hierocl.p.59A.; qhri/wn Str.6.2.6; used for prisoners, Plu.Phoc.33, App.Pun.4.

gale/h, contr. galh=, h=s, h(, a name given to various animals of the
weasel kind,
weasel, marten, polecat or
foumart, Batr.9, al., Ar.Ach. 255, Pl.693, Arist.HA609a17, al.; ei) dia/|ceien galh= (a bad omen) Ar.Ec.792, cf. Thphr.Char.16.3: prov., qu/ra di' h(=s galh= . . ou)k ei)se/rxetai Apollod. Car.6. g. a)gri/a wild
ferret (found in Africa and Spain, Hdt.4.192), Arist.HA580b26, Ruf.Fr.79, Str.3.2.6; g. *tarthssi/a Hdt. l.c., Diogenian.3.71. g. e)noiki/dios tame
weasel, Plu.2.446c; g. katoiki/dios Philum.Ven.33.1, Dsc.2.25. prov., galh=n e)/xeis, of bad luck, Diogenian.3.84; galh=| xitw/nion krokwto/n, of 'pearls before swine', Stratt.71, Zen.2.93; galh=| ste/ar, = batra/xw| u(/dwr (q. v.), Diogenian.3.83. a small
fish, distd. from galeo/s by Ael.NA15.11. (From galeya_, Adj. from *galis, cf. Skt.
girikā 'mouse', Lat.
glīs.）
ga^leo/-bdolon, to/, = galh/oyis, Dsc.4.94.

ga^leo-eidh/s, e/s, (galeo/s 1)
of the shark kind, oi( g. Arist.HA565a20:—more usu. ga^leo-w/dhs ib.505a5, al.

ga^leo/s, o(,
dog-fish or small
shark, Pl.Com.137, Arist.HA489b6; g. nebri/as,
Scyllium stellare, ib.565a26; g. a)steri/as ib.543a17, cf. Philyll. 1; g. lei=os,
Mustela laevis, Arist.HA565b2. = gale/h 1.3, oi( e)noika/dioi g. Aret.CD1.4.

ga^lero/s, a/, o/n, = galhno/s,
cheerful, Hsch., AB229. Adv. -rw=s cj. in AP12.50 (Asclep.).

galerwpo/s, o/n,
with cheerful, happy face, AB229.
galew/dhs, v. galeoeidh/s.
galew/numos, o(, = galeo/s 1, Philotim. ap. Gal.6.726.

ga^lew/ths, ou, o(,
gecko lizard, Ar.Nu.173, Arist.Fr.370.
sword-fish, = cifi/as, Plb.34.2.12, Str.1.2.15.
weasel, Luc. VH1.35; g. ge/rwn (transl. by
colore mustelino, Ter.Eun.4.4.21) Men.188.
galh=, h(, contr. for gale/h (q. v.).
ga/lh: e)ce/dras ei)=dos, kai\ e)n h(=| (leg. galh=） gale/a to\ zw=|on, Hsch.
ga^lhn-ai/h, h(, Ep. for galh/nh, A.R.1.1156.
ga^lhn-ai=os, a, on, = galhno/s, AP10.21 (Phld.); o)pwpai/ Epigr.Gr.403.2 (Sebastopolis). Adv. -aiws Sch.Od.7.319.
ga^lh/n-eia^, Dor. ga^la/neia^, h(, = galh/nh, E.IA 546 (lyr.), HF402 (lyr.), Hyps.Fr.3iii4 (lyr.).

ga^lh/n-h, h(,
stillness of the sea, calm (g. me\n e)n qala/ssh| nhnemi/a d' e)n a)e/ri Arist.Top.108b25, but cf. Od.5.452, 12.168), Hom. only in Od., leuk h\ d' h)=n a)mfi\ galh/nh 10.94; oi( d' e)lo/wsi galh/nhn will sail the
calm sea, 7.319;
stillness of deep waters, Coluth.360; nhnemi/as te kai\ g. Pl.Tht.153c; e)n tai=s g. kai\ eu)di/ais Arist.HA533b30: metaph. of the mind,
calmness, serenity, fro/nhma nhne/mou gala/nas A.Ag.740 (lyr.); e)n galh/nh| in
calm, quiet, S.El.899; g. e)n th=| yuxh=| Pl.Lg.791a.
lead sulphide, galena, Plin.HN33.95, 34.159. name of an
antidote, Androm. ap. Gal.14.32. (Aeol.gelh/nh (sic) acc. to Jo.Gramm.Comp. 3.1; perh. akin to gela/w.)
ga^lhn-h/s, e/s, = galhno/s, Arist.Phgn.811b38.
ga^lhn-ia/zw, = sq., Hp.Vict.2, Ph.1.276, Them.Or.1.17a:—Pass., aor. galhniasqh=nai Simp.in Epict.p.20 D.

ga^lhn-ia/w,
to be calm, find peace, xai/rei kai\ g. Epicur.Fr.425, cf. Opp.C.1.115, Them.Or.15.195a; Ep.part. galhnio/wn, -wsa, AP9.208, 5.34.7 (Rufin.).
ga^lhn-i/dion, Dim. of galh/nh, Gloss.

ga^lhn-i/zw,
calm, still, esp. waves or winds, Hp.Vict.3.71, E.Fr.1079. intr.,
become calm, prob. in Hp. Morb.Sacr.13;
to be calm or
tranquil, Alex.178.6, Ph.1.354; to\ galhni/zon th=s qala/tths Arist.Pr.936a5:—so in Med., Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.98.
ga^lh/n-ios, on, = galhno/s, Luc.Halc.2.
ga^lhnoba/ths [ba^], ou, o(, in pl., epith. of demons, PMag.Par.1.1364.

galhno/s, o/n （h/, o/n Cat.Cod.Astr.1.136),
calm, esp. of the sea, galh/n' o(rw= (neut. pl.) I see
a calm, E.Or.279; of persons,
gentle, Id.IT345; g. prosfqe/gmata Id.Hec.1160; galhnh\ e(/cis metw/pou Arist. Phgn.812a1; bi/os Pl.Ax.370d, Ph.1.411; to\ g. Them.Or.34p.459D.; as title, galhno/tatos despo/ths PGrenf.1.60.16 (vi A. D.). Adv. -nw=s D.L.9.45: Comp. -no/teron J.BJ1.28.2.
ga^lhno/ths, htos, h(, = galh/nh, S.E.P.1.10.

ga^lhnw/dhs, es,
calm, Sch.A.Pr.139.

galho/yis, ews, h(,
brownwort, Scrofularia peregrina, Dsc.4.94.

galhro/s, = galero/s, Hsch. galhyo/s, a
plant, Id., AB 230. ga/li: i(kano/n, Hsch.
gali/a: ei)=dos ploi/ou lh|strikou=, EM502.44.

galia/gkwn, wnos, o(,
weasel-armed, i. e.
short-armed, Hp.Art.12, al.:—more correctly written galea/gkwn in Arist.Phgn.808a31, 813a12, Plu.2.520c.
gali/ai: oi( o)ni/skoi, Hsch.
galia/w, = a)kolastai/nw, Com.Adesp.967.

ga^li^deu/s, e/ws, o(,
a young weasel, Cratin.265.
ga/linqoi (or ge/linqoi): e)re/binqoi, Hsch.
ga^li^obra^xi/wn [xi_], onos, o(, = galia/gkwn, coined by Gal.19.90.

ga/lion, to/,
bedstraw, Galium verum, Dsc.4.95 (expld. by Dsc. from ga/la because used in place of rennet).
ga/lis: galao/s, Hsch.

galla/zw,
practise cult of Cybele, Schwyzer633.12 (Eresus, ii/i B. C.).

gallai=os, a, on,
of a *ga/llos, g. *kube/lhs o)lo/lugma Rhian.67.
galleri/as, ou, o(, = o)ni/skos, Dorio ap.Ath.7.315f.
ga/lli, to/, = drw=pac, Aët.3.180.
ga/llia: e)/ntera, Hsch.
galli^ambiko\n me/tron, variety of Ion. metre used in cult of Cybele, Heph.12.3.

gallia/rios, o(,
footpad, cutpurse, PLips.40 ii 10 (iv A. D.).

galliko/s, h/, o/n, perh.
gelded, POxy.1836 (v/vi A. D.).
gallisti\ temei=n, prov. 'cut the Gordian knot', Macar.2.92.
galliw/tas, = galew/ths 1 (Lacon.), Hsch. ga/lloi: h(=loi, Id. (Aeol. va/lloi).

galloma^nh/s, e/s,
frenzied like a *ga/llos, Man.4.221.

*ga/llos, o(,
priest of Cybele, Schwyzer 633.11 (Eresus, ii/i B. C.), Arr. Epict.2.20.17, AP6.234 (Eryc.), 220 (Diosc.):—fem. form *gallai/ Lyr.Adesp.121.
eunuch, J.AJ4.8.40, PGnom.244, D.L.4.43.
ga/lminos, misspelling for ga/lbinos, Sammelb.2251.

ga^l-ourge/w,
make of milk, Poll.1.251.

ga^l-ouxe/w,
suckle, Sor.1.88, J.AJ2.9.5, A.D.Synt.278.1 codd., Sm.1 Ki.6.7:

ga^l-ouxi/a,
suckling, Gp.16.21.7:

ga^l-ou=xos, o(,
wet-nurse, Sor.1.89, Paul.Aeg.3.13. (Later forms for galakt-.)

ga/lows [a^], h(, gen. ga/low, dat. sg. and nom. pl. galo/w| Il.3.122, 22.473: Att. ga/lws, gen. ga/lw Hdn.Gr.2.236 (also gen. ga/lwtos acc. to EM220.18):—
husband's sister or
brother's wife, sister-in-law, Il. 6.378, al. (Cf. Lat.
glōs, Phryg. ge/laros: a)delfou= gunh/, Hsch.）
galwne/s: xrw=ma i(/ppwn to\ o)noeide/s, EM220.32.
gama/lh: ka/mhlos (Chald.), Hsch.

gambra/, h(, fem. of gambro/s,
sister-in-law, BGU827.29 (ii A. D.), PLond.2.403 (iv A. D.).

gambreu/w,
form connexions by marriage, pro/s tinas LXX De.7.3; tisi/ 2 Es.9.14:—Med.,
marry, v.l. ib. Ge.38.8:—Pass.,
to be connected by marriage, tini/ J.AJ14.12.1.
ga/mbrion: tru/blion, Hsch. ga/mbria: dw=ra h)\ dei=pna gambrou=, Id.

gambro-kto/nos, on,
bridegroom-slaying, Lyc.161.

gambro-poie/w,
make a son-in-law of, Tz.H.10.433.

gambro/s, o(,
connexion by marriage, Pi.N.5.37, A.Ag.708 (pl.): hence,
son-in-law, Il.6.249, Hdt.5.30,67, Democr. 272, E.Ph. 427, etc.
brother-in-law, i.e.
sister's husband, Il.5.474, 13.464, Hdt.1.73, etc.; or,
wife's brother, S.OT70. = penqero/s,
father-in-law, E.Hipp.635, Andr.641, LXXEx.3.1. Dor. and Aeol.,
bridegroom, wooer, Sapph. 103, Pi.P.9.116, Theoc.18.49, 15.129, Arat.248. (Cf. Skt.
jārá- (from
ĝ[mmacrnull]ró- 'lover'.)

gambrotideu/s, e/ws, o(,
son of a gambro/s, Iamb.Protr.21. kz/.

ga/mela, ta/,
offerings made on the occasion of a marriage, Michel 995B36 (Delph., v B. C.).
ga=men, Dor. for e)/ghmen, aor. 1 of game/w, Pi.P.3.91, Theoc.8.93.

ga^met-h/, h(, fem. of sq.,
married woman, wife, opp. concubine, [gunai=ka] kthth/n, ou) gameth/n Hes.Op.406, cf. Pl.Lg.841d, Lys.1.31 (pl.), Men.Pk.237, PTeb.104.17 (i B. C.), etc.; gameth=| a)lo/xw| Epigr.Gr.310 (Smyrna); so gameth/ alone, A.Supp.165 (lyr.), Arist.Fr.144, POxy.795.4 (i A. D.); te/kna kai\ gameta/s Phld.Ir.p.53 W., cf. Herc. 1457.10, al.

ga^me/t-hs, ou, o(,
husband, spouse, A.Pr.897 (lyr.), E.Tr.311 (lyr.), Euph.107.3; poet. word used by X.Cyr.4.6.3, and late, PLond.5.1711.53 (vi A. D.); Dor. gen. game/ta E.Supp.998 (lyr.):— fem. ga^me/tis, idos,
a wife, dub. in AP5.179 (Mel.), cf. IPE2.298.10 (Panticapaeum).
ga_metri/a, = gewmetri/a, Archyt.1, Perict. ap. Stob.3.1.121:—so ga_me/tras, for gewme/trhs, Tab.Heracl.1.187; ga_metriko/s Archyt. 2.

ga^me/w, fut. game/w Il.9.388,391, contr. gamw= A.Pr.764, S.OT1500, Ant.750, E.Or.1655, X.Cyr.5.2.12, etc.; later gamh/sw Plu.2.386c, Luc.Rh.Pr.8 (for gamh/seis Tim.52 leg. gamhsei/eis): aor. 1 e)/ghma Il. 14.121, etc.; later e)ga/mhsa LXXEs.10.3, Ev.Marc.6.17, Luc.
D Deor. 5.4, etc. (cf. infr. 11.2): pf. gega/mhka Ar.Lys.595, Pl.Lg.877e: plpf. e)gegamh/kei Th.1.126:—Med., fut. Ep. game/ssetai Il.9.394 codd., Att. gamou=mai E.Ph.1673, Ar.Th.900, later gamh/somai Plu.Art. 26, etc.: aor. e)ghma/mhn Od.16.392, Anacr.86, Is.5.5, etc.:—Pass., fut. gamhqh/somai J.AJ6.13.8, Ant.Lib.1.2, D.C.58.3, Hld.5.30, etc.: aor. e)gamh/qhn D.H.11.34, Str.10.4.20, etc.: poet. shortd. gameqei=sa v.l. in Theoc.8.91, cf. Eust.758.52: pf. gega/mhmai X.An.4.5.24, D. 36.32: plpf. e)gega/mhto App.BC4.23: (ga/mos):—
marry, i.e.
take to wife, of the man, *)adrh/stoio d' e)/ghme qugatrw=n one of his daughters, Il.14.121; e)/nqa d' e)/ghme gunai=ka Od.15.241; g. gunai=ka e)s oi)ki/a, like a)/gesqai, Hdt.4.78: c. acc. cogn., ga/mon gamei=n A.Pr.764,909; to\n *(ele/nhs ga/mon . . gh/mas E.IA 467; gh=mai ge/ktra basile/ws the king's daughter, Id.Med.594: rarely c. dupl. acc., ga/mous tou\s prw/tous e)ga/mee *ku/rou du/o qugate/ras (for prw=ton e)ga/mee . . qugate/ras) Hdt.3.88, cf. E.Tr.357; also ga/mw| g.
marry in lawful wedlock, D.39.26; e)k kakou=, e)c a)gaqou= gh=mai,
marry a wife of mean or noble stock, Thgn.189, 190; e)k meio/nwn X.Hier.1.28; e)k gennai/wn E.Andr.1279; para/ tinos ib.975, Pl.Plt.310c; e)pi\ qugatri\ g. a)/llhn gunai=ka set a stepmother over one's daughter, Hdt.4.154, cf. E.Alc.372; e)pi\ de/ka tala/ntois tina\ gamei=n
marry a wife with a dowry of ten talents, And. 4.13. of mere sexual intercourse,
take for a paramour, Od. 1.36, Luc.Asin.32; g. biai/ws sko/tion le/xos E.Tr.44. later of the woman, e)a\n gamh/sh| a)/llon Ev.Marc.10.12: abs., 1 Ep.Cor.7.28. Med.,
give oneself or
one's child
in marriage: of the woman,
give herself in marriage, i.e.
wed, c. dat., game/esqai tw=| o(/tew/| te path\r ke/letai Od.2.113; ghmame/nh w(=| ui(=i+: o( d' o(\n pate/r' e)cenari/cas gh=men 11.273: abs., Hdt.4.117; soi\ me\n gamei=sqai mo/rsimon, gamei=n d' e)moi/ A.Fr.13; ei)s tu/rann' e)ghma/mhn I
married into a royal house, E. Tr.474; gh/mato d' ei)s *maraqw=na, i. e. she
married Herodes of Marathon, IG14.1389 i 5 (h(/n t' e)gh/mato is f.l. for h(/ t' e)g. in E.Med.262): ironically of a henpecked husband, kei=nos ou)k e)/ghmen a)ll' e)gh/mato Anacr.86; so Medea to Jason, mw=n gamou=sa . . se/; did I
marry you? E.Med.606; e)ghma/mhn, of a man marrying a rich wife, Antiph.46; gamei=tai e(/kastos (sens. obsc.) Luc.VH1.22; o( gamhqei\s w(s parqe/nos ka)/peita geno/menos a)nh/r Phld.Sign.2; incorrectly, in later writers, ghma/menos Apollod.3.12.6, cf. Q.S. 1.728. of parents,
get their children married, betroth them,
get a wife for the son, *phleu/s qh/n moi e)/peita gunai=ka game/ssetai au)to/s (where Aristarch. ge ma/ssetai
will seek or
make suit for) Il.9.394:—Act. aor. 1 e)ga/mhsa in this sense, Men.885. Pass.,
to be taken to wife: hence,
marry a husband, Il.cc. ad init., PGrenf.2.76.11 (iv A. D.), etc.; rarely in correct authors, Poll.3.45.

ga^mh/gu^ris, ews, h(,
enrolment of youths in fratri/ai, EM221.4.
ga^mh/l-euma, to/, = ga/mos, A.Ch.624 (lyr.).

ga^mh/l-ios, on,
of or
for a wedding, bridal, nuptial, koi/th Id.Supp.805 (lyr.); te/los Id.Eu.835; xoai/ Id.Ch.487; le/ktra Id.Fr.242; eu)nh/ E.Med.673; ou)x h(=yan fw=s to\ g. Epigr.Gr.256.7 (Cyprus); zugo\n g. IG14.2125; of divinities,
presiding over marriage, Ath.5.185b, Poll.1.24; *)afrodi/ta E.Fr.781.17 (lyr.). as Subst., gamh/lios (sc. plakou=s), o(,
bride cake, Philetaer.13.5. gamhli/a (sc. qusi/a), h(,
wedding-feast, gamhli/an ei)sfe/rein toi=s fra/tersi contribute
the wedding feast for one's clansmen, D.57.69; toi=s f. u(pe/r tinos ib.43, cf.Is.3.79: abs., ib.76.

ga^mhl-iw/n, w=nos, o(, the seventh month of the Attic year, IG12.6.80, Arist.Mete. 343b5, Thphr.HP7.1.2, etc. (from game/w, bccause
it was the fashionable time for weddings).

ga^m-hsei/w, Desiderat. of game/w,
wish to marry, Alciphr.1.13, 3.37.

ga^m-h/simos, h, on,
marriageable, Gloss.

ga^m-hte/on,
one must marry, Plu.Demetr.14 (parody of E.Ph.395), Arr.Epict.3.7.10, Hermog. Prog.11.

ga^m-htikw=s, Adv.
with an inclination for marriage, Hsch. s.v. gamhsei/ein.

ga^m-i/zw,
give a daughter
in marriage, A.D. Synt.280.11, 1 Ep.Cor.7.38.

ga^m-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for marriage, no/moi Pl.Lg.721a; g. o(mili/a
connubial intercourse, Arist.Pol.1334b32; g. u(me/naios Pherecr. 12 D.; g. u(/mnos a
bridal song, Hippoloch. ap. Ath.4.130a, Porph.Marc.2; suggrafh/ POxy.1473.25 (iii A. D.); ta\ g.
bridal, wedding, Th.2.15;
questions of marriage-rights, Id.6.6, cf. Arist.Pol. 1304a14. Adv. -kw=s e(stia=n feast
as at a wedding, Id.EN1123a22. gamiko/n, to/,
marriage-contract, POxy.903.17 (iv A. D.). of persons,
of marriageable age, Epigr.Gr.288.7 (Cyprus): pr. n. in IG14.496.
*gami/lios, ou, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month in Epirus, GDI1339 (Dodona).
ga/m-ios [a^], a, on, = gamh/lios, me/los Mosch.2.124; eu)nh/ Opp.C. 3.149, cf. Nonn.D.1.69, al.; gami/hs e)lpi/dos e)ste/resen IG12(8).600 (Thasos).
gam-i/skw, = gami/zw, Callicrat. ap.Stob.4.28.18:—Med.(or Pass.) in Arist.Pol.1335a20; a)ndri/, of a woman, PLond.5.1708 (vi A. D.):—Pass., Ev.Marc.12.25.

ga/mma, to/, indecl.,
the letter g. X.Cyr.7.1.5, Oec.19.9, etc.:—also ge/mma Demoer.19. (Aram.
gamla' 'camel'.)

gamma^ti/skion, to/, Dim. of ga/mma,
ornament on official dress, Lyd. Mag.2.4.

gammoeidh/s, e/s,
shaped like a *g, oi)ki/a BGU1037.8 (i A. D.); of the top of the thigh-bone, Heliod. ap. Orib.49.13.3, cf. Hero Spir.1.28. Adv. -dw=s Nicom.Ar.1.19.

ga^mo-dai/sia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
wedding, A<*>l.NA12.34.

ga^mo-klope/w,
have illicit intercourse, Ps.-Phoc.3.

ga^mo-klo/pos, on, (kle/ptw)
adulterous, AP9.475, Tryph.45, Nonn.D.3.377, al.

ga^mo-poii/+a, h(,
celebration of a wedding, Ath.5.180c.
ga_mo/ros, o(, Dor. for ghmo/ros (q.v.).

ga/mos [a^], o(,
wedding, Il.5.4.29, al.; ga/moi ei)lapi/nai te 18.491; ga/mon teu/xein furnish forth
a wedding, Od. 1.277; g. dainu/nai 4.3; a)rtu/ein ib.770; ga/mon poiei=n Herod.7.86, Test.Epict.2.19: pl., ga/mous dittou\s e(stia=n Is.8.9; of a single wedding, oi)kosi/tous tou\s g. poiei=sqai Men.450; ga/mous poiei=n D.30.21, Ev.Matt.22.2; e)pitelei=n g. th=s qugatro/s Arist.Fr.549, cf. D.S.13.84; oi( keklhme/noi ei)s tou\s g. Diph. 17.2; e)n toi=s g. a)/klhtos ei)sdeduke/nai Apollod.Car.24.
marriage, wedlock, Il.13.382, etc.; a)/gein [gunai=ka] e)pi\ ga/mw| X.An.2.4.8; a)gage/sqai tina\ pro\s ga/mon Plu.Cat.Ma.24; to\n *oi)ne/ws g. the
marriage granted by O., S.Tr.792; g. qew=n tinos E.Tr.979, cf. IT25; ei)s g. tino\s e)lqei=n Id.IA1044 (lyr.); more freq. in pl., A.Pr.558 (lyr.), 739 (lyr.), Ag.1156 (lyr.), etc.; cf. game/w 1: also toi=s meqhmerinoi=s ga/mois, i.e.
prostitution, D.18.129; *pano\s a)naboa=| ga/mous, i.e.
rape, E.Hel.190 (lyr.); of
unlawful wedlock, as of Paris and Helen, Id.Tr. 932; ga/moi a)/rrenes Luc.VH1.22; g. a)ndrei=oi Procop.Arc.16.23:—E. Andr.103, X. Cyr.8.4.19, do not establish the sense of
a wife; for E.Tr.357, v. game/w 1.1. i(ero\s g.
ritual marriage, Men.320, Hsch., EM468.56; as a nickname, Anaxandr.34.2; name of play by Ale.Com. Pythag. name for
three, Theol.Ar.16; for
five, Plu.2.388c; for
six, Theo Sm.p.102H., Theol.Ar.33. *ga/mos personified, Philox.13, Lib.Or.5.27. name of month at Epidaurus, IG4.1485,1492. (Perh. akin to Skt.
jāmís 'brother or sister', Lat.
geminus.）

ga^mo-stole/w,
furnish forth a wedding, Sch.Pi.N.3.97.

ga^mo-stoliko/s, h/, o/n,
determining marriage, Vett. Val.119.8; to/pos
Cat.Cod. Astr. 5(1).203.

ga^mo-sto/los, on,
preparing a wedding, epith. of Hera and Aphrodite, Pisand. ap. Sch.E.Ph.1760, Epic.Alex.Adesp.9 iii 5, Orph.H.55.8, AP6.207 (Arch.); *(ume/naios ib. 7.188 (Ant. Thall.); nu/c Musae.282. Astrol., name for the seventh house of the horoscope, Paul.Al.M.2.
ga^mo-telei=n: ga/mous e)pitelei=n, Hsch.
gamfai/, ai(, = sq., Lyc.152.

gamfhlai/, w=n, ai(,
jaws of animals, as of the lion, Il.16.489; of the horse, 19.394; of Typhon, A.Pr.357;
bill or
beak of birds, E.Ion
159 (lyr.), cf. Ps.-Orac. in Ar.Eq.198: as Adj., u(po\ gamfhlh=|sin o)dou=sin (sic) Man.5.187 (s. v. l.): once in sg., gamfhlh/: h( gna/qos h)\ siagw/n, EM221.13.

gamy-o/s, h/, o/n,
curved, crooked, of the uterine ko/lpoi, Hp.
Nat Pucr.31; ke/rata Arist.HA630a31; r(u/gxos Id.PA662b2; o)/nuxes ib.662b5 (Comp.); a(/rpai Lyc.358. of birds of prey, = gamyw=nuc, Ar. Nu.337 (anap.).

gamy-o/ths, htos, h(,
crookedness, of talons, Arist. HA619b9.

gamy-o/w,
make curved: only used in Pass.,
to be or
become so, ib.619a17.
gamy-wlh/, h(, = gamyo/ths, Hsch., AB1356.

gamy-w=nuc, u^xos, o(, h(, (o)/nuc)
with crooked talons, of birds of prey, ai)gupioi\ gamyw/nuxes Il.16.428, Od.22.302; oi)wnoi/ A.Pr.488; ta\n g. parqe/non, of the Sphinx, S.OT1199 (lyr.); g. a(/rph Nonn.D.12.336, etc.:—also gamy-w/nuxos, on, Arist.HA563b20, GA750a11, Plu.2.727c; to\ g. Plot. 6.7.9, Iamb.Protr.21.iq/: pl., gamyw/nuxoi a)stakoi/ Epich.30; ta\ g., of beasts of prey, Arist.HA517b1, cf. 503a30.

gamywnu^xopantofi^la/rpa^sos, on,
snatcher of everything with curved talons, Lyr.in Philol.80.336.
ga=n: a)ggei=on sku/fw| paraplh/sion, Hsch.
ga/na (A) [a^], Dor., esp. Sicil., for gunh/, Greg.Cor.p.345S.
ga/na (B): xe/rsos, gh=, Hsch. gana/eis, cf.sq.11.2.
ganape/as: telei/as, and ganape/a: peli/a, Cyr. gana/ssas: kalw=s, Hsch. ganauge/as: te/leios e)n tw=| o(ra=n, Id.

ga^na/w, (ga/nos)
glitter, gleam, of metals; Hom. always in Ep. part., qw/rhkes lampro\n gano/wntes Il.13.265; ko/ruqes lampro\n gano/wsai 19.359: hence,
look fresh and smiling, prasiai\ . . e)phetano\n gano/wsai, of garden-beds, Od.7.128; na/rkisson . . gano/wnta h.Cer.10; xalkw=| gana/ontas e)fh/bous Mus.Belg.16.70 (Attica, ii A. D.); o)fqalmoi\ gano/wntes, in phthisis, Aret.SD1.8.
exull, rejoice, Opp.H.1.659. trans.,
make bright, Arat.190; cf. gana/ssai: smh=cai, h(du=nai, Hsch. gana/ontes
glorifying, Herm. for gana/entes, A. Supp.1019 (lyr.).
ganda/nein: a)re/skein, Hsch. ganda/w: la/mpw, Id. ga/ndion: kibw/tion, Id. ga/ndos: o( polla\ ei)dw\s kai\ panou=rgos: tine\s de\

ga/dos, Id. ga/ndoma: puroi/, a)/leura, Id. ga/nea: kh/pous, Id. (ko/pous cod.). ganei=n: leukai/nein, Id., EM223.44. gani=tai: da/panoi, a)/swtoi, Hsch. (cf. Lat.
ganeo).
ga/nnos, = gla/nos (Ephes.), Phlp.in GA149.20.
ga/nnua, perh. = ga/nea, Orph.Fr.47.5.

ga/nos (A) [a^], eos, to/, （gai/w, cf. ga/numai)
brightness, sheen, Sapph.127 (?), Supp.9.2.
gladness, joy, pride, la/fura . . a)rxai=on ga/nos A.Ag.579. of water and wine, from their
quickening and
refreshing qualities, xai/rousan ou)de\n h(=sson h)\ diosdo/tw| ga/nei sporhto/s (Pors. for *dio\s no/tw| ga=n ei), i.e. rain, ib.1392; krhnai=on g. Id.Pers. 483; g. a)mpe/lou, bo/truos, ib.615, E.Ba.261,383 (lyr.); also of honey, g. meli/sshs Id.IT634: abs.,
water, Lyc.1365; *)aswpou= g. E.Supp.1150 (lyr.). of a divine being, pagkrate\s g. Hymn.Curet.3.

ga/nos (B): para/deisos (Cypr.), EM223.48, cf. ga/nea; dub. in
Ber. Sächs.Gesellsch.1908.5 (Cypr.), IG12(2).58.17 (Mytilene). (Hebr.
gan 'garden'.)

ga^no/w,
make bright, polish, Plu.2.74e: metaph., ta\ pra/gmata toi=s eu)proswpota/tois tw=n e)piqe/twn ib.683e:—metaph. in Pass., a)lhqei/as fwti\ geganwme/na Dam.Pr.33,cf.26; a\h\r . . zofero\s kai\ oi(=on geganwme/nos Agath.5.3; e(oi=s e)ga/nwsen i)a/kxois
glorified, Epigr.Gr.985 (Philae);
make glad, delight, th\n yuxh/n Ph.1.121:—Pass.,
to be made glad, exult, tau=q' w(s e)ganw/qhn Ar.Ach.7, Ph.1.c., al.:—esp. pf. part. Pass. geganwme/nos
bright, xlani/s Phld.Vit.p.21 J.;
glad-looking, sti/lbwn kai\ geganwme/nos Anacr.13A; geg. u(po\ th=s w)|dh=s,
under the glamour of song, Pl.R.411a, cf. Phld.Mort.13, Plu.2.42c; geg. kai\ a)nqhro/s, of oratorical style, Id.TG2.
tin, lacker, a)ggei=on geganwme/non Crito ap.Gal.12.490; g. tw=| kassite/rw| Aët.12.55, cf. Eust.1188.61.

ga/nu^mai [a^], mostly pres.; impf. e)ga/nunto Q.S.5.652; e)ga/nuto Jul.Or.1.8c: Ep. fut. ganu/ssomai Il.14.504: pf. part. geganu_me/nos Anacreont.35.3, Them.Or.13.177a: plpf. e)gega/nuso ib.20.240d, al.:—
brighten up, be glad or
happy, ga/nutai fre/na he
is glad at heart, Il.13.493: c. dat., da/mar a)ndri\ fi/lw| e)lqo/nti ganu/ssetai 14.504, cf. 20.405, Od.12.43, Ar.V.612; g. e)pi/ tini E.IT1239 (lyr.); tino/s A. Eu.970 (lyr.), cf. E.Cyc.504 (lyr.); u(po\ tou= lo/gou Pl.Phdr.234d.—Freq. in later Prose, Ph.1.36,56, Plu.2.1098f, Polyaen.1.18, Jul.Or.1.40b, al., Them. ll.cc.; a)/|dwn kai\ ganu/menos Aristid.Or.50(26).40; freq. written gann- in codd. (ga-n-u-from root gau-, cf. gai/w, gau=ros.)
ganu/mata: a)rtu/mata, AB230 (ganu/rm- Hsch.). ganuro/n: leuko/n, h(du/, i(laro/n, Hsch.:—also ganero/n, EM223.46.
ga^nu/skomai, Dep., = ga/numai, Them.Or.2.26d, 21.254c: c. gen., g. tou= to/pou Socr.Ep.18.
ganutelei=n: ganopetei=n, h(du/smata poiei=n, Hsch.

ga^n-w/dhs, es,
bright: of ground,
rich, Thphr.HP6.5.4.

ga^/n-wma, atos, to/, = ga/nos,
brightness, brilliance, prob. in IG4.1484.97 (Epid., iv B. C.), Plu.2.48d, 50a.
joy, gladness, Ph.1.335, al.
lacker, e)/stw to\ g. tou= xalkou= mo/libdos Aët.6.58. metaph. of internal
membranes or
coats, to\ g. tw=n e)nte/rwn Alex.Trall.9.3, cf. Sever.Clyst.p.34D.

ga^/n-wsis, ews, h(,
polishing (with oil or wax), a)ga/lmatos Plu.2.287c, cf. Vitr.7.9.4;
varnishing, lackering, Aq.Am.7.7. metaph.,
making glad, brighiening, Phld.Mus.p.30 K.

ga^n-wth/s, ou=, o(,
tinsmith, Gloss.

ga^n-wto/s, h/, o/n,
tinned, polished, lackered, a)ggei=on Aët.12.1.

ga_odi/kai [i^], oi(,
arbitrators in territorial dispute, SIG421.45 (Thermon, iii B. C.).
ga_orge/w, Thess., = gewrge/w, IG9(2).1229.16 (Phalanna).
ga/pedon, to/, Dor. for gh/pedon, IG4.823.58 (Troezen).
gapelei=n: a)melei=n, Hsch. ga/pos: u)/xhma (Tyrrhen.), Id.

ga/potos [a_], on,
to be drunk up by Earth, g. xu/sis, g. xoai/, g. timai/, of libations, A.Ch.97,164, Pers.621.

ga/ptwma (sic), prob. gnampt-,
curvature, BCH23.178 (Pisid.).
ga/rabos: o)lolugw/n, Hsch.

ga^ra/rion, to/,
jar for ga/ros, BGU781 iii7 (i A. D.), etc.
ga/rga: ai)/geiros, Hsch.

gargai/rw, (ga/rgara)
swarm with, a)ndrw=n a)ri/stwn pa=sa g. po/lis Cratin.290, cf. Ar.Fr.359; a)rgurwma/twn e)ga/rgairen a( oi)ki/a Sophr.30 (e)ma/rmairen codd. Ath.): c. dat., po/ntos e)ga/rgaire sw/masin Tim.Pers. 107.
ga/rgala, = ga/rgara, Hsch.
garga/lh, h(, = e)reqismo/s, Erot. s.v. gargalismo/s.
gargalh/s, e/s, prob. f.l. for dusgarg-, Ael.NA16.9.

garga^l-i/zw,
tickle, titillate, Pl.Phlb.47a, Epicur.Fr.411; au)to\s au(to\n ou)qei\s g. Arist. Pr.965a11:—Pass., gargali/zesqai mo/non a)/nqrwpon Id.PA673a6, cf. EN1150b22: also, generally,
feel tickling or
irritation, Pl.Phdr.251c. metaph., ta\ ta\s ai)sqh/seis gargali/zonta h(de/a Phld.Mus.p.33K., cf. Ph.2.352; ta\ w)=ta g. Aristid.Or.34(50).16, cf. Luc.Cal.21; also of pain, a\lghdw\n -ousa Plu.2.1088a:—Pass., gargalizome/nou tou= sw/matos Plot.6.7.34.

garga^l-ismo/s, o(,
tickling (ge/lws dia\ kinh/sews tou= mori/ou tou= peri\ th\n masxa/lhn Arist.PA673a8), Hp. Alim.26, Pl.Smp.189a (pl.), Phdr.253e, Epicur.Fr.412 (pl.); e)n tw=| sw/mati die/drame g. Hegesipp.1.16; h(donh\ gargalismou= e)fi/etai Ph.1.118, cf. 212 (pl.), Plu.2.765c: ga/rgalos, o( (more Att. acc. to Moer., cf. Ar. Th.133), and garga/lh, h(, are cited by Erot. s.v. gargalismo/s, fr. Ar.Fr.175 and Diph.25.
ga/rganon, to/, v. ta/rganon.

ga/rga^ra, ta/,
heaps, lots, plenty, a)ndrw=n Aristomen.1; a)nqrw/pwn Alc.Com.19.

garga^rew/n, w=nos, o(,
uvula, Hp.Prog.[23], Arist.Resp.474a20; g. a)nespasme/nos Hp.Epid.3.1.s/, cf. Gal.UP7.5. a
morbid condition thereof, = stafulh/, Hp.Aff.4.
trachea, Arist.HA492b11.
gargarh/s: qo/rubos, Hsch.

garga^r-i/zw,
gargle, Sch.Il.8.48 (but f.l. for gargal- in Gal.11.352).

garga^r-ismo/s, o(,
gargling, Alex.Trall.5.4.

garga^r-iste/on,
one must gargle, Orib.Fr.19.
garga/rtai: li/qoi au)tofuei=s, Hsch. ga/rgasis: garga/lh u(postaqmou=, Id.

ga^re/laion, to/,
paste made of ga/ros
and oil, Gal.6.716.

ga^rhro/n, to/,
pot of ga/ros, POxy.1299.8 (iv A. D.), etc.

gari=nos, o(, an unknown
fish, Marcell.SId.37.
ga/rion [a^], to/, Dim. of ga/ros, Arr.Epict.2.20.29, POxy.1759.9 (ii A. D.).

ga^ri/skos, o(, an unknown
fish, Marcell.SId.33.

ga^ri_tiko/s, h/, o/n,
made to hold ga/ros, bi=kos PSI5.535.36 (iii B. C.).

ga/rka, h(,
rod (Maced.), Hsch.

ga/rkon, to/,
axle-pin, EM221.45: ga/rnon, Poll.1.145, Hsch.

ga^ropw/lhs, o(,
seller of ga/ros, PBaden 42.9 (ii A. D.), Gloss.

ga/ros [a^], o(, a kind of
sauce or
paste, made of brine and small fish, to\n i)xqu/wn g. A.Fr.211; tarixhro\s g. S.Fr.606, cf. Cratin.280, Pherecr.173, Pl.Com.198, Alciphr.1.18; of the
fish itself, Ruf. Podagr.10 (Lat. version):—also ga/ron, to/, Str.3.4.6, and ga/ros, ous, to/, POxy.937.27 (iii A. D.).

ga_ro/tas, a, o(, (gh=, a)ro/w) Sicilian for a
bullock, Athanis 1, = Dionys. Trag.12.

ga/rra: r(a/bdos, Hsch. ga/rrhs: a)/rrhs (i. e. va/rrhs, = a)/rrhn), Id. garri/ai: ga/moi, Id. garriw/meqa: loidorou/meqa, Id. ga/rsana: fru/gana (Cret.), Id. ga/sos, o(,
cheat, rogue, Id.
ga/ssa, h(, acc. to Hsch., = h(donh/. (Perh. akin to ghqe/w.)

gastero-plh/c, plh=gos, o(,
glutton, Eust.1837.39.
gastero/-xeir, xeiros, o(, h(, = gastro/xeir (q. v.), Str.8.6.11.

gasth/r, h(, gen. e/ros, gastro/s: dat. -e/ri, gastri/ (the longer forms in Ep., Lyr., and once in Trag., E.Cyc.220): dat. pl. gasth=rsi Hp. Morb.4.54, gastra/si D.C.54.22:—
paunch, belly, Il.13.372, etc.; g. a)spi/dos
the hollow of a shield, Tyrt.11.24;
belly or
wide part of a bottle, Cratin.190.
the belly, as craving food, ke/letai de/ e( g. Od.6.133; bo/skein h(\n gaste/r' 17.228; gaste/ri d' ou)/ pws e)/sti ne/kun penqh=sai, i. e. by fasting, Il.19.225; e)n gastro\s a)na/gkais A.Ag.726 (lyr.); to express
gluttony, gaste/res oi)=on Hes.Th.26; g. a)rgai/ Epimenid.1; e)gkra/teia gastro\s kai\ potou= X.Cyr.1.2.8, cf. Oec.9.11; gastro\s e)gkrath/s master of
his belly, Id.Mem.1.2.1; opp. gastro\s h(/ttwn, ib.1.5.1; gastri\ douleu/ein, xari/zesqai, to be the slave of
his belly, ib. 1.6.8, 2.1.2; g. delea/zesqai ib. 2.1.4; th=| g. metrei=n th\n eu)daimoni/an D.18.296; ta=s gastro\s fei/desqai, com. of one who has nothing to eat, Theoc. 21.41.
paunch stuffed with mincemeat, sausage, haggis, Od.18.44, 118, 20.25, Ar.Nu.409.
womb, o(/ntina gaste/ri mh/thr . . fe/roi Il.6.58; e)k gattro/s from
the womb, from
infancy, Thgn.305; e)n gastri\ e)/xousa big with child, Hdt.3.32; u(=n e)/xousan e)n g. PFlor.130.3 (iii A. D.); e)n g. fe/rousa Pl.Lg.792e; e)n g. labei=n
conceive, Arist.HA 632a28, AP11.18 (Nicarch.), LXX Ge.30.41, al.; sullamba/nein v.l. ib. Ge.25.21, cf. Ev.Luc.1.31; e)s g. ba/llesqai Hdt.3.28; kata\ gastro\s e)/xein Vett. Val. 193.33; fe/rein Gp. 16.1.3; also gunh\ e(pta\ h)/dh gaste/ras dustokou=sa Philostr.VA3.39. (Perh.for grasth/r, cf. gra/w.)

ga/stra, Ion. gastero/-trh, h(,
the lower part of a vessel
bulging out like a paunch, tri/podos Il.18.348, Callix.2, Hero Spir.2.16;
hull of a ship, Sch.Th.1.50. a
vase with such a belly, Aen.Tact.4.2 (prob. l.), PSI4.420.25 (iii B. C.), IG12(3).174.26 (Astypalaea), J.BJ 2.14.5, Dsc.5.88, Gp.14.8.2, etc.
architectural member of similar shape, Milet.7.59, BCH29.460 (Delos). = gasth/r 1, dub. in Eratosth.18.
back of the thigh, Hsch. (pl.). = gogguli\s h)\ kra/mbh, Id.

gastrai/a, h(, a kind of
turnip, Lacon. word, Hsch.; restored in Ath.9.369a for gaste/ras or gaste/as.

gastra^fe/ths, ou, o(,
stomach-bow, Hero Bel.81.2.

gastrh/sios, =
castrensis, Edict.Diocl.3.8 (Aegina).
gastri/an: stro/fon h)\ dia/noian, Hsch.
gastri/dion, to/, Dim. of gasth/r, gastri/on, Ar.Nu.392.

gastri/doulos [i^], o(,
a slave to one's belly, D.S.8.18.

gastri/zw, (ga/stris)
punch a man
in the belly, Ar.Eq.273 (Pass.), 454, V.1529.
stuff, gorge, to\n paidagwgo/n D.Chr.66.11, cf. Luc. DMeretr.10.4 (Phryn. 76 is incorrect):—Pass.,
to be stuffed full, eat gluttonously, Theopomp. Hist.187, Men.Pk.98, Posidon.18, Luc.Rh. Pr.24, Alciphr.3.45; i(kanw=s gegastri/smeqa Ath.3.96f. gastri/zwn sfugmo/s, term invented by Archig., Gal.8.665.

gastri^-marge/w,
to be gluttonous, Ph.2.22.

gastri^-margi/a, h(,
gluttony, Hp.Int.6, Pl.Phd.81e (pl.), Eus.Mynd.9, Andronic. Rhod.p.572 M.; pl., Luc.Am.42.

gastri^/-margos, on,
gluttonous (cf. lai/margos), Pi.O. 1.52, Arist.EN<*>118b19, Xanth.12, Cerc.16.2, Nic.Dam.p.22 D., etc.: Sup. -o/tata, qhri/a Ph.2.22.

gastri/on, to/, Dim. of gasth/r,
paunch, SIG1002.9 (Milet., v/iv B. C.);
sausage, Archestr.Fr.47, Com.Adesp.394, Milet.6.21 (v B. C.).
cake, made with sh/samon (Cret.), EM221.45. Dim. of ga/stra 11, Herm.in Phdr.p.202A.

ga/stris, idos or ews, o(, h(,
pot-bellied, pi/qos Ael.NA14.26: as Subst., = ga/stra, IG11(2).154A69 (Delos, iii B. C.). as Subst.,
glutton, Ar.Av.1604, Th.816, Jul.Or.5.176c: Comp. gastri/steros
more of a glutton, Pl.Com.195: as Adj., ga/stris h(donh/ Ph.1.261.
affected with tapeworm, Hsch.
cake, made in Crete, Chrysipp. Tyan. ap. Ath. 14.647f.

gastrismo/s, o(,
gluttonous eating, Sophil.6.

gastro-ba^rh/s, e/s,
heavy with child, AP5.53 (Diosc.).
gastro-bo/ros, on, = gastri/margos, Poll.2.168,175.

gastro-eidh/s, e/s,
paunchlike, round, nau=s Plu.Per.26: in Eust.1684.28 gastro-oi/dhs (leg. gastroi/dhs).
gastroii/+s, i/dos, h(, = foreg., Pherecr. 143.5 (pl.).

gastro-knh/mh,
calf of the leg, Gal.14.708, v.l. in Hp. Off.9:—also gastro-knhmi/a, Ion. -ih, h(, Hp.Art.60, Arist.HA494a7, BGU183.3 (i A. D.), Luc.VH1.22, Gal.2.316; and gastro-knh/mion, to/, Poll.2.190, PFay.90.8 (iii A. D.).

gastro-logi/a, h(, the Greek
Almanach des Gourmands, written by Archestratus, Ath.3.104b, 7.278b; also cited by the title of h( gastronomi/a, Id.1.4e, 2.56c.

gastro-manteu/omai,
divine by the belly, Alciphr.2.4, 15.
gastro-nomi/a, v. gastrologi/a.

gastro-pi/wn [i_], onos, o(, h(,
a pot-bellied person, D.C.65.20.

gastr-o/pths, ou, o(,
vessel for cooking sausages, Demioprat.ap. Poll.10.105:—fem. gastr-opti/s IG11(2).161B128 (Delos, iii B. C.), but gastropoti/s ib. 199B79.

gastro-rra^fi/a, h(, (r(a/ptw)
sewing up of a belly-wound, Scrib. Larg.206, Gal.10.416, Antyll. ap. Orib.44.23.46.

gastro/-rroia, h(,
diarrhoca, Lyd.Ost.33, Steph.in Hp.1.87D.

gastro-to/mos, on,
opening bellies, for embalming, Man.4.267.

gastro-fore/w,
bear in the belly of a bottle, AP9.232 (Phil.).

gastro-fo/ros, o(,
bearer of ga/stra 11, PLond.1821.

gastro-xa/rubdis [xa^], ios, o(, h(,
with a gulf of a belly, Cratin.397.

gastro/-xeir, xeiros, o(, h(,
living by one's hands, written gastero/xeir in Str.8.6.11, EM221; cf. xeiroga/stwr, e)gxeiroga/stwr.

gastrw/dhs, es, = gastroeidh/s,
pot-bellied, Ar.Pl.560: generally,
convex, bulging, Hp.Medic.7, Gal.19.120.

ga/strwn, wnos, o(, = ga/stris,
pot-belly, Alc.37 B, Ar.Ra.200, Ph. 1.686.
gateilai/ (gata/lai cod.): ou)lai/, Hsch.; cf. w)teilh/.

ga_to/mos, on, Dor. for gh/-tomos,
cleaving the ground, di/kella A.Fr. 196, cf. AP6.95 (Antiphil.), Hsch. s.v. tmh/gas.

gauliko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a gau=los 11, xrh/mata g.
its cargo, X.An.5.8.1 (v.l. gaulitika/).
gauli/s, i/dos, h(, = sq., Opp.C.1.126.

gauna/kh, h( (in Lat. form
gaunaca), and gauna/khs, o(, PSI4.340.22 (iii B. C.); = kauna/khs, Gloss.:—Dim. gauna/kion PAmh.2.144.22 (v A. D.).

gau/rhc, hkos, o(, (gau=ros)
a braggart, Alc.37 B, cf. Hsch. s.v.

gaur-i/a_ma, atos, to/,
arrogance, exultation, LXX Ju.10.8, Phld. Mort.18, Plu.Aem. 27, etc.

gau=r-os, on,
exulting in, bostru/xoisi Archil.58; o)/lbw| E.Supp. 862: abs.,
haughty, disdainful, Id.Fr.788, Ar.Ra.282; g. kai\ mete/wros
Luc.Nigr.5, cf. Jul.Caes.319d; in good sense,
splendid, D.Chr. 67.5 (Comp.), D.C.68.31; epith. of e)/fhboi, IG7.544,545 (Tanagra); also,
skittish, mo/sxw gaurote/ra Theoc.11.21: to\ g., = gauro/ths, to\ g. e)n fresi\n kekthme/noi E.Supp.217; ta\ gau=ra Babr.43.6. Adv. Sup. gauro/tata, ei)pei=n Max. Tyr.7.7. (Cf. gai/w.）

gaur-o/ths, htos, h(,
exultation, Plu.Marc.6; of a horse or ass, Id.Pel.22, Mar.38.

gaur-o/w,
make proud, only aor. e)gau/rwsa Plu.Cor.15, D.C.55.6 (unless gaurw=n 'overriding' (of xro/nos) is to be read in E.Fr.52.8): elsewh. Pass. gauro/omai, = gauria/w,
exult, sth= de\ para\ li/mnhn gaurou/menos Batr. 262a; le/wn gaurou/menos Ph.2.125: c. dat.,
pride oneself on, mh\ gaurou= sofi/h| Ps.-Phoc.53; plou/tw| gaurwqei/s PFlor.367.11 (iii A. D.); canqoi=s bostru/xois gaurou/menos E.Or.1532, cf. Ba.1144; e)pi\ tw=| e)/rgw| gaurou=ntai X.Hier.2.15: impf. e)gaurou/mhn Babr.43.15, D.C.53.27: fut. -wqh/somai LXX Nu.23.24 (v.l. gauri-): aor. e)gaurw/qhn PFlor.367.11 (iii A. D.), D.C.48.20: pf. gegau/rwmai LXX Wi.6.2.

gau/r-wma, atos, to/,
subject for boasting, E.Tr.1250, Aristid.Or.28(49).124.

gausa/das: yeudh/s, Hsch. gausali/ths, an Indian
bird, Id.

gau/sa^pos, o(, = Lat.
gausa^pa, Str.5.1.12: gausa/phs, Varr. ap. Prisc.Inst.7.56.

gauso/omai,
to be bent, pf. Pass. gegau/swtai Sor.Fract.19:—Act., gausw=sai, Hsch.

gauso/s, h/, o/n, or gau=sos, h, on (accent uncertain, Gal.18(2).518; codd. of Hp. have gau=sos but gausoi/),
crooked, bent outwards, mhro/s Hp.Fract.20, Art.77.

ga_fa/gas, a, o(, Dor. word (Syrac., EM221.49),
earthworm, Hsch., AB230.
ga/futon: ghgene/s, Hsch.
gdou=pos, gdoupe/w, poet. forms for dou=pos, doupe/w (esp. in compds., e.g. e)ri/gdoupos, e)rigdoupe/w）, e)pi\ d' e)gdou/phsan Il.11.45.

ge, Dor. and Boeot. ga, enclitic Particle, giving emphasis to the word or words which it follows. with single words,
at least, at any rate, but often only to be rendered by italics in writing, or emphasis in pronunciation: to\ ga\r . . sidh/rou ge kra/tos e)sti/n such is the power of
iron, Od.9.393; ei)/ pou ptwxw=n ge qeoi\ . . ei)si/n if the poor
have any gods to care for them, 17.475; ma/lista/ ge 4.366; o(/ g' e)nqa/de lew/s
at any rate the people here, S.OC42, etc.: with negs., ou) du/o ge not
even two, Il.5.303, 20.286; ou)/koun fqo/ggos ge not
the least sound, E.IA9. with Pronouns: with Pron. of 1st Pers. so closely joined, that the accent is changed, in e)/gwge, e)/moige (also e)/gwga Lacon., but e)gw/nga, i)w/nga Boeot.): in Hom. freq. with Art. used as Pron., v. o(/ ge: with demonstr. Pronouns, kei=no/s ge, tou=to/ ge, etc.: in Com. coalescing with -i/ final, au(thgi/ Ar.Ach.784; toutogi/, tautagi/, etc., Id.V.781, Pax1057, etc. (but e)ngetauqi/ Th.646): after possess. Pronouns, e)mo/n ge qumo/n Il.20.425, etc.: freq. after relat. Pronouns, o(/s ge, oi(/ ge, etc., oi(/ ge/ sou kaqu/brisan S.Ph.1364; o(/s g' e)ce/lusas dasmo/n Id.OT35, etc.; o(/son ge xrh/|zeis
even as much as . . , ib.365; oi(=o/n ge/ moi fai/netai Pl.R.329a: rarely with interrog. Pronouns, ti/na ge . . ei)=pas
; E.Tr.241; poi/ou ge tou/tou plh/n g' *)odusse/ws e)rei=s
; S.Ph.441. after Conjunctions, to emphasize the modification or condition introduced by the subjoined clause, pri/n ge, before
at least, sts. repeated, ou) me\n . . o)i/+w pri/n g' a)popau/sesqai, pri/n ge . . ai(/matos a)=sai *)arh=a Il.5.288, cf. Od.2.127; pri\n a)/n ge or pri/n g' a)/n, Ar.Eq.961, Ra.78, etc.; o(/te ge Pl.Phd.84e; o(po/te ge S.OC1699; e)pei/ ge X.An.1.3.9; e)peidh/ ge Th.6.18; o(/pou ge X.Cyr.2.3.11; ei)/ ge, e)a/n ge, if
that is to say, if
really, Th.6.18, Pl.Phdr.25<*>c; also simply to lay stress on the condition, ka)/n ge mh\ le/gw and
if I do not . . , Ar.Ach.317; ei)/per ge if
at any rate, Hdt.7.16.g/, 143, etc.; w(/ste ge (v.l. w(/s ge), with inf., so far
at least as to . . , Pl.Phdr.230b; w(/s g' e)moi\ xrh=sqai krith=| E.Alc.801; w(/s ge or w(/sper ge as
at least, S.Ant.570, OT715, etc.:—ge may follow te, when te is closely attached to the preceding word, w(s oi(=o/n te/ ge ma/lista X.Mem.4.5.2, Pl.R.412b; e)a/nte ge Id.Plt.293d; oi(/ te/ ge Id.Grg. 454e:—for its use in opposed or disjunctive clauses, v. infr. 11.3. after other Particles, kai\ mh\n . . ge, ou) mh\n . . ge, with words intervening, X.Mem.1.4.12, E.Alc.518, etc.; after a)/n in apodosi, when preceded by ou) or kai/, Id.Ph.1215, Or.784; a)/tar . . ge but
yet, Ar.Ach. 448; kai/toi ge, v. kai/ toi; a)lla/ ge (without intervening words) is f.l. in Pl.Hp.Ma.287b (leg. a)ll' a)/ge), R.331b (a)lla/ ge e(/n codd., a)lla\ e(/n ge Stob.); a)lla/ ge dh/ dub. in Id.Phdr.262a; later, Plu.2.394c, Ael.NA10.49 codd.: but, when preceding other Particles, ge commonly refers to the preceding word, while the Particle retains its own force: but sts. modifies the sense of the following Particle, ge mh/n
nevertheless, pa/ntws ge mh/n Ar.Eq.232, cf. E.El.754, X., etc.; Ep. and Ion. ge me/n Il.2.703, Od.4.195, Hdt.7.152; ge me\n dh/ A.Ag. 661, S.Tr.484; ge me/ntoi Pl.Tht.164a, X.An.2.3.9, etc.: ge dh/ freq. strengthens an assertion, A.Pr.42, Th.2.62, etc.; oi)o/meqa/ ge dh/ Pl.Euthd.275a (cf. also 11.1); ge/ toi, implying that the assertion is
the least that one can say, Ar.V.934, Pl.424,1041, etc.; ge/ toi Pl. Grg.447b; ge/ toi dh/ S.OT1171, Pl.Phdr.264b; ge/ toi/ pou Id.Lg. 888e; ge dh/pou Id.Phd.94a, etc.; ge/ pou
at all events, any how, Ar. Ach.896, Pl.R.607d, 478a, etc.; for ge ou)=n, v. gou=n. exercising an influence over the whole clause: epexegetic,
namely, that is, *dio/s ge dido/ntos
that is if God grant it, Od.1.390; klu=qi, *posei/daon . . , ei) e)teo/n ge so/s ei)mi if
indeed I am really thine, 9.529: hence to limit, strengthen or amplify a general assertion, a)nh\r . . o(/stis pinuto/s ge any man—
at least any wise man, 1.229; freq. preceded by kai/, usu. with words intervening, h)= mh\n keleu/sw ka)piqwu/+cw ge pro/s
ay and besi <*>es that . . , A.Pr.73; parh=sa/n tines kai\ polloi/ ge some,
ay and a great many, Pl.Phd.58d; kai\ geloi/ws ge Id.R.531a; freq. with the last term in an enumeration, tau/th| a)/ra . . prakte/on kai\ gumnaste/on kai\ e)deste/on ge kai\ pote/on Id.Cri. 47b; o)/yeis te kai\ a)koai\ kai\ . . kai\ h(donai/ ge dh/ Id.Tht.156b; repeated, sunh/gago/n moi kai/ ge a)rgu/rion kai/ ge xrusi/on LXX Ec.2.8; rarely without intervening words, kai/ ge o( qa/natos dia\ th\n moi/rhn e)/laxen Hp.Septim.9, cf. Lys.11.7 codd.; kai/ ge . . e)kxew= Act.Ap.2.18: hence, in dialogue, in answers where something is added to the statement of the previous speaker, as e)/pemye/ ti/s soi . . kre/a
; Answ. kalw=s ge poiw=n
yes and quite right too, Ar.Ach.1049; keno\n to/d' a)/ggos, h)\ ste/gei ti
; Answ. sa/ g' e)/nduta . .
yes indeed, your clothes, E.Ion1412; ou(/tw ga\r a)\n ma/lista dhxqei/h po/sis. Answ. su\ d' a)\n ge/noio g' a)qliwta/th gunh/
yes truly, and you . . , Id.Med.817, cf. S.OT 680, etc.; pa/nu ge
yes certainly, Pl.Euthphr.8e, etc.; ou(/tw ge/ pws
yes somehowso, Id.Tht.165c; sts. preceded by kai/, kai\ ou)de/n g' a)/topon
yes and no wonder, ib.142b, cf. d, 147e; sts. ironically, eu)= ge khdeu/eis po/lin E.IT1212. to heighten a contrast or opposition, after conditional clauses, ei) me\n dh\ su/ g' . . , tw=| ke *poseida/wn ge . . if
you do so, then
at all events Poseidon will . . , Il.15.49 sq.; e)pei\ pro\s tou=to siwpa=n h(/dio/n soi . . to/de ge ei)pe/
at any rate tell me this, X.Cyr. 5.5.20; ei) mh\ to\ o(/lon, me/ros g' e)piba/llei D.18.272:—sts. in the protasis, ei) ga\r mh\ e(ko/ntes ge . . a)ll' a)e/kontas . . Hdt.4.120. in disjunctive sentences to emphasize an alternative, h)/toi kei=no/n ge . . dei= a)po/llusqai h)\ se/ . . Id.1.11; h)/toi kri/nome/n ge h)\ e)nqumou/meqa o)rqw=s ta\ pra/gmata Th.2.40; path\r d' e)mo/s . . zw/ei o(/ g' h)\ te/qnhke Od.2.131, cf. Il.10.504: also in the second clause, ei)pe/ moi, h)e\ e(kw\n u(poda/mnasai h)/ se/ ge laoi\ e)xqai/rousi Od.3.214, cf. Hdt.7.10.q/, S.OT1098 sq. in exclamations, etc., w(/s ge mh/ pot' w)/felon labei=n dub. in E.IA70, cf. S.OC977, Ph.1003, Ar.Ach.93,836, etc.; in oaths, ou)/toi ma\ th\n *dh/mhtra/ g' v.l. in Ar.Eq.698; ma\ to\n *poseidw= g' ou)de/pot' Id.Ec.748; kai\ nai\ ma\ *di/a ge X.Ap.20; kai\ nh\ *di/a ge Ar.Eq.1350, D.Chr.17.4, Luc. Merc.Cond.28, Lib.Or.11.59, etc.: with words intervening, kai\ nh\ *di/', w)= a)/ndres *)aqhnai=oi, e(/teroi/ ge . . D.13.16; nh\ *di/a, w)= *)aqhnai=oi, w(/ra ge u(mi=n X.HG7.1.37; merely in strong assertions, ti/s a)\n file/onti ma/xoito; a)/frwn dh\ kei=no/s ge/ . . Od.8.209, etc. implying concession, ei)=mi/ ge
well then I will go (in apodosi), E.HF861; dra= g' ei)/ ti dra/seis Id.IA817, cf. Andr.239. ge freq. repeated in protasis and apodosis, as pri/n ge . . , pri/n ge, v. supr.1.3; ei) mh/ ge . . tini\ mei/zoni, th=| ge parou/sh| a)timi/a| Lys.31.29; even in the same clause, ou)de/n g' a)/llo plh/n ge karki/nous Ar.V.1507, cf. Hdt.1.187, E.Ph.554, Pl.R.335b, Grg.502a. POSITION: ge normally follows the word which it limits; but is freq. placed immediately after the Article, as o(/ ge po/lemos Th.1.66, etc.; or the Prep., kata/ ge to\n so\n lo/gon X.Cyr.3.1.15; e)/n ge tai=s *qh/bais S.OT1380; or de/, nu=n de/ ge Pl.Tht.144e; to\ de/ ge ib.164b; doi=men de/ ge/ pou a)/n Id.R.607d, cf. Phd.94a, etc.; freq. in retorts, a(me/s pok' h)=mes a)/lkimoi neani/ai. Answ. a(me\s de/ g' ei)me/s Carm.Pop.18; ou)k oi)=d' o(/ti le/geis. Answ. h( grau=s de/ ge oi)=d', w(s e)gw=|mai Men.Epit.577, cf. A.Th.1031, etc.
ge/a, v. gh=. ge/ar: e)/ar, Hsch. (g = v). ge/bous: zuga/, Id. ge/bouton: yo/fon, Id. gega/a_te, gega/a_si, v. gi/gnomai. gega/qei, v. sub ghqe/w.
gega/kein [a_], Dor. for gegake/nai, = gegone/nai, Pi.O.6.49.
gega/lhmai: gegalh/nismai, diake/xutai, Hsch. gega/men, gegaw/s, v. gi/gnomai. ge/ggei: bre/xei, Id. (leg. te/ggei).

ge/geios, on,
earth-born, a)/nqea Call.Fr.252b: hence,
ancient, Hecat. 362 J.; lo/gos Call.Fr.252: Comp. -o/teron ib.103.

geghqo/tws, Adv. pf. of ghqe/w,
with joy, Hld.7.5, Ph.2.295.
ge/glantai: kekoi/lantai, Hsch.; cf. gla/fw. geglu/pwntai: a)ntegklei/ontai, Id. gegrifw/s: o( tai=s xersi\n a)low=n, Id.

gegumnwme/nws,
defencelessly, J.Ap.1.22. gegunaikwme/na: pe/mmata/ tina, Hsch.

ge/gwn-a, Ep. pf. with pres. and past signf., used by Hom. in 3sg. ge/gwne and part. gegwnw/s Il.11.275, al.: 3sg. plpf. (with impf. signf.) e)gegw/nein 22.34, 23.425, Od.21.368: later, imper. ge/gwne A.Pr.195, S.Ph.238, E.Or.1220; subj. gegw/nw S.OC213; part. gegwnw/s Arist.Pr.904b35, cf. gegwno/s:—from pres. *gegw/nw Hom. has inf. gegwne/men Il.8.223, 11.6, 3sg. impf. e)ge/gwnen (v.l. ge/gwnen) 14.469:—from pres. *gegwne/w come inf. gegwnei=n 12.337, Pi.P.9.3, A.Pr.523, Pl.Hp.Ma.292d: impf. e)gegw/neun Od.17.161, gegw/neun 9.47: after Hom., 3sg. gegwnei= Arist.de An.420a1, Pr. 917b21: impf. -ei/tw X.Cyn.6.24; part. gegwne/ontes Michel 1383B (Chios): fut. gegwnh/sw E.Ion696 (lyr.): aor.inf. gegwnh=sai A.Pr.990, part. -h/sas D.C.68.3; cf. gegwnhte/on, gegwni/skw:—
shout so as to make oneself heard, kw/kusen . . ge/gwne/ te pa=n kata\ a)/stu Il.24.703; e)bo/hse, ge/gwne/ te pa=si qeoi=si Od.8.305: in pres. sense, o(/sson te ge/gwne boh/sas as far as [a man]
can make himself heard by shouting, Od.6.294 (also in past sense, 5.400, al.); ou)/ pw/s oi( e)/hn bw/santi gegwnei=n Il.12.337; a)dhne/ws gegwne/ontes Michel l.c.;
make one's voice carry, pollw=| ple/on gegwnei=n (Cobet for h)\ a)gnoei=n） e)/sti nu/ktwr h)\ meq' h(me/ran Antipho 5.44; porrwte/rw o( au)to\s th=| au)th=| fwnh=| gegwnei= met' a)/llwn a)/|dwn kai\ bow=n h)\ mo/nos Arist.Pr.917b21: c. dat. pers.,
cry out to, e)gegw/nei . . *pouluda/manti Il.14.469, etc.; qeoi=si met' a)qana/toisi gegw/neun Od.12.370;
make oneself heard by a person, ou)de/n soi ma=llon gegwnei=n du/namai h)\ ei)/ moi pareka/qhso li/qos Pl.Hp.Ma.292d.
speak articulately, opp. to mere sound, o( a)h\r ou) gegwnei= Arist.de An.420a1; ou) du/nantai gegwnei=n . . a)lla\ mo/non fwnou=sin Id.Aud.804b24. c. acc. pers.,
sing, celebrate, Pi.P.9.3. c. acc. rei,
tell out, proclaim, A.Pr. 523, al.; tini/ ti ib.195,784, S.Ph.238; tini/ ti e)s ou)=s g. E.Ion696; ta\ gegwna_me/na the
proclamation, IG5(1).1111.12 (Geronthrae); also ou)k e)/xw . . gegwnei=n o(/pa I cannot
tell where [it is], E.Hipp.586 codd.—For part. gegwnw/s as Adj., v. gegwno/s 2.

gegwn-ai/: o(mili/ai,
Hsch.

gegw/n-hsis, ews, h(,
loud talking, hallooing, Plu.2.722f (pl.).

gegwn-hte/on,
one must proclaim, Pi.O.2.6.

gegwn-i/skw, lengthd. pres. for ge/gwna,
cry aloud, shout, w(s e)pi\ plei=ston Th.7.76: impf. e)gegw/niskon D.C.56.14. c. acc. rei,
tell out, proclaim, A.Pr. 627, E.El.809.

gegwnokw/mh, h(,
filling the village with clamour, Com.Adesp.1354.

gegwno/s, o/n, Adj. (from part. gegwnw/s, as a)raro/s, o/n, from a)rarw/s)
loud-sounding, sonorous, pe/mpei gegwna\ . . e)/ph A.Th.443; o)/nta d' a)/fwna boh\n i(/sthsi gegwno/n Antiph.196.2;
loud of voice, a)nh/r AP7.428.15 (Mel.): in later Prose, fwnh/ D.H.8.56, Ph.1.348, Corn.ND 16; lo/gos Ph.1.95, al.; ou) lo/gw| g. a)lla\ th=| yuxh=| e)ktei/nasin e(autou\s ei)s eu)xh/n Plot.5.1.6: Comp. gegwno/teros, ku/knwn AP9.92 (Antip. Thess.), cf. D.H.5.24, Hld.10.32; g. fqe/ggesqai Ath.14.622e, etc. gegwno/s as neut., g. me/los Ael.VH2.44; gegwno\s a)naboa=n Luc.Gall.1; fqe/ggesqai Philostr.VA5.9, cf. Her.2.2; to\ g. th=s o)gkh/sews Corn.ND21: also masc. and fem. as Adj., gegwno/tos lo/gou Ph.1.133; plh/ceis gegwnui/as
resounding blows, ib. 123. Adv. Comp. gegwno/teron e)kboh/sas J.AJ4.3.2, cf. Porph.Chr.23.
gegw/s, w=sa, w/s, v. gi/gnomai.

ge/enna, hs, h(, Hebr.
gé-hinnóm, the
valley of Hinnom, which represented
the place of future punishment, Ev.Matt.5.22, al.

ge/h, h(, = gh=, Orac. ap. Eus.PE4.9: ge/hqen,
from the earth, Orac.ib. 5.9.
geh-po/nos, geh-poniko/s, geh-poni/a, h(, v. gewp-.
geh/oxos, o(, = gaih/oxos, v.l. in Hes.Th.15.

gehro/s, o/n, (ge/a)
of earth, earthy, Arist.GA743a12, etc.; g. kai\ petrw/dh Pl.R.612a, cf. Hp.
Aër.7; to\ g., opp. to\ ou)ra/nion, Them.Or. 32.359a.

geia^ro/ths, ou, o(,
plougher of earth, AP9.23 (Antip.), APl.4.94 (Arch.), etc.; of oxen, Epigr.Gr.793 (Phrygia, ii A. D.).
geida/rion, to/, = gai+da/rion, BGU377.
gei=qron: e)/nduma, Hsch.

gei+ko/s, h/, o/n,
of land, g. po/des, in land-surveying, Hero
*Geom.23.67,al.

gei/nomai (ge/n-
yomai, cf. gi/-gn-omai): as Pass., only pres. and impf.,
to be born, cf. gi/gnomai (which is a constant v.l. in Hom.), geinome/nw|
at one's birth, Il.20.128, 24.210, Od.4.208, cf. Hes.Th.82, Alc.Supp.14: impf. geino/meq' Il.22.477, Hes.Sc.88. as Med., aor. 1 e)geina/mhn (Aeol. 3sg. ge/nnat' Alc.Supp.8.13), in causal sense,
beget, e)gei/nao pai=d' a)i/+dhlon Il.5.880, cf. S.Aj.1172, etc.; more freq. of the mother,
bring forth, qea\ de/ se gei/nato mh/thr Il.1.280, cf. 6.26, Od.6.25, etc.; oi( geina/menoi the
parents, Hdt.1.120, X.Ap.20; o( geina/menos the
father, Ph.2.171; h( geiname/nh the
mother, Hdt.4.10, 6.52, E.Tr.825 (lyr.); ai( g.
women in childbed, Arist.HA582b15; mh/thr h(/ m' e)gei/nato she who
bare me, A.Eu.736, cf. Fr.175, Supp.581 (lyr.), S. OT1020; patri\s h(/ m' e)gei/nato E.Ph.996. of Zeus,
bring into life, ou)k e)leai/reis a)/ndras, e)ph\n dh\ gei/neai au)to/s Od.20.202. metaph., e)gei/nato mo/ron au(tw=| A. Th.751 (lyr.). aor. 1, in later Poets, in pass. sense, = e)geno/mhn, Call.Cer.58. (Sts. written by itacism for gi/nomai, as IG22.786.7 (iii B. C.).)
geio/qen, Adv. = gh=qen, Call.Fr.35c, A.D.Adv.188.19.

geio-ko/mos, on,
cultivating land, Hsch.
geio-mo/ros, = gewmo/ros, A.R.3.1387, AP9.438 (Phil.), D.P.190.
geio-po/nos, = gewpo/nos, AP6.41 (Agath.), Nonn.D.42.329, etc.
geio-to/mos, = ghto/mos, A.R. 1.687, Opp.C.1.137, Nonn.D.21.97, al.

geio-fo/ros, on,
earth-bearing, skafi/des AP6.297 (Phan.).
gei=sa, h(, = gei=son, AB227.

geish/pous, podos, o(,
projecting end of rafter, IG22.463.51:—hence geishpo/disma, atos, to/, ib.114: the spellings geisi/podes (Poll.1.81, AB227), geisipo/d-isma and geio-i/zw (
support the cornice, Is.Fr.113) are less correct.

gei/sion, to/, Dim. of gei=son,
low parapet, J.BJ5.5.6.

geiso/logxos, on,
with a cornice of spear-heads, g. o)/gkwma o)do/ntwn, metaph. of thole-pins, prob. in Tim.Pers.4.

gei=s-on (in codd. freq. written gei=sson), to/,
projecting part of the roof, cornice, IG22.463.51, Thphr.Sign.18 (pl.), Demetr.Eloc.108 (pl.): in pl., of the stones composing it, IG12.372.152; g. kataie/tia ib.2.1054.39.
coping of a wall, E.Or.1570, 1620, Ph.1158, 1180. metaph.,
hem or
border of a garment, Ar.Fr.762; gei=sa o)fru/wn Poll. 2.49.

gei=s-os, ous, to/, - foreg., LXXEz.43.17: pl., gei/sh BCH35.76 (ii B. C.); dat. pl. gei/sesi OGI483.127 (Pergam., ii B. C.) :—also gei=sos, o(, Gloss. (Carian word, acc. to St.Byz. s.v. *mono/gissa.)

geis-o/w,
protect with a gei=son, EM229.40.

gei/s-wma, atos, to/,
pent-house, Poll.1.76.

gei/s-wsis, ews, h(,
eaves, Hsch., EM229.41.
gei/taina, h(, fem. of gei/twn, as te/ktaina of te/ktwn, AB1199.
gei/th: ba/mmata e)c e)ri/wn, Hsch.
geitne/w, = geitnia/w, BGU775.15 (iii A. D.).

geitni/-a, h(, = geitoni/a 1, Hp.Ep.23, OGI383.98 (Commagene): in pl.,
adjoining areas, PTeb.14.10 (ii B. C.), PAvrom.2 A8 (i B. C.), PAmh.2.68.4 (i A. D.), etc.
geitni-a/zw, = geitnia/w, Aesop.75.

geitni-a^ko/s, h/, o/n,
neighbouring, J. AJ2.14.6.
geitni/-a_ma, atos, to/, gloss on geito/nhma, Hsch.

geitni/-a_sis, ews, h(, = geitoni/a,
neighbourhood, proximity, Arist.PA672b28, etc.
a neighbourhood, district, OGI483.28, 32 (Pergam., ii B. C.), Ph.2.475 (pl.), Plu. Cor.24; barbarikai\ g. Id.Per.19.
proximity, resemblance, kata\ th\n g. kai\ o(moio/thta Arist.EE1232a21, cf. Pol.1257a2, J.AJ12.2.9.

geitni-a/w, pres. (3sg. impf. e)geitni/a S.Ichn. 232, and v. sub fin.),
to be a neighbour, be adjacent, Ar.Ec.327, D.55.3, PTeb.105.19 (ii B. C.), Plb.6.33.10, Jul. Or.5.168a, etc.:—chiefly in Prose, but Ep. part., geitnio/wsan po/ntw| IG14.889 (Sinuessa).
border on, resemble, g. th=| politei/a| Arist. Pol.1295a33; [tw=| kalw=|] Id.Rh.1367b12; no/sos geitniw=sa qana/tw| Ph.2.548; tini\ kakw=| Metrod.Herc.831.3: later fut. -a/sw Gal.3.690: aor. e)geitni/a_sa Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.1.

gei/tni-os, a, on,
neighbouring, adjacent, BGU94.

geiton-ei/a, h(, = geitoni/a, IG5(2).443.13 (Megalop., ii/i B. C.), Plot. 5.8.7;
nearness, Phld.D.3.9.

geiton-eu/w, = sq., c. dat., X.
l ect.1.8, Str. 3.3.8, al.: abs., Id.4.6.8, al., Phld.Ir.p.48 W., etc.:—Med., to\ a)/lloh(/misu tou= sw/matos geitoneu/etai tau/th| th=| i)/cei Hp.Fract.18.

geiton-e/w, = geitnia/w, c. dat., A.Pers.311, Supp.780 (lyr.), v.l. in S.OC1525, SIG 685.38 (ii B. C.), Procop.Aed.4.1; geitoneu=s' a)popni/geis Call. Iamb.1.300: metaph., to\ sw=ma geitonh=san mete/laben au)th=s (sc. yuxh=s) Plot.3.9.2, cf. 1.2.5.
geito/n-hsis, ews, h(, = sq., Luc. Symp.33, Plot.1.2.5.

geiton-i/a, h(,
neighbourship, pikra\ g. Pl.Lg.843c, cf. Arist.Rh.1395b9;
neighbouring region, Plot.4.4.19.
quarter, ward, in a city, J.BJ7.4.1:— hence geiton-i/arxos, o(,
chief official of a ward, Hsch. s.v. r(egeona/rios.
geiton-ia/w, = geitnia/w, Theopomp.Hist.253.
geito-su/nh, h(, = geitoni/a, Str.13.1.22.

geito/-sunos, on,
neighbouring, AP9.407 (Antip.).

gei/twn, onos, o(, h(,
neighbour, borderer, gei/tones h)de\ e)/tai *menela/ou Od.4.16, cf. 9.48, Hes.Op.346, etc.; opp. su/noikos, Pl.Lg.696b; g. tino/s E.IT1451, X.An.3.2.4; tini/ ib.2.3.18; e)k tw=n g. or e)k geito/nwn
from or
in the neighbourhood, Ar.Pl.435, etc.; oi(=on e)k g. fwnh\n qhreuo/menoi Pl.R.531a; lu/xnon e)k tw=n g. e)na/yasqai Lys.1.14; e)k g. th=s patri/dos metoikei=n Lycurg.21, cf. Str.10.4.12; rarely a)po\ g. D.S.13.84; e)n geito/nwn (sc. oi)/kois） oi)kei=n Men.Pk.27, Luc.Philops.25, etc.; to\ xwri/on to\ e)n g. D.53.10: metaph., e)n g. ei)=nai to be
of like kind, Luc.Icar.8: prov., me/ga gei/toni gei/twn Alcm.50, cf. Pi.N.7.87. as Adj.,
neighbouring, bordering, po/lis, po/ntos, Id.P.1.32, N.9.43; xw/ra, pu/lai, r(oai/, A.Pers.67 (lyr.), Th.486, S.Aj.418 (lyr.): c. dat., *)aqh/nais g. po/lis E.Ion294; nekroi=si g. qa=koi Id.HF1097; also in Prose, h( g. po/lis Pl.Lg.877b; oi( g. ba/rbaroi Jul.Or.2.72c: neut. gei=ton Hsch.: neut. pl. gei/tw IG2.814aB36. gi/tonas (sic): ta\ du/o ai)doi=a, Hsch.
geiwpei/nhs, o(, = gewpei/nhs, Hdn.Epim.15.

geiw/ras, ou, o(,
sojourner, LXXIs.14.1, Ph.1.417.
proselyte, Hsch.

gekaqa/: e(kou=sa, Hsch. (Prob. Cret. ve/kaqqa < vekṇt-
ya^.) ge/kalon (i. e. ve/khlon）: h(/suxon, Id. geka=sa (g = v）: e(kou=sa, Id. gelaiw/s: o( ge/lws, Id. ge/lan: au)gh\n h(li/ou, Id. (vel-, cf. ei)/lh); cf. gelei=n. gelandro/n: yuxro/n, Id.

gela_nh/s, e/s, (gela/w)
cheerful, kardi/a, qumo/s, Pi.O.5.2, P.4.181.

ge/lanoi, oi(,
an inferior breed of horses, Hsch.

gela_no/w,
brighten, cheer: hence,
calm, qumo/n B.5.80.
gelarh/s: galh/nh (Lacon.), Hsch. gelari/hs, = galleri/as, Euthyd. ap. Ath.7.31 <*>f. ge/laros, v. galo/ws. ge/las: nau/tas, Hsch.

gela^s-ei/w, Desiderat. of gela/w,
to be ready to laugh, Pl.Phd. 64b.

gela^/s-imos, on,
laughable, Stratt.72, Luc.Somn.5: less correct than ge/loios, Phryn.206.

gela^s-i=nos, o(,
laugher, of Democritus, Ael. VH4.20: fem. gelasi/nh Anaxandr.25. oi( g. (sc. o)do/ntes)
the grinners, i. e.
the front teeth, which show when one laughs, Poll.2.91. mostly pl.,
dimples, which appear in the cheeks when persons laugh, Mart.7.25 (sg.), Choerob. in An.Ox.2.188; also of
dimples in the hinder parts, Alciphr.1.39, AP5.34 (Rufin.).

ge/la^s-is, ews, h(,
laughing, EM801.13.
gela^/s-kw, = gela/w, AP7.621.

ge/la^s-ma, atos, to/,
smile, kuma/twn a)nh/riqmon ge/lasma A.Pr.90.
cause of laughter, gh=ras poluxro/nion g. Secund. Sent.12.

gela^s-th/s, ou=, o(,
laugher, sneerer, S.OT1422:—fem. gela^/s-tria, Sch.Ar.Th.1068.

gela^s-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
able to laugh, S.E.P.2.211, Simp.in Ph.104.27; to/ g. Antig.Mir. 175, Iamb.Protr.21. ks/; a)/nqrwpos gelestiko/n Luc Vit.Auet.26. Adv. -kw=s Suid.

gela^s-to/s, h/, o/n,
laughable, e)/rga Od.8.307; of persons, Babr.45.12.
gela^s-tu/s, u/os, h(, Ion. for ge/lws, Call.Del.324.

gela/w, Ep. gelo/w Od.21.105, Aeol. ge/laimi Hdn.Gr.2.463, al.; Ep. part. gelo/wntes Od.18.40, gelw/ontes, -w/wntes, or -oi/wntes ib. 111, cf. 20.390; Ep. impf. gelw/wn or -oi/wn 20.347; Dor. part. gela=sa, 3pl. gela=nti, Theoc.1.36,90; Aeol. gelai/sas Sapph.2.5: Att. fut. gela/somai Pl.Phdr.252b, X.Smp.1.16, etc.; later gela/sw AP2.178 (Mel.), 11.29 (Autom.), Anacreont.38.8, etc.: aor. e)ge/la^sa E.IT276, etc.; Ep. e)ge/lassa Il.15.101; Dor. e)ge/laca Theoc.20. <*>, v.l.ib.7.42; 3pl. ge/lan for e)ge/lasan Poet. ap. EM255.6:—Pass., fut.-asqh/somai D.L.1.78, Luc.Am.2: aor. e)gela/sqhn D.2.10, (kat-) Th.3.83, Pl. Euthphr.3c, etc.: pf. gege/lastai （kata-) Luc.DMort.1.1. abs.,
laugh, a(palo\n gela/sai Od.14.465; a)xrei=on g. 18.163; gnaqmoi=si geloi/wn a)llotri/oisin 20.347; dakruo/en g. Il.6.484; mhde\n i(/lewn g. S.Aj. 1011; h( d' e)ge/lasse xei/lesin, of feigned laughter, Il.15.101; e)ge/lasse de/ oi( fi/lon h)=tor his heart
laughed within him, 21.389; gelw= o(rw=n Hdt.4.36:—Pass., ei(/neka tou= gelasqh=i ai for the sake of
a laugh being raised, D.2.19. of things, ge/lasse de\ pa=sa peri\ xqw/n Il. 19.362; gai=a/ te pa=s' e)ge/lasse h.Cer.14; gela=| de/ te do/ mata patro/s Hes.Th.40; gelw=nta u(da/th Lyr.Alex.Adesp.32.4.
laugh at, e)p' au)tw=| h(du\ ge/lassan Il.2.270, 23.784; e)p' a)llh/loisi gelw=sin Thgn. 1113; gela=| de\ dai/mwn e)p' a)ndri\ qermw=|
laughs scornfully at . . , A.Eu. 560 (lyr.); e)pi/ tini at a thing, X.Mem.4.2.5, Pl.Phlb.50a: freq. c. dat., gela=| de\ toi=sde . . a)/xesin polu\n ge/lwta S.Aj.957 (lyr.), cf. 1043, Ar. Nu.560; e)ge/lasa yolokompi/ais
was amused at them, Id.Eq.696;
o(/tan pot' a)nqrw/poisin h( tu/xh gela=| Philem.110; ei)s e)xqrou\s g. S. Aj.79; e)n kakoi=si toi=s e)moi=s A.Ch.222: rarely c. gen. pers., gela=| mou S.Ph.1125 (lyr.), cf. Pl.Tht.175b, Luc.Dem.Enc.16, Procop.Goth.4.28 (v.l.). c. acc.,
deride, tina/ Theoc.20.1; h)\ to/de gela=te, ei) . .
; X.Smp.2.19; ti/ de\ tou=t' e)ge/lasas e)teo/n
; what is this you
are laughing at? Ar.Nu.820:—Pass.,
to be derided, A.Eu.789 (lyr.), S.Ant. 839 (lyr.); pro/s tinos Id.Ph.1023; para/ tinos Id.OC1423.
ge/lgei: bapti/zei, xrwmati/zei, Hsch.

ge/lgh, e/wn, ta/, = r(w=pos,
frippery: the market where they are sold, Eup.304, Luc.Lex.3. (ge/lgh, h(, Ael.Dion.Fr.295, is prob.an error due to Eust.）
gelghqeu/ein: a)pathlogei=n, Hsch. ge/lgia: ph/nh, spa/qh, koura/lia, Id.

gelgi_do/omai, Pass.,
form a compound bulb, of garlic, Thphr.HP 7.4.11.

ge/lgis, h(, gen. ge/lgi<*>qos, also ge/lgios and -idos (in codd. freq. with false accent gelgi/s, gelgi/qos, etc., but cf. Hdn.Gr.1.87): pl. ge/lgeis Thphr.HP7.4.11, CP1.4.5:—
head of garlic, and in pl., the
cloves which compose it, h( ge/lgis diairei=tai ei)s ta\s ge/lgeis Id.HP7.4.12, cf. Hp.Nat.Mul.77; po/timoi ge/lgi_qes AP6.232 (Crin.).

gelgo-pwle/w,
sell garlic, Hermipp.13.
sell ge/lgh, Hsch.

gelgo-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in garlic, Poll.7.198:—fem. gelgo/-pwlis, idos, Cratin.48.
ge/lea: te/lea, Hsch. gelei=n: la/mpein, a)nqei=n, Id. ge/lenos: a)sfo/delos, na/rkissos, Id.
*gele/ontes, oi(, one of the four Ionic tribes, Plu.Sol.23, CIG3078 (Teos), 3664 (Cyzicus), etc.: *gele/wn, ontos, o(, epith. of Zeus, IG22.1072.

geli/kh: e(/lic, Hsch. ge/lin: o)rkia=n (leg. o(rmia/n), Id. ge/linqoi: e)re/binqoi, Id. ge/llai: ti=lai (cf. Lat.
vello), Id. gelli/zein: gargali/zein, Id. gelli/cai (Aeol. for veili/cai）: suneilh=sai, Id. (In the above lemmata, exc. gelli/zein, g stands for v.）

*gellw/, ou=s, Aeol. *ge/llw, ws, h(, a kind of
vampire or
goblin, supposed to carry off young children, Sapph.47.
geloduti/a: h(liodusi/a, Hsch.; cf. ge/lan.

geloi-a/zw, only pres.,
jest, LXX Ge.19.14, Aristarch. ap. Ath.2.39e, Plu.2.231c, Arr.Epict.3.16.4, Jul.Caes.306b, Procop.Arc.9.

geloi-asmo/s, o(,
jesting, LXX Je.31 (48).27.

geloi-asth/s, ou=, o(,
jester, buffoon, Ptol. Megalop.2, LXX Jb.31.5, Poll.5.128, prob. in Luc.Merc.Cond. 4.

geloi-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
mirth-provoking, Eust.1837.8.
geloi-a/w, Ep. for gela/w, in aor. part. geloih/sasa h.Ven.49.

geloiomele/w,
write comic songs, AP7.719 (Leon.).

ge/loios or geloi=ss, a, on,
mirth-provoking, amusing, once in Hom., Il.2.215 (in Ep. form geloi/i+os）; xrh=ma Archil.79, cf. Hdt.8.25; *ai)sw/pou ti g. Ar.V.566, cf. 1259; geloi=a
jests, Thgn.311; ge/loia le/gein Anaxandr.10, Alex.183; opp. spoudai=os, X.Cyr.2.3.1, Pl.Lg. 816d; tou= a)lhqou=s e(/neka, ou) tou= g. Id.Smp.215a; to\ g. the
comic, Arist.Po.1449a34, al.; ta\ g. h(de/a Id.Rh.1371b35; of persons,
facetious, misw= geloi/ous E.Fr.492; h(du\s kai\ g. Aeschin.1.126; g. e)sti kai\ bou/letai Pl.Smp.213c. Adv. -oi/ws Id.Cri.53d.
ludicrous, absurd, *zeu\s g. o)mnu/menos toi=s ei)do/sin Ar.Nu.1241; g. e)/somai au)tosxedia/zwn Pl.Phdr.236d; g. i)atro/s, dida/skalos, Id.Prt.340c, R. 392d; e)pi\ to\ -o/teron o(/moios a
caricature, Arist.Top.117b17, cf. Po. 1449a36; of arguments, etc.,
paradoxical, Pl.Prt.355a, Tht.158e, etc. Adv. -oi/ws, e)/xein Id.R.528d, cf. Arist.Mete.362b12.—In Smp.189b, Pl. confines g. to signf. 1, g. ei)pei=n a)lla\ mh\ katage/lasta. (Att. ge/loios A.D.Pron.50.5, but geloi=os Ael.Dion.Fr.101, and so cod. R in Ar.Ach.1058, Nu.1241. Some Gramm. expl. ge/loios, = ge/lwtos a)/cios, geloi=os, = gelwtopoio/s, Ammon.p.38V., EM224.43; others reversely, Et.Gud., etc.: Suid. gives both views. Phlp. ap. Eust. 906.53 wrote geloio/s, = gelwtopoio/s.)

geloio/ths, htos, h(,
absurdity, Ath.11.497f.
geloiw/dhs, es, = ge/loios 11, Porph.Chr.55, Procop.Arc.23, Goth. 4.21, Sch.Ar.V.564. Adv. -dw=s Id.Pl.681, Hsch. s.v. a)stei/ws.
geloi/wn, geloi/wntes, gelo/w, gelo/wntes, v. sub gela/w.
ge/loutron: e)/lutron, Hsch. (vel-).

gelowmi^li/a, h(,
fellowship in laughing, AP9.573 (Ammian.).
gelso/n: a)tuxe/s, Hsch. gelunma/cai: geloia/sai, Id.
*gelxa/nos (i. e. velx-), title of Zeus in Crete, Hsch.

ge/lws, Aeol. ge/los, o(, gen. ge/lwtos, Att. ge/lw: dat. ge/lwti, Ep. ge/lw or ge/lw| Od.18.100: acc. ge/lwta, poet. (and late Prose, Polyaen.1.34.2, f.l.in Palaeph.30) ge/lwn, v. infr. (acc. ge/lw is v.l. in Od.18.350, cf. infr.): gen. pl. gelw/twn Pl.Lg.732c: dat. ge/lwsin Ph. 2.167, PGiss.1.3.6 (ii A. D.): (gela/w):—
laughter, ge/lw| e)/kqanon Od. 18.100; ge/lw . . pare/xousai 20.8; a)/sbeston ge/lw (v.l. ge/lon） w)=rsen ib.346; a)/sbestos d' a^r' e)nw=rto ge/lws . . qeoi=si Il.1.599; ge/lwn d' e(ta/roisin e)/teuxe Od.18.350; ge/lwn d' e)/qhke sundei/pnois E.Ion1172; ge/lwta poiei=n, mhxana=sqai, kinei=n, X.Cyr.2.2.11 and 14, Smp.1.14; paraskeua/zein Pl.Lg.669d; ge/lwn cuntiqe/nai, ge/lwta a)/gein, S.Aj.303,382; g. e)/xei tina/ Od.8.344; g. a)\n gi/gnoito Pl.Plt.295e; ge/lwtos katarrage/ntos Ath.5.211c (so in Act., pollou\s kate/rrhcen h(mw=n ge/lwtas Hippoloch.ib.130c); katasxei=n ge/lwta X.Cyr.2.2.5, etc.; ou) ge/lwta dei= s' o)flei=n E.Med.404, cf.Ar.Fr.898; e)pi\ ge/lwti to provoke
laughter, Hdt.9.82, Ar.Ra.405; ge/lwtos a)/cia
ridiculous, E.Heracl.507; a(/ma or su\n ge/lwti, Pl.Lg.789d, X.An.1.2.18; meta\ ge/lwtos Antiph.144.6; e)n ge/lwti profe/rein in
joke, Plu.2.124d; polu\s g. loud
laughter, X.Cyr. 2.3.18, etc. (platu\s g., which Thom.Mag.p.293 R. recommends, is not classical); me/gistos, i)sxuro\s g., Pl.Plt.l.c., R.388c; *sardo/nios g. (v. *sardo/nios）; *ai)a/nteios g. a maniac's
laugh, Diogenian.1.17. metaph. of waves, = ge/lasma, Opp.H.4.334.
occasion of laughter, food for laughter, g. gi/gnomai/ tini S.OC902; tau=t' ou) g. klu/ein e)mou=; E.Ion528; ge/lwta/ tina ti/qesqai Hdt.3.29, 7.209; a)podei=cai Pl.Tht. 166a; ei)s g. tre/pein, e)mba/llein, Th.6.35, D.10.75; e)n ge/lwti poiei=sqai/ ti Luc.Hist.Conscr.32, etc.; g. e)/sq' w(s xrw/meqa toi=s pra/gmasi D.4.25; o(/sa ga\r . . , plei/wn e)sti\ g. tou= mhdeno/s Id.14.26.
dimple in the hinder parts, Luc.Am.14.
gelwti=nos: katage/lastos, Hsch.

gelwto-poie/w,
to create, make laughter, esp.by buffoonery, X.Smp. 3.11, Pl.R.606c, Hyp.Phil.2.

gelwto-poii/+a, h(,
buffoonery, X.Smp.4.50, Luc.Salt.68, Procop.Arc.15.

gelwto-poii+kw=s, Adv.
ridiculously, Poll.9.149.

gelwto-poio/s, o/n,
exciting laughter, ridiculous, A.Fr.180.2; bwmoloxi/ai Procop.Arc.9. as Subst.,
jester, buffoon, X.An.7.3.33, Smp.1.11, Pl.R.620c. = batra/xion 11 (because it produced a wry face), Ps.-Dsc.2.175.

gelwto-fuh/, h(, = foreg.11.2, Apul.Herb. gelwto/-fullis, idos, h(,
Indian hemp, Cannabis sativa, Plin.HN24.164.
gelwto/s, h/, o/n, prob. f.l. for geloi=os, Olymp.in Alc.p.10C.
gelw/wn, gelw/wntes, v. gela/w.

gem-i/zw, (ge/mw)
fill full of, load, freight or
charge with, prop. of a ship, tino/s Th.7.53, X.HG6.2.25, etc.; gemi/sas th\n nau=n cu/lwn Test. ap.D.21.168; nau=n si/tou D.34.36; qhri/wn ta\s nau=s Plb.1.18.8; trape/zas qoi/nhs OGI383.146 (Commagene); of animals,
load, kth/nh PFay.117.14 (ii A. D.), cf.PTeb.419.17 (iii A. D.): c. dupl.acc., PFlor. 195.4 (iii A. D.); spodou= g. le/bhtas
charging them
with ashes, A.Ag. 443; gemi/sw se
let me fill you, addressed to a cup, Theopomp.Com. 32; au(to/n
stuff, gorge, Men.Pk.296; th\n koili/an a)po/ tinos v.l. in Ev.Luc.15.16:—Med., D.20.31; e)gemizo/mhn a)nqrwpei/ou trofh=s Luc. Asin.46:—Pass., metaph. of the Cyclops, E.Cyc.505 (lyr.); of bees, gemisqei=sai a)pope/tontai Arist.HA624b2: c. gen., g. a)lazonei/as, eu)sebei/as, Ph.2.186,357. later, c. acc. rei, gemi/zein u(/dwr (sc. th\n u(dri/an)
to fill it
full of water, Paus.3.13.3:—Pass., oi)=non, pu=r gemisqei/s, AP12.85 (Mel.).
ge/m-isma, atos, to/, gloss on ge/mos, Hsch.

gem-isto/s, h/, o/n,
laden, full, Ath.9.381a.
ge/mma, Ion., = ga/mma, Democr.19.
ge/mmata: i(ma/tia, Hsch. (ve/mm-, cf. ei(=ma).

ge/mos, ous, to/,
load, spla/gxn', e)poi/ktiston ge/mos A.Ag.1221.
gemo/w, = gemi/zw, PRein.53.4 (iii A. D.).
gempo/s: koi=los, Hsch. gempu/los, o(, = phlamu/s, Id.

ge/mw, used only in pres. and impf.,
to be full, prop. of a ship, Hdt. 8.118, X.HG5.1.21: generally, pa/nta g. Jul.Mis.368c. = ku/ein, Hsch. c. gen. rei,
to be full of, ploi=a ge/monta xrhma/twn Th.7.25; limh\n e)/gemen ploi/wn Pl.Criti.117e; kw/mas pollw=n kai\ a)gaqw=n gemou/sas X.An.4.6.27; of animals,
to be laden. o)/noi ge/montes oi)/nou kai\ brwma/twn Posidon.5: metaph., ko/mpos th=s a)lhqei/as g. A.Ag.613, cf. S.OT4; ge/mw kakw=n dh/ E.HF1245; g. qrasu/thtos Pl.Lg.649d; a)summet ri/as kai\ ai)s xro/thtos ge/mousa yuxh/ Id.Grg.525a; pikri/as Phld. Ir.p.56 W.: c. dat.,
to be filled with, i)tri/oisi, pe/mmasi, Archipp.9, Antiph.174.2; gh=n puro\s ge/mousan r(eu/masin Carc.5; g. e)c a(rpagh=s Ev.Matt.23.25.

genarx-e/w,
to be the ancestor of the human race, o( genarxw=n a)/nqrwpos (of the Gnostic prwta/nqrwpos) lamb.Myst.10.5.

gena/rx-hs, ou, o(,
founder or
first ancestor of a family, Call.Fr.36, Lyc.1307; of Julius Caesar, Ph.2.528; of Abraham, Id.1.513; epith. of Heracles, IG 5(1).497 (Sparta), al.
ruler of created beings, gena/rxa th=s genesiourgi/as Corp.Herm.13.21, cf. Orph.H.13.8.

genea/, a=s, Ion. geneh/, h=s, h(, Ep. dat. geneh=fi Il.14.112: (gene/sqai): of the persons in a family,
race, family, *pria/mou g. Il.20.306, cf. Od.1.222, 16.117; geneh/n te to/kon te Il.15.141; i)/dmen . . geneh/n, i)/dmen de\ tokh=as 20.203, cf. 214; geneh=| u(pe/rteros higher
by birth or
blood, 11.786 (but
younger in Archil. ap. Sch.ad l.); tau/ths ei)=nai g. kai\ ai(/matos
of this
race and blood, Il.6.211; patro/qen e)k geneh=s o)noma/zein 10.68; geneh=|
by birthright, Od.1.387; *ai)twlo\s geneh/n
by descent, Il.23.471; geneh\n *dio/s 21.187; geneh\ e)/k tinos
descent from . . , ib.157; geneh\n a)po\ *qrhi/khs Hdt.2.134; of horses,
breed, stock, Il.5.265, 268: pl., xrh/mata kai\ genea/s
families, Plu.Tim.34; genea\n poiei=sqai to have
issue, GDI1798 (Delph.); patria\ kai\ g., = fratri/a kai\ ge/nos, ib.1152 (Elis): hence,
tribe, nation, *persw=n g., *turrhnw=n g., A.Pers. 912 (lyr.), Eleg.2:—rare in Prose, ti/s w)\n genea/n; X.Cyr.1.1.6; kai\ au)to\n kai\ ta\n g. a)pole/sqai SIG306.8 (Tegea, iv B. C.).
race, generation, oi(/hper fu/llwn g. toih/de kai\ a)ndrw=n Il.6.146; du/o g. mero/pwn a)nqrw/pwn 1.250, etc., cf. Hdt.2.142, Th.1.14, Heraclit. ap. Plu.2.415e (but, = mh/n, Id. ap. Lyd.Mens.3.14); a)sth\n e)c a)stw=n a)mfote/rwn e)pi\ trei=s g. gegenhme/nhn SIG1015.6 (Halic.);
age, g. a)nqrwphi/+h the historical, opp. to the mythical,
