age, Hdt.3.122; e)pi\ th=s h(mete/ras g. D.H.3.15.
offspring, Il.21.191, Orac. ap. Hdt.6.86, S.Aj.189 (lyr.); of a single person, *turou=s g. (i. e. Pelias) Pi.P.4.136, cf.
l.8(7).71. metaph.,
class, kind, to\ su/mmetron kai\ kalo\n kai\ o(po/sa th=s g. tau/ths e)sti/n Pl.Phlb.66b; tau/ths toi genea=s o( nou=s ou(=tos Plot.5.1.7. of Time or Place,
birthplace, g. e)pi\ li/mnh| *gugai/h| Il.20.390, cf. Od.1.407; of an eagle's
evrie, 15.175.
age, time of life, geneh=fi new/tatos Il.14.112; geneh=| presbu/tatos, progene/steros, o(plo/teros, 6.24,9.161, Od.19.184. after Hom.,
time of birth, e)k geneh=s Hdt.3.33,4.23; a)po\ g. X.Cyr.1.2.8.

genea_log-e/w, Ion. geneh-,
trace a pedigree, g. ge/nesin Hdt.2.146; g. e(wuto/n
draw out one's pedigree, ib.143; g. th\n sugge/neian X.Smp. 4.51; g. tina/ tinos Plu.2.894b; g. tina\ gene/sqai, ei)=nai . . , Id.Lyc.1, Paus.5.14.9; peri/ tinos Luc.Salt.7: abs., oi( -logou=ntes Isoc.15.180, Thphr.Char.28.2:—Pass., Hp.Septim.4; tau=ta me/n nun gegenehlo/ghtai Hdt.6.54; ta\ nundh\ genealoghqe/nta Pl.Ti.23b; genealogou/menos e)/k
tinos Ep.Hebr.7.6; e)genealogh/qh (impers.)
the genealogy was reckoned, LXX 1 Ch.5.1.

genea_lo/g-hma, atos, to/,
pedigree, Eust.18.29.

genea_log-i/a, h(,
tracing a pedigree, Pl.Cra.396c, al.: in pl., Isoc.11.8; title of work by Hecataeus; g. kai\ mu=qoi Plb.9.2.1, cf. 1 Ep.Ti.1.4, Jul.Or.7.205c.

genea_log-iko/s, h/, o/n,
genealogical, Plb.9.1.4, Ph.2.141, S.E.M.1.253.

genea_/log-os, o(,
genealogist, D.H.1.13, D.L.1.115.

genea/rx-hs, ou, o(, = a)/rxwn tou= ge/nous, IG3.1278, cf. OGI531 (Bith.); = gena/rxhs (which is freq. v.l.), Apollod.2.1.4, Heraclit. All.22, Jul.Ep.89, etc.; po/lews g.
chief, sheikh, CR Acad.Inscr. 1924.28 (Dura).

genearx-iko/s, h/, o/n,
patrimonial, xwri/a Just.Edict.3.1.1.

geneh=qen, Adv.
from birth, by descent, Arat.260; a)/grauloi g. AP 7.415 (Pers.).

gene/ql-h, Dor. ge/neql-qla, h(: of persons,
race, stock, family, c. gen. pers., *paih/ono/s ei)si gene/qlhs Od.4.232, cf. 13.130; sh=s e)c ai(/mato/s ei)si gene/qlhs of thy
race by blood, Il.19.111; gene/qlhn
by birth or
origin, h)=n de\ g. *)/ikios Call.Aet.1.1.7; of horses,
breed, stock, Il.5.270; qhrw=n g. h.Hom.27.10; tw=n a)liqi/wn a)pei/rwn [e)sti\] gene/qla Simon.5.6.
offspring, h.Ap.136, S.El.129 (lyr.), 226 (lyr.), etc.
birth, gene/qlas a)rxa/ Hymn.Is.36.
birthplace, o(/qi a)rgu/rou e)sti\ g. Il.2.857.
generation, age, ou)/ ti palaio/n, e)f' h(mete/rh| de\ gene/qlh| Opp.H.5.459.
time of birth, e)k gene/qlhs D.P.1044.
geneql-h/i+os, on, = gene/qlios, Orac. ap. Eus.PE6.2.
gene/ql-ia, ta/, v. gene/qlios.

geneql-ia/zw,
keep a birthday, App.BC4.134.

geneql-ia^ko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to a birthday, w(=rai AP6.321 (Leon.); h(me/ra Vett. Val.26.14, al., cf. Ph.2.529. = geneqlialo/gos, Gal.15.441, cf. Gell.14.1.1.

geneqlia_log-e/w,
cast nativities, practise astrology, Str.16.1.6:— Med., Cat.Cod.Astr.1.170.

geneqlia_log-i/a, h(,
casting of nativities, astrology, J.AJ18.6.9, Ptol.Tetr.7, Iamb.Myst.9.1, Hierocl.Prov.ap.Phot. p.172 B.

geneqlia_log-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for nativity-casting, Ptol.Tetr.54: h( -kh/ (sub. te/xnh), = foreg., Ph.1.464.

geneqlia_/log-os, o(,
caster of nativities, Ptol.Tetr.13, Hierocl.Prov.ap.Phot.p.172B., Iamb.Myst.1.18.
geneqli/dios, on, = gene/qlios, dw=ra AP6.325 (Leon.), cf. 243 (Diod.).
geneqliolo/gos, = geneqlial-, Hsch. s.v. a)strolo/gos.

gene/qlios, on, also a, on Lyc.1194:—
of or
belonging to one's birth, g. do/sis a
birthday gift, A.Eu.7; h( gene/qlios h(me/ra
birthday, Epicur. Fr.217, OGl111.29 (ii B. C.), etc.; geneqli/a h(me/ra ib.222.6 (iii B. C.): pl., ib.493.20 (ii A. D.); th=| geneqli/a| POxy.494.24 (ii A. D.); and h( gene/qlios, without h(me/ra, CIG3957b, Luc.Dem.Enc.2; gene/qlion h)=mar AP6.261 (Crin.); also a)gw\n g. tou= qea/trou
to celebrate a birthday, ClG 4342d (Aspendus); ta\ g.
birthday feast, SIG463.11; g. qu/ein offer
birthday offerings, E.Ion653, Pl.Alc.1.121c; e(stia=n Luc.Herm.11, cf. BGU362x9 (iii A. D.), etc.
of one's race or
family, esp. of tutelary gods, *zeu\s g. Pi.O.8.16, P.4.167; g. dai/mwn Id.O.13.105; g. qeoi/ A.Th.639 (but in Pl.Lg.729c, 879d,
presiding over generation, and in D.H.1.67, = Penates); ai(=ma g.
kindred blood, E.Or.89; g. a)rai/ a
parent's curse, A.Ch.912.
giving birth, generative, gene/qlios a)kti/nwn path/r, i.e. the Sun, Pi.O.7.70; g. po/ros thy
natal stream, A.Eu.293; bla/stai g. S.OC972; a)ne/lusa gene/qlion . . [delfu/n], of her first child, Hymn.Is.17.
geneqli/wma, atos, to/, = gene/qlh, Iamb. ap. Sch.Hes.Th.459.

ge/neqlon, to/, = gene/qlh,
race, descent, A.Supp.290.
offspring, Id.Ag.784 (lyr.), 914, etc.; g. *oi)tai/ou patro/s S.Ph.453; ta\ qnhtw=n g. the
sons of men, Id.OT1425.

genei-a/zw, Dor. genei-a/sdw, (ge/neion)
get a beard, come to man's estate, D.H.1.76, AP12.12 (Flacc.); a)/rti geneia/sdwn Theoc.11.9, cf. CIG 3715 (Apamea Bith.): pf. gegenei/aka Philem.15.

genei-a/s, a/dos, h(,
beard, kua/neai . . geneia/des a)mfi\ ge/neion (pl. for sg.) Od.16.176; da/skion geneia/da A.Pers.316, cf. S.Tr.13, Theoc.2.78; pro/s <se> geneia/dos . . a)/ntomai E.Supp.277. pl.,
cheeks, E.Ion1460, Ph. 1381, IT1366; of horses, xalina\ geneia/sin a)fri/zontes da/pton Q.S.4.548.
bandage for the chin, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.20.9, Gal.18 (1).786.

genei/-a^sis, ews, h(,
growth of the beard, in pl., Plot.4.3.13.

genei-a/skw,
begin to get a beard, Pl.Smp.181d, X.Cyr.4.6.5; a)/rti geneia/skwn IG3.1314.

genei-asth/r, h=ros, o(,
chin-strap of a bridle, Poll. 1.147.

genei-a/ths [a_], Ep. and Ion. genei-h/ths, ou, o(,
bearded, Theoc. 17.33, Luc.
Bis Acc.28, Jul.Or.4.131a, Call.Dian.90:—fem. genei-a=tis, tri/gla Sophr.31; Ion. geneih=tis tri/glh Eratosth.12.

genei-a/w, = geneia/zw,
grow a beard, get a beard, e)ph\n dh\ pai=da geneih/santa i)/dhai Od.18.269, cf. 176, Hp.Nat.Puer.20, X.An.2.6.28, etc.; ei)s a)/ndra geneiw=n Theoc.14.28.
have a beard, Ar.Ec.145, Pl.Plt.270e, Arist.GA746b24, D.C.68.15.
genei-o/lhs, ou, o(, = geneia/ths, Hdn.Gr. 2.638.

ge/nei-on, to/, (ge/nus)
part covered by the beard, chin, Od.16.176; polio\n g. Il.22.74; esp. in supplication, e)/llabe xeiri\ genei/ou 8.371; g. xeiri\ paxei/h| a(ya/menos 10.454; genei/ou leukh/rh tri/xa A.Pers.1056 (lyr.), cf. Th.666, Hdt.2.36: in pl., S.OT1277, Plu.Ant.1; kei/rasqai ta\ g. Id.Cat.Mi.53: prov. of a lean animal, ou)de\n a)/llo plh\n g. te kai\ ke/rata nothing but
chin and horns, Ar.Av.902.
beard, Hdt.6.117: pl., Theoc.6.36, J.AJ11.5.3, Paus.2.10.3, Theo Sm.p.104H. a lion's
mane, Luc.Cyn.14.
chaps, Arist.HA518b17;
jaws, AP7.531 (Antip. Thess.). pl.,
teeth of a saw, Nic.Th.53. dub. sens. in IG11(2).165.11, 28 (Dclos, iii B. C.).

geneiosullekta/dai, oi(,
beard-gatherers, Ath.4.157b.
geneo/s: ei)=do/s ti pele/keos, Hsch.
genesiako/s, h/, o/n, = geneql-, h(me/ra Vett.Val.19.27.
genesia_lo/gos ( genei-olo/gos, Gloss.), o(, = geneqlialo/gos, Ach.Tat.Intr. Arat.23, v.l. in Artem.2.69.

genesi-a/rxhs, ou, o(,
creator, tou= ka/llous LXX Wi.13.3; of the Sun, Jul.Astr.in Cat.Cod.Astr.1.136.2.
genesi-arxiko/s, h/, on, = genearxiko/s, xwri/a Just.Nov.21.2.

gene/si-os, on, = gene/qlios, qeo/s Plu.2. 402a; epith. of Posidon, Paus.2.38.4. *gene/sion, to/, shrine of Posidon *g., Paus.l.c. gene/sia, ta/,
day kept in memory of the birthday of the dead, Hdt.4.26, cf. Ammon.p.36V., Phryn.83; to be distinguished from gene/qlia
birthday-feast, though used for it in Pl.Lg.784d (s. v. l.) and later Gk., POxy.736.56 (i B. C./i A. D.), PFay.114.20 (i/ii A. D.), etc., Alciphr.3.18 and 55, Ev.Matt.14.6, Ev.Marc.6.21, D.C.47.18; so h( g. h(me/ra, = h( gene/qlios, CIG2883c (Branchidae); h( g. alone, OGI583.14 (Cyprus); th=| tou= *sebastou= e)mmh/nw| g. IGRom.4.353b (Pergam., ii A. D.).

genesi-ourge/w,
bring into being, muria/das yuxw=n Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.44.

genesi-ourgi/a, h(,
generation, Corp.Herm.13.21, Iamb.Comm.Math.9; tou= ko/smou Id.Myst.1.11.

genesi-ourgo/s, o/n,
concerned with or
incident to generation, fu/sis ibid.; dai/mones ib.2.7; paqh/mata Id.VP32.228; a)sth/r Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.11; o(rmai/ Procl.in Cra.p.105 P.; duna/meis Id.Inst. 209; qeoi/ Dam.Pr.381, al.; to\ g. ib.349:—Subst. g., o(,
author of existence, c. gen., LXXWi.13.5; th=s paliggenesi/as Corp.Herm.13.4;
fashioner, creator, Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.44; panto\s ko/smou Jul.Gal. 100c.

ge/nesis, ews, h(, (gene/sqai)
origin, source, *)wkeano/n te qew=n ge/nesin Il.14.201; *)wkeanou=, o(/s per g. pa/ntessi te/tuktai ib.246, cf. Pl.Tht. 180d;
beginning, in dual, toi=n genese/oin h( e(te/ra Id.Phd.71e.
manner of birth, Hdt.1.204, 6.69, etc.;
race, descent, Id.2.146; patro\s ou)=sa ge/nesin *eu)ru/tou S.Tr.380; kata\ ge/nesin, opp. kaq' ui(oqesi/an, IG12(1).181 (Rhodes). Astrol.,
nativity, geniture, AP 11.164 (Lucill.), 183 (Id.), Epigr.Gr.314.21 (Smyrna), PLond.1.98r60 (i A. D.), Vett.Val.216.6: hence,
lot, fortune, Astramps.Orac. 16.8,23.7.
production, generation, coming into being, opp. o)/leqros, Parm.8.21; more usu. opp. fqora/, Pl.Phlb.55a, etc.; peri\ gene/sews kai\ fqora=s, title of work by Arist.: generally,
formation, pu/ou Hp.Aph.2.47;
origination, making, i(mati/wn, peri\ ta\ a)mfie/smata, Pl. Plt.281b,3; g. kai\ ou)si/a dikaiosu/nhs Id.R.359a. = to\ gi/gnesqai,
becoming, opp. ou)si/a, ib.525b, Ti.29c, Procl.Inst.45,al. concrete,
creation, i.e.
all created things, Pl.Phdr.245e; g. kai\ ko/smos Id.Ti.29e, freq. in Ph., as 1.3,al., cf. Plot.6.3.2, etc.
race, kind or
sort of animals, Pl.Plt.265b, etc.;
family, di/dumos g. of the Spartan kings, Id.Lg.691d.
generation, age, Id.Phdr.252d: pl., Id.Plt.310d; kata\ peri/stasin th=s g. according to the circumstances of his
time, Porph.Sent.32. paidopo/ros g.
genitalia muliebria, AP9.311 (Phil.). Math.,
generation of a figure, Papp.234.4,al.
origin of a spiral, Id.272.7; h( e)n g. eu)qei=a the
initial line, Id.286.22.
*genesiw/n, w=nos, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Magnesia on the Maeander, Inscr.Magn.116.

gene/t-eira, fem. of geneth/r,
mother, Pi.N.7.2, CIG4132 (Galatia); late Prose, trofo\s pa/ntwn kai\ g. h( gh= Artem.1.79; a)lh/qeia g. Plot.5.8.4.
daughter, Euph.84.4.

genet-h/, h(, = genea/ 11.3, e)k geneth=s from
the hour of birth, Il.24.535, Od.18.6; eu)qu\s e)k g. Arist.EN1144b6; opp. di' e)/qos, ib.1154a33; later a)po\ geneth=s Iamb.VP30.171.

genet-h/r, h=ros, o(, = gene/ths, Epic.Alex.Adesp.3.10, Arist.Mu.397a4, IG3.716, Coluth.373, Tryph.294: in pl.,
parents, IG7.2543, Nonn.D.4.61, al.

gene/t-hs, ou, o(,
begetter, ancestor, E.Or.1011 (anap.), Call.Epigr. 23.2;
father, IG3.1335, 12(7).115 (Amorgos); gene/tai kai\ patri\s e)/xousin o)ste/a, i.e.
the tomb of my fathers, BMus.Inscr.2.179,al.: in pl.,
parents, IG4.682 (Hermione): generally,
author, Epigr.Gr.979.4 (Philae).
son, o( *dio\s g. S.OT472; o( e)mo\s g. E.Ion916 (lyr.). as Adj., = gene/qlios, qeoi/ A.Supp.77 (lyr.), E.Ion 1130.
produced, o( *nei=los qe/rei g. Olymp.in Mete.94.9.

genet-h/sios, on,
sexual, o(rmh/ AP15.12.12 (Leo Phil.).

genet-iko/s, h/, o/n:—fem. -kh/ (sc. ptw=sis), h(,
genitive case, Sch.D.P.449.
gene/t-ios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Halos, IG9(2).109a74.
ge/net-is, h(, fem. of gene/ths, LXX Wi.7.12: acc. -tin Aglaïas 10.

*genetulli/s, i/dos, h(,
goddess of one's birth-hour, Ar.Nu.52: in pl., Id.Th.130, Luc.Pseudol.11.

gene/twr, oros, o(, = gene/ths, po/ntos g. nefe/wn a)ne/mwn te Xenoph. 30.5, cf. Hdt.8.137; g. path/r E.Ion136 (lyr.), cf. IG5(1).540 (Lacon.), 14.1565, Arist.Mu.397b21, 399a31; *)apo/llwn o( g. Id.Fr.489; *(adrianw=| gene/tori IGRom.4.562 (Aezani).
genh/, h(, poet. for genea/, Call.Fr.241, Herod.2.1,4.84.

genhi/+s, -i/+dos, Att. genh/|s, h=|dos, h(,
pickaxe, mattock, S.Ant.249.

ge/nhma, atos, to/,
produce, of the fruits of the earth (cf. ge/nnhma), PRev.Laws24.15,al. (iii B. C.), LXX Ge.40.17,al.; g. th=s a)mpe/lou Ev.Marc.14.25: pl., tou= e)nestw=tos e)/tous OGI262.9 (Syria), cf. BGU 188.9 (ii A. D.), POxy.277.6 (i B. C.); g. kai\ e)pigenh/mata PRyl.154.22 (i A. D.), etc. genhma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., PEdgar41.9.

genhma^to-gra^fe/w,
sequester produce of land for non-payment of taxes, in Pass., PFay.23.14, 26.8,al., BGU291,599.

genhma^to-gra^fi/a, h(,
sequestration, prob. in Wilcken Chr.363 (ii A. D.).

genhma^to-fu/lac [u^], akos, o(,
custodian of crops, PMagd.1.10 (iii B. C.), etc.:—hence genhma^to-fu^la^ke/w, to\n spo/ron
PTeb.ined., and genhma^to-fu^la^ki/a, h(, PTeb.27.4 (pl.), al. (ii B. C.), PRyl.90.50 (iii A. D.).
genhtiko/s, v.l. for genn-, Arist.Top.124a24.

genhto/s, h/, o/n, (gene/sqai)
originated or
originable, Arist.Cael.280b15 sqq., v.l. in Pl.Ti.28b, 28c, cf.Ph.1.3,al. (Freq. confused with gennhto/s in codd.)
genia=s: e)/kgonos, Hsch.

geniko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to or
connected with the ge/nos, Arist. Top. 102a36; h( diafora\ g. ib.101b18;
generic, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.28, Phld. Sign.18,19,etc.: Comp., Stoic.2.117, Ptol.Phas.p.5 H.: Sup., Diog. Bab.Stoic.3.214, BGU282.19 (ii A. D.), etc. Adv. -kw=s M.Ant.8.55,
Plot.6.1.9, Iamb. in Nic.p.22 P., etc.
principal, typical, o)rxh/seis Luc.Salt.34 (Comp.), cf. 22 (Sup.).
consisting of families, fulai/ D.H.4.14, etc.;
of the family, no/mos CIG3467.54 (Sardis), cf. 2712 (Mylasa).
sexual, a(ma/rthma Hdn. 6.1.5 (dub.).
in kind, opp. a)rguriko/s, lo/gos PFlor.77.7 (iii A. D.). Gramm., h( genikh/ (sc. ptw=sis)
genitive case, Stoic.2.59, D.T.636, etc.

genismo/s, o(,
arrangement according to ge/nh,
classification of rents according to (1)
hypothetical estimate and (2)
actual method of collection, PTeb.67.5, al. (ii B. C.).

ge/nn-a^ Emp.17.27, 22.9, A.Pr.853 (but ge/nna_ in lyr. passages of E., as Hec.159), hs, h(:—poet. for ge/nos,
descent, birth, origin, ge/nna| megalunome/nwn A.Pr.892, cf. Ag.760 (lyr.).
origin, [tou= o)/ntos] Parm. 8.6; die/xein ge/nnh| te krh/sei te Emp.22.7; gh= g. pa/ntwn Secund. Sent.15;
production, pu/ou Aret.SD1.14; u(grw=n ib.15.
offspring, son, Pi.O.7.23; qna/|skonta ge/nnas a)/ter A. Th.748; lagi/na g. Id.Ag.119;
generation, pe/mpth d' a)p' au)tou= ge/nna Id.Pr.853, cf. 774.
race, family, ou)rani/a g. ib. 165; a)rse/nwn g. E.Med.428 (lyr.): rare in Prose, h( tou= pe/ratos g. Pl.Phlb.25d, cf. Is.Fr. 136.
creation, creature, PMag.Leid.V.7.14. personified,
Creative Force, ib. W.5.3. of the Moon,
coming forth, Ach.Tat.Intr.Arat.21, Sch.Arat.735, Paul.Al.G.4.

genn-aia/zw,
to be brave, Sch.E.Hipp.206:—also genn-ai/+zomai, Suid. s.v. th\n leonth=n e)ndu/ou.

genn-aiopreph/s, e/s,
befitting a noble: only in Adv. -pw=s Ar.Pax988.

genn-ai=os, a, on, also os, on E.Hec.592: (ge/nna):—
true to one's birth or
descent (eu)gene\s me/n e)sti to\ e)c a)gaqou= ge/nous, gennai=on de\ to\ mh\ e)cista/menon e)k th=s au(tou= fu/sews Arist.HA488b19, cf. Rh.1390b22), ou)/ moi gennai=on a)luska/zonti ma/xesqai Il.5.253 (nowhere else in Hom.); gennai=on de/ soi taxe/ws u(pakou/ein Ar.Fr.28 D.: hence, of persons,
high-born, noble, Archil.107, etc.; te/kna Hdt.1.173; w)= gonh=| gennai=e S.OT1469; e)sqlou\s e)/k te gennai/wn gegw=tas Id.Fr.107.3; gennai=o/s tis e(pta\ pa/ppous e)/xwn a)pofh=nai Pl.Tht.174e; oi( g., opp. oi( a)gennei=s, Arist.Pol. 1296b22; so of animals,
well-bred, sku/lac Pl.R. 375a, X.Cyr.1.4.15; opp. a)gennh/s, Arist.HA558b16.
noble in mind, high-minded, Hdt.3.140 (Sup.), S.El.129 (lyr.), etc.; to\ g., = gennaio/ths, Id.OC 569; of actions,
noble, Hdt.1.37; lh=ma g. Pi.P.8.44; tla/sas to\ g. S. OC1640, cf. E.Alc.624; g. e)/pos, lo/goi, po/noi, S.Ph.1402, E.Heracl. 537, HF357 (lyr.). as a form of polite speech, gennai=os ei)= you are
very good, Ar.Th.220. w)= gennai=e, common form of address in Pl., as Grg.494e, cf. S.Ph.801; ironical, D.H.7.46. of things,
good of their kind, excellent, me/los A.Fr.281.5; stafulh/, su=ka, Pl. Lg.844e; gennai/ou . . a)/cion ou)qeno/s of no
great use, Ath.Mech.31.2; ironical, ge/nei g. sofistikh/ Pl.Sph.231b (cf. 1.1), etc.;
genuine, intense, du/h S.Aj.938, etc.;
violent, seismo/s Philostr. VA6.38; qa/lph Jul. Or. 2.101d. gennai=on: to\ th=s gene/sews a)rxhgo/n, Hsch. Adv. -ai/ws
nobly, Hdt.7.139, Th.2.41, Pl.La. 196b, Men.672; o(/rkos, ph=gma g. page/n A.Ag.1198; ironical, ma/la g. e)pilaqo/menon w(=n eu)= pa/qoi Jul. Or.3.125c: Comp. -ote/rws Pl.Tht.166c, Ps.-Callisth. 1.38: Sup. -o/tata E.Cyc.657 (lyr.). irreg. Sup. gennaie/statos Dinol. 10.

ge/nn-as, o(,
mother's brother, uncle, Hsch.

genn-a/w, fut. Med. gennh/somai in pass. sense, D.S.19.2 (but -hqh/somai Id.4.9): (ge/nna):—causal of gi/gnomai (cf. gei/nomai), mostly of the father,
beget, o( gennh/sas path/r S.El. 1412; oi( gennh/sante/s se your
parents, X.Mem. 2.1.27; to\ gennw/menon e)/k tinos Hdt.1.108, etc.; o(/qen gegenname/noi
sprung, Pi.P.5.74; of the mother,
bring forth, bear, A.Supp.48, Arist.GA716a22, X. Lac.1.3, etc.:—Med.,
produce from oneself, create, Pl. Ti.34b, Mx. 238a.
produce, grow, get, ka)\n sw=ma gennh/sh| me/ga S.Aj.1077. metaph.,
engender, produce, lh/qh tw=n i)di/wn kakw=n qrasu/thta genna=| Democr.196; pantoi/an a)reth/n Pl.Smp.209e; dianoh/mata/ te kai\ do/cas Id.R.496a, etc.; gennw=si to\n ou)rano\n [oi( filo/sofoi]
call it
into existence, Arist.Cael.283b31; o( e)c a)swma/tou gennw=n lo/gos ib.305a16, cf. Plot.6.6.9; of numbers,
produce a total, Ph. 1.347.

genn-h/eis, essa, en,
generative, mh/dea Emp.29.2.

ge/nn-hma, atos, to/,
that which is produced or
born, child, S.Tr.315; pai/dwn tw=n sw=n ne/aton g. Id.Ant.627; tw=n *lai/+ou . . tis h)=n gennhma/twn Id.OT1167: generally, any
product or
work, Pl.R. 597e, etc.: in pl.,
fruits of the earth, Plb.1.71.1, etc.; tw=n stoixei/wn Phld.Sign.37.
breeding, dhloi= to\ g. w)mo\n (sc. o)/n） . . paido/s S.Ant.471. Act.,
begetting, A.Pr. 850 (pl., s.v.l.).
producing, Pl.Sph.266d.

genn-hma^ti/zw,
produce offspring, Aq.Is.55.10, al.
genn-hma^tiko/s, h/, o/n, = gennhtiko/s, J.BJ4.8.3.
genn-hsiourgo/s, = genesiourgo/s, Hsch.

ge/nn-hsis, Dor. ge/nn-a_sis, ews, h(,
engendering, producing, E.IA1065 (lyr., codd.); g. kai\ to/kos Pl.Smp.206e;
birth, IG22.1368.130, v.l. in Ev.Luc.1.14.
production, a)gaqw=n Arist.Pol.1332a18 (pl.).
genn-h/teira, h(, fem. of gennhth/r, Pl.Cra.410c.

genn-hte/on,
one must produce, grow, Gal.10.198.
genn-hth/r, h=ros, o(, = sq. 1, App.Anth.6.128.

genn-hth/s, ou=, o(,
begetter, parent, S.OT1015, Fr.752, Pl.Cri.51e, Lg.717e; tw=n pra/cewn w(/sper kai\ te/knwn Arist.EN1113b18: generally,
producer, Plot.3.3.3. gennh=tai, oi(, (ge/nna) at Athens,
members of ge/nh, Pl.Lg.878d, Philoch.94; ei)s tou\s g. e)ggra/fein, a)/gein, Is.7.13,15, cf. Arist.Ath.3, IG22.1229.5; *)apo/llwnos *patrw/|ou kai\ *dio\s *(erkei/ou g. D.57.67.

genn-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
generative, productive, h( pra=cis h( g. Arist.HA539b21; yuxh\ g. Id.de An.416b25: c. gen.,
generative or
productive of . . , tino/s Epicur.Ep.1p.11U., Arist.GA726b21, etc.; u(/lhn spe/rmatos -kh/n Epicur.Nat.Herc.908.1. of men or animals,
able to procreate, Arist.HA544b26, de An.432b24.

genn-hto/s, h/, o/n,
begotten, ui(o\s g., opp. poihto/s, Pl.Lg.923e;
mortal, Luc.Icar.2; gennhtoi\ gunaikw=n
born of women, Ev.Matt.11.11, Ev.Luc.7.28.
generable, opp. fqarto/s, Arist.Metaph.1027a29 (v. l.); u(lh\ g. matter
for generation, ib.1042b6. Adv. -tw=s
by means of generation, Iamb. Myst.1.18.
genn-h/tria, h(, = gennh/teira, dikw=n Phryn.PSp.62 B.

genn-h/twr, Dor. genn-a/twr, oros, o(, = gene/twr, *zeu/s A.Supp.206, E.Hipp.683, Jul.Or.2.51d, v.l. in Arist.Mu.397b21; g. kai\ e(stiou=xon Pl.Lg.878a: pl., ib.869a; qew=| gennh/tori pa/ntwn IG3.636: metaph. of numbers, e)a\n puqmenikoi\ w)=sin oi( g. Iamb. in Nic.p.56 P., al.

gennodo/teira, h(,
the giver of heirs, *)afrodi/th Orph.H.55.12.
genno/n: a)rxai=on, Hsch. (perh. for e(/non); also, = koi=lon, Id. ge/nnou: kai\ la/be (cf. ge/nto） kai\ ka/qize (Cypr.), Id.

ge/nos, eos or ous, to/,
race, stock, kin, a)mfote/roisin o(mo\n g. h)d' i)/a pa/trh Il.13.354; ai(=ma/ te kai\ g. Od.8.583; u(mete/rou d' ou)k e)/sti ge/neos basileu/teron 15.533; ge/nos pate/rwn ai)sxune/men Il.6.209; g. a)po/lwle tokh/wn Od.4.62; o(/qi toi ge/nos e)sti\ kai\ au)th=| 6.35: freq. abs. in acc., e)c *)iqa/khs ge/nos ei)mi/ from Ithaca I am
by race, 15.267, cf. Il. 5.544,896, S.Ph.239, etc.; in Att. freq. with the Art., podapo\s to\ ge/nos ei)=
; Ar.Pax186, cf. Pl.Sph.216a: so in dat., ge/nei poli=tai D.23.24; ge/nei ui(o/s, opp. an adopted son, Id.44.2; oi( e)n ge/nei, = suggenei=s, S.OT1430; oi( e)/cw ge/nous Id.Ant.660; ou)de\n e)n ge/nei Id.OT1016; ge/nei prosh/kein tini/ X.An.1.6.1; ge/nei a)pwte/rw ei)=nai D. 44.13: in gen., ge/nous ei)=nai/ tinos to be of his
race, a)/nagnos kai\ ge/nous tou= *lai/+ou S.OT1383, cf. X.HG4.2.9; e)ggute/rw, e)ggu/tata ge/nous, nearer, next
of kin, Is.8.33, A.Supp.388.
direct descent, opp.
collateral relationship, ge/nos ga/r, a)ll' ou)xi\ sugge/neia Is.8.33; ai( kata\ ge/nos basilei=ai
hereditary monarchies, Arist.Pol.1285a16, 1313a10.
offspring, even of
a single descendant, so\n g. Il.19.124, 21.186; h( d' a)/r' e)/hn qei=on g. ou)d' a)nqrw/pwn 6.180; a(mo\n *oi)di/pou g. A. Th.654; *dio\s g., of Bacchus, S.Ant.1117 (lyr.); *te/kmhssa, du/smoron g. Id.Aj.784. collectively,
offspring, posterity, e)kei=noi kai\ to\ g. to\ a)p' e)kei/nwn Th.1.126; e)cw/lh poiei=n au)to\n kai\ g. kai\ oi)ki/an D.19.71. generally,
race, of beings, qew=n Ar.Th.960; h(miqe/wn g. a)ndrw=n Il.12.23; h(mio/nwn, bow=n g., Il.2.852, Od.20.212; i(/ppeion g., i.e.
mules, S.Ant.342; i)xqu/wn plwto\n g. Id.Fr.941.9.
clan, house, family, Hdt.1.125, etc.; *fru\c me\n geneh=|, ge/neos de\ tou= basilhi/+ou ib.35; tou\s a)po\ ge/nous men
of noble family, Plu.Rom.21; i(ereu\s kata\ g. IG 5(1).497, al.; also i(e/reia a)po\ ge/nous, dia\ ge/nous, ib.607.29,602; esp. at Athens and elsewhere as a subdivision of the fratri/a, Arist.Ath. Fr.3, Pl.Alc.1.120e, etc.; = Lat.
gens, D.S.4.21, Plu.Num.1.
tribe, as a subdivision of e)/qnos, Hdt. 1.56,101.
caste, Id.2.164. of animals,
breed, Id.4.29.
age, generation, Od.3.245; g. xru/seon, etc., Hes.Op.109: hence,
age, time of life, ge/nei u(/steros Il.3.215, cf. Arist.Rh.1408a27.
sex, Epich.172.1, Pl.Smp.189d;
gender, Arist.Rh.1407b7, Diog.Bab.Stoic.3.214, etc.
class, sort, kind, ta\ g. tw=n kunw=n e)sti dissa/ X.Cyn.3.1; to\ filo/sofon g. Pl. R.501e; to\ tw=n gewrgw=n [g.] Id.Ti.17c, cf. R. 434b, Arist.Pol.1329a27; tw=n i)xquopwlw=n g. Xenarch.7.4; to\ tw=n parasi/twn g. Nicol. Com.1.1, etc. in Logic, opp. ei)=dos (species), Pl.Prm.129c, al., Arist.Top.102a31, 102b12, al.; ta\ g. ei)s ei)/dh plei/w kai\ diafe/ronta diairei=tai Id.Metaph.1059b36. in the animal kingdom, ta\ me/gista g., = the modern Classes, such as birds, fishes, Id.HA490b7, cf. 505b26; so in the vegetable kingdom, ge/nh ta\ me/gista, = sitw/dh, xedropa/ and a)nw/numa, Thphr.HP8.1.1.
genus, to\ tw=n karki/nwn g., to\ tw=n peristerw=n g., etc., Arist.HA487b17, 488a4; tw=n de/ndrwn kai\ tw=n futw=n ei)/dh plei/w tugxa/nei kaq' e(/kaston ge/nos Thphr.HP1.14.3; tou= au)tou= ge/nous [pi/tus] kai\ peu/kh Dsc. 1.69, al. ge/nos ti a
species of plant, Thphr.HP4.8.13; so later, ge/nh, =
crops, a)/llois ge/nesi toi=s pro\s puro\n dioikoume/nois PTeb.66.43, al. (ii B. C.); oi(=s e)a\n ai(rw=mai ge/nesi plh\n knh/kou PAmh.2.91.15 (ii A. D.);
produce, POxy.727.20 (ii A. D.);
materials, ib.54.16 (iii A. D.); e)n ge/nesin in
kind, opp. e)n a)rguri/w|, PFay.21.10 (ii A. D.). ta\ g. the
elements, Pl.Ti.54b. (Cf. Skt.
jánas, gen.
jánasas; Lat.
genus, -eris, v. gi/gnomai.)
genou/sths, ou, o(, misread for ge/nous th=s in Pl.Phlb.30d, cf. Hsch.
ge/nta, ta/, = e)/ntera, Call.Fr.309, Nic.Al.62,557; = kre/a, spla/gxna, Hsch.

gentia_nh/, h(,
gentian, Hp.Ep.19, Dsc.3.3. [-a_nh/ Damocr. ap. Gal. 13.822, 14.97, but -a^nh/ ib.14.123.]
gentia\s r(i/za, = foreg., Androm. ap. Gal.14.41. = gluku/rriza, Dsc.3.5; = kentau/reion to\ me/ga ib.6.
ge/ntimos: a)/kron tou= a(lieutikou= kala/mou, Hsch.; cf. ge/rsumon. ge/ntinoi: oi)kei=oi, and ge/ntinos: u(/pnos, Id.

ge/nto,
he grasped, = e)/laben, 3sg. of Verb found only in this form, Il.8.43, al. (Cf. a)po/geme: a)/felke, and u(/ggemos: sullabh/ (Cypr.), Hsch.) shortd. form for e)ge/neto, v. gi/gnomai.
ge/nuc: pe/lekus, Hsch.

ge/nu^s, uos, h(, dat. ge/nui Pi.O.13.85: pl., gen. genu/wn P.4.225 (disyll.), A.Th.122 (lyr.): dat. ge/nusi S.Ant.121 (lyr.), Ep. ge/nussi Il.11.416, genu/essi Nic. (v. infr.): acc. ge/nuas, contr. ge/nu_s:—
jaw, puka/sai te ge/nus eu)anqe/i+ la/xnh| Od.11.320; h( a)/nw g., h( ka/twqen, Arist.HA492b23, sq.: pl., ge/nues
both jaws, the mouth with the teeth, Il.23.688, 11.
416, Pi.P.4.225, S.Ant.121: in sg., Thgn.1327, E.Ph.1380, al.: generally,
side of the face, cheek, fi/lon fi/lhma para\ ge/nun tiqe/nta E. Supp.1154.
edge of an axe, axe, S.Ph.1205 (lyr.), El.196 (lyr.); of a fishing-hook, Opp.H.3.539; pura/grhs Nic.Al.50 (pl.). (Cf. Skr.
hanus, Lat.
gena, etc.) [u_ twice in E., El.1214 (lyr.), Fr. 530.6.]
geo-eidh/s, e/s, = gew/dhs, Ti.Locr.101a, Arist.GA731b13, HA555b28.

geo-qalph/s, es,
earth-cherishing, CIG3769 (Nicomedia).
geo-ktei/ths, ou, = gewmo/ros (?) (add.), ib.3695b (Mysia).

geo/omai, Pass.,
to become earth, D.S.3.40.

geou=xos, o(,
landowner, Agatharch.95, PAmh.88.30 (ii A. D.), POxy.910.16, etc. (gaiou=xos Paul.Al.N.2): hence geouxe/w PFay.23.6, BGU18.19 (ii A. D.), etc.; geouxiko/s, h/, o/n, POxy.1638.15 (iii A. D.).

ge/rados: ai)gialo/s, Hsch.; cf. xe/rados. gera/zw,
honour, EM 8.5, 227.43:—Pass., Hsch.
gerai/omai, dub. l. in Nic.Al.396.

geraio/s, a/, o/n, (ge/rwn, gh=ras) = ghraio/s,
old: in Hom. (who never has ghraio/s) always of men, with notion of dignity (v. infr.), cf. Pi. N.4.89; o( geraio/s that
reverend sire, Il.1.35, etc.; geraie/ 10.164, etc.; but geraia/s (acc. pl. fem.) 6.87 (cf. 270, 287) is f.l. for gerai/ras, v. geraro/s: Comp. gerai/teros Od.3.24, A.Eu.848, Hdt.6.52; gonh=| pefukw\s g. （-te/ra| codd.) S.OC1294; freq. in political sense, oi( g.
the elders, senators, X.Cyr.1.5.5, Pl.Lg.952a, IG14.2445 (Massilia): Sup. gerai/tatos Ar.Ach.286, Pl.Lg.855e, etc.; rarely, = presbu/tatos,
eldest, Theoc.15.139. of things,
ancient, po/lis A.Ag.710 (lyr.); xei/r E.Hec.64 (lyr.). (gerai^o/s Tyrt.10.20, E.HF446 (lyr.); cf. gerao/s.)

geraio/ths, htos, h(,
advanced age, PMasp.279.26 (vi A. D.), etc.

geraio/-floios, on,
with old, wrinkled skin, su=ka AP6.102 (Phil.).

geraio/-frwn, onos, o(, h(, (frh/n)
old of mind, sage, A.Supp.361 (lyr., Burges for gerafro/nwn).
ge/raira, h(, v. geraro/s. geraira/des or gerara/des, ai(, = gerarai/, AB228; priestesses of Athena at Argos, ib.231.10; gerhra/des, Hsch.

gerai/rw, Ep. impf. ge/rairon Il.7.321: fut. gera^rw= Jusj. ap. D.59.78, Epigr.Gr.992 (Balbilla): aor. 1 e)ge/rhra CIG2936 (Tralles), APl. 4.183.7, Orph.A.507, ge/rhra IG4.1475 (Epid.); e)ge/ra_ra Pi.O.5.5, N.5.8: (geraro/s):—
honour, reward with a gift, nw/toisin d' *ai)/anta dihneke/essi ge/rairen Il.7.321, cf. Od.14.437,441, etc.: generally,
honour, tina/ Pi.O.3.2: c. dat. modi, bwmou\s e(ortai=s ib.5.5; tina\ e)piniki/ois B.2.8; ge/nos qew=n g. fwnh=| Ar. Th.961 (lyr.); dw/rois kai\ a)rxai=s kai\ e(/drais kai\ pa/sais timai=s X. Cyr.8.1.39; stefa/nois tou\s nikw=ntas Id.HG1.7.33; o(\n . . e)pestefa/nwse gerai/rwn IG3.713:—Pass., ti/mios gerai/retai E.Supp.553; timai=s X.Cyr.8.8.4. gerai/rei: te/rpei, Hsch.:—Pass., gerairo/mena mni/oisi prob. in Nic.Al.396. reversely, g. tini/ ti
present as an honorary gift, ta\ *)ioba/kxeia tw=| *dionu/sw| Jusj. ap. D.l.c.
celebrate, ta\ pa/qea tragikoi=si xoroi=si Hdt. 5.67; xorei/ais qusi/an Pl.Lg.799a, cf. Epin.980b.—Not in early Prose, exc. Hdt., X., and Pl.: in later Prose, Ph.1.186, Arr.Ind.8.5 (Pass.), Porph.Abst.2.16, etc.
*gerai/stios, v. *gera/stios.
gerai/teros, gerai/tatos, Comp. and Sup. of geraio/s (q. v.).
gera^le/os, = ghr-, Hsch.

gera/ndru^on, to/, (dru=s)
an old tree or
stump, Ph.2.437, Plu.2.796b, etc.: hence of an old person, Aristaen.2.1: heterocl. pl., gera/ndrues, Hsch. as Adj.,
old, withered, Thphr.HP2.7.2, A.R.1.1118, Jul.Ep.98; g. pre/mna Dsc.4.186. (u_ A.R. l.c., u^ AP9.233 (Eryc.).)

nera/n-eion [a^], to/, a kind of
truffle, Eust.1017.19; = u(/dnon, Thphr. HP1.6.9, ap.Ath.2.62a (om.codd. Thphr.); but dist. from u(/. ib. 1.6.5, ap.Ath.2.61f.

neran-i/as, ou, o(, (ge/ranos)
crane-necked, long-necked, Phryn.PSp.55 B.

neran-i/zw,
utter the crane's note, Gloss.

nera/n-ion, to/, (ge/ra^nos)
Geranium tuberosum, a plant, Dsc.3.116; e(/teron g.
crane's-bill, Erodium malacoides, ibid.; also gera/nios, Hsch. (but h( gera/nios a
plaster, Aët.15.15). substance used in Alchemy, Pelag.Alch.p.256 B.

neran-i/s, i/dos, h(, a kind of
surgical bandage, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.47 tit., Gal.18(1).814.

neran-i/ths (sc. li/qos), ou, o(,
a precious stone, Plin.37.187. [i_]
gera^no-bosi/a, h(, = sq., Poll.9.16.

gera^no-bwti/a, h(,
feeding of cranes, Pl.Plt.264c (pl.).
gera^no-ge/rwn, = gera/nion, Ps.-Dsc.3.116.

gera^no-ma^xi/a, h(,
battle with cranes, *(omhrikh\ tw=n *pugmai/wn g. Str.2.1.9.
gera^no-po/dion, = luxni/s, Ps.-Dsc.3.100.

ge/ra^nos, h(, also o(, Thphr.Sign.38:—
crane, Grus cinerea, Il.3.3, Hes.Op.448, Alc.Supp.9, Ar.Av.710, Arist.HA614b18, al.
crane for lifting weights, esp. used in the theatre, Poll.4.130.
quern, Hsch.
dance resembling the movements of the crane, Luc.Salt.34, Plu.Thes.21, Poll.4.101. (masc.) a
fish, Ael. NA15.9. = o)/mbros (Cyren.), EM227.51. (Cf. OHG.
chranuh, OE.
cran 'crane', Lith.
garn[ytilde]s 'stork', etc.)

gera^noulko/s, o(,
leader of the dance called ge/ranos at Delos, Hsch.

gera^no/fqalmos, on,
crane-eyed, Sch.Opp.H.1.386.

gera^nw/dhs, es,
crane-like, tra/xhlos Phryn.PSp.55 B.
gera^o/s, h/, o/n, = geraio/s, S.OC200, Tim.Pers.227, Nic.Fr.74.71, IG3.779.

gerao/xos, on,
holder of privilege, gloss on a)ge/rwxos, Sch.Il.10.430.

gera^ro/s, a/, o/n,
of reverend bearing, majestic, Il.3.170; gerarw/teros h)=en *)odusseu/s ib.211; gerarh\ tra/peza a table
of honour, Xenoph.1.9; gerarai=s xersi/ IG14.818; a)nh\r g. to\ ei)=dos Plu.Alex.26; to\ g. tou= h)/qous M.Ant.1.15. Adv. -rw=s, me/lpousin AP9.692. later, = geraio/s, A.Ag.722 (lyr.); g. tokh=es IG3.1335, Q.S.9.90. geraroi/, oi(,
elders, A.Supp.667 (lyr.); but gerarai/
priestesses of Dionysus is f. l. for ge/rairai in D.59.73, al.; cf. *mhtro\s . . pro/polos semnh/ te ge/raira IG2.2116, and gerai/ras (acc. pl.) is prob. l. in Il.6.270, cf. 87,287 (cf. Sch. BT); cf. EM227.35. (ge/raira old fem. of geraro/s; cf. xi/maira: xi/maros.)

ge/ra^s, aos (in Prose -ws X.Ages.1.5, Luc. Tyr.9), to/: nom. pl. ge/ra^, apoc. for ge/raa, Il.2.237, 9.334, Od.4.66; ge/ra_ E.Ph.874; ge/rea Hdt.2.168, SIG1037 (Milet.); ge/rh ib.1025 (Cos); ge/ra_ta IG14.1389i29: gen. pl. gerw=n Th.3.58, etc.; Ep. dat. gera/essi Hes.Th. 449, Theoc.17.109:—
gift of honour, moi=ran kai\ g. e)sqlo\n e)/xwn Od.11.534; to\ ga\r g. e)sti qano/ntwn
the last honours of the dead, Il.16.457;
privilege, prerogative conferred on kings or nobles, g. q' o(/ ti dh=mos e)/dwken Od.7.150, cf. Il.20.182; ta\s a)ggeli/as e)sfe/rein e)di/dou g. Hdt. 1.114, etc.; pro/teron de\ h)=san e)pi\ r(htoi=s ge/rasi patrikai\ basilei=ai Th. 1.13; timai\ kai\ e)/painoi kai\ g. Pl.R.516c; g. kai\ a)=qla ib.460b; freq. of priests (cf. 3), Aeschin.3.18; dai/mosin ne/mei ge/ra a)/lloisin a)/lla A.Pr.231; so later, g. a)leitourghsi/as PFlor.382.3 (iii A. D.). generally,
gift, present, Od.20.297, etc. esp.
perquisite received by priests at sacrifices, ta\ de/rmata kai\ ta\ a)/lla ge/rea SIG1037 (Milet., iv/iii B. C.); ge/rh lamba/nei to\ de/rma kai\ to\ ske/los ib.1025.22 (Cos, iv/iii B. C.); o( pria/menos tw=n gerw=n lh/yetai ta\s genome/nas karpei/as PEleph.14.13 (iii B. C.).
reward, POxy.1408.16 (iii A. D.). (If akin to ge/rwn, prop.
privilege of age.）

gera/smios, on, (ge/ras)
honouring, h.Merc.122. = geraro/s,
honoured, E.Ph.923; ma/ntis Nic.Th.613;
aged, o)/sswn E.Supp.95.

*gera/stios, o(,
a month at Sparta and Cos, Th.4.119, SIG1012.15; at Troezen and Calaurea (in form *gerai/st-), Caryst.13, SIG993.

gerasto/s, h/, o/n,
honoured, EM227.43.

gerasfo/ros, on,
winning honour, Pi.P.2.43.
gera/ths, name of a breed of horses, POxy.922.7 (vi/vii A. D.).
gergaqo/s, = gurg-, POxy.741.5 (ii A. D.). ge/rgana (i. e. verg-）: e)rgalei=a, Hsch.
ge/rgera: polla/, Hsch. (ge/rgena cod., cf. Varr.LL5.11).
gerge/rimos (sc. e)lai/a), = drupeph/s, Call.Fr.50, cf. Suid., Hsch.; also of figs, Didym. ap. Ath.2.56d.
gerge/rinos, = gergi=nos, Hsch. ge/rgeros: bro/gxos, Id.; cf. gargarew/n. gerge/roy: zw=|on, Id. (gerge/l- cod.). gergi=nos, o(, = dia/bolos, Id. ge/rgupes: nekroi/, Id.
ge/rgura, v. go/rgura.

gerdiorabdisth/s, o(,
worker who beat the web in a weaving-shed, PTeb.305.5 (ii A. D.).

gerdio/s or ge/rdios, o(,
weaver, Hsch., Rev.Épigr.1.146, PTeb.116.48 (ii B. C.), POxy.39.8 (i A. D.), etc.:—also ge/rdis, BGU426.19, etc.:—fem. gerdi/a, Edict.Diocl.20.12, gerdi/aina, BGU617.4 (but ge/rdios, h(, EM228.40):—Adj. gerdiako/s, h/, o/n, te/xnh PGrenf.2.59.10; i(sto/s POxy.646: -ko/n (sc. te/los), to/,
tax on weaving, ib.288.2 (i A. D.).

gerdiw/n, w=nos, o(,
weaving-shed, PFlor.50.70 (iii A. D.).

gerdopoio/n, to/, =
textrinum, Gloss.

gerea_fo/ros,
one who enjoys perquisites, title of priest at Cos (cf. ge/ras 3), g. basile/wn SIG1025.21.
ge/rhn, h(, fem. of ge/ranos, Ael.Dion.Fr.104, Hsch.; also, = e)/ntimos, Id.

*gerh/nios, o(, Homeric epith. of Nestor, *gerh/nios i(ppo/ta *ne/stwr,
from Gerena or Gerenon, a city of Messenia; cei=nos e)w\n . . par' i(ppoda/moisi *gerh/nois Hes.Fr.15.3.

gerh-fori/a, h(,
enjoyment of privileges, D.H.2.10 (pl.).
gerh-fo/ros, = gereafo/ros, BCH12.282 (Myndos).
gerqure/on: i(laro/n, Hsch. ge/rinqoi: e)re/binqoi, Id.
geroa/ktai: dh/marxoi (Lacon.), Hsch. (for gerw'iaktai/, = gerousiastai/).

geroi=a, ta/,
tales of old time, Corinn.20: as title of poems by her, Ant.Lib.25 (prob.).
geroi/tan: pa/ppon (Cypr.), Hsch.; cf. ge/rus, geru/tas, = ge/rwn, Id.

geront-a^gwge/w, (a)gwgo/s)
guide an old man, S.OC348: c.acc., *phle/a g. Id.Fr.487, parodied by Com.Adesp.11, cf. Ar.Eq.1099.
geront-a/rion, to/, = gero/ntion, Gloss.

geront-ei/a, h(,
membership of a gerousi/a, OGI 534 (Ephesus).

gero/nt-eios, a, on,
belonging to an old man or
old age, Ar.Fr.715.

geront-eu/w,
to be a senator, geronteu/sas IG5(1).254 (Sparta, i B. C.), al.:—Med., Hsch.s.v. ghrwpi/zetai.
geront-i/a, h(, Lacon., = gerousi/a, X.Lac.10.1.

geront-i/as, ou, o(,
father's father (Lacon.), Sch.Il.14.118, Eust.971.23.

geront-ia/w,
grow old or
childish, D.L.3.18.

geront-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for old men, loutra/ Pl.Lg.761c; kra=sis Ath.Med. ap. Orib. inc.23.6: -ko/n, to/,
senate-house, Str.14.1.43; cf. sq. Adv. -kw=s
like an old man, v.l. in Ar.V.1132, cf. Plu.2.639d: Comp. -kw/teron Cic. Att.12.1.2.

gero/nt-ion, to/, Dim. of ge/rwn,
little old man, Hp.Ep.13, Ar.Ach.993, X.An.6.3.22, Theoc.4.58, Luc.Bacch.3. the Carthaginian Senate, Plb.6.51.2 (v.l. gerontiko/n).

geronto-gra/|dio [a_], to/, （grau=s)
old man-woman, barbarism in Ar. Th.1199 (sed divisim leg.).

geronto-di^da/ska^los, o(, h(,
old man's master, Pl.Euthd.272c.

geronto-eidh/s, e/s,
like an old man, Eust. 1923.63.

geronto-komei=on, to/, (kome/w)
hospital for the old, Cod.Just.1.3.45.1:—also Subst. geronto-ko/mos, o(,
warden of such a hospital, Just.Nov.7.1:
geronto-komika/, ta/, Sch. Pl.Phdr.240c.

geronto-ma^ni/a, h(,
craze or
dotage of old men, name of a play by Anaxandrides, Arist.Rh.1413b26.

gerousi/-a, h(,
Council of Elders, senate, E.Rh.401: esp. at Sparta, D.20.107, Arist.Pol.1270b24, IG5(2).345.10 (Orchom. Arc., ii/i B. C.); cf. gerwi/+a and geronti/a; also of the Carthaginian Senate,
Arist.Pol.1272b37; and the Roman, Plu.2.789e, Jul.Or.2.97b; of the Jewish
Sanhedrin, Act.Ap.5.21, cf. LXX Ex.3.16.
sacred college, i(era\ g. IG3.702 (Eleusis), cf. 7.2808 (Hyettus, iii B. C.), etc. = presbei/a, E.Rh.936.

gerousi-ako/s, a/, o/n,
of or
belonging to the senate, xrh/mata CIG3080 (Teos).

gerousi-a/rxhs, ou, o(,
president of Jewish elders, ib.9902 (Rome).

gerou/si-as, ou, o(,
member of the gerousi/a at Sparta, IG5(1).31, al.: pl., ib.62.19; also,
official of a guild, ib.206, 209.

gerousi-asth/s, ou=, o(,
member of a gerousi/a, Plb.7.9.1, IG7.2808.17 (Hyettus, iii B. C.).

gerou/si-os, a, on,
for or
befitting the ge/rontes, g. oi)=nos wine
drunk only by the chiefs, Il.4.259, Od.13.8; g. o(/rkos an oath
taken by them, Il.22.119; gerou/sion, to/,
perquisite of chiefs, Hsch.

gerra/dia, ta/,
mats of plaited work, Hsch.

ge/rron, to/,
anything made of wicker-work:
oblong shield, covered with ox-hide, Hdt.7.61, X.Cyr.7.1.33, etc.; *qra/|kia g. Plu. Aem.32. ge/rra, ta/,
wattled screens or
booths, used in the Athen. market-place, ta\ g. e)nepi/mprasan D.18.169; ta\ g. a)nairei=n Id.59.90: generally,
wattles, Str.4.4.3, Jul.Or.1.29d: metaph. of the eyelashes, Gal.UP10.6.
wicker body of a cart, Str.7.2.3. = gerroxelw/nh, Plb.8.3.3 (pl.), D.H.6.92, Arr.An.1.21.5.
stake, Eup.405;
dart, dub. in Alcm.133. = ai)doi=on (Sicel) (or prob., = o)/lisbos, cf. Orion 43.24), Epich.235.

gerro-fo/roi, oi(,
troops that used wicker shields, X.An.1.8.9, Pl.La. 191c, Str.7.3.17.

gerro-fu/lac [u^], akos, o(,
defender of wicker-work barrier, Sammelb.1918, prob.in OGI111 (nisi leg. o(rofu/lac).

gerro-xelw/nh, h(,
penthouse, mantlet, used in siege-works, Ph.Bel.98.19.
ge/rrw: a)po/lwla, Hsch. (i. e. ve/rrw).

ge/rsumon, to/,
end of a fishing-rod, Hsch.
ge/ru^nos, o(, = gu/rinos, Nic. Th.620, Al.563.
gerwi/+a (i. e. gerw'i/a), h(, Lacon. form of gerousi/a, Ar.Lys.980 (gerwxi/a codd.); cf. gerwni/a, Hsch.

ge/rwn, ontos, o(,
old man, Il.1.33, etc.: pleon., palaioi\ ge/rontes Ar. Ach.676; a)/nous te kai\ g. S.Ant.281, cf. Ar.Eq.1349; a)ei\ ga\r h(ba=| toi=s ge/rousin eu)= maqei=n A.Ag.584; kalo\n de\ kai\ ge/ronta manqa/nein sofa/ Id.Fr.396. ge/rontes, oi(,
Elders, Chiefs, ki/klhsken de\ ge/rontas a)risth=as *panaxaiw=n Il.2.404 sq., cf. 9.574, Od.2.14; later, Senators, esp. at Sparta, Hdt.1.65, 6.57, Pl.Lg.692a, IG22.687, Arist.Pol. 1265b38 (sg. ge/ronti IG5(1).1346, but usu. gerousi/as, q. v.); in other states, as at Elis, Arist.Pol.1306a17, cf. 1272a7, OGI479.11 (Dorylaeum). as Adj.,
old, ge/ron sa/kos Od.22.184; g. gra/mma A.Fr. 331; more freq. in masc., g. path/r Il.1.358, Od.18.53; a)nh\r g. Thgn. 1351; g. xalko/s Simon.144; g. lo/gos A.Ag.750 (lyr.); i(/ppos S.El. 25; po/nos Id.OC1258 (codd. but pi/nos Scaliger, edd.); oi)=nos Alex. 167.5, cf. Eub.124; pe/plos, le/mbos, Theoc.7.17, 21.12: rarely in Prose, oi( ge/rontes tw=n i)xqu/wn Arist.HA607b28; of stags, ib.611b3; *)anti/gonos o( g. Antigonus
the Elder, Plu.Pel.2: neut. pl., ge/ronta bouleu/eis (for a)rxai=a) S.Fr.794.
part of the spinning-wheel, Pherecr.114. (Skt.
járant- 'old',
járati 'render infirm'; cf. ge/ras.)

gerwni/a and gerwxi/a, v. gerwi/+a. gerw/noion: koi=lon, keno/n, Hsch. ge/sma: geu=ma, Id. ge/sta: gogguli/s, Id.:—also gesti/a: e)/ndusis, and ge/stra: stolh/, Id. ge/tor: e)/tos, and ge/tos: e)niauto/s, Id. (g = v). geu=: guno\n ti\ a)/ra, Id.
geuqmo/s, o(, = geu=sis, Nic.Al.399.
geu/lofa, = gew/lofa, Hsch.

geu=ma, atos, to/, (geu/w)
taste, smack of a thing, E.Cyc.150; tri/a g. Ar.Ach.187; geu/matos xa/rin Arist.HA491a8.
food, sithra\ g. Hp.Acut.10: metaph., a)/geustoi tou= pantro/fou g. sofi/as Ph.1.544.
geumatiko/s, h/, o/n, dub. sens., xitw/n Schwyzer 462B29 (Tanagra, iii B. C.).
geunw=n: gona/twn, Hsch. (leg. geu/nwn, cf. go/nu).

geu=os, to/, in pl. geu/h, perh.
ass, POxy.1675.12 (iii A. D.).

geu=s-is, ews, h(,
sense of taste, Democr.11, Arist.EN1118a26, de An. 422a29, etc.
a tasting, LXX Da.5.2.
food, LXX Wi. 16.2, al.
taste, flavour, Dsc.1.12, Gp.5.7.3.
back of the tongue, Poll.2.104.

geus-te/on,
one must make to taste, tina\ ai(/matos Pl.R.537a.

geus-th/rion, to/,
cup for tasting with, Ar.Fr.299, Pherecr. 143.3.

geu/s-ths, ou, o(,
taster, CIG2214.8 (Chios).

geus-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for taste, g. ai)sqhth/rion the seat of the sense
of taste, Arist. de An.422b5; ai)/sqhsis D.H. Comp.12; du/namis Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.60; to\ g. Plu.2.990a. Adv. -kw=s Sch. Ven.Il.5.661.

geus-to/s, h/, o/n,
that may be tasted, to\ g. Arist.Rh.1370a23, de An.422a8, Plu.2.38a, Porph.Abst.1.33.
*geusto/s, o(, name of a month at Lamia, IG9(2).66, al.
geustri/nhn: gaulo/n, Hsch.
geu/strion, geustri/dion, and geustri/s, = geusth/rion, Gloss.

geu/w, fut. geu/sw Anaxipp.1.27: aor. e)/geusa Hdt.7.46, E.Cyc.149: —Med., fut. geu/somai Od.17.413, etc.: aor. e)geusa/mhn 20.181, etc.; geu/setai, -so/meqa, Ep. for -htai, -w/meqa, Il.21.61, 20.258: 3pl. opt. geusai/ato E.IA423: pf. ge/geumai A. v. infr., etc. (geu/meqa Theoc.14.51): plpf. e)ge/geunto Th.2.70:—
give a taste of, gluku\n geu/sas to\n ai)w=na Hdt.7.46; tina/ ti E.Cyc.149, Theopomp.Com.65, Polyaen. 1.1.1; tina/ tinos Anaxipp. l.c., Alex.179, Pl.Lg.634a: metaph., tina\ a)gaqw=n lo/gwn dub. in Men.Georg.45; s' e)/geus' a)\n tw=n e)mw=n xeirw=n Herod.6.11: but, Med., geu/omai, with pf. and plpf. Pass.,
taste, c. gen., proiko\s geu/sesqai *)axaiw=n Od.17.413; a)llh/lwn e)ge/geunto
they had tasted, eaten of . . , Th.2.70; me/litos Pl.R.559d, etc.
take food, Hp.Epid.3.1.b/, Act.Ap.10.10;
dine, PLond. ined.2487 (iv A. D.). metaph.,
taste, make proof of, feel, douro\s a)kwkh=s h(mete/roio geu/setai Il.21.60; o)i+stou= Od.21.98; xeirw=n 20. 181; a)ll' a)/ge . . geuso/meq' a)llh/lwn e)gxei/h|sin
let us try one another with the spear, Il.20.258;
taste the sweets of, a)rxh=s, e)leuqeri/hs, Hdt. 4.147, 6.5; u(/mnwn Pi.I.5(4).20; a)lka=s, stefa/nwn, Id.P.9.35, I.1.21; ei) de\ geu/etai a)ndro\s a)nh/r ti Id.N.7.86; of a married woman, a)ndro\s gegeume/nh A.Fr.243; g. po/nwn
to have experience of them, Pi. N.6.24; mo/xqwn S.Tr.1101; pe/nqous E.Alc.1069; no/mwn Pl.Lg.752c; a)mfote/rwn Id.R.358e; g. e)mpu/rwn
make trial of them, S.Ant.1005: rarely c. acc., e)/rshs i)kma/da geuo/menos AP6.120 (Leon.); ka/pparin Plu.2.687d: abs., S.Aj.844. (Cf. Skt.
ju[snull ]áte 'enjoy', Lat.
gusto.）

ge/fu_ra (Boeot. be/fura Stratt.47.5), Lacon. di/foura Hsch., Cret. de/fura GDI5000 ii
b 6 (Gortyn), h( (used by Hom. only in Il., always in pl.):—
dyke, dam, potamw=| plh/qonti e)oikw\s xeima/rrw|, o(/s t' w)=ka r(e/wn e)ke/dasse gefu/ras: to\n d' ou)/t' a)/r te ge/furai e)ergme/nai i)sxano/wsi Il.5.88; cf. gefuro/w: metaph., pole/moio ge/furai, expld. by Sch.Il. as ai( di/odoi tw=n fala/ggwn, i. e. the
open space between hostile armies, but more prob.
limits of the battlefield, Il.4.371, 11.160, etc.; po/ntou g. of the Isthmus of Corinth,
causeway through the sea, Pi.N.6.39, cf.I. 4(3).20; so, of the
causeway between Athens and Eleusis, Carm.Pop.9; at the Euripus, Str.9.2.2. after Hom., in sg.,
bridge, ge/furan zeugnu/nai Hdt.4.97, cf. 1.75 (pl.); g. gai=n duoi=n zeukthri/an A. Pers.736; g. lu=sai X.An.2.4.17; po/ron u(pe\r gefurw=n a)/gontes Lib. Or.11.243; also, of
a tunnel, u(postei/xei g. Philostr.VA1.25.
gefu_r-erga/ths [a^], ou, o(, = gefuropoio/s, Tz.H.2.82.

gefu_r-i/zw,
abuse from the causeway, in the procession from Athens to Eleusis, Hsch., Suid.: hence,
abuse freely, Plu.Sull.6,13.
gefu_/r-ion, to/, Dim. of ge/fu_ra, Ael.VH8.14.

gefu_r-ismo/s, o(,
gross abuse, Str.9.1.24 (pl.).

gefu_r-isth/s, ou=, o(,
abuser, reviler, oi( *)aqh/nhsi g. Plu.Sull.2.

gefu_ro-poie/w,
make a bridge, Plb.3.64.1.

gefu_ro-poio/s, o(,
bridgemaker, = Lat.
pontifex, Plu.Num.9.

gefu_r-ourgi/a, h(,
bridge-making, Tz.H.1.931.

gefu_r-o/w, (ge/fura)
dam up (cf. ge/fura 1), gefu/rwsen de/ min (sc. to\n potamo\n h( ptele/h) Il.21.245; but in Prose, g. to\n potamo/n
throw a bridge over it, Hdt.4.118; *bo/sporon ib.88; tou\s th=s qala/tths troxou/s Pl.Criti.115c; e)gefurw/qh o( po/ros Hdt.7.36; ploi/ois th\n dia/basin g. Plb.3.66.6; also,
dam, potamou\s nekroi=s Luc.DMort.12.2; ta\ du/spora Id.Demon.1, cf. Nonn. D.27.185.
make into a causeway or
embankment, gefu/rwsen de\ ke/leuqon Il.15.357. metaph, no/ston *)atrei/dais g. Pi.I.8(7) 51.

gefu_/r-wma, atos, to/,
bridge, J.BJ3.7.28 (pl.).

gefu_/r-wsis, ews, h(,
furnishing with a causeway or
bridge, Str.1.3.18 (pl.); g. h( dia\ tw=n new=n Arr.An.5.7.3; in concrete sense, die/bh ta\s g. Ctes.Fr.29.17.

gefu_r-wth/s, ou=, o(,
bridge-builder, Plu.Luc.26 (pl.).

gewgra^f-e/w,
describe the earth's surface, Str.1.1.16, Arist.Mu.393b20:—Pass., ta\ gewgrafou/mena
geographic description, title of Strabo's work, Ath.14.657f.

gewgra^f-i/a, h(,
geography, Phld.Po.5.1425.2, Str. l. c.
geographical work, Democr.14c, Plu.Thes.1 (pl.), Porph. Antr.4.
map, stroggu/las gra/fontes ta\s g. Gem.16.4.

gewgra^f-iko/s, h/, o/n,
geographical, g. e)mpeiri/a, g. pi/nac, Str.1.1.2, 11. Adv. -kw=s Id.2.1.41, etc.: ta\ -ka/
geographical treatise, ib.1; of Strabo's work, Ath.3.121a.

gew/gra^f-os, on,
earth-describing: Subst.,
geographer, Str.1.1.16, al.; o( g., i. e. Strabo, Eust.ad D.P.11, al.

gew-daisi/a, h(, (dai/w)
land-dividing: mensuration, opp. the science of geometry, Arist.Metaph.997b26, Jul.Gal.178b, Procl.in Euc. p.25 F.

gew-dai/sths, ou, o(,
land-surveyor, Hero
*Deff.138.3:—also gew-dai/ths, Call.
Oxy.ined. (= Fr.158), Iamb.Comm.Math.26.

gew-daite/omai,
divide, parcel out land, Eust.1619.2.

gew/dhs, es,
earth-like, earthy, Pl.Phd.81c, Hierocl.
in CA Praef. p.417 M.; g. kai\ a)/liqon
with deep soil, X.An.6.4.5, al.; to\ g. Arist. GA753a25, 782b22; to\ -esteron ib.751b3; g. fu=lon Aristid.Or.43(1).14; a)/nqrakes -e/statoi Thphr.HP5.9.1. epith. of certain zw/|dia, Vett.Val.10.11.

gew-lofi/a, h(,
hill of earth, Str.5.4.3, AP6.98 (Zon.).

gew/-lofos, on,
crested with earth, o)/rh Str.16.2.16; xwri/a Id.12.7.1. Subst. gew/lofos, o(,
hill, hillock, X.Cyr.3.3.28 codd., Plb.1.75.4, Ph.1.191; gew/lofon, to/, Theoc.1.13, Numen. ap. Ath.7.305a. gew/lofos, o(,
boor, clod-hopper, Ael.Dion.Fr.107.

gewmant-ei/a, h(,
geomancy, Varr. ap. Isid.8.9.13: Subst. gew/mant-is, ews, o(, Id. ap. Serv.Virg.A.3.359.

gewmetr-e/w, prop.,
measure, survey land, BGU12.27 (ii A. D.):— but usu.,
practise or
profess geometry, Pl.Tht.162e, Men.85e, Arist. Rh.1406b30. generally,
measure, c. acc., to\n a)e/ra Ar.Av.995; ta\ e)pi/peda Pl.Tht.173e, cf. X.Smp.6.8, BGU12.27 (ii A. D.), Luc. Icar.21 (Pass.).

gewme/tr-hs, ou, o(,
land-measurer, ib.28 (ii A. D.):—but usu.,
geometer, Pl.Tht.143b, al., cf. Men.495, CIG3544 (Perg.).

gewme/tr-htos, on,
geometrical, lo/goi Procl.in Euc.p.201 F.; ta\ -ta ib.p.185 F.

gewmetr-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
geometry, Hdt.2.109, Ar.Nu.202: pl., ta\ e)n tai=s g. Pl. Men.76a, cf. Man.4.129.
land-survey, tw=n a)mpelw/nwn kai\ paradei/swn PTeb.24.42 (ii B. C.), cf. POxy.499.27 (ii A. D.).
land-tax, PLips.67.2 (ii A. D.), PFay.55.11 (ii A. D.), etc.
tax for surveying, PTeb.93.2, al. (ii B. C.).

gewmetr-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for geometry, geometrical, a)riqmo/s Pl.R.546c, etc.; i)so/ths Id.Grg.508a; a)nalogi/a Arist.EN1131b13; meso/ths Theo Sm.p.106 H., etc. (cf. gametriko/s）; a(rmoni/a Nicom.Ar.2.26; qewrh/mata Plu.2.720a (Sup.); gewmetrikh/ (sc. te/xnh),
geometry, Pl.Grg.450d, Nicom.Com.1.18; ta\ -ka/ title of work on
geometry, Democr.11n, cf. Arist.APo.79a9. Adv. -kw=s
by a rigidly deductive proof, Procl.in Prm.p.897 S., Id.in Ti.1.345 D.: g.
refellere, prove wrong
to demonstration, Cic.Att.12.5.3.
skilled in geometry, Pl.R.511d, Plu.2.579b, Arist.Pol. 1282a9; g. *bria/rews, of Archimedes, Id.Marc.17: Comp. -w/teros Ph.1.621. Adv. -kw=s Arist.Top.161a35, Str.2.1.41, Plu.2.643c.

gewmi^gh/s, e/s,
mixed with earth, Str.12.7.3, Placit.3.2.6.

gewmor-e/w,
till or
farm the land, Alex. ap. Eus.PE9.22.

gewmor-i/a, h(,
portion of land, Nic.Al.10: pl.,
farms, cultivated lands, Opp.C.4.434. = gewrgi/a, Alciphr.1.4, AP7.532 (Isid.).
harvest, lipara\ g. AP6.258 (Addaeus).
division of land, Nicom.Ar. 1.3.

gewmor-iko/s, h/, o/n,
concerning gewmori/a, g. no/mos an
agrarian law, D.H.10.39.
gew/mor-os, v. ghmo/ros. = gewrgo/s, Hsch.

gew/nion, to/,
price of earth, SIG2.587.57.

gew-no/mos, on, (ne/mw)
one who distributes land, IG12.45 (pl.).
receiving a portion of distributed lands, colonist, D.C.38.1:—also gew-no/mhs, ou, o(, Phryn.PSp.57 B.

gew/pedon, to/,
portion or
plot of ground, garden, esp. within a town, Hdt.7.28 (v.l. geope/dwn, gewpedi/wn); cf. gh/pedon.

gewpei/nhs, ou, o(,
poor in land, Hdt.2.6, 8.111, Aristid.1.191 J.

gewpon-e/w,
till the ground, Ph.1.212; ga_p- E.Rh.75; geh- Heph. Astr.2.28.

gewpon-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
tillage, Orph.Fr.280, Epigr.Gr.446 (Arabia), Max. Tyr.27.5:—also geh- Ps.-Phoc.161, gh- Them.Or. 30.350a, Hld.10.6.

gewpon-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for agriculture, Gal.16.311; ta\ g. title of treatise on the subject compiled by Cassianus Bassus.

gewrg-e/w,
to be a husbandman, farmer, Pl.Lg.805e, X.Oec.14.2, etc.; g. e)n th=| gh=| And. 1.92; e)n th=| *na/cw| Pl.Euthphr.4c, etc.; gewrgei=s e)k tou/twn you
have become a landed proprietor by these means (i. e. the fruits of treason), D.19.314: c. acc. cogn., gewrgi/an zw=san g. of pastoral nomads, Arist.Pol.1256a35:—Med., oi( gewrgou/menoi Aristeas 112. c. acc.,
till, plough, cultivate, pollh/n (sc. gh=n) Ar.Ec.592; ta\s a)/llas [nh/sous] Th.3.88; gewrgw=n ta\ e)kei/nwn D.18.41:—Pass., of land, IG9(1).61 (Daulis); xw/ras gegewrghme/nhs kai\ gewrghqhsome/nhs SIG685.80 (Crete); ta\ gewrgou/mena futa/ Arist. Pr.896a10. generally,
cultivate, e)lai/an Gp.9.2.6: hence, g. e)/laion, oi)=non,
produce it, D.C.49.36, cf. IG22.1100; tou= gewrgoume/nou oi)/nou Gp.6.7.2. metaph.,
work at a thing,
practise or
exploit it, D.25.82; fili/an Plu.2.776b; te/xnhn Hld.6.6; to\n i(ppo/dromon Lib.Or.35.13;
cultivate, yuxa\s do/gmasi Ph.2.348. of a river,
fertilize, Philostr.Im.1.11, Ep.59, Hld.2.28.

gew/rg-hma, atos, to/, in pl.,
operations of husbandry, Pl.Lg.674c.

gewrg-h/simos, on,
tilled or
fit for tillage, Arist.Pr.924a22, Str.16.4.18, Plb.1.56.4.

gewrg-hte/on,
one must till the soil, Them.Or.30 tit.

gewrg-i/a, h(,
tillage, th=s *xersonh/sou Th.1.11, etc.;
agriculture, farming, Pl.Smp.187a, etc.; g. yilh/
tillage of arable land and pasture, opp. pefuteume/nh, of vineyards and orchards, Arist.Pol.1258b17. in pl.,
farms, tilled land, toi=s me\n gewrgi/as e)pi\ misqw/sesi paradido/ntes Isoc.7.32, cf. Pl. Lg.806d, Luc.Prom.14, etc.; rarely in sg., D.30.30. metaph.,
source of income, Lib.Or.39.12.

gewrg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
agricultural, skeu/h Ar.Pax 552; ko/poi g. CIG4659 (Palestine, iii A. D.); u(phresi/a BGU 197.17 (i A. D.); bibli/on g. a book
on rural economy, Plu.
Cato Ma.25; h( g. (sc. te/xnh)
agriculture, farming, Pl.Lg.889d, etc.; ta\ g.
lands, Chrysipp.Stoic.3.180; also,
treatise on agriculture, Democr.26b, Ath. 14.649d; esp. that of Nicander, Id.3.92c.
occupied or
skilled in farming, Arist.Pol.1317a25; dh=mos ib.1318b9; lew/s Ar.Pax920:— as Subst.,
a good farmer, Pl.Ap.20b, etc.;
fond of rural pursuits, Plu.2.268c. Adv. -kw=s Poll.7.141.

gew/rg-ion, to/,
field, Ph.Bel.96.49 (pl.), Theagen.17 (pl.), BGU1092.10 (iv A. D.);
orchard, Str.14.5.6: metaph., *qeou= g. 1 Ep.Cor.3.9.
husbandry, LXX Si.27.6.
crop, ib.Pr.24.5. in pl.,
tax on land, dub. in SIG311.9 (Lagina, iv B. C.).
gew/rg-issa, hs, o(, fem. of gewrgo/s, Just.Nov.156 Praef. (pl.).
gewrg-i/ths, o(, = gewrgo/s, Proll. Hermog. in Rh.7.45 W.

gewrg-o/s, o/n, (gh=, e)/rgon)
tilling the ground, boi/dion Ar.Ach.1036;
fertilizing, *nei=los Lib.Or.13.39:—as Subst., gewrgo/s, o(,
husbandman, Hdt.4.18, Ar.Pax 296, Pl.Phdr.276b, etc.; oi( g., opp. oi( misqarnou=ntes, Arist.Pol.1296b28; but g., opp. o( despo/ths tou= xwri/ou, IG22.1100; so of vine-dressers, gardeners, etc., Pl.Tht.178d, Ael.NA7.28; g. o)/xlos
the peasantry, D.H.10.53; g. bi/os prob. in Ar.Pax589; de/ndrwn w(=n g. ai(/de ai( xei=res Philostr.VA2.26.

gewrg-w/dhs, es,
agricultural, Plu. 2.8b.
gew=res: gewfu/lakes, Suid. (Cf. geiw/ras.)

gewru^x-e/w,
dig in the earth, dig a mine, Hdt.4.200, Ael.NA16.15.

gewru^x-i/a,
excavation, IG2.1055.27, Ael.NA6.43.

gew/ru^x-os, on, (gh=, o)ru/ssw)
burrowing, lagidei=s Str.3.2.6, cf. Hsch. s.v. ska/loy:—fem. gewru^xi/s, h(,
mole, prob. cj. in Gloss. (pl.).

gewtom-i/a, h(,
turning up the earth, ploughing, Eleg.Alex.Adesp.1.1, Max.499.

gew/tom-os, on,
cutting the ground, o(/plon AP10.101 (Bian.).

gewtra^gi/a, h(,
an eating of earthy substances, Hp.Morb.4.55.

gewfa^n-h/s, e/s,
looking like earth, e)pikli/nwn e)pi\ to\ -e/steron Archig. ap.Orib.8.2.4: esp. in pl., g.
a spot where a kind of ochre was dug, at Samos, Thphr.Lap.61:—so gewfa^/n-ion or gewfa^/n-eion, to/, peri\ tou= g. title of speech by Din., D.H.Din.10, cf. Sch.Nic.Al.149, Poll.7.99, EM 229.21.
gewfu/lac, v. gew=res.

gewxa^rh/s, e/s,
fond of the earth, of
creeping plants, Jul.Or.5.175d.

gh=, h(, occasionally in Hom., freq. in Hes., and the only form in Att. Prose for gai=a: dual gai=n A.Pers.736: pl. rare, gai= Arist.Pr. 934b9, ge/ai SIG279.40 (Zelea), etc., AP9.430 (Crin.): gen. gew=n Hdt.4.198, GDI5755.14 (Mylasa); gw=n BGU993 iii 10 (ii B. C.): acc. ge/as [Democr.] 299, SIG46.3 (Halic.), ga=s PTeb.6.31 (ii B. C.), Str. 2.5.26; Cypr. za=s Inscr.Cypr.135.30 H.: dat. pl. ge/ais prob. in CIG 2693f9 (Mylasa), LW415.9 (ibid.):—
earth (including land and sea, Sapph.Supp.5.2) opp.
heaven, or
land opp.
sea, *gh= te kai\ *)he/lios kai\ *)erinu/es Il.19.259, cf. 3.104; ti/s gh=; Od.13.233; gh=s peri/odoi Hdt.4.36, Arist.Mete.362b12, title of work by Hecat.: personified, Il. l.c., A.Th.69, Pers.629, etc.; kata\ gh=n on
land, by
land, opp. nausi/, Th. 1.18; opp. e)k qala/sshs, Id.2.81; kata\ gh=n ste/llesqai X.An.5.6.5, etc.; e)pi\ gh=s on
earth, opp. ne/rqe, S.OT416; kata\ gh=s below
the earth, A.Ch.377,475, etc.; ka/tw gh=s S.OT968; u(po\ gh=s Id.Fr.572; ga=s u(pe/nerqe Pi.Fr.292: gen. with local Adverbs, i(/na gh=s E.Andr. 168; pou=, poi=, o(/poi g., S.OT108, Ph.1211, El.922; o(/pou g. Ar.Av. 9.
earth, as an element, Xenoph.27, Anaxag.4, Pl.Prt.320d, Lg.889b, Arist.Metaph.989a5, Cael.306a18, etc. gh=n kai\ u(/dwr ai)tei=n, as tokens of submission, Hdt.5.18, Lycurg.71; gh=n kai\ u(/dwr dido/nai Hdt.5.18, al.
land, country, kai\ gh=n kai\ po/lin A.Eu. 993; gh=n pro\ gh=s e)lau/nesqai, diw/kein, from
land to land, Id.Pr.682, Ar. Ach.235; h( a(gi/a gh= LXX Wi.12.3; one's
native land, Tyrt.12.33, Thgn.1213, A.Supp.890 (lyr.), S.OC441, E.Ph.1090; freq. omitted with art., e)k th=s e)mautou= (sc. gh=s） drape/tas Id.Heracl.140, etc. freq. in Trag.,
city, au)to/s te kai\ gh= dori\ pesou=s' *(ellhnikw=| Id.Tr. 868.
the earth or
ground as tilled, a)/roton gh=s S.OT270; ga= fqi/nousa ib.665, etc.; th\n gh=n e)rga/zesqai, qerapeu/ein, till
the ground, Pl.R.420e, X.Oec.5.12; ta\ e)k th=s gh=s fuo/mena Id.Mem.4.3.10.
estate, farm, gh=n pri/asqai Lys.32.23; e)pi\ gh=| danei/zein lend on mortgage, D.36.6. of particular
kinds of earth or
minerals, e.g.
fuller's earth. Thphr.Char.10.14, cf. Gal.12.168; *kimwli/a g. Ar.Ra. 712, cf. Hp.Mul.2.189.
ghgen-e/ths, ou, o(, = sq., a)/rguros Tim.Fr.26; gi/gas E.Ph.128 (lyr.).

ghgen-h/s, e/s, Dor. ga_genh/s Hdn.Gr.2.419:—
earthborn, bolbo/s Xenarch.1.5; of a potter's vessel, Antiph.182.3;
indigenous, bou/balis S.Fr.792.
earthborn, of primeval men, *)erexqeu/s Hdt.8.55; *palai/xqwn A.Supp.250; tou\s e)/mprosqen fu/esqai ghgenei=s kai\ mh\ e)c a)llh/lwn genna=sqai Pl.Plt.269b, cf. Arist.GA762b29; of the Thebans, Trag.Adesp.84; g. prwtopla/sths LXX Wi.7.1; of body, opp. soul, Pl.Lg.727e. oi( g.
the dead, the shades, ib.Pr. 2.18, 9.18.
born of Gaia, of Titans and Giants, Batr.7, A.Pr. 353, E.Ba.996 (lyr.); o( g. strato\s *giga/ntwn S.Tr.1058; th\n e)pi\ tw=n ghgenw=n (sc. a)nastrofh/n), opp. civilized life, Phld.Sto.Herc.339.19: in Com. with an insinuation of impiety, Ar.Nu.853; (but also
boorish, bw=los, a)/rotron, g. a)/nqrwpos Alex.108.5); of things, Titanic, i.e.
portentous, ghgenei= fush/mati Ar.Ra.825: Sup. -e/statos
most earthy, i. e. limited in intelligence, Procl.in Prm.p.763 S.

ghgh=lic, o(,
field-mouse, Hsch.:—also gh/ligros, o(, Id. ghguri/dai: oi)ktroi/, Id.

gh/dion, to/, Dim. of gh=,
little farm, piece of land, Ar.Pax570, Fr. 387.2, Arist.Pol.1320a39, Ph.2.541, POxy.1559.11 (pl., iv A. D.); mikro\n g. X.Cyr.8.3.38.

ghqa^la/ssios, on,
amphibious, zw=|on Cat.Cod.Astr.7.208.14.

ghqa^le/os, a, on, (ghqe/w)
joyous, Androm. ap. Gal. 14.36.

gh=qen, Adv.
out of or
from the earth, A.Th.247, Eu.904, S.OC1591;
from beneath, Id.El.453: in late Prose, ta\ g. J.AJ4.3.2; g. h(/keis Luc.Icar.4.

ghqe/w, 3sg. ghqei= (contr.) Il.14.140, Dor. ga_qei= Theoc.1.54 (but pf. is always used for pres. in Trag., unless ghqou/sh| freni/ be read in A.Ch.772, and impf. e)p-egh/qei (v. infr.) in Id.Pr.157 (lyr.)): impf. e)gh/qeon Il.7.127, 214: fut. ghqh/sw 8.378, etc.: aor. e)gh/qhsa, Ep. gh/qhsa Hes.Sc.116, Dor. ga/qhsa Pi.P.4.122, cf. Limen.7: pf. ge/ghqa (in pres. sense, v. supr.), Dor. ge/ga_qa with 3sg. gega/qei Epich. 109 (imper. ge/ga_qi Hymn.Curet.6), Il.8.559, etc.: plpf. e)gegh/qein restored by Elmsl. in A.Pr.157, Ep. gegh/qein Il.11.683, 13.494, Boeot. 3sg. gega/qi Corinn.Supp.1.27. A collat. form gh/qw, Dor. ga/qw, mentioned by Hsch., is found in CIG3632 (Ilium), Orph.H.16.10, al.:—Med., gh/qomai Q.S.14.92, AP6.261 (Crin.), S.E.M.11.107: (v. gai/w):—
rejoice, c. acc. rei, ti/s a)\n ta/de ghqh/seien Il.9.77; g. kata\ qumo/n 13.416; nw=i ghqh/sei profane/nte
will rejoice at our appearing, 8.378: freq. c. part.,
rejoice in doing . . , ge/ghqas zw=n S.Ph.1021; pi/nwn E.Cyc.168: gegh/qei fre/na Il.11.683 (but *)axillh=os kh=r ghqei= 14.140); qumw=| ghqh/sas Hes.Sc.116; a(\n peri\ yuxa\n ga/qhsen Pi.P.4.122; palaiai=sin e)n a)retai=s g. Id.N.3.33; geghqe/nai e)pi/ tini S.El.1231, Hierocl.in CA 5p.427M.: c. dat., a)/llos a)/llw| ge/gaqe Axiop.1.23; toi=s mega/lois a)ei\ kakoi=s ge/ghq' o( ko/smos Sotad.15.4: part. geghqw/s, like xai/rwn, Lat.
impune, h)= kai\ g. tau=t' a)ei\ le/cein dokei=s; S.OT368; but simply,
cheerful, faidro\s kai\ g. D.18.323.
ghqi/a: h)/qh, Hsch. (For vh/qea.)
gh=qos, eos, to/, = sq., Epicur.Fr.423, Plu.Ages.29, Luc.Am.9, etc.

ghqo-su/nh, h(,
joy, delight, Il.13.29, 21.390, Ph.1.354; = *fili/a (q. v.), Emp.17.24: in pl., h.Cer.437, A.R.2.878.

ghqo/-sunos, h, on, also os, on Orph.H.27.14, AP6.235 (Thall.):—
joyful, glad, Il.7.122; xa/rmh| 13.82. Adv. -nws Hp.Ep.17, Suid.

ghqulli/s, Dor. ga_q- Epich.134, i/dos, h(, Dim. of gh/quon:—
spring onion (acc. to Moer.115, the Att. equivalent for a)mpelo/prason), Epich. l. c., Eub.89.3, Nic.Al.431, Epaenet. ap. Ath.9.371e, IG5(1).1511 (Sparta, prob.).
gh/quon, to/, = gh/teion, Ar.Fr.5, Phryn.Com.12, Thphr.7.1.2, etc.

gh/-inos, h, on,
of earth, th\n de\ . . pla/santes ghi/nhn Semon.7.21; pli/nqoi X.An.7.8.14; tei/xh Pl.Lg.778e; sw=ma Id.Phdr.246c, cf. Hierocl. in CA 4p.425M.; ou)de\ to\ cu/lon gh=, a)lla\ gh/inon Arist.Metaph. 1049a20; no/os App.Anth.3.146 (Theon.): Sup. -w/tatos, a)riqmo/s Lyd.Ost.45.

gh-i/+ths [i_], ou, o(,
husbandman, S.Tr.32 (in contr. form gh/|ths).

gh-lexh/s, e/s,
sleeping on the earth, Call.Del.286.
ghlia=sqai: kate/xesqai, Hsch. ghloume/nous: suneilhmme/nous, Id.

gh/lofos, o(, = gew/lofos,
hill, X.An.1.5.8, Pl.Criti.113d; g. xeiropoi/htos artificial
mound, Jul.Or.2.63b; gh/lofon, to/, J.BJ1.21.10: as Adj., Gp.3.1.9; (in Dor. form) galo/fw| prw=ni Limen.12.
gh=ma: i(ma/tion, Hsch. (g = v).

gh-mo/rion, to/,
burial plot, IG7.2183 (Thespiae).

gh-mo/ros, o(, Dor. and Trag. ga_mo/ros, Trag.Adesp.208 (s. v. l.), A.Supp.613,
PLond.ined.2134 (ii A. D.); cf. th=sde gamo/rw| xqono/s (Dobree for th=| de/ g' a)moi/rou) A.Eu.890; Att. gewmo/ros, (gh=, mei/romai):—
one who has a share of land, landowner: oi( gamo/roi, in Sicily,
the wealthy landowners, Hdt.7.155: at Argos, A.Supp. l.c.; at Athens, gewmo/roi
landowners, large or small, opp. eu)patri/dai, dhmiourgoi/, Arist.Ath. Fr.2, Pl.Lg.737e, etc. gewmo/roi, oi(, = Lat.
tresviri agris dividundis, D.H.9.52. metaph. of *(/aidhs, Trag.Adesp. l.c. as Adj.,
dividing earth, i.e.
ploughing, bou=s A.R.1.1214; gewmo/ros te/xna IG9(1).880 (Corc.).
gh/neia: o(/sa e)k th=s gh=s w)fe/lima, Hsch. (Fort. gh/ina.) gh/nesqai: kate/xesqai, Id. (Cf. vhle/w, = ei)le/w).

gh-ou=xos, on, (e)/xw)
land-holding, Eust.1392.23; cf. gaih/oxos.

gh-oxe/w,
hold land, Hdt.7.190.

gh-pa/ttalos, o(,
oblong radish, com. word in Luc.Lex.2.

gh/-pedon, to/, = gew/pedon,
plot of ground, Pl.Lg.741c, Arist.Pol.1263a3. Trag. used Dor. form ga/pedon acc. to St. Byz.: hence g. for da/pedon (metri gr.), A.Pr.829 (Pors.).

gh-peth/s, e/s, (pi/ptw)
falling or
fallen to earth, E.Ph.668 (lyr.).
gh-pone/w, gh-poni/a, gh-poniko/s, gh-po/nos, = gewp-, qq. v.
gh/-potos, on, v. ga/potos.
ghra/eis, essa, en, = sq., Alc.Oxy.1233.16.

ghr-aio/s, a/, o/n (also o/s, o/n Antipho 4.1.2): (gh=ras):—longer form of geraio/s,
aged, old, ghraio\s de\ qa/nois Hes.Op.378, cf. Hdt.3.64, Pi.P.4.157, A.Pers.854 (lyr.), Supp.606, Th.6.54; g. teleuta=n X.Ages.11.15, Pl.Smp.179e; to
 me
 a)/r' ai)w
 g. kate/pefne Maiist. 12.

ghr-a^le/os, a, on (also ghra/lios, Hsch., ghra/lei^os, IG12(7).113 (Amorg.)), = foreg., Xenoph.1.18, Pi.P.4.121, A.Pers.171, Cratin. 126, J.BJ1.2.2; g. o)do/ntes, r(uti/des, Anacr.43.2, AP5.128 (Autom.); sani/s ib.9.242 (Antiphil.); a)po\ krota/fwn pelo/mesqa pa/ntes ghrale/oi Theoc.14.69.
gh/r-a_ma, atos, to/, = gh/reion, Sch.Arat. 921.
ghr-a/mwn: gra/za, Hsch.
ghr-a/nai, v. ghra/skw.
ghr-a/nion: gh/ran, Hsch.

gh/r-ansis, ews, h(,
a growing old, Arist.Metaph.1065b20, Ph.201a19.
ghr-a^o/s, o/n, = ghraio/s, IG14.1721.
ghra/s, v. ghra/skw.

gh=ras, to/, gen. gh/raos Il.22.60, al., Archil.116, Mimn.2.6, Pi.O. 8.71, etc.; gh/rws Thgn.174, Att. (v. infr.): dat. gh/rai+ Pi.N.7.99, Hdt.6.24, contr. gh/ra| S.Aj.507, etc., gh/rati v.l. in Adam.Phgn.1.14 (cf. gh=ros):—
old age, g. lugro/n Od.24.250; stugero/n Il.19.336; e)pi\ gh/raos ou)dw=| (v. ou)do/s) 22.60; opp. g. liparo/n, Od.19.368, Pi. l.c.; g. polio/n Thgn.174; gh=ras e)kdu=nai, a)posei/sasqai, Ar.Pax 336, Lys. 670 (with play on signf. 11); e)pi\ gh/rws in
old age, Id.Eq.524; e)n tw=| gh/ra| Pl.R.329c, Lys.2.73; su\n gh/ra|, e)n g. baru/s, S.OT17, Aj.1017; dianoi/as g. Arist.Pol.1271a1: metaph., ou)k e)/sti gh=ras tou=de tou= mia/smatos, i.e. it never wears out, A.Th.682.
cast skin, slough of a serpent, gh=ras e)kdu/nein Arist.HA549b26, Nic.Th.31, Antig.Mir. 20, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.35.4; of crabs, Arist.HA600b20, Thphr.Fr. 177.
ghra/simos, h, on, = ghraio/s, JHS34.12 (Teos).

ghra/skw, fut. ghra/somai [a_] Critias 1.5 (and in compds., e)g-, kata-, sug-, Th.6.18, Ar.Eq.1308, E.Fr.1058); ghra/sw Pl.R.393e: poet. inf. ghra_se/men Simon.85.9: aor. e)gh/ra_sa (kat-) Hdt.2.146, Pl.Tht.202d (also causal, cf. infr. 11): acc. fem. part. ghra/sasan (v.l. ghra=san) Hdt.7.114: pf. gegh/ra_ka S.OC727, etc.:—also ghra/w X. Cyr.4.1.15, Arist.EN1135b2, Men.481.14, Plu.2.911b, part. ghrw=n Epict.Fr.3: aor. 2 (as if from gh/rhmi or gh/ra_mi） e)gh/ra Il.7.148, 17.197, Od.14.67, (kat-) Hdt.6.72; inf. ghra/nai [a^] A.Ch.908 (cum Sch.), S.OC870 (so EM230.53, but ghra=nai Moer.115), part. ghra/s Il.17.197, dat. pl. ghra/ntessi Hes.Op.188, gen. pl. <u(per-> ghra/ntwn dub. in Ael.NA7.17; also ghrei/s, e/ntos, Xenoph.9:—Med., ghra/skomai Hes.Fr.171:—Pass., (u(per-） ghraqei/s Ps.-Callisth.1.25:—
grow old, and in aor. and pf.,
to be so, khru/sswn gh/raske
grew old in his office of herald, Il.17.325, cf. 2.663, etc.; of things, o)/gxnh e)p' o)/gxnh| g. Od.7.120; xro/nos ghra/skwn A.Pr.981; pa/lin ga\r au)=qis pai=s o( g. a)nh/r S.Fr.487; meta\ th\n do/sin g. xa/ris Men.Mon.347; to\ th=sde xw/ras ou) gegh/rake sqe/nos S.OC727: c. acc. cogn., bi/on toiou=ton ghra/nai ib.870:—so in Med., Hes.Fr.171. causal in aor. 1 e)gh/ra_sa,
bring to old age, e)gh/rasa/n me trofh=| A.Supp.894; ghra/sas po/da (but perh. acc. cogn.) AP6.94 (Phil.). (Akin to ge/rwn, gh=ras.)

gh/reion, to/,
thistledown, Arat.921, Nic.Al.126, Th.329.

ghrobosk-e/w,
to feed or
cherish in old age, esp. one's parents, E. Med.1033, Alc.663; also te/kna Demoph.Sent.43:—Pass.,
to be cherished when old, Ar.Ach.678 (ghrwboskh/sei is read in Lib.Decl. 49.22; ghrwboskh/santa is v.l. in Stob.3.1.38; cf. ghro-komei=on, -kome/w, -komi/a, -ko/mos: such forms might be due to contr. of ghrao-, but are more prob. misspellings).

ghrobosk-i/a, h(,
care of the aged, Alex. 312, Plu.2.111e; esp. of parents, POxy.1210.5 (i A. D.).

ghrobosk-o/s, o/n, (bo/skw)
nourishing or
taking care of in old age, esp. one's parents, S.Aj.570, Hyp.Fr.233; ghrobosko\n ou)k e)/xw . . tai=da E.Supp.923 (lyr.); g. a)podido/nai xa/ritas D.H.8.47; g. e)lpi/des hopes
of such nurture, ib.51: Subst., X.Oec.7.12.

ghrokom-ei=on, to/,
alms-house for the aged, Suid. (ghrwk- Hdn. Epim.205), Zonar.

ghrokom-e/w, = ghroboske/w, abs., Trag.Adesp.25: c. acc., Call.Epigr.51, J.AJ4.8.24, Ael.NA10.16, Luc.Tox.22, Max. Tyr.5.7:—Pass., e)n qugatra/sin g. Agath.2.14 (ghrwk- J. l.c., Luc. l.c., Max.Tyr. l. c.).
ghrokom-i/a, = ghroboski/a, J.AJ5.9.4 (ghrwk-), Plu. Cat.Ma.5 (pl., ghrwk-), 2.583c.

ghrokom-iko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to ghrokomi/a, Gal.6.330.

ghro/kom-os, on, (kome/w)
tending old age, xh/tei ghroko/moio for want
of one to tend one's age, Hes.Th.605; a(\s dai/mwn a)nt' e)me/qen w)/pase ghroko/mous, i.e. daughters, Epigr.Gr.536 (Tomi); xei/r g. IG3.1335; fronti/des g. Opp.H.5.85: in later Prose (written ghrwko/mos), J.AJ1.13.3, Alciphr.3.16, Lib.Decl.49.25.

gh=ros, to/, = gh=ras, not found in nom., gen. gh/rous Hp.Int.6, Rev.Arch.1913.247 (Selymbria), dat. gh/rei LXX Ge.15.15, al., Ev.Luc.1.36; gh/rei+ v.l. ap.Sch.Il.3.150. (These forms are also found as vv. ll. for gh/raos, gh/rai+.)

ghrotrof-e/w, = ghroboske/w, Is.1.39, Pl.Mx.248d:—Pass., ghrotrofou/menoi Isoc.14.48: fut. Med. in pass. sense, ghrotrofh/sontai D.60.32; u(po\ tw=n . . tai/dwn ghrotrofhqe/ntes Lys.13.45, cf. Lycurg. 144.
ghrotrof-i/a, h(, = ghroboski/a, Antipho Soph.66, PFlor.382.39 (iii A. D.); ta\s g. a)poti/nein Plu.2.579e.

ghrotro/f-ion or ghrotrof-ei=on, to/,
alms-house for the aged, Suid. s.v. ghrokomei=on.
ghro/trof-os, on, （tre/fw） = ghrobosko/s, E.Alc.668; g. e)lpi/s Pi.Fr.214, cf. CIG2240 (Chios); xa/rin ou) duna/mhn g. tele/sai Supp.Epigr.1.567.10 (Karanis).

ghrofore/w,
carry an old person, Plu.2.983b.
ghro/w, v. guro/w.

ghrugo/nos, h, on,
born of sound, kou/ras ghrugo/nas, i. e. echoes, Theoc.Syrinx6.

gh/ru_ma, atos, to/, (ghru/w)
sound, of a trumpet, A.Eu.569 (lyr.): pl., a)di/dakta g. Plu.2.973a.

*ghru^o/nhs, ou, o(, (ghru/w) the three-bodied Giant Geryon, Pi.I.1.13, etc.: *ghru^oneu/s, e/ws, Ep. h=os, Hes.Th.287: *ghru^w/n, o/nos, A. Ag.870:—hence *ghru^oni/s or ghrotrof-hi/+s, i/dos, h(,
a poem on Geryon by Stesichorus, Ath.11.499e, Paus.8.3.2.

gh=rus, Dor. ga=rus, B.5.15, S.Ichn.65, uos, h(,
voice, speech, Il.4.437; stono/essa g. S.OT186 (lyr.); *)orfei/a g., i.e. Orpheus, E.Alc. 969; *kolxi/da gh=run i(ei=sa A.R.4.731: in later Prose, Plu.2.397c: metaph. of the
voice of passion, Ph.1.373. (Cf. Oir.
gāir, gairm 'shout', Welsh
gawr, garm.）

ghru/w, Dor. and Aeol. ga_ru/w, Sapph.Supp.25.20, etc.; inf. garu/en, -e/men Pi.O.1.3, N.3.32: fut. -u/sw: aor. e)gh/rusa Ar.Pax805; Dor. e)ga/rusa S.Ichn.244:—Med., fut. -u/somai Pi.I.1.34, E.Hipp. 213: aor. e)ghrusa/mhn Id.El.1327 (lyr.); Dor. opt. garu/sainto Theoc. 1.136, etc.; also e)ghru/qhn (v. infr.):—
sing or
say, speak, cry, Sapph. l. c., dub. in Simon.31: c. acc.,
utter, a)/kranta Pi.O.2.96; frone/onti suneta\ g. B.3.85; g. eu)=xos Pi.N.6.58; o)/pa Ar.Pax805; qe/spin au)da/n S. l.c. trans.,
sing of, celebrate, tina/ Pi.N.7.83; ti Id.O. 13.50, etc. Med., abs.,
sing, h.Merc.426; toi\ skw=pes a)hdo/si garu/sainto let the owls
sing against the nightingales, Theoc.1.136 (perh. f.l. for dhri/sainto): c. acc. cogn., ghru/et' a)nqrw/pwn no/on Hes. Op.260; garu/somai ai)=san Pi.I.1.34, cf. P.5.72; ou) mh\ ta/de ghru/sh| E.Hipp.213 (lyr.), cf. 1074; au)dh\n th/nde ghruqei=s' e)/sei A.Supp.460. (u^ in pres. Hes., Pi., etc.; u_ A.Pr.78, Theoc.9.7, Orph.A.432, AP7.201 (Pamph.): u_ always in fut. and aor.）
ghrwboske/w, ghrwkome/w, etc., v. ghro-. ghrwpi/zetai: geronteu/etai, Hsch. gh/rws, v. gh=ras.

gh/teion, to/, = gh/quon,
horn onion, Allium Cepa, var., Ar.Eq.677, al., Anaxandr.41.57, Alex.127.7, Call.Aet.1.1.25: pl., Ph.1.665.
gh/|ths, o(, contr. for ghi/+ths (q. v.).

ghtika/, ta/, a kind of
cup, Epist.Alex. ap. Hsch.

gh-tome/w,
cleave the ground, A.R.2.1005, Lyc.268.

gh-fa^ge/w,
eat earth, Arist. ap. EM222.9.

gh-fa/gos [a^], on, = gaihfa/gos,
herbeating, i.e.
poor, Call.Fr.58.
gh-foriw/n, w=nos, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Iasus, GDI3750.

gh/xu^ton, to/, (xe/w)
the soft mould or
soil on the earth's surface, Gal.19.91.
gi/a: a)/nqh (i. e. vi/a), Hsch. gi/ai: o)du/nai, Id. gi/ar[es]: e)/ar, Id. gigali/a: h( gh=, Id.

*gi^ga/nt-eios, a, on,
gigantic, AP9.708 (Phil.), Luc.Philops.23:— also *gi^gantai=os, a, on, Aesop.53, Hsch. s.v. *)abramiai=os: *gi^gantiai=os, sw/mata Pall.in Hp.2.143 D.: *gi^gantiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the Giants, ta\ -ka/ Plu.2.360f;
monstrous, qrasu/ths Simp. in Ph.1145.4, cf. Procl.in Prm.p.659 S.
*gi^gant-i/a, h(, = *gigantomaxi/a, Philostr. VS1.21.5.
*gi^gant-ia/s, a/dos, h(, title of Epic by Dionysius, St.Byz. s.v. *dwdw/nh.
*gi^ga/nt-ios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Amphissa, GDI 2091; at Triteia, ib.1813.

*gi^gant-ole/ths, ou,
giantkiller, name of Dionysus and Apollo, AP9.524,525, Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.4; of Zeus, prob. in Pancrat.Oxy.1085.25; *gi^gant-ole/twr, oros, o(, Luc. Tim.4:—fem. *gi^gant-ole/tira and *gi^gant-ole/tis, idos, Suid., Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.8.

*gi^ganto-ma^xi/a, h(,
battle of the gods and giants, Pl.R.378c (pl.), Sph.246a, Plu.Ant.60, etc.

*gi^ganto/-raistos, o(,
giant-quelling, Lyc. 63.
*gi^ganto-fqo/ros, on, = sq., Sch.Lyc.63.

*gi^ganto-fo/nos, on,
giant-killing, E. HF1193, Nonn.D.1.516.
*gi^ganto-fo/ntis, idos, h(, fem.of foreg., Corn.ND20.

*gi^gantw/dhs, es,
gigantic, Ph.2.117, Eun.Hist.p.218 D.
gigarti/s: stafi/s, Hsch.

gigart-w/dhs, es,
like grape-stones, Thphr.HP 3.17.6, Thd.Is.1.25.

gigart-w/nion, to/, expld. by
unripe grapes, PLond. ined.1821.

*gi/gas [i^], antos, o(, mostly in pl., Giants, u(pe/rqumoi Od.7.59; *ku/klwpe/s te kai\ a)/gria fu=la *giga/ntwn ib.206; ou)k a)/ndressin e)oiko/tes
a)lla\ *gi/gasin 10.120; g. ghgene/tai Hes.Th.185, cf. E.Ph.128 (lyr.); of Capaneus, A.Th.424. as Adj.,
mighty (gi/gantos: mega/lou, i)sxurou=, u(perfuou=s, Hsch.), *zefu/rou gi/gantos au)/ra| Id.Ag.692 (lyr.), cf. Eurytus (PLG3.639).

giggi/dion, to/,
a plant, Daucus Gingidium, Dsc.2.137,3.52: giggiki/dion, Sch.Nic.Al.432. = lepi/dion, Dsc.2.174.

giggi/s, i/dos, h(, kind of
turnip, French carrot, Alex.Trall.1.15.

gi/ggla^ros, o(, a kind of
flute or
fife, Poll.4.82:—Dim. giggla/rion, to/, AB88; cf. gi/ggras.
giggli/an: ka/lumma kefalh=s e)reou=n, Hsch.

gigglismo/s, o(,
tickling, Suid. = gi/gglumos 5, Paus.Gr.Fr. 108.
gi/gglos: na=nos, Hsch.
gigglu/mion [u^], to/, Dim. of gi/gglumos, Anthem.p.155 W. (gigl- codd.).

gigglu^mo-eidh/s, e/s,
like a hinge, tou= braxi/onos to\ g. Hp.Fract.2, Gal.2.735. Adv. -dw=s Gal.18(1).513.

gigglu^mo/-omai,
to be hinge-jointed, gegigglu/mwntai pro\s a)llh/lous oi( sfo/nduloi Hp.Art.45.

gi/gglu^mos ( gigglumo/s, Hsch.), o(,
hinge, oi(=on ei) g. Hp.Loc.Hom.6, cf. Apollod.Poliorc.190.1: hence a species of
joint, Arist.de An.433b22, Gal.2.735. metal
pivot or
gudgeon on which a door turns, = stro/figc, IG4.1484.74 (Epid.), 11(2).165.15 (Delos, iii B. C.):— written glumo/s, ib.142.49 (an engraver's error).
joint in a coat of mail, X.Eq.12.6.
clasp, buckle, J.AJ3.6.3,4.
mode of kissing, Hsch.
gigglu^m-w/dhs, es, = gigglumoeidh/s, Arist.HA529a32.

gigglu^m-wto/s, o/n,
hinged, sani/des Ph.Bel.91.29, Apollod.Poliorc.189.9. g. fi/lhma, = gi/gglumos 5, Telecl.13.

giggr-a/i+nos, on,
like the gi/ggras, au)loi/ Ath.4.174f.

giggr-anto/s, h/, o/n,
composed for the gi/ggras, me/lh g.. of 'scrannel pipes', Ath.4.175b.

gi/ggr-as, ou, o(,
small Phoenician flute or
fife, of a high pitch and plaintive tone, Amphis14 (from *gi/ggrhs, Phoenician name for Adonis, Ath.4.174f):—also gi/ggros au)lo/s Antiph.108, Men.259: gi/ggron, Hsch.
its music, TryphoFr.109 V.;
dance to its tune, Poll.4.102.

giggr-asmo/s, o(,
the tone of the gi/ggras, Hsch.
giggri/, an abusive interjection, Hsch.
giggri/as, = gi/ggras, Id.

gi/gnomai, Ion. and after Arist. gi/nomai [i_], (Att. Inscrr. have gign- in fifth and fourth cent., cf. IG2.11.9, 1055.25, etc.); Thess. gi/numai IG9(2).517.22; Boeot. gi/nioumai ib.7.3303: fut. genh/somai: aor. e)geno/mhn （e)gena/mhn LXXJe.14.1, al. (pro-) Decr.Byz. ap. D.18.90), Ion. 2sg. ge/neu Il.5.897, 3sg. gene/sketo Od.11.208, e)/gento Hes.Th.705, Sapph.16, Pi.P.3.87, Parm.8.20, IG4.492 (Mycenae), prob.in Scol. 19; Ep. ge/nto Hes.Th.199, Emp.98.5, Call.Jov.1.50, Theoc.14.27, etc. (gṇ-to): pf. ge/gona Il.19.122, etc.: 3pl. ge/gonan Apoc.21.6: plpf. e)gego/nei Lys.31.17, etc.; Ion. e)gego/nee Hdt.2.2; Ep. forms (as if from pf. ge/ga^a), 2pl. gega/a_te Batr.143; gega/a_si Il.4.325, freq. in Od.: 3pl. gega_/ka^sin cj. in Emp.23.10: 3dual plpf. e)k-gega/thn [a^] Od.10.138; inf. gega/men [a^] Pi.O.9.110, (e)k) Il.5.248, etc.; part. gega^w/s -a^ui=a, pl. -a^w=tes, -a^ui=ai Hom., etc., contr. gegw/s, -w=sa S.Aj.472, E.Med.406; inf. gega_/kein Pi.O.6.49: Med. forms e)kgega/asqe Epigr.Hom.16, e)k-gega/ontai (in fut. sense) h.Ven.197 (s.v.l.):—Pass. forms, fut. genhqh/somai (only in Pl.Prm.141e, ou)/te genh/setai, ou)/te genhqh/setai, cf. Procl.in Prm.p.963 S.): aor. e)genh/qhn Epich.209, Archyt.1, Hp.Epid.6.8.32,7.3, later Att., Philem. 95.2 and 167, IG2.630b10 (i B. C.) and Hellenistic Gk., Plb.2.67.8, D.S.13.51: pf. gege/nhmai Simon.69, freq. in Att. Poets and Prose, in Att. inscr. first in cent. iv, IG2.555: 3pl. gegene/antai Philet. ap.Eust.1885.51: plpf. e)gege/nhto Th.7.18, al.; cf. gei/nomai:—
come into a new state of being: hence, abs.,
come into being opp. ei)=nai, Emp.17.11, Pl.Phd.102e, cf. Ti.29a; and so, of persons,
to be born, ne/on gegaw/s new
born, Od.19.400; u(po\ *tmw/lw| gegaw=tas
born (and so
living) under Tmolus, Il.2.866; h)\ pro/sqe qanei=n h)\ e)/peita g. Hes.Op.175; gignome/naisi la/xh ta/d' . . e)kra/nqh
at our birth, A.Eu.347; g. e)/k tinos Il.5.548, Hdt.7.11; patro\s e)k tau)tou= E.IA406, cf. Isoc.5.136; se/qen . . e)c ai(/matos A.Th. 142; less freq. a)po/ tinos Hdt.8.22, etc.; e)sqlw=n E.Hec.380, etc.; gegone/nai kakw=s, kalw=s, Ar.Eq.218, Isoc.7.37, etc.; ka/llion, eu)=, Hdt. 1.146, 3.69; to\ mh\ gene/sqai not
to have been born, A.Fr.401: freq. with Numerals, e)/tea tri/a kai\ de/ka gegonw/s Hdt.1.119; a)mfi\ ta\ pe/nte h)\ e(kkai/deka e)/th geno/menos X.Cyr.1.4.16; gegonw\s e)/th peri\ penth/konta D. 21.154; oi( u(pe\r ta\ strateu/sima e)/th gegono/tes
those of an age beyond . . , X.Cyr.1.2.4: c. gen., gegonw\s pleio/nwn e)tw=n h)\ penth/konta Pl.Lg. 951c, etc.: rarely with ordinals, o)gdohkosto\n e)/tos gegonw/s Luc.Macr. 22, cf. Plu.Phil.18. of things,
to be produced, o(/sa fu/lla kai\ a)/nqea gi/gnetai w(/rh| Od.9.51; opp. o)/llusqai, Parm.8.13,40; opp. a)po/llusqai, Anaxag.17, cf. Pl.R.527b, etc.; opp. a)polei/pein, Diog. Apoll.7; opp. a)polh/gein, Emp.17.30; ta\ gigno/mena kai\ e)c w(=n gi/gnetai Pl.Phlb.27a; a(plh=| dihgh/sei h)\ dia\ mimh/sews g. Id.R.392d; o( e)k th=s xw/ras gigno/menos si=tos X.Mem.3.6.13; ta\ e)n a)grw=| gigno/mena ib.2.9.4; of profits, karpoi\ oi( e)c a)gelw=n g. Id.Cyr.1.1.2, etc.; ta\ a)=qla a)po\ tetta/rwn tala/ntwn e)ge/nonto
were the produce of, i.e.
were worth, 4 talents, Id.HG4.2.7; to\ a)po\ tw=n ai)xmalw/twn geno/menon a)rgu/rion
produced by [the ransom of] . . , Id.An.5.3.4; of sums, o( gegonw\s a)riqmo\s tw=n yh/fwn the
total of the votes, Pl.Ap.36a; e(/katon ei)/kosi stath/rwn gi/gnontai trisxi/liai triako/siai e(ch/konta [draxmai/] 120 staters
amount to 3,360 drachmae, D.34.24; so in Math., of
products, o( e)c au)tw=n geno/menos a)riqmo/s Euc.7.24; a)riqmo\s geno/menos e(katonta/kis
multiplied by 100, Papp.10.13; of times of day, w(s h( h(me/ra e)ge/neto Th.7.81, etc.; e(/ws a)\n fw=s ge/nhtai Pl.Prt.311a; a(/ma e(/w| gignome/nh| Th.4.32; of Time in general,
elapse, die/ths xro/nos e)gego/nee tau=ta prh/ssousi Hdt.2.2; xro/nou genome/nou D.S.20.109.
falldue, oi( gigno/menoi dasmoi/ X.An.1.1.8; tou\s to/kous tou\s g. Isoc.17.37; to\ ti/mhma to\ g., to\ g. a)rgu/rion, D.24.82, Syngr. ap. eund.35.11; to\ g. me/ros X.HG7.4.33; to\ g. toi= plh/qi ta=s zami/au IG5(2).6A20 (Tegea, iv B. C.): c. dat., to\ g. tini\ e)/laion UPZ 19.32 (ii B. C.); toi=s gei/tosi to\ g. Thphr.Fr.97; ta\ g.
dues, PHib.1.92 and 111 (iii B. C.): hence gigno/menos
regular, normal, ti/mhma, xa/ris, D. 38.25; e)n tai=s g. h(me/rais in the
usual number of days, X.Cyr.5.4.51; freq. in later Gk., as Luc.Tox.18, etc. of events,
take place, come to pass, and in past tenses
to be, kai/ sfin a)/xos kata\ qumo\n e)gi/gneto Il.13.86, etc.; ma/xh e)gego/nei Pl.Chrm.153b, etc.; e)kexeiri/a gi/gnetai/ tisi pro\s a)llh/lous Th.4.58; h( no/sos h)/rcato gi/gnesqai Id.2.47; pneu=ma ei)w/qei g. ib.84; ta\ *)olu/mpia gi/gnetai, tragw|doi\ gi/gnontai,
are held, X.HG7.4.28, Aeschin.3.41, etc.; yh/fisma g.
is passed, X.Cyr.2.2.21; pista\ g., o(/rkoi g., pledges
are given, oaths
taken, ib.7.4.3, D.19.158; gi/gnetai/ ti u(po/ tinos (masc.), X.An.7.1.30, (neut.) Pl.Tht.200e; ta\ gigno/mena u(po\ tw=n *)aqhnai/wn Th.6.88; ta\ geno/mena e)c a)nqrw/pwn Hdt.Praef.; u(/brisma e)k tw=n *sami/wn geno/menon Id.3.48; a)po/ tinos g. X.An.5.6.30; para/ tinos Pl.R.614a; o(\ mh\ ge/noito which
God forbid, D.10.27,28.21; but ge/noito, = Amen, LXX Is.25.1; ge/noito ge/noito ib.Ps.71(72).19: Math., gegone/tw
suppose it done, Euc.6.23, etc.; ge/gone
it is done, Apoc.16.17: c. dat. et part., gi/gnetai/ ti/ moi boulome/nw|, a)sme/nw| (v. bou/lomai, a)/smenos）; ou)k a)\n e)moi/ ge e)lpome/nw| ta\ ge/noito, i.e. I could not hope to see these things
take place, Od.3.228; h(dome/noisi h(mi=n oi( lo/goi gego/nasi Hdt.9.46, etc.; of sacrifices, omens, etc., ou) ga/r sfi e)gi/neto ta\ sfa/gia xrhsta/ ib.61, cf.62; ta\ i(era\ kala\ e)ge/neto X.An.6.4.9: abs., ta\ diabath/ria e)g.
were favourable, Th.5.55; quome/nw| ou)k e)gi/gneto ta\ i(era/ X.HG3.1.17: in neut. part., to\ geno/menon
the event, the fact, Th.6.54; ta\ geno/mena
the facts, X.Cyr.3.1.9, etc.; to\ gigno/menon Pl.Tht.161b, etc.; ta\ gegenhme/na
the past, X.An.6.2.14; to\ genhso/menon
the future, Th.1.138; ta\ gegono/ta, opp. o)/nta, me/llonta, Pl.R.392d, cf. Lg.896a: of Time, w(s tri/th h(me/rh tw=| paidi/w| e)kkeime/nw| e)ge/neto Hdt.1.113; e(/ws a)/n tines xro/noi ge/nwntai Pl.Phd. 108c; but in pf. and plpf.,
to have passed, w(s dieth\s xro/nos e)gego/nee Hdt.2.2; pri\n e(\c mh=nas gegone/nai Pl.Prt.320a: impers., e)ge/neto or ge/gonen w(/ste . .
it happened, came to pass that . . , X.HG5.3.10, Isoc. 6.40, etc.; e)ge/neto, w(s h)/kousen . . kai\ e)qumw/qh
it came to pass, when he heard . . that . . , LXX Ge.39.19; e)ge/neto e)n tw=| poreu/esqai . . kai\ dih/rxeto Ev.Luc.17.11: c. inf., gi/netai eu(rei=n
it is possible to find, Thgn.639; e)ge/neto, c. acc. et inf.,
it came to pass that, Act.Ap.9.3, al., PAmh.2.135.10 (ii A. D.): c. dat. et inf., e)a/n soi ge/nhtai strafh=nai Epict.Ench. 23. folld. by a Predicate,
come into a certain state,
become, and (in past tenses),
to be, folld. by Nouns and Adjs., dhi/+oisi de\ xa/rma g. Il.6.82, cf. 8.282; swth\r genou= moi A.Ch.2; kwluth\s g. tino/s Th.3.23; [ou)=roi] nhw=n pomph=es g. Od.4.362, etc.; pa/nta de\ gigno/menos peirh/setai
turning every way, ib.417; pantoi=os g., folld. by mh/, c. inf., Hdt.3.124; pantoi=os g. deo/menos Id.7.10.g/; e)k plousi/ou pe/nhs g. X.An.7.7.28; dhmotiko\s e)c o)ligarxikou= g. Pl.R.572d: rarely c. part., mh\ prodou\s h(ma=s ge/nh|, i.e. prodo/ths h(mw=n, S.Aj.588, cf. Ph. 773; mh\ a)parnhqei\s ge/nh| Pl.Sph.217c; a)potetramme/noi e)ge/nonto Th. 3.68, etc.: with Pron., ti/ ge/nwmai
; what
am I to become, i.e. what is to become of me? A.Th.297, cf. Theoc.15.51; ou)k e)/xontes o(/ti ge/nwntai Th.2.52; less freq. with masc., ou)d' e)/xw ti/s a)\n genoi/man A.Pr.905; gi/gnontai pa/nq' o(/ti bou/lontai Ar.Nu.348. in past tenses,
having ceased to be, o( geno/menos strathgo/s the
ex-strategus, POxy.38.11 (i A. D.); h( g. gunh/ tinos the
former wife, PFlor.99.4 (i/ii A. D.). with Advbs., kakw=s xrh=n *kandau/lh| gene/sqai Hdt.1.8; eu)=, kalw=s, h(de/ws g.,
it goes well, etc., X.An.1.7.5, Arr.Epict.3.24.97, LXX To. 7.9; with personal construction, oi( para\ *pla/twni deipnh/santes e)s au)/rion h(de/ws gi/gnontai Plu.2.127b; di/xa g. tou= sw/matos
to be parted from . . , X.Cyr.8.7.20; trixh=| g.
to be in three divisions, Id.An.6.2.16; g. e)mpodw/n, e)kpodw/n, E.Hec.372, X.HG6.5.38, etc. folld. by oblique cases of Nouns, c. gen., g. tw=n dikaste/wn, tw=n geraite/rwn,
become one of . . , Hdt.5.25, X.Cyr.1.2.15, cf. Ar.Nu.107, etc.; boulh=s gegonw/s D.C.36.28 (cf. supr.1.b);
