fall to, belong to, h( ni/kh *)aghsila/ou e)gege/nhto X.HG4.3.20;
to be under control of, o( nou=s o(/tan au(tou= ge/nhtai S. OC660, cf. Pl.Phdr.250a (s. v.l.); u(mw=n au)tw=n gene/sqai D.4.7 (also e)nto\s e(wutou= g. Hdt.1.119; e)n e(autw=| g. X.An.1.5.17; e)n sautou= genou= S.Ph.950); th\n po/lin e)lpi/dos mega/lhs ginome/nhn Plu.Phoc.23: of things,
to be at, i.e.
cost, so much, ai( trixi/des ei) genoi/aq' e(kato\n tou)bolou= Ar.Eq.662, cf.X.Oec.20.23. c. dat.,
fall to, i. e. as wife, LXXNu.36.11. with Preps., g. a)po\ dei/pnou, e)k qusi/as,
have done . . , Hdt.2.78, 1.50; polu\n xro/non g. a)po/ tinos
to be separated from . . , X.Mem.1.2.25; g. ei)/s ti
turn into, to\ kako\n g. ei)s a)gaqo/n Thgn.162; freq. in LXX, e)genh/qh moi ei)s gunai=ka Ge.20.12; ei)s brw=sin ib.La.4.10; ei)s ou)de/n, ei)s keno/n, Act.Ap.5.36, 1 Ep.Thess. 3.5; e)s *aakedai/mona Hdt.5.38 (in Hom. even without Prep., e)me\ xrew\ g. Od.4.634); g. ti ei)/s tina
comes to him, of a dowry, Is.3.36; of a ward, And.1.117; g. e)c o)fqalmw=n tini
to be out of sight, Hdt.5.24; e)c a)nqrw/pwn g.
disappear from . . , Paus.4.26.6; g. e)n *xi/w| Hdt.5.33, etc.; g. e)n . . ,
to be engaged in . . , oi( e)n poih/sei gino/menoi in poetry, Id.2.82; e)n [pole/mw|] Th.1.78; e)n pei/ra| g. tinos X.An.1.9.1; e)n o)rgh=|, e)n ai)ti/a| pro/s tina g., Plu.Flam.16, Rom.7; of things, e)n kairw=| g.
to be in season, X.HG4.3.2; e)n tu/xh| g. tini/ ti Th.4.73; g. dia\ ghlo/fwn, of a road, X.An.3.4.24; but di' e)/xqras g. tini/
to be at enmity with, Ar.Ra.1412; g. e)pi\ potamw=|
arrive or
be at . . , Hdt.1.189, etc.; g. e)pi/ tini
fall into or
be in one's power, X.An.3.1.13, etc.; e)pi\ sumforai=s g. D.21.58 codd. (-a=s Schaefer); g. e)pi/ tini, also,
to be set over . . , X.Cyr.3.3.53; g. e)f' h(mw=n au)tw=n
to be alone, Aeschin.2.
36; g. e)pi\ th=s dioikh/sews D.C.43.48; g. e)p' e)lpi/dos
to be in hope, Plu.Sol.14: Math., g. e)pi\ a)riqmo/n
to be multiplied into a number, Theol.Ar.3; g. kata/ tina or ti
to be near . . or
opposite to . . , in battle, X.Cyr.7.1.14, HG4.2.18; but kata\ custa/seis g.
to be formed into groups, Th.2.21; kaq' e(\n g. Id.3.10; kaq' au(tou\s g.
to be alone, D.10.52; g. meta\ tou= qei/ou
to be with God, X.Cyr.8.7.27, etc.; h( ni/kh g. su/n tini Id.Ages.2.13; g. par' a)mfote/rois toi=s pra/gmasi
to be present on both sides, Th.5.26; g. para/ ti
to depend upon . . , D.18.232; g. peri\ to\ sumbouleu/ein
to be engaged in . . , Isoc.3.12; genou= pro/s tina
go to So-and-so, PFay.128, etc.; g. pro\s th=| kardi/a|
to be at or
near . . , Pl.Phd.118, etc.; g. pro/s tini
to be engaged in . . , Isoc. 12.270, D.18.176; au)to\s pro\s au(tw=|
meditate, Plu.2.151c; so g. pro\s to\ i)a=sqai Pl.R.604d; pro\s paraskeuh/n Plb.1.22.2: impers., e)pei\ pro\s h(me/ran e)gi/gneto X.HG2.4.6; gene/sqai pro/s tinwn
to be inclined towards them, Hdt.7.22; g. pro\ o(dou=
to be forward on the way, Il.4.382; g. u(po/ tini
to be subject to . . , Hdt.7.11, Th.7.64; g. u(po\ tai=s mhxanai=s
to be under the protection of . . , X.Cyr.7.1.34. gi/gnetai folld. by pl. nouns, i(/na gi/gnhtai . . a)rxai/ te kai\ ga/moi Pl.R.363a, cf. Smp.188b; e)ge/neto . . h(me/rai o)ktw/ Ev.Luc.9.28. (Cf.
jánati 'procreate',
jánas ( = ge/nos), Lat.
gigno, gnatus.）

gignw/skw, Dor. (Epich.9, Pi.O.6.97), Aeol., Ion., and after Arist. ginw/skw, but gignw/skw in early Att. Inscrr., as IG12.127.19 (kata-), etc.: fut. gnw/somai Il.23.497, etc., Dor. 3sg. gnwsei=tai Call.Lav. Pall.123 (gnw/sw is f.l. in Hp.Steril.215); Cret. form a)na-gnw/onti dub. in GDI5075 (for aor. 1, v. a)nagignw/skw): pf. e)/gnwka Pi.P.4.287, etc.: aor. 2 e)/gnwn Il.13.72, etc., Ep. dual gnw/thn Od.21.36, Dor. 3pl. e)/gnon Pi.P.4.120; imper. gnw=qi Epich.[264], etc.; subj. gnw=, gnw=|s, gnw=| Il.1.411, etc., Ep. also gnw/w, gnw/omen Od.16.304, gnw/wsi Il.23.610; opt. gnoi/hn Il.18.125, etc.; pl. gnoi=men Pl.Alc.1.129a; inf. gnw=nai Od.13.312, etc., Ep. gnw/menai Il.21.266; part. gnou/s S.El.731, etc.:—Med., aor. 1 gnw/sasqai Man.2.51:—Pass., fut. gnwsqh/somai Ar.Nu.918, Th.1.124, etc.: aor. e)gnw/sqhn A.Supp. 7 (lyr.), E.El.852, Th.2.65: pf. e)/gnwsmai E.HF1287, Th.3.38:—
come to know, perceive, and in past tenses,
know, c. acc., Il.12.272, etc.; as dist. fr. oi)=da
know by reflection, gignw/skw, =
know by observation, gno/ntes de\ ei)do/tas periora=n Th.1.69; e)gw\ d' oi)=d' o(/ti gignw/skete tou=ton a(/pantes D.18.276; xalepo/n e)sti to\ gnw=nai ei) oi)=den h)\ mh/ it is hard to
perceive whether one knows or not, Arist.AP0.76a26;
discern, distinguish, recognize, o)/fr' eu)= gignw/skh|s h)me\n qeo\n h)de\ kai\ a)/ndra Il. 5.128; a)spi/di gignw/skwn by his shield, ib.182; ironically, eu)= nu/ tis au)to\n gnw/setai he will
learn him to his cost, 18.270; nu=n e)/gnwn to\n *)/erwta Theoc.3.15: sts. c. gen., gnw/thn a)llh/lwn
were aware of . . , Od.21.36, cf. 23.109. folld. by relat. clauses, gignw/skw d' w(s . . I
perceive that . . , 21.209; e)/gnws w(s qeo/s ei)mi Il.22.10; e)/gnwkas w(s ou)de\n le/geis Ar.Nu.1095; g. o(/ti . . Heraclit. 108, A.Pr.104,379, etc.; i(/n' ei)dh=te u(mei=s kai\ gnw=te o(/ti . . D.21.143; gnw/menai ei)/ min . . fobe/ousi Il.21.266; g. ti/ pe/ponqe pa/qos Pl.Phlb.60d: c. acc. and relat. clause, *tudei/dhn d' ou)k a)\n gnoi/hs, pote/roisi metei/h Il.5.85; g. qeou\s oi(/tine/s ei)si Heraclit.5; *swkra/thn g. oi(=os h)=n X.Mem.4.8.11; tou\s *pe/rsas g. o(/ti . . Id.Cyr.2.1.11; also a)llotri/as gh=s g. o(/ti du/natai fe/rein Id.Oec.16.3: c. part., e)/gnwn min . . oi)wno\n e)o/nta
perceived that he was . . , Od.15.532; gno/ntes ou)demi/an sfi/si timwri/an ou)=san Th.1.25; e)/gnwka . . h)pathme/nh S.Aj.807; e)/gnwn h(tthme/nos I
felt that I
was beaten, Ar.Eq.658; xrusw=| pa/ttwn m' ou) gignw/skeis Id.Nu.912, cf. Antipho 5.33, X.Cyr. 7.2.17: c. gen., w(s gnw= xwome/noio when
he was aware of . . , Il.4.357, cf. Pl.Ap.27a: c. inf., i(/na gnw=| tre/fein th\n glw=ssan h(suxeste/ran S. Ant.1089: c. acc. et inf.,
recognize that . . , Th.1.43, etc.;
take a thing
to mean that . . , Hdt.1.78: c. dupl. acc.,
perceive or
know another to be . . , oi(/ous gnw/sesqe tou\s a)nqrw/pous X.An.1.7.4: abs., o( gignw/skwn
the perceiver, opp. ta\ gignwsko/mena
the objects perceived, Pl.R.508e; also o( g.
one who knows, a prudent person, ib.347d:—Pass., ei) gnwsqei=en w(=| . . if
it were known of them in what . . , Id.Prt.342b.
form a judgement, think, tau)ta/ Hdt.9.2; ta)nanti/a tou/tois g. X. HG2.3.38; ou(/tw g. Id.An.6.1.19; ta\ di/kaia g. Lys.22.2; a(\ gignw/skw le/gein ( = th\n gnw/mhn l.) D.4.1; peri\ th=s bohqei/as tau=ta gignw/skw Id.1.19; tou=to gignw/skwn, o(/ti . . Men.572, cf. 648; w(s e)mou= a)gwnioume/nou ou(/tw gi/gnwske X.Cyr.2.3.15: abs., au)to\s gnw/sh|
see thou to that, Pl.Grg.505c; esp. in dialogue, e)/gnwn
I understand, S.Aj. 36; e)/gnws
you are right, Id.Tr.1221, E.Andr.883; e)/gnwkas; Lat.
tenes? Nausicr.1.5;
judge, determine, decree that . . , c. acc. et inf., Hdt.1.74, 6.85, Isoc.17.16: c. inf.,
determine to . . , And.1.107:— Pass.,
to be pronounced, of a sentence or judgement, Th.3.36; parano/mws gnwsqei=sa di/aita D.33.33, cf. 59.47; kri/sis e)gnwsme/nh u(po/ tinos Isoc.6.30. Pass., of persons,
to be judged guilty, A.Supp.7; gnwsqe/nta zhmiou=sin oi( no/moi Arist.Rh.Al.1431b30; teqna/tw e)a\n gnwsqh=|, e)a\n de\ fugh\ gnwsqh=|, feuge/tw IG12.10.29. pf. Pass. with act. sense, w(molo/ghken u(ma=s u(pa/rxein e)gnwsme/nous are
determined, D. 18.228 (sed leg. h(ma=s).
know carnally, Men.558.5, Heraclid. Pol.64, LXX Ge.4.1, al., Ev.Matt.1.25, Plu.Galb.9, etc. g. xa/rin, = ei)de/nai xa/rin, D.C.39.9. causal,
make known, celebrate, gnw/somai ta\n o)lbi/an *ko/rinqon Pi.O.13.3 acc. to Sch. ad loc., v. dub. (Root gnw-, cf. Skt.
jānāmi, jñātas, Lat.
gnosco, gnotus, etc.)

gizi/, h(, a kind of
cassia, Gal.14.67; gi/zir (v.l. zi/gir) Dsc.1.13; gi/zeir Peripl.M.Rubr.12; gizhra/, Orib.Syn.2.56.17.

gilo/s: e(tero/fqalmos, Hsch. gima/sai: siago/nes, Id. gimba/nai: zeu/gana, Id. gi/n: soi/ (leg. ti/n), Id. ginipth/rion, to/, perh. f.l. for ginist-, = Lat.
genista, broom, PLeid.X.19.
gi/nomai, ginw/skw, v. gign-.

gi/cai: xwrh=sai, Hsch. gi/o: au)tou=, Id. gi=pon: ei)=pon, Id. gi/s: i(ma\s kai\ gh= kai\ i)sxu/s (i. e. vi/s), Id. gisa/menai: ei)de/nai, Id. gi/sas: fqei/ras, Id.: inf., gi/sai
deflower, App.Anth. 4.73 (perh. Strat.). gi/sgon: i)/son, Hsch. (vi/s von). gi/sion: mikro\n tei=xos, Id. (leg. gei/s-). gisti/a: e)sxa/ra （e)sxa/th cod.), Id. gisti/ai: i(stourgoi/, Id. gistiw=: pau/somai, Id. gisxu/n: i)sxu/n, Id. gite/a: i)te/a （e)te/a cod.), Id. (In the above words, g freq. = v.) gi=ton, to/, dub. sens. in UPZ89.14(pl., ii B. C.). gi/tonas, v. gei/twn.

gla^g-a/w,
to be milky, juicy, glago/wnti spe/rmati AP9.384.23.
gla^g-e/as: gegalaktwme/nas, Hsch.

gla^g-ero/s, a/, o/n,
full of milk, AP6.154 (Leon. or Gaet.).
soft, plump, Opp. C.1.200, 332.

gla^go/-eis, essa, en, = foreg., mazoi/ AP5.55 (Diosc.).
milky, milk-white, Nic.Th.923, Opp.H.4.113.

gla^go-ph/c, h=gos, o(, h(,
curdling milk, gauloi\ g. bowls
for the purpose, AP6.35 (Leon.).

gla/gos [a^], eos, to/, poet. for ga/la (q. v.),
milk, Il.2.471, Pi.Fr.106, Nic.Al.385.

gla^go/trofos, on,
milk-fed, Lyc.1260.

gla/zw, = kla/zw,
sing aloud, me/los Pi.Fr.97. gla=qis, ios, h(, name of a
sacrifice or
festival, dub. sens. in Riv.Fil.53.208 (Crete, pl.).

glainoi/ or glai=noi, oi(,
star-shaped ornaments, Hsch., EM232.40. glaismoi/: lo/foi, Hsch. glaka/w, = glaga/w, Id. glakko/n: galaqhno/n, Id.

glakto-pa^gh/s, e/s,
full of milk, masto/s Jahrb.19.Anz.186 (Smyrna).

glakto-fa/gos [a^], on, shortd. for galakt-,
living on milk, Il.13.6: *glaktofa/goi, oi(, Scythian people, Hes.Fr.54.

glakto-fo/ros, on,
milk-producing, prob. in Marc.Sid.100.
gla/mata: a)stra/galoi, Hsch.
gla^ma/w, = lhma/w, Poll.4.185, Moer.111.
gla^mo/s: mu/ca, Hsch. gla/mptein: pi/nein, Id.
gla^mucia/w, = glama/w, and gla/mucos [a^], on, = sq., EM232.42.

gla^mu^ro/s, a/, o/n,
blear-eyed, o(fqalmoi/ Hp.Mul.2.116,119; prov., e)n tuflw=n po/lei+ g. basileu/ei 'dans le royaume des aveugles le borgne est roi', Sch.Il.24.192. of birds, perh. = lamuro/s, S.Fr.396 (but e)nugrobi/ous EM232.44). (With glama/w, gla/mucos （<glamo-m.）, glamuro/s, glamw/dhs, cf. Lett.
glums 'mucus',
glumt 'become viscous', Engl.
clammy.）
glamyoi/: xalinoi\ sto/matos, Hsch.
gla^mw/dhs, es, = glamuro/s, EM232.44.
gla/mwn [a^], on, = gla^muro/s, Ar.Ra.588, Ec.254, Eup.9, Lys.14.25.

gla/nis [a^], o( （h( Paus.4.34.2), or gla^ni/s (Hsch., also expld. as, = a)rgo/s), gen. idos Ephipp.12.1, Mnesim.4.32; gla/nios (v.l. gla/news) Arist.HA568b22, al.: acc. gla/nin AB88: pl. gla/neis, oi(, Arist.HA 602b24; gla/nides Archipp.26; gla/nies Matro Conv.80:—
sheat-fish, Silurus, esp.
Parasilurus Aristotelis, Arist.HA568a25, etc.:—also gla/nios, o(, Hdn.Gr.1.94, Gloss.
glanoi/: a)xrei=oi, Hsch.

gla/nos, o(,
hyena, Arist.HA594a31.
gla/c, v. glau/c 111. gla/ptw, = gla/fw, EM233.7.

gla^ri/s, i/dos, h(,
chisel, whether for wood or stone work, S.Fr.529, IG11(2).161 A87 (Delos, iii B. C.), Call.Fr.159 (pl.), Poll.7.118, 10.147. = o)/ros, Hsch.
gla/ssa, v. glw=ssa:—hence gla/sswn: mwro/s, Zonar.
glaukeiou=s, ou=n, = glau/kinos, IG2.759 ii 11 (iv B. C.).

glaukhpo/ros, on,
blue-rolling, klu/dwn [Emp.] Sphaer.143.
glauko/n: bota/nh tis (cf. glau/kion), Hsch.

glauk-ia/w, Hom. only in Ep. part. glaukio/wn,
glaring fiercely, of a lion, Il.20.172; g. o)/ssois deino/n Hes.Sc.430; of a sparkling stone, D.P.1121; glaukio/wsa selh/nh Man.5.250: 3pl. glaukio/wsi Opp.C.3.70; late Prose, glaukiw=n to\ ble/mma Hld.7.10.
have a glau/kwma,
glare blindly, o)fqalmoi\ . . dusalqe/a glaukio/wntes Q.S.12.408.

glauk-i/danon, to/, name of an
eyesalve, Gal.12.746.
glauk-i/dion, to/, Dim. of glau=kos, Antiph.222.1. Dim. of glau/c, IG2.735.33.

glauk-i/zw,
to be bluish-grey, of marble, Str.5.2.5; xrw=ma -i/zon Sch.Arat.367, cf. PLeid.X.100,al. = a)mbluwpe/w, Hsch.
glauk-i_ni/dion [ni^], to/, = glauki/dion, Amphis 35.

glau/k-i_nos, h, on,
bluish-grey, i(ma/tion Plu.2.821e, cf. 565c. g. e)/laion oil
flavoured with glau/kion, Edict.Diocl.32.67.

glau/k-ion, to/,
juice of the horned poppy, Glaucium corniculatum, Dsc.3.86, cf. 1.64, Gal.11.857. kind of
duck, perh.
white-eyed duck, Anas leucophthalmus, Ath.9.395c.

glauk-i/skos, o(, a fish so called from its colour, Philem.79.21, Damox.2.18, PEdgar 15.4 (iii B. C.), AP5.184 (Asclep.). a
plant, Hegesand. 35.

glauk-ismo/s, o(,
dyeing blue-grey, PHolm.21.42.

glaukoeidh/s, e/s,
grey, Sch.Il.16.34.

glauko/mmatos, on,
grey-eyed, Pl.Phdr.253e.

glauko/s, h/, o/n, orig. without any notion of colour,
gleaming (cf. glau/ssw, glauso/s), once in Hom., glaukh\ de/ se ti/kte qa/lassa Il.16.34 (hence glaukh\ duspe/mfelos, = the sea, Hes. Th.440): so in Trag. (not A.), g. li/mna S.Fr.371,476; a(/ls E.Cyc.16; oi)=dma Id.Hel.1501 (lyr.); later g. sela/na Mesom.Sol.21; plh/qonta puro\s glaukoi=o selh/nh Tryph.514; a)ste/res Him.Ecl.13.37; g. h)w/s Theoc.16.5; also g. dra/kwn Pi.O.8.37 (expld. by Sch.as, = glau/kwy, glaukw=pis). later, of colour (kuanou=s leukw=| kerannu/menos Pl.Ti.68c; cf. glauko/teron kua/noio faei/netai Hegesianax 1),
bluish green or
grey, of the olive, S.OC701, E.IT1101, Tr.802 (all lyr.), etc.; of the elder,
Emp.93; o)pw/ra, of grapes, S.Tr.703; of vine leaves, AP9.87 (Marc. Arg.); of the beryl and topaz, D.P.1119 sq.; ma/ragdos Nonn.D.5.178. freq. of the eye,
light blue, grey, opp. me/las, xaropo/s, Arist.GA779b13, HA492a3, cf. Paus.1.14.6; e)/qnos g. i)sxurw=s kai\ purro/n Hdt.4.108, cf. Hp.
Aër.14, Arist.Pr.892a3, etc.; g. *)aqa/na E.Heracl.754 (lyr.), Theoc.28.1, cf. Plot.4.4.19; cf. glaukw=pis: —this colour was not admired, Luc.DMeretr.2.1, Philostr. VA7.42.

glau=kos, o(, an eatable
fish of grey colour, Epich.49,50, Cratin.161, Antiph.7.6, Arist.HA607b27, Numen. ap. Ath.7.295c, etc. as pr. n., esp. of a Chian inventor: hence prov., ou)x h( *glau/kou te/xnh, c. inf., 'it does not need a genius to . . ', Pl.Phd.108d, etc.

glauko/ths, htos, h(,
greyness, of the eyes, Arist.GA778a18; o)mma/twn g. deinw=s pikra/ Plu.Sull.2; also g. a)e/ros Corn.ND35.
glauko/fqalmos, on, = glauko/mmatos, Dsc.1.125, Gal.12.740.
glaukofo/rbidas: i(/ppous eu)genedta/tas, Hsch.

glauko-xai/ths, ou, o(,
with greyish hair or
mane, Choerob.in Cod. Barocc.50f.200.

glauko/-xroos, o(, h(, acc. glauko/xroa,
grey-coloured, of the olive, Pi.O.3.13.

glauko/w,
dye blue-grey, e)/ria PHolm.19.28, 26.30, cf. EM233.24. Pass.,
to be affected with glau/kwma, Hp.Prorrh.2.20, Epid.4.30; ta\s o)/yeis glaukwqh=nai J.AJ12.2.14.

*glaukw/, ou=s, name for the
moon, Sch.Pi.O.6.76.

glauk-w/dhs, es,
of the owl kind, Arist.HA504a26.

glauk-w/lenos, on, of Tethys,
with sea-grey arms, Hymn.Is.148.

glau/k-wma, atos, to/,
opacity of the crystalline lens, cataract, Arist.GA780a17; esp. of the supposedly incurable forms of this affection, opp. u(po/xuma, Ruf. ap. Orib.Syn.8.49, cf. Paul.Aeg.3.22, Gal.19.435.

glauk-w/pion, to/,
temple of Athena Glaucopis, prob. in Alc.32.

glauk-w=pis, h(, gen. idos: acc. ida, also in Od.1.156:—in Hom., epith. of Athena, prob.,
with gleaming eyes, Il.1.206, al., cf. IG12.418, Sch. Ven.ad 5.458, Hsch. = glauko/s, of the olive, Euph.150; of the moon, Emp.42.3, E.Fr. 1009.
glauk-wpo/s, o/n, = foreg., Corn.ND20, Ael.NA17.23, Eust.86.46:—also glauk-w/phs, o(, Eust.1389.2.

glau/k-wsis, ews, h(,
blindness from glau/kwma, Hp.Aph.3.31 (pl.), Gal.UP10.6, etc.
glauk-w/y, w=pos, o(, h(, = glaukw=pis, dra/kontes Pi.O.6.45; o)/fis Id.P.4.249; *pronoi/h Euph.2.

glauno/s, o(, a kind of
tunic, Poll.7.48.

glau/c, Att. glau=c, glauko/s, h(, Euphronius ap. Sch.Ar.V.1081, cf. Hdn.Gr.2.947:—
the little owl, Athene noctua, so called from its
glaring eyes, Epich.166, Arist.HA488a26, al.; freq. as emblem of Athena, Ar.Av.516, Eq.1093, etc.: prov., glau=k' *)aqh/naze, glau=k' ei)s *)aqh/nas, 'carry coals to Newcastle', Ar.Av.301, Antiph.175.2; glau=c e)n po/lei 'Jack's as good as his master', Hsch., etc.; glau=kes *laureiwtikai/, of Athenian coins, from the type, Ar.Av.1106; so of figures of owls, IG2.678B76. g. qalatti/a, an unknown
bird, Thphr. Sign.52. a kind of
dance, Ath.14.629f.
wart cress, Coronopus procumbens, Dsc.4.138, Gal.11.857:—also gla/c, Hdn. Gr.1.395, al.
glauro/n: semno/n, Hsch. glauso/n: lampro/n, qrasu/, i)tamo/n, Id.

glau/ssw,
shine, glitter, Hsch.: aor. imper. glau=con EM234.15. (Denom fr. glauko/s, cf. dia-glau/ssw.)
gla^fi/s, = glufi/s, EM235.10.

gla/fu^ [a^], to/, （gla/fw)
hollow, cavern, Hes.Op.533.

gla^fu^r-i/a, h(,
elegance, Plu.Pyrrh.8 (pl.); of mathematical demonstrations,
neatness, Iamb. in Nic.p.38P., al.: metaph.,
smoothness of manner, g. kai\ piqano/ths Plu.2.1065d.

gla^fu^r-o/s, a/, o/n, (gla/fw)
hollow, hollowed, nh=es Il.2.454, al.; g. pe/trh, spe/os 2.88, 18.402; a)/ntron Agath.1.10 (Sup.); ta\ g. th=s gh=s Id.2.15; g. fo/rmigc Od. 17.262; g. a(/rmata Pi.N.9.12; g. limh/n
a deep harbour or cove, Od. 12.305.—In this sense Ep. and Lyr. (not in Trag.); twice in Com., Hermipp.63.11 (mock-Epic); [poth/ria] tapeina\ kai\ g. Epigen.4.3; later po/des
arched, Arist.HA538b11 (Comp.).
polished: hence,
hairless, smooth, of spiders, Arist.HA555b11.
neat, delicate, r(u/gxos Id.PA662b8; khri/on Id.HA554b28（Comp.); of dishes,
dainty, deipna/rion Diph.64.1; e)mbamma/tia Anaxipp.1.35. metaph.,
subtle, exact, of persons and things, w)= sofw/tat', w)= glafurw/tate Ar.Av.1272; g. a)stei=o/s q' a(/ma Machoap.Ath.13.579b; glafurw/teros tw=n nu=n nomoqetw=n Arist.Pol.1274b8; glafurwte/ran e)/xein th\n dia/noian Id.PA650b19; ei)/ ti komyo\n h)\ sofo\n h)\ g. oi)=sqa Dionys.Com. 3.1, cf. Plot.4.8.6; to\ g.
subtlety, poiki/llontes tw=| g. gewmetri/an Plu. Marc.14, cf. Iamb.in Nic.p.20 P.; g. te/xnai, qewri/a, Ph.1.270,566: Sup., Id.2.262. Adv., Comp. -ote/rws
more subtly, Arist.de An.405a8.
skilful, neat, xei/r Theoc.Ep.8.5; [a)ra/xnion] sofw/taton kai\ -w/taton Arist.HA623a8. Adv. -rw=s, h(=tton g. e)/xein with less
finish, Id.Pol.1271b21, cf.Alex.110.20.
refined, glafuro/n ti kai\ prosagwgo\n e)meidi/asen Luc.DDeor.20.11; g. diatribai/ Plu.Cim.13. Adv. -rw=s, g. kai\ perittw=s dia/gein Id.2.989c; g. biw/sas CIG2004 (Maced.). of literary style,
polished, elegant, g. a(rmoni/a D.H.Dem. 36; r(uqmo/s Id.Comp.13; su/nqesis, opp. au)sthra/, ib.21. Adv. -rw=s, le/gein Id.Isoc.2; of music, e)melw|/dei pa/nu glafuro\n kai\ e)narmo/nion Luc. DDeor.7.4.

gla/fw [a^],
scrape up, dig up, hollow, possi\ gla/fei, of a lion, Hes. Sc.431.
engrave, CR12.282 (ii A. D.).
gla/xwn [a_], Dor. for glh/xwn, v. blh/xwn.
gle/ba: a)ci/wma sugklh/tou, Hsch. glei=nos, o(, v. gli=nos.

gleuk-a^gwgo/s, o/n,
for carrying new wine, bu/rsa Pherecr.16.

gleuk-a/w, in aor. part. -h/sas, of
oversweetened wine, Hsch.
gleu/k-h, hs, h(, = gluku/ths, Sch.Nic.Al.171.

gleu/k-inos, h, on,
made with gleu=kos
as a vehicle, mu/ron, a special kind of confection or oil, Dsc.1.57, Androm. ap.Gal.13.1039, Aët.12.55; also g. e)/laion Colum.12.53, Plin.HN23.46.
partly fermented, oi)=nos Gal.UP4.3.
gleuk-i/ths [i_] (sc. oi)=nos), ou, o(, = gleu=kos 1.1, Olymp.in Mete.311.13.

gleukopo/ths, ou, o(,
drinker of new wine, *sa/turoi AP6.44 (Leon. (?)); *pa/n APl.4.235 (Apollonid.).

gleu=kos, eos (Dor. gen. gleu/kios GDI4993 (Gortyn)), to/,
sweet new wine, Arist.Mete.380b32, Nic.Al.184, 299, PPetr.3p.149 (iii B. C.), Act.Ap.2.13, Dsc.5.6; oi)/nou gleu/kous PGrenf.2.24.12 (ii B. C.), PFlor.65.8 (vi A. D.).
grape-juice, Gal.6.575.
sweetness, Arist.Pr.931a18.
gleu=cis, v. glu/cis. gle/faron, to/, Aeol. for ble/faron, Pi.O. 3.12, etc.
glhmw/dhs, es, = glamuro/s, Gal.19.91.
glh/n, h(, = sq., Hermesian.1.

glh/nh, h(,
eyeball, Il.14.494, Od.9.390; to\ ei)/dwlon to\ e)n th=| o)/yei, Ruf. Onom.24, cf. Poll.2.70; poet.
eye, S.OT1277; *fae/qwn mona/di glh/na| paraugei= Cerc.4.18. e)/rre, kakh\ g. Il.8.164, perh.
doll, plaything (since figures are reflected small in the pupil, cf. ko/rh).
socket of a joint, distd. from kotu/lh as being not so deep, Gal.2.736.
honeycomb, AB233, Hsch. = gli/nh (q. v.), Hdn. Gr.1.330.
glhni/s (or glh=nis), h(, perh. a measure of capacity, e)lai/w kotu/la glhni/s IG5(1).1447 (Messene, iii/ii B. C.).

glhnoeidh/s, e/s,
like a glh/nh 111, opp. kotuloeidh/s, Hp.Art.79; koilo/ths Gal.UP2.11: a)pofu/seis Id.2.760.

glh=nos, eos, to/, in pl.,
gaudy things, playthings, trinkets, Il.24.192, A.R.4.428 (expld. from glhno/n, = poiki/lon by Hsch.). = glh/nh 1, Nic.Th.228. = fa/os, Hsch., prob. in A.Fr.300.4: in pl.,
stars, Arat.318. pl., = xrh/mata (Elean), Sch.Il. l.c.
glhnw=sai: diafqei=rai, Cyr., and glhnwta/ (glh/nwsa cod.): ponhra/, Hsch. glhxuli/s: ponhra/, Cyr. (glhxuri/s, Zonar.).
glh/xwn, Dor. gla/xwn, h(, v. blh/xwn, g. a)gri/a, = kalami/nqh 11, Ps.-Dsc.3.35; = di/ktamnon, ib.32.

glhxwni/ths oi)=nos, o(, wine
prepared with glh/xwn, Dsc.5.52, Gp. 8.7.
glhxwnoeide/s, to/, = di/ktamnon, Hsch.

gli/a, h(,
glue, EM234.24, Suid.; cf. gloio/s.
glia=tai: pai/zei, Hsch.:—but gliw=sai: to\ pai/zein, EM234.24.
gli/nh, h(, = gloio/s, Suid.: gli/na EM234.26: glh/nh Hdn.Gr.1.330:—Adj. glinw/dhs, es, = gloiw/dhs, Arist.Fr.311 codd.Ath., Sch. Nic.Al.471, Dsc.4.82:—written glhnw/dhs, Gp.2.6.35,41.

gli=nos or glei=nos, o(,
Cretan maple, Acer creticum, Thphr.HP3.3.1, 3.11.2.
gli/on, = eu)/tonon or i)sxuro/n, Hsch., EM234.24, Eust.1560.32.

glisxr-antilogecepi/triptos, on, Com. word in Ar.Nu.1004,
hair-splitting-pettifogging-barefaced-knavish.

glisxr-eu/omai,
to be close, stingy, M.Ant.5.5.

glisxr-i/a, h(, = glisxro/ths,
stinginess, Sch.Ar.Pax193 (but expld. by a)tuxi/a).

glisxro-loge/omai,
squabble about trifles, Ph.1.526.

glisxro-logi/a, h(,
straw-splitting, ib.698, D.L.2.30.

gli/sxros, a, on,
sticky, Hp.VC14; gh= Thphr.6.5.4; joined with liparo/s, Pl.Ti.82d, 84a; g. to\ si/alon Pherecr.69.3; of oil, Arist.Mete. 383b34; opp. yaquro/s (q. v.), ib.385a17;
tough, cu/lon Thphr.3.17.5. metaph.,
sticking close, importunate, g. prosaitw=n liparw=n te Ar.Ach.452: metaph.,
clinging, g. h( o(lkh\ th=s o(moio/thtos Pl.Cra.435c. Adv. -rws, e)piqumei=n Id.Cri.53e; ei)ka/zein make a
close comparison, Id.R.488a, cf Cra.414c: Sup. -o/tata, sarka/zontes Ar. Pax482.
penurious, niggardly, Arist.EN1121b22; gli/sxron ble/pein Euphro10.16. Adv. -rws kai\ kata\ smikro\n feido/menos Pl.R.553c, cf. X.Cyr.8.3.37; fau/lws kai\ g. parei/xonto xrh/mata Hell.Oxy.14.2; g. zh=n, opp. trufa=n, Arist.Pol.1266b26; g. lamba/nein, opp. a)fqo/nws dido/nai, ib.1314b3: hence,
with difficulty, hardly, g. kai\ mo/lis lamba/nein D.37.38, cf. App.Mith.72; h)\ to\ para/pan ou)de/n . . , h)\ g. Arist.Pol.1275a38; also tro/pon tina\ gli/sxron but
scantily, Id.PA660b14. of things,
mean, shabby, of buildings, D.23.208; g. dei=pnon Plu.Lyc.17; of land,
poor, Id.Flam.4; g. te/xnai Luc.Fug.13; *xru/sippos pollaxou= g. e)sti/n Plu.2.31e. Adv. -rws, of painting,
carefully, with elaborate detail, Philostr.Im.2.12 and 28. (Cf. gloio/s.)

glisxro/xolos, on,
viscous from bile, Hp.Epid.4.26 (-xroos f.l. ap. Erot.).

glisxrw/dhs, es,
glutinous, f.l. for blix-, Hp.VC19.

gli/sxrwn, onos, o(,
niggard, Ar.Pax193.
gli/tton, to/, = gloio/s, Hsch.; = a)po/luma, Eust.1560.32.

gli/xomai, only pres. and impf., exc. aor. 1 e)glica/mhn Pl.Com. 241:—
cling to, strive after, long for, tino/s Hdt.3.72; *ai)gu/ptou Id.4.152 (but g. peri\ e)leuqeri/hs Id.1.102 (s. v. l.)); tau=t' h)=n w)=n ma/list' e)gli/xeto D.5.22; g. tou= zh=n Pl.Phd.117a, Charond. ap. Stob.4.2.24; kra/tous Thphr.Char.26.1: c. acc., Hp.Ep.17 (dub.), Pl.Hipparch.
226e: folld. by a relat. clause, glixo/meqa th\n ma=zan i(/na leukh\ parh=| Alex.141.7; w(s strathgh/seis gli/xeai how thou shalt become general, Hdt.7.161: c. inf., w(=n e)gli/xonto mh\ a(/yasqai Th.8.15; ei)de/nai Pl.Grg. 489d; le/gein D.6.11; a)posterh=sai Id.18.207; zh=n Antiph.86.3; qigei=n Phld.D.3.1.—Not in Ep. or Trag. (gli^-: gli/xwn [i_] is f.l. for glh/xwn in Hdn. Gr.1.37.)
glixo/s, = gli/sxros 2, Hsch.; also, = peri/ergos, Id.:—fem. glixw/, similarly expld. by EM234.26; = feidwli/a, Zonar.
glixu/ths: a)tuxh\s h)\ e)pi/ponos h)\ e)rwtikh/, Hsch., cf. EM234.25.
glohro\n xalkou=n, dub. sens. in IG2.716b6.

gloi/a or gloia/, h(, = gli/a,
glue, Hsch.

gloia/zw,
wink, twinkle with the eyes, Hp. ap. Gal.19.91, EM234.45.

gloia/s, a/dos, h(,
vicious, of mares, S.Fr.1037:—masc. gloi/hs, htos, of horses, Hdn. Gr.2.680; also of persons,
slippery, shifty, EM 234.44.

gloio/-omai,
become sticky, Dsc.5.79.
gloio-poie/omai, = foreg., Id.Eup.1.2.

gloio-po/tis, idos, h(,
sucking up grease, xlamu/s AP6.282 (Theodor.).

gloio/s, o(,
any glutinous substance, gum, Hdt.3.112; o( glisxro/tatos g. Arist.Mir.844a14, cf. Sor.2.11, Gp.20.13, POxy.1220.16 (iii A. D.; gluou= Pap.); esp.
oil and dirt scraped off the wrestler's skin with the stleggi/s, Sch.Ar.Nu.449: generally,
oily sediment in baths, Semon.8, Telesp.41H.; g. paidiko/s substitute for butter in ointments, Hippiatr.69. as Adj. gloio/s, a/, o/n,
slippery, knavish, Ar.Nu. l.c. = nwqro/s, a)sqenh/s, Hsch. Adv. -w=s, = nustaktikw=s, Id.
thick, palli/olon CPR27.9 (ii A. D.). (For gloi-vo/s, cf. gli/a, gli/nh, etc., Lat.
glūs, glūten.）

gloiw/dhs, es,
glutinous, Pl.Cra.427b, Arist.Fr.311 (glin- codd. Ath.); to\ g. Thphr.HP5.4.1. Adv. gloio-dw=s Sor.2.13, Gal.19.91.
full of oily sediment, u(/dwr M.Ant.8.24.

glouro/s, ou=, o(,
gold, AP15.25.7 (Besant.), Hsch.:—hence glou/rea: xru/sea (Phryg.), Id.

glou/tia, ta/,
medullary tubercles near the pineal gland of the brain, Gal.UP8.14.
the great trochanter, Id.2.773.

glouto/s, o(,
buttock, g. decio/s Il.5.66, cf. Hp.Fract.13, Arist.HA 493a23: pl., Il.8.340, Hdt.4.9: dual, tw\ gloutw/ X.Eq.7.2: heterocl. pl., glouta/, ta/, Sch.Theoc.6.30. = sfai/rwma th=s kotu/lhs, Hsch. (Cf. Skt.
glaús 'round lump', Engl.
clot.）

glu^k-a/dion, to/,
sweetmeat, Hsch.
vinegar, Orusap.EM626.58, Choerob.Rh.p.251S.

glu^k-a/zw,
sweeten, th\n kata/posin Epict. Gnom.22;
affect with a sensation of sweetness, tou\s u(giai/nontas S.E. P.1.211:—Pass.,
receive a taste of sweetness, Hierocl.p.29A., S.E. P.1.20; but,
taste sweet, Gp.2.39.4, and so intr. in Act. of wine, Ath. 1.26c; me/li gluka/zon LXX Ez.3.3, cf. Plot.4.3.26.

glu^k-ai/nw, fut. glu^k-a^nw= LXX Si.12.16: aor. e)glu/ka_na D.L.8.70:—
sweeten, LXX Si.27.23; opp. pikrai/nw, D.L. l.c.;
affect with a sensation of sweetness, th\n a)koh/n D.H. Comp.15: abs.,
produce an effect of sweetness, in Music, Aristox.Harm.p.23 M.:—more freq. in Pass., fut. glukanqh/somai LXX Si.49.1: aor. e)gluka/nqhn Hp.Morb.3.17, Mosch.3.110: pf. geglu/kasmai Ath.9.384d, but a)p-egl. Diph.Siph.ib.2.55f:—
to be sweetened, turn sweet, Hp.
Aër.8, Arist.Ph.244b23;
to be affected with a sensation of sweetness, D.H.Comp.12, Ph.1.121.
glu^k-a/nison, to/, = a)/nison ( = a)/nhqon), Sch.Theoc.7.63.

glu^/k-ansis, ews, h(,
sweetening, Thphr.CP 4.4.5.

glu^k-antiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for sweetening, Ocell.1.9. Adv. -kw=s S.E.M.7.344; g. diati/qesqai ib.367.
glu^k-ei/dion, to/, Dim. of gluku/s 11, BGU417.18 (ii/iii A. D.).
glu^/k-eios, a, on, = gluku/s, th=s . . ou)/ti glukeio/teron IG14.1935.

glu^k-e/laion, to/,
sweet oil, Xenocr.55, Sammelb.5747.8 (glukue/l-), Gal.14.793.
glu^k-ero/s, a/, o/n, = gluku/s, Od.14.194, 17.41, Pi.P.4.32, E.Med.1099 (anap.), Arist. PA677a23; opp. w)fe/limos, Crates Theb.10.5: Comp. -w/teros Od.9.28, Them.Or.21.262c.

glu^kero-sta/fu^los [a^], on,
with sweet grapes, Opp.C.1.465.

glu^kero/-xrws, wtos, o(, h(,
with sweet skin, AP7.207 (Mel.).
glukh/: bota/nh tis e)dw/dimos, Hsch. (Perh., = sq.)
glu^kh/raton, to/, = gluku/rriza, Ps. Dsc.3.5.

glu^k-i/zw,
treat with sweetmeats, tou\s poli/tas IG7.190.17 (Pagae). intr.,
have a sweet flavour, o)/cos -i/zon Gp.6.15.1, cf. 5.26.10:—also in Pass.,
become sweet, form lead acetate, Zos.Alch. p.248B.

glu^k-i/nas, ou, o(, in Crete,
cake made with sweet wine, Seleuc. ap.Ath.14.645d, Hsch.

glu^/k-ios, a, on,
sugary, sickly, Arist.EE1238a28; v.l. for *lu/kion in S.Ph.1461.

glu^k-ismo/s, o(,
distribution of sweetmeats or
sweet wine, Callix.2, Inscr.Prien.108.257 (ii B. C.), IG7.2712.68 (Acraeph.).
glu/kka, = gluku/ths, and glukko/s: gluku/s, Hsch.
glu^ko/eis, essa, en, = gluku/s, poto/n Nic.Al.444.

glu^ku/-dakrus, u,
shedding sweet tears, *)/erws AP7.419 (Mel.), 12.167 (Id.).

glu^ku-derkh/s, e/s,
with a sweet glance, Hsch., Cyr.
glu^ku/-dion, to/, = glukei/dion, PLond.2.239.13 (iv A. D.: -oi/dion Pap.).

glu^ku-dro/mos, on,
faring pleasantly, *neilw=tai Lyr.Alex.Adesp.32.3.

glu^ku/-dwros, on,
with sweet gifts, *kleiw/ B.3.3; *ni/ka Id.10.1; *)/erws AP5.21 (Rufin.). g. a)/galma
sweet gift brought in thy honour, B. 5.4.

glu^ku-hxh/s, Dor. glu^ku-a_xh/s, e/s,
sweet-voiced, AP9.26 (Antip. Thess.).

glu^ku-qu_me/w,
to be pleasant, Hierocl. in CA26p.479M.

glu^ku-qu_mi/a, h(,
sweetness of mind, g. pro\s ta\s h(dona/s
readiness to indulge . . , opp. to\ karterei=n, Pl.Lg.635c, cf. Plu.2.476d.
kindly disposition, Id.Them.10, Id.2.970b; pro/s tina Sammelb.4630.8 (ii A. D.).
pleasantness, Iamb.Myst.5.11.

glu^ku/-qu_mos, on,
sweet of mood, Il.20.467; of the Epicureans, Luc.Herm.16. Act.,
charming the mind, delightful, e)/rws, u(/pnos, Ar.Lys.551, Nu.705.

glu^ku-ka/la^mon [ka^], to/,
scented lotus, Zonar.

glu^ku-karpe/w,
bear sweet fruit, Thphr.CP2.3.7.

glu^ku/-karpos, on,
bearing sweet fruit, a)/mpelos Theoc. 11.46, cf.Corn.ND14.

glu^ku/-kreos, on,
of sweet flesh, kogxu/lion Sophr. 24.
glu^ku/-la^los, on, = sq., Cat.Cod.Astr.2.209.

glu^ku/-logos, on,
sweet-speaking, Sch.E.Hec.134.

glu^ku-mari/des, ai(, a kind of
cockle, Xenocr. 60,61, prob. in Gal.13.174.

glu^ku-mh/xa^nos, Dor. glu^ku-ma/xa^nos, on,
having pleasant devices, Pi.Pae.2.80.

glu^ku-mei/li^xos, on,
sweetly winning, h.Hom.5.19.
glukumh/, = gluku/rriza, Hp. ap. Gal.19.91.

glu^ku/-mhlon [ku^], Aeol. and Dor. glu^ku/-ma_lon, to/, = meli/mhlon,
sweet-apple, Sapph.93, Call.Cer.29, Dsc.1.115, Orib.5.31.3; as a term of endearment, Theoc.11.39.

glu^ku-mu_qe/w,
speak sweetly, AP 12.122 (Mel.).

glu^ku/-mu_qos, on,
sweetly-spoken, e)/pos ib.5.194 (Id.).
glu^ku/-nous, oun, gen. ou, = gluku/qumos, Polem.Phgn.22.

glu^ku/-pais, paidos, o(, h(,
full of sweet boys, *(ro/dos AP12.52 (Mel.).

glu^ku-pa/rqenos, h(,
sweet maid, in pl., *(=wrai ib.9.16 (Id.).

glu^ku/-pi_kros, on,
sweetly bitter, *)/eros . . g. o)/rpeton Sapph.40, cf. AP5.133 (Posid.), 12.109 (Mel.), Plu.2.681b; of news, 'a gilded pill', Cic.Att.5.21.4; h(donh/ Ph.1.678: later in literal sense, Gal.11.586.

glu^ku-po/ths, ou, o( （gluko-codd.),
drinker of sweetwine, Philagr. ap. Orib.5.19.6.

glu^ku-pra/tion [a_], to/,
shop where sweetmeats are sold, Gloss.:—also glukeopra/ths (sic), ou, o(,
dealer in sweetmeats, ib.

glu^ku/-pu_ros, o(, a kind of
wheat, BGU1067.16 (ii A. D.).

glu^ku/-rri_za, h(,
sweet-root, i. e.
liquorice, Glycyrrhiza glabra, Dsc.3.5, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.24.4:—also glu^ku/-rrizon, to/, Gp.7.24.4, and glu^ku/-rrizos, h(, Hsch.

glu^ku/s, ei=a （-h=a Herod.4.2), u/ （-u/n IG14.1890),
sweet to the taste or
smell, ne/ktar Il.1.598; oi)=nos Epich.124, etc.; gluku\ o)/zein Cratin.Jun. 1, prob. in Crates Com.2; opp. o)cu/s, Hp.Vict.2.55; opp. drimu/s, Plu. 2.708e: mostly metaph., even in Hom.,
pleasant, delightful, i(/meros, u(/pnos, Il.3.139, Od.2.395; g. ai)w/n 5.152, Hdt.7.46; po/lemos gluki/wn ge/net' h)e\ ne/esqai Il.2.453; ou)de\n glu/kion h(=s patri/dos ou)de\ tokh/wn Od.9.34, cf. Pi.N.5.2, E.Med.1036, etc.; gluku/ [e)sti], c. inf., A.Pr.698, Alex. 210; qanei=n glu/kiston B.3.47; o(/tw| . . mhde\n h)=n i)dei=n gluku/ S.OT1335 (lyr.), cf.1390. of water,
sweet, fresh, Xenoph.1.8, etc.; opp. pikro/s, Hdt.4.52; opp. a(lmuro/s, Arist.Mete.355a33, etc. after Hom. (but v. supr.), of persons,
sweet, dear, glukei=a (v.l. -h=a） ma=ter Sapph. 90; glukei=ai pai=des a)rxai/ou *sko/tou S.OC106: c. inf., g. frh\n sumpo/taisin o(milei=n Pi.P.6.52; freq. in epitaphs, IG14.1472 (Sup.), etc.; also u(pe\r th=s glukuta/ths patri/dos teleuth=sai POxy.33i13 (ii A. D.); w)= gluku/tate
my dear fellow, Ar.Ach.462, cf. Ec.124; sts. in bad sense,
simple, silly, w(s g. ei)=! Pl.Hp.Ma.288b; also applied kat' a)nti/frasin to a swine, Gal.18(2).611; gluku\ pnei=on, of mustard, Matro Conv.90. as Subst., o( g. (sc. oi)=nos)
grape-syrup, Alex. 59, 172.14, Arist.Pr.875b2, Herod.6.77, POxy.1088.51; also to\ g. Nic.Al.386, POxy.234ii6 (ii/iii A. D.). of the eye of Polyphemus, Theoc.6.22. h( g., = gluku/rriza, Thphr.HP9.13.2. h( g., = xolh/, Sch.Nic. Th.594. Comp. and Sup. gluki/wn Od.9.34; glu/kistos B.3.47, Ael.NA12.46, etc.; also gluku/teros, -tatos Pi.O.1.109, 19, etc.; glu/sswn Xenoph.38.2. Adv. -ke/ws Poll.4.24. (Perh. fr. *dluku/s, cf. Lat.
dulcis.）

glu^ku^si/dh [i_], h(,
peony (g. a)/rrhn, =
Paeonia officinalis, g. qh/leia, =
P. corallina, Dsc.3.140), Hp.Superf.33, Mul.2.136, Pl.Com.61, Thphr.HP9.8.6.

glu/kusma, atos, to/,
sweetness, Lib.Descr.30.15.
sweetmeat, Sch.Ar.Pl.660.

glu^ku/strufnos, on,
sweet with an astringent taste, Thphr.HP9.20.5.

glu^ku/ths, htos, h(,
sweetness of taste, Hdt.4.177, Thphr.CP6.9.4; u(da/twn D.S.4.84, cf. Arr.Peripl.M.Eux.49.
sweetness, pleasantness, g. fusikh/, of life, Arist.Pol.1278b30; th=s le/cews D.H.Comp.11; me/los kai\ g. Phld.Mus.p.49K.; of persons, Plu.2.67b: in pl.,
delights, e)piqumi/ai ponhrai\ kai\ gluku/thtes Phld.Lib.p.61 O.

glu^ku^-fa^gi/a, h(,
the use of sweet food, Alex.Trall.1.15.
glu^ku^/-faion, = e)ruqro/danon (Cret.), Hsch.

glu^ku^/-fqoggos, on,
sweet-toned, Sch. Pi.O.6.162.

glu^ku^/-frouroi, oi(,
those who love staying at home, Hsch.
glu^ku^/-fullon, to/, dub. in Gal.19.730.
glu^ku^/-fu^ton, to/, = gluku/rriza, Ps.-Dsc.3.5.

glu^ku^-fwge/w,
speak sweetly, Theoc.15.146 (sed leg. gluku\ fwnei=).

glu^ku^-fwni/a, h(,
sweet voice or
speech, D.S.3.69, Heraclit.Incred.14.

glu^ku^/-fwnos, on,
sweet-voiced, sweet-sounding, Sch.Pi.O.4.4; rejected by Poll.2.113.

glu^ku^/-xu_los, on,
with sweet juices, Hp.Ep.16, Xenoc.24,30.
glu^ku^/-xu_mos, on, = foreg., Gal.11.494; di/aita Paul.Aeg.2.15:—Subst. glu^ku^-xu_mi/a, h(, Gal.14.749.

glu/kwn, wnos, o(,
sweet one: w)= glu/kwn
you dear sílly creature! Ar. Ec.985.
*glu^kw/neios, a, on, Glyconic, a kind of verse, so called from its inventor Glycon, Heph.10.2, Sch.Metr.Pi.O.1, etc.
glumo/s, o(, prob. misspelt for gigglumo/s, IG11(2).142.49 (Delos, iv B. C.).

glu/cis, ews, h(,
sweet insipid wine, Phryn. Com.65, Polyzel.12 (pl.), cf. Ath.1.31e:—also written gleu=cis in Hsch.

glupt-h/r, h=ros, o(, (glu/fw)
graving tool, chisel, AP6.68 (Jul.).

glu/pt-hs, Dor. glu/pt-as, ou, o(,
carver, sculptor, APl.4.142, 145.

glupt-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of engraving, gluptikh\ sfragi/dwn (sc. te/xnh) Poll.7.209.

glupto/s, h/, o/n,
fit for carving, of wood or stone, Thphr.Lap.5.
carved, lu/gdou g. AP5.193 (Posidipp. or Ascl.); g. o(moi/wma LXX De. 4.25; pro/soyis Iamb.Protr.21.kg/; glupto/n, to/,
carved image, LXX Is.44.10,al.: but glupta/, ta/,
quarries, ib.Jd.3.19.

glu/f-a^nos [u^], o(, （glu/fw)
tool for carving, knife, chisel, h.Merc.41, Theoc.1.28; g. kala/mou pen-
knife, AP6.63 (Damoch.).
gluf-ei=on, to/, = glu/fanos, Luc.Somn.13.

gluf-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
carver, J.AJ8.5.2, IG5(1).209 (Sparta); sfrhgi/dwn Man.6.344 (pl.).

gluf-euth/s, ou=, o(,
stone-mason or
sculptor, PMasp.147.8 (vi A. D.).

gluf-h/, h(,
carving: carved work, D.S.5.44, CPHerm.127 (iii A. D.); g. th=| sfragi=di poiei=n its
emblem, device, Plu.2.985b, cf. Iamb.Protr.21.kg/; *dhmhtri/ou g.
the work of D., under a carving, IG5(1).540 (Mistrá), cf. CIG4558 (Acre).
hole cut in a beam, Anon. ap. Suid. v. kainoprepe/s.

gluf-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for carving: glufikh/ (sc. te/xnh) Epigr.Gr. 841 (Thrace).

gluf-i/s, i/dos, h(, in early writers always pl. glufi/des (but sg., opp. a)ki/s, of the constellation Sagitta, Hipparch.2.5.12),
notched end of the arrow, e(/lke d' o(mou= glufi/das te labw\n kai\ neu=ra Il. 4.122; e(/lken neurh\n glufi/das te Od.21.419; glufi/des me/ssh| e)gka/tqeto neurh=| A.R.3.282; but perh. of
notches or
grooves for the fingers, para\ ta\s glufi/das perieili/cantes kai\ pterw/dantes to\ bubli/on Hdt.8.128, cf. Aen.Tact.31.26; to/cwn pterwtai\ glufi/des, poet. for
the arrow itself, E.Or.274, cf. AP5.57 (Arch., sg.): also in pl.,
notches in the arrow-head, Paul.Aeg.6.88.
pen-knife, AP6.62 (Phil.), 64 (Paul. Sil., pl.).
chisel, J.BJ5.5.2. in Architecture,
capitals of columns, qrigko\s . . lai/+neos xalke/h|sin e)pi\ glufi/dessin a)rh/rei A.R.3.218, cf. Sch. adloc., EM235.13. in pl., = qala/mai, Hsch.

glu/fw [u^], fut. glu/yw LXX Ex.28.9: aor. e)/gluya Str.9.2.25:— Med., aor. e)gluya/mhn Theoc.Ep.8, Plu.2.806d:—Pass., aor. 1 part. glufqe/n AP6.229 (Crin.), but aor. 2 glufe/n [u^] App.Anth.3.79 (Posidipp.), Ps.-Callisth.3.22, (dia-) Ael.VH14.7: pf. ge/glummai AP9.752 (Ascl. or Antip. Thess.), Pl.Smp.216d, (e)g-) Hdt.2.106, but e)c-e/gl- Eup.331, Pl.R.616d:—
carve, cut out with a knife, nau=s t' e)/glufen Ar.Nu.879; g. sfrhgi=das
engrave them, Hdt.7.69, cf. Pl. Hp.Mi.368c; of sculptors, opp. gra/fw, Hdt.2.46, Str.l.c.; e)/gluye/n me si/dhros, written under a statue, IG14.973:—Med.,
cause to be engraved, Theoc.l.c., Plu. l.c.
note down or
write [on waxen tablets], to/kous AP11.289 (Pall.). Pass.,
to be hatched, e(/ws glufh=nai ta\ w)a/ Antig.Mir.97. (Cf. Lat.
glūbo 'peel',
glūma 'husk', OHG.
klioban 'cleave'.)
glw/nh: ou)deno\s a)/cion, Hsch.

glw/c, h(, only pl. glw=xes,
beard of corn, Hes.Sc.398. (Cf. glwxi/n.)
glwrei=n: xroni/zein, Hsch. glwro/n: nomo/n, Id.

glw=ssa, Ion. gla/ssa, Herod.3.84, al., SIG1002.7 (Milet.), Schwyzer 692 (Chios), Att. glw=tta, hs, h(,
tongue, Od.3.332, etc. g. la/ruggos, = glwtti/s,
larynx, Gal.UP7.13.
tongue, as the organ of speech, glw/sshs xa/rin through love
of talking, Hes.Op.709, A.Ch. 266; glw/ssh| matai/a| Id.Pr.331, cf.Eu.830; glw/sshs a)krath/s Id.Pr.884 (lyr.); mega/lhs g. ko/mpoi S.Ant.128; glw/ssh| deino/s, qrasu/s, Id.OC806, Aj.1142; h( g. o)mw/mox' h( de\ frh\n a)nw/motos E.Hipp.612: with Preps., a)po\ glw/sshs by
frankness of speech, Thgn.63; fqe/ggesqai Pi.O.6.13 (but a)po\ g. lhi/ssetai, opp. xersi\ bi/h|, of fraud opp. violence, Hes. Op.322); also, by
word of mouth, Hdt.1.123, Th.7.10, Arr.An.2.14.1; tw=| nw=| q' o(moi/ws ka)po\ th=s g. le/gw S.OC936; ta\ glw/sshs a)/po, i.e.
our words, E.Ba.1049; a)po\ g. fra/sw by
heart, opp. gra/mmasin, Cratin.122; ou)k a)po\ glw/sshs not from
mere word of mouth, but after full argument, A.Ag.813; mh\ dia\ glw/sshs without using
the tongue, E.Supp.112; e)n o)/mmasin . . dedorkw\s kou) kata\ glw=ssan klu/wn S.Tr. 747:—phrases: pa=san glw=ttan basa/nize try every
art of tongue, Ar. V.547; pa=san i(e/nai glw=ssan let loose one's whole
tongue, speak withoutrestraint, S.El.596; pollh\n g. e)gxe/as ma/thn Id.Fr.929; kaka\ g. slander, Pi.P.4.283: pl., e)n kertomi/ois glw/ssais, i.e. with blasphemies, S.Ant.962 (lyr.), cf.Aj.199 (lyr.): bou=s, k h=|s e)pi\ glw/ssh|, v. bou=s, klei/s. of persons,
one who is all tongue, speaker, of Pericles, megi/sth g. tw=n *(ellhni/dwn Cratin.293, cf. Ar.Fr.629 (s. v. l.). h( g. tou= tamiei/ou the
advocacy of the fiscus, Philostr. VS2.29.
language, a)/llh d' a)/llwn g. memigme/nh Od.19.175, cf. Il.2.804; glw=ssan i(e/nai speak a
language or
dialect, Hdt.1.57; g. *(ellhni/da, *dwri/da i(e/nai, Id.9.16, Th.3.112, cf. A.Pers.406, Ch.564; glw=ssan nomi/zein Hdt.1.142, 4.183; glw/ssh| xrh=sqai Id.4.109; kata\ th\n a)rxai/an g. Arist.Rh.1357b10;
dialect, h( *)attikh\ g. Demetr.Eloc.177; but also *dwri\s dia/lektos mi/a u(f' h(/n ei)si g. pollai/ Tryph. ap. Sch.D.T.p.320 H.
obsolete or
foreign word, which needs explanation, Arist. Rh.1410b12, Po.1457b4, Plu.2.406f: hence *glw=ssai, title of works by Philemon and others.
people speaking a distinct language, LXX.Ju.3.8 (pl.), interpol. in Scyl.15.
anything shaped like the tongue (cf. glw=ssai w(sei\ puro/s Act.Ap.2.3). in Music,
rced or
tongue of a pipe, Aeschin.3.229, Arist.HA565a24, Thphr.HP4.11.4, etc.
tongue or
thong of leather, shoe-latchet, Pl.Com.51, Aeschin.Socr.57.
tongue of land, App.Pun.121, cf. 95.
ingot, g. xrush= LXX Jo.7.21.
marking on the liver, in divination, Hsch. (glw=ssa from glwx-
y[acaron], cf. glw/c, glwxi/s; gla/ssa from *gla^x-
y[acaron], weak grade of same root.)
glwss-alge/w or (by dissimilation)

glwss-arge/w,
talk till one's tongue aches, Poll.4.185.

glwss-algi/a, h(,
endless talking, wordiness, E.Med. 525, Andr.689, Ph.2.165; but glwttargi/a,
idleness of the tongue, siwph\n kai\ g. h(mi=n e)piba/llei Luc.Lex.19.

glwss-a/omai, pf. part. geglwssame/nos,
tuneful, sto/ma kakkabi/dwn prob. in Alcm.25.

glwss-a/rion, to/, Dim. of glw=ssa, Dsc.3.144, Gal.12.149. kind of
spoon or
spatula, BGU162.2 (ii/iii A. D.).

glw/ss-aspis, idos, o(,
one who uses his tongue as his shield and defence, EM235.39.

glw/ss-hma, atos, to/, = glw=ssa 11.2, Quint.Inst.1.8.15, M.Ant.4.33.
tongue or
point of a dart, A.Fr.152.

glwss-hmatiko/s, h/, o/n, (glw=ssa 11.2)
interlarded with glw=ssai, le/cis, fra/sis, D.H.Amm.2.2, Th.50, etc. Adv. -kw=s Tim.Lex.Praef.
glwss-i/dion, Att. glwtt-, to/, Dim. of glw=ssa, Zen.5.65 (pl.). Dim. of glwtti/s 11, Porph.in Harm.p.273.

glwss-i/dos, h(,
inflammation of the tongue, in horses, Hippiatr.130.

glwsso-ga/stwr, oros, o(, h(,
living by one's tongue, Com. ap. Poll.2.108.

glwsso-gra/fos [a^], on,
writer on glw=ssai, Str.13.1.19, Ath. 3.114b, 15.699e, Gal.19.106.
glwsso-eidh/s, e/s, v. glwtt-.

glwsso-ka/toxon, to/,
tongue-depressor, Heliod. ap. Orib.44.14.13.

glwsso-khlo/kompos, on,
soothing with boastful tongue, Com.Adesp.86.

glwsso/-komos, o(,
sarcophagus, BSA17.235 (Pamphylia).
surgical instrument, used for reducing fractures and dislocations, Heliod. ap. Orib.49.20.
box-splint, Gal.10.442, UP7.14.
pudenda muliebria, Eub.142.

glwsso-poii/+a, h(,
making of mouth-pieces (glw=ssa 111.1), and glwsso-poio/s, o/n,
making them, Poll.2.108, 7.153.

glwsso-pwgw/nion, to/,
half a head with the tongue, POxy. 108.14 (ii/iii A. D.).

glwsso/s, h/, o/n,
talking, chattering, Hdn.Gr.1.208.
glwsso-strofei=n: perilalei=n kai\ stwmu/llesqai, Hsch.

glwsso-te/xnhs, ou, o(,
tongue-artificer, opp. xeirote/xnhs, D.Chr.7.124 (pl.).

glwsso/-tmhtos, on,
with the tongue cut out, LXX Le.22.22.

glwsso-tome/w,
cut out the tongue, ib.2 Ma.7.4:—Pass., Plu.2.849b.

glwsso-xa^ri^te/w, = xaritoglwsse/w,
flatter, LXX Pr.28.23.

glwssw/dhs, es, = glwssoeidh/s:
talkative, babbling, LXX Ps.139 (140).11, Sext.Sent.13M.
glw=tta, h(, Att. for glw=ssa.
glwtth/n, dub. in Pl.Com.239: perh. f.l. for glwtt<ode/y>hn.

glwtt-i/zw,
kiss lasciviously, bill, AP5.128 (Autom.).

glwtt-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of the tongue, to\ g. (sc. o)/rganon) Arist.PA683a21.

glwtt-i/s, i/dos, h(,
glottis, mouth of the windpipe, Gal.UP7.13, al.
mouthpiece of a pipe, in which the reed was inserted, Luc.Harm.1, Theo Sm.p.61 H.; of a trumpet, Hero Spir.1.16.
shoe-string, Phryn.208;
latchet, Lyd.Mag.2.13. a bird, perh.
landrail, Arist.HA597b16.

glwtt-ismo/s, o(,
lascivious kiss, AP5.131 (Philod., pl.).

glwtto-deye/w, = Lat.
fellare, Com.Adesp.32 D.

glwtto-eidh/s, e/s,
tongue-shaped, Arist.HA528b30; glwss-, v.l. in Dsc.4.88.
glwtto-poie/w, = glwttodeye/w, Ar.V.1283.

glwtto-strofe/w,
ply the tongue, Ar.Nu.792.

glwxi/n [i_] or glwxi/s (cf. Hdn.Gr.2.431, 437), h(, gen. i=nos:—
projecting point: hence,
end of the yoke-strap, Il.24.274.
barb of an arrow, S.Tr.681, cf. Sch.adloc., Gal.5.548;
point of a penknife, AP6.63 (Damoch.); triai/nhs Nonn.D.36.111; kerai/as ib. 1.193; of the moon's horns, ib.40.314. Pythagorean name for
an angle, Hero
*Deff.15.
extremity, puma/th g. D.P.184;
inlet, qala/tths g. Agath.5.22.
stigma of saffron, Gp.11.261.

glwxi_nwto/s, h/, o/n,
barbed, be/lh Paul.Aeg.6.88.

gnaq-mo/s, o(,
jaw, poet. form of sq., Il.17.617, al.: also in pl., Od. 18.29; gnaqmoi=s a)dh/lois farma/kwn E.Med.1201; for a)llotri/ois
gnaq- moi=si gela=n, v. a)llo/trios; also gnaqmo/n: tomw/taton kai\ ai(retikw/taton, Hsch.

gna/q-os [a^], h(,
jaw, Prose form of gnaqmo/s, also freq. in Poets, g. i(ppei/h Hom.Epigr.14.13; h( a)/nw, h( ka/tw g., Hp.Art.30, cf. Hdt. 2.68; kai\ g. kai\ to\ a)/nw th=s g. (where gna/qos, =
lower jaw) Id.9.83; e)/page gna/qon take your
teeth to it! Ar.V.370; gna/qou dou=los a greedy fellow, E.Fr.282.5; also o)/nou g. Eup.434: freq. in pl., Pl.Phdr. 254e, Arist.PA664a11.
cheek, in pl., Hp.VM19, Gal.2.424, etc.; ta\s g. fusw=n D.19.314, cf. Ruf.Onom.47, Gal.18(1).423. metaph., potamoi\ puro\s da/ptontes a)gri/ais gna/qois A.Pr.370, cf. Ch. 280; also traxei=a po/ntou *salmudhssi/a g., of jagged rocks, Id.Pr. 726.
point of a wedge, ib.64.

gnaq-o/w,
hit on the cheek, Phryn.Com.28.

gna/q-wn, wnos, o(,
full-mouth, pr. n. of a parasite, Plu.2.707e, Longus4.16:—also *gnaqwna/rion, ibid.: *gnaqwni/dhs Luc.Tim.45.

gnaq-w/neios, on,
like a *gna/qwn, Plu.2.707e.

gnamp-th/r, h=ros, o(,
jaw, i)obo/lwn Androm. ap. Gal.14.36.

gnamp-to/s, h/, o/n,
curved, bent, i)xqua/askon gnamptoi=s a)gki/stroisin Od.4.369; meta\ gnampth=| si ge/nussin Il.11.416; po/rpas te gnampta/s q' e(/likas 18.401; o)/nuxes g. Hes.Op.204; g. dro/moi, of the diaulos, Pi.I.1.57; g. xalinou/s, Hsch.
supple, pliant, of the limbs of living men (opp. to the stark and stiff ones of the dead), e)ni\ gnamptoi=si me/lessi Il.11.669, 24.359, Od.11.394, etc. metaph.,
pliable, ou)/te no/hma gnampto\n e)ni\ sth/qessi (of Achilles), Il.24.41.

gna/mp-tw (in codd. freq. kna/mptw), fut. -yw A.Pr.995,
Paean Oxy.660.8, Lyc.1247: aor. e)/gnamya, Ep. gna/mya A.R.2.965:—poet. form of ka/mptw used by Hom. only in compds. in tmesi, e)n de\ go/nu gna/myen Il.23.731; g. tina/
bend his will, A.l.c.; no/on Orph.L.195; in literal sense, do/ru g. Lyc. l.c.; a)/krhn
round a headland, A.R.l.c., al.:—Pass., Nic.Th.423, Plu.Arat.13.

gnamfai/, = gna/qoi, Hsch. gna/myis, ews, h(,
bending, EM235.55.

gna

tai\ a)ktai/, curving beach, Hsch.; gnapta\s e(/likas: ta\ kamfqe/nta felli/a, Id.; cf. gnampto/s. gna/ptw, = gna/mptw, Id.
gna/ptwr, oros, o(, = gnafeu/s, Man.4.422.
gna/-falon or gna/-fallon, gna-fei=on, gna-feu/s, gna-feutiko/s, gna-feu/w, gna-fiko/s, gna/-fissa, gna/-fos, gna/-fw, v. kn-.
gna^fa/dion, to/, = sq., Hsch.

gna^fa/llion, to/,
cotton-weed, Diotis maritima, Dsc.3.117, Plin. HN27.88:—also gna^falli/s, i/dos, h(, Ps.-Dsc.3.117.

gna/fallon [a^], to/,
flock of wool, Jahresh.14 Beibl.52, PMagd.8.7 (iii B. C.):—hence Subst. gnafallolo/gos, o(,
flock-picker, Ostr.1081; more freq. by haplology gnafallo/gos, ib.1082, 1086, PPetr.2Intr. p.44 (iii B. C.).

gna/falos, o(, an unknown
bird, Arist.HA616b16.

gna/yis, ews, h(,
dressing of cloth, Pl.Plt.282e, Sch.Ar.Pl.166.

gnh/si-os, a, on, (ge/nos)
belonging to the race, i. e.
lawfully begotten, born in wedlock, no/qon kai\ gnh/sion Il.11.102, cf. Od.14.202, Hdt.3.2, Leg.Gort.10.41, Ar.Av.1665, And.1.127, D.44.49, etc.; pai/dwn e)p' a)ro/tw| gnhsi/wn Men.Pk.435; a)delfo/s Ar.Av.1659; no/qos . . gnhsi/ois i)/sws sqe/nei S.Fr.87; fronou=nta gnh/sia E.Hipp.309; g. fro/nhma S.Fr. 307. generally,
genuine, legitimate, fi/los Phoc.2 A; g. gunai=kes
lawful wives, opp. pallaki/des, X.Cyr.4.3.1; poli=tai Arist.Pol.1278a30, cf. 1319b9; g. th=s *(ella/dos
true Greeks, D.9.30; a)kousth/s D.H. Isoc.18 (Sup.); mh/thr tw=n e)rwtikw=n lo/gwn, of Aphrodite, Luc.Am.19; g. a)retai/
real, unfeigned virtues, Pi.O.2.11; g. u(/mnoi
inspired song, B.8.83; of fevers, g. tritai=os a
genuine tertian, Hp.Prog.24; g. o)/cos
genuine vinegar, Eub.65; of writings,
genuine, Gal.15.748, Harp. s.v. *)alkibia/dhs. Adv. -i/ws
genuinely, truly, E.Alc.678, Lys. 2.76, D.Ep. 3.32, etc.; g. fe/rein bear
nobly, Antiph.281, Men.205;
lawfully, toi=s g. sumbiw/sasin Phld.Piet.93. gnh/sia, ta/,
charges on land, g. dhmo/sia PAmh.86.15 (i A. D.), cf. PLond.3.1157.4 (ii A. D.).

gnhsi-o/ths, htos, h(,
legitimate birth, a)p' a)mfoi=n Arist.Rh.1360b35, cf. Phld.Hom. p.50 O.
genuineness, sincerity, meta\ pa/shs g. Poxy.140.16 (vi A. D.).
gni/s: ge/ranos (Tyrrhen.), Hsch.

*gni/fwn, wnos, o(,
niggard, as pr. n., Luc.Vit.Auct.23; prob. in Alciphr.3.34.
gnoi/+sai: gnou=ai, Hsch. gnote/ra, = ballwth/, Ps.-Dsc.3.103. gno/feon: me/lan, Id.; cf. sq.
gnof-i/as, ou, o(, name of a wind, Lyd.Mens.4.119.

gno/f-os, later form for dno/fos,
darkness, Chron.Lind. D.28, Ep.Hebr.12.18, D.Chr. 34.37(pl.), Luc.Peregr.43: pl.,
storm-clouds, Arist.Mu.391b12.

gnof-o/w,
darken, LXX La.2.1.

gnof-w/dhs, es,
dark, gloomy, ib.Pr.7.9, Ph.2.109, Plu.2.949a.

gnu/qos [u^], eos, to/,
pit, Lyc.485: but gnu/qos, o(,
hollow, Hsch.

gnu/c, Adv., (go/nu)
with bent knee, Il., always in phrase gnu\c e)ripw/n falling
on the knee, 5.309,357,al.; later g. h(/menos Arat.921; sfh=len g. e)pio/nta A.R.3.1310; g. e(driow=sai Orac. ap. Zos.2.6: in later Prose, Gal.UP3.15.
gnupeso/n: a)rgo/n, oi( de\ e)/kluton, Hsch.

gnu/petos, on, (go/nu, pi/ptw)
falling on the knee:—hence gnupte/w (leg. gnupete/w),
to be weak, Hsch. gnu/ponti (leg. -ou=nti）: a)sqenou=nti, Id., and gnu/pwn, wnos,
depressed or
weak, Id.
gnufai/: na/pai, Hsch. gnu/wn: nwqrai/nwn, Id.

gnw=ma, atos, to/, (gnw=nai)
mark, token, Hdt.7.52;
test, S. Tr.593; of an ass's teeth, Arist.HA577b3.
opinion, judgement, A. Ag.1352, E.Heracl.407. = Lat.
groma, Suid.

gnwmana/doxos, o(,
surety for performance of a service, PMonac.14.63 (vi A. D.).

gnwma^t-euth/s, ou=, o(,
a dealer in maxims, Sch.Il.10.31.

gnwma^t-eu/w,
discriminate, discern, skia\s g. Pl.R.516e (v. gnwmoneu/w), cf. Philostr. VA2.30, Plot.5.8.11, v.l. in S.E.M.7.332; ta\ bouleu/mata tw=n polemi/wn Agath.1.14; g. ph/xei kai\ me/trw| th\n a)reth/n Them.Or.2.36b: abs.,
exercise discrimination, Plot.5.8.11;
decide, c. acc. et inf., Men. Prot.p.47 D.

gnwmeishghth/s, ou=, o(,
proposer of a motion, BGU362 XV 8 (iii A. D.).

gnw/m-h, h(,
means of knowing: hence,
mark, token, Thgn.60 (pl.); of the teeth (cf. gnw/mwn 111), Arist.HA576b15.
organ by which one perceives or
knows, intelligence,
thought, judgement (th=s yuxh=s h( g. Pl.Lg.672b), e)kmaqei=n yuxh/n te kai\ fro/nhma kai\ g. S. Ant.176: acc. abs., gnw/mhn i(kano/s
intelligent, Hdt.3.4; g. a)gaqo/s, kako/s, S.OT687, Ph.910; toia/de th\n g. Id.El.1021; kata\ g. i)/dris Id.OT1087 (lyr.); gnw/ma| diplo/an qe/to boula/n Pi.N.10.89; gnw/mh| maqei=n ti S.OC403; gnw/mh| kurh/sas Id.OT398; gnw/mh| frenw=n, opp. o)rgh=|, ib. 524; gnw/mhs cu/nesis Th.1.75; gnw/mhs ma=llon e)fo/dw| h)\ i)sxu/os Id.3.11; tai=s g. kai\ toi=s sw/masi sfa/llesqai X. Cyr.1.3.10, cf. Th.1.70; gnw/mh|, opp. tu/xh|, swfronou=ntes Isoc.3.47; gnw/mhs a(/ptesqai affect
the head, of wine or fever, Hp.Acut.63, Fract.11; gnw/mhn e)/xein
understand, S. El.214 (lyr.), Ar.Ach.396; pa/ntwn g. i)/sxein S.Ph.837 (lyr.); prose/xein gnw/mhn give
heed, attend, deu=ro th\n g. prosi/sxete Eup.37; pro\s e(/teron gnw/mhn e)/xein Aeschin. 3.192; to be on one's
guard, Th.1.95; dhlou=n th\n g. e)/n tini to show one's
wit in . . , Id.3.37; e)n gnw/mh| ti parasth=sai D.4.17; a)po\ gnw/mhs fe/rein yh=fon dikai/an with a good
conscience, A.Eu.674; but ou)k a)po\ g. le/geis not without
judgement, with good
sense, S.Tr.389; a)/ter gnw/mhs A.Pr.456; a)/neu g. S.OC594; gnw/mh| kola/zein
with good reason, X.An.2.6.10; gnw/mh| th=| a)ri/sth| (sc. kri/nein or dika/zein)
to the best of
one's judgement, in the dicasts' oath, Arist.Rh. 1375a29; h( kaloume/nh g. tou= e)pieikou=s kri/sis o)rqh/ Id.EN1143a19; so peri\ w(=n a)\n no/moi mh\ w)=si, gnw/mh| th=| dikaiota/th| krinei=n D.20.118; g. th=| d. dika/sein o)mwmo/kasin Id.23.96, cf. 39.40; th=| d. g. Arist.Pol.1287a26; o(/stis gnw/mh| mh\ kaqareu/ei has not a clear
conscience, Ar.Ra. 355.
will, disposition, inclination, eu)sebei= gnw/ma| Pi.O.3.41; g. *dio/s A.Pr.1003; e)n gnw/mh| gegone/nai tini/ to stand
high in his favour, Hdt.6.37; pa/sh| th=| g. with all
one's zeal, Th.6.45; ti/na au)tou\s oi)/esqe g. e(/cein peri\ sfw=n au)tw=n And.1.104; g. e)/. peri/ tina Lys.10.21; pro\s tou\s *)aqhnai/ous th\n g. e)/xein
to be inclined towards . . , Th.5.44; e)mpimpla/nai th\n g. tino/s satisfy his
wishes, X.An.1.7.8, cf. HG6.1.15 (pl.); a)f' e(autou= gnw/mhs on his own
initiative, Th.4.68; e)k mia=s g. of one
accord, with one
consent, D.10.59; mia=| gnw/mh| Th.1.122, 6.17; dia\ mia=s g. gi/gnesqai Isoc.4.139; kata\ gnw/mhn according to one's
mind or
wishes, o(/tan ta)kei= qw= kata\ gnw/mhn e)mh/n E.Andr.737; a)/n ti mh\ kata\ g. e)kbh=| D.1.16: in pl., fi/liai gnw=mai friendly
sentiments, Hdt. 9.4.
judgement, opinion, brotw=n g. Parm.8.61; tau/th| . . th=| gnw/mh| plei=sto/s ei)mi I in cline mostly
to this view, Hdt.7.220 (s. v.l.); also tau/th| plei=stos th\n gnw/mhn ei)mi/ Id.1.120; h( plei/sth g. e)sti/ tini Id.5.126; tle/on fe/rei h( g. tini/ Id.8.100; to\ plei=ston th=s g. ei)=xen . . prosmei=cai Th.3.31; gnw/mhn ti/qesqai Hdt.3.80; ou(/tws th\n g. e)/xein to be of this
opinion, Th.7.15, cf. X.Cyr.6.2.8, Ar.Nu.157; ei)/ tini g. toiau/th pareisth/kei peri\ e)mou= And.1.54; th\n au)th\n g. e)/xein Th.2.55; th=s au)th=s g. ei)=nai, e)/xesqai, Id.1.113, 140; o( au)to\s ei)mi\ th=| g. Id.3.38; kata\ g. th\n e)mh/n in my
judgement or
opinion, Hdt.2.26, 5.3; ellipt., kata/ ge th\n e)mh/n Ar.Ec.153, cf. Plb.18.1.18, D.H.Isoc.3: abs., gnw/mhn e)mh/n Ar.V.983, Pax232; para\ gnw/mhn toi=s *(/ellhsin e)ge/neto contrary to
general opinion, Th.4.40; but para\ g. kinduneutai/
reckless venturers, Id.1.70, cf. 4.19; ei)pe\ mh\ para\ g. e)moi/ either contrary to
my wish, or contrary to
your true opinion, A.Ag.931, cf.Supp.454: freq. of
opinions delivered publicly, e(sta/nai pro\s th\n g. tino/s Th.4.56; *qemistokle/ous gnw/mh|
by the advice of Th., Id.1.90,93; gnw/mhn a)pofai/nein deliver
an opinion, Hdt.1.40; a)podei/knusqai ib.207; e)kfai/nein Id.5.36; ti/qesqai S.Ph.1448 (anap.), Ar.Ec.658; a)pofai/nesqai E.Supp.336; poiei=sqai peri/ tinwn Th.3.36; gnw/mas kate/qento have made up their
minds, Parm.8.53.
verdict, h( tou= dikastou= g. IG4.364 (Corinth, iv A. D.), cf. 685.32 (pl., Cret., ii B. C.).
proposition, motion, gnw/mhn ei)sfe/rein Hdt.3.80,81; ei)pei=n Th.8.68, etc.; (but gnw/mas protiqe/nai hold a debate, Th.3.36); gnw=mai trei=s proeke/ato Hdt.3.83: freq. in Inscrr.,
resolution, IG12.118.28, etc.; g. strathgw=n ib.22.27; *kleiso/fou kai\ s|umpruta/newn ib.1; h( e)kferome/nh g. ib.1051c26; gnw/mhn nika=n carry
a motion, Ar.V.594, Nu.432; kratei=n th=| g. Plu.Cor.17. gnw=mai, ai(,
practical maxims, Heraclit. 78, S.Aj.1091, X.Mem.4.2.9, Arist.Rh.1395a11 (sg., 1394a22). in pl.,
fancies, illusions, S.Aj.52.
intention, purpose, resolve, a)po\ toia=sde gnw/mhs with some such
purpose as this, Th.3.92; gnw/mhn poiei= sqai, c.inf.,
propose to do, Id.1.128; kata\ gnw/mhn of
set purpose, D.H. 6.81 (so also gnw/mhs Lib.Or.33.13, 50.12); ti/na e)/xousa gnw/mhn; with what
purpose? Hdt.3.119; oi)=da d' ou) gnw/mh| ti/ni; with what
intent? S.OT527, cf. Aj.448; h( cu/mpasa g. tw=n lexqe/ntwn the general
purport . . , Th.1.22; h)=n tou= tei/xous h( gnw/mh . . , i(/na . .
the purpose of it was . . , that . . , Id.8.90.

gnwm-hdo/n, Adv. (gnw/mh 111.2)
vote by vote, punqa/nesqai D.H.8.43.

gnwm-hsto/s, o(,
knowledge, a)f' ou(= g. as far as my
memory goes, Hsch. s. h. v.
gnwm-i/dion, to/, Dim. of gnw/mh, Ar. Eq.100, Nu.321, Luc.Par.42.

gnwm-iko/s, h/, o/n,
normative (nisi leg. gnwmonika/）, g. a( fu/sis a( tou= a)riqmou= Philol.11. (gnw/mh 111.3),
dealing in or
suited to maxims, aidactic, peri/odos Hermog.Inv.4.3; ta\ g. S.E.M.1.278; to\ g. D.Chr.52.17; sxh=ma g. Sch. Od.15.74. Adv. -kw=s Phld.Hom.p.15 O., Ath.5.191e.

gnwmo-dote/w,
give advice, IG12(7).p.1 (Amorgos).

gnwmo-loge/w,
speak in maxims, Arist.Rh.1394a21, Rh.Al.1439a3, Plu.2.481b, D.L. 8.78, Procop.Gaz.Ep.21.

gnwmo-loghte/on,
one must speak in maxims, Arist.Rh.Al.1439a3.

gnwmo-logi/a, h(,
sententious style, Pl.Phdr.267c;
theory of maxims, Arist.Rh.1394a19.
collection of maxims, Plu. Cat.Ma.2 (pl.), Suid. *qe/ognis: pl., Plb.12.28.10, D.H.Dem.46, Plu. Fab.1, etc.

gnwmo-logiko/s, h/, o/n,
sententious, ta\s teleuta\s g. poiei=sqai Arist.Rh.Al.1439a5, Demetr.Eloc.9. Adv. -kw=s TheonProg.5.

gnwmon-eu/w,
measure as on a sun-dial, test, v.l. in Pl.R.516e (ap. Tim.Lex.).

gnwmon-iko/s, h/, o/n, (gnw/mwn 1)
judging by rule, X.Mem.4.2.10;
fit to judge of, skilled in a thing, tino/s Pl.R.467c, Iamb.Myst. 3.27. (gnw/mwn 11.2.a)
of or
concerning sun-dials, qewrh/mata Hipparch. 1.9.8, cf. Str.1.1.20: -ko/s, o(,
expert in sun-dials, AP14.139, Gal.5.652, Procl.Hyp.5.54: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh),
the art of making them, Vitr.1.3. Adv. -kw=s Str.2.1.35.
forming a gnw/mwn (11.2. c), tri/gwna Iamb. in Nic.p.71 P. Adv. -kw=s ib.p.77 P.

gnwmo/n-ion, to/, Dim. of gnw/mwn 11.2. a,
pointer or
dial-hand, Hero Dioptr.5, Procl.Hyp.3.26 (pl.).

gnwmo-su/nh, h(,
prudence, judgement, Sol.16.

gnwmo-tu^pe/w,
coin maxims, Ar.Th.55.

gnwmo-tu^pi/a, h(,
coining of maxims, Hsch.

gnwmo-tu^piko/s, h/, o/n,
clever at coining maxims, Ar.Eq.1379.

gnwmo-tu/pos [u^], on, （tu/ptw)
maxim-coining, sententious, Id.Ra.877, Nu.952 (lyr.); g. ma/lista oi( a)groi=koi Arist.Rh.1395a7.

gnwmo-flua_ke/w,
babble of 'saws and instances', dub. cj. in Cerc.9.5.

gnw/mwn, onos, o(, (gi-gnw/-skw)
one that knows or
examines, an interpreter, discerner, qesfa/twn A.Ag.1130; tw=n paraxrh=ma Th.1.138; glw=tta g. (sc. gluke/wn kai\ drime/wn) X.Mem.1.4.5: gnw/mones, oi(,
inspectors of the sacred olives at Athens, Lys.7.25.
expert witness or
valuer, SIG169.52 (lasus, iv B. C.). as Adj.,
discerning, no/os Hymn.Is.141.
carpenter's square, Polyaen.4.3.21; [o( dhmiourgo\s th=| deka/di] w(/sper gnw/moni kai\ eu)qunthri/w| e)xrh/sato Theol.Ar.59.
pointer of the sun-dial, Hdt.2.109, Phld.Sign.30, Plu. Per.6 (pl.), D.L.2.1. Geom.,
gnomon, Euc.2 Def.2, etc.
Arith., number added to a figurate number to obtain the next number of the same figure, Iamb.in Nic.p.58 P.; esp. of the odd integers, Arist.Ph.203a14, Theo Sm.p.32 H.; also of the original figurate number, Theol.Ar.9 (dub.l.). = kleyu/dra, Thphr.Fr. 159.
point of a drill, Apollod.Poliorc.149.4. generally,
index, tino/s Plu.2.968f, Ael.NA6.34, al., Vett.Val.305.10; simply,
mark, POxy.1409.18 (iii A. D.). in pl.,
teeth that mark a horse's age, X.Eq.3.1. metaph.,
rule of life, Thgn.543, cf. Luc.Herm. 76. sens. obsc., o( g. a)ni/statai Diog.Ep.35.
tariff, OGI 674.5 (Coptos), BGU1118.45 (i B. C.), AB233.
code of regulations, PGnom.1, OGI669.44 (i A. D.).

gnwr-i/zw, fut.Att.-i^w=: pf. e)gnw/rika Pl.Phdr.262b:—
make known, point out, A.Pr.487, LXX 1 Ki.10.8, al., Ep.Rom.0.22:—in this sense mostly Pass.,
become known, Pl.R.428a, Arist.APr.64b35; ta\ gnwrizo/mena me/rh th=s oi)koume/nhs Plb.2.37.4. c. acc. pers.,
make known, tina/ tini Plu.Fab.21;
commend, tina\ th=| boulh=| i)sxurw=s App. Mac.9.6.
certify a person's
identity, BGU581.13 (ii A. D.), POxy. 1024.18 (ii A. D.).
gain knowledge of, become acquainted with, discover, c. part., tou)/rgon w(s ou) gnwrioi=mi/ sou to/de do/lw| prose/rpon S. OT538; ta\ kala\ g. oi( eu)fue/es pro\s au)ta/ Democr.56, cf. E.Alc.564, Th.7.44, Arist.Ph.184a12:—Pass., Th.5.103, Men.72; g. peri/ ti or peri/ tinos Arist.Metaph.1005b8, 1037a16.
become acquainted with, tina/ Pl.La.181c, D.35.6; tina\s o(poi=oi/ tine/s ei)si Isoc.2.28:— Pass., e)gnwrisme/noi au)tw=|
being made acquainted with him, ibid.; pro/s tinos Luc.Tim.5.

gnw/r-i^mos, on, rarely h, on, Pl.R.614e, Luc. Somn.9:—
well-known, gnw/rima le/geis Pl.R.558c; fi/la te kai\ sunh/qh kai\ g. Id.Lg.798e; lo/gos g. tini D.3.23; o)no/mata g.
familiar, Arist.Po.1451b20, Top.149a18 (Sup.); opp. a)/gnwston, ibid.; g. h(mi=n, opp. a(plw=s, Id.EN1095b3: more freq. in Comp. -w/teron, a(plw=s, opp. g. h(mi=n, Id.AP0.72a3, al.; -w/tera tekmh/ria Iamb.Myst.5.13. of persons, gnwrimw/teron poiei=n tina/ tini X.Cyr.5.5.28. Subst.,
acquaintance, e(tai=ros h)\ kai\ g. a)/llos Od.16.9; less than fi/los, D.18.284; toi=s oi)kei/ois kai\ toi=s g. Pl.R.343e, cf. X.Mem.2.3.1, D.21.73, etc.
pupil, *)isokra/tous kai\ tw=n e)kei/nou g. D.H.Comp.19, cf. Philostr.VS1.24.2,al., Plu.2.448e, IG3.774.
kinsman, LXX Ru.3.2.
notable, distinguished, oi( gnw/rimoi
the notables or
wealthy class, X.HG2.2.6; opp. dh=mos, Arist.Pol.1291b18, Plu. Nic.2, etc.: Sup. oi( e)n tai=s po/lesi -w/tatoi D.19.259; less freq. of things,
remarkable, Luc.Herm.21. Adv. -mws
intelligibly, g. ai)ni/comai E.El.946; g. moi pa/nu fra/seis Antiph.52.6; a(plw=s kai\ pa=si g. gegra/fqai D.24.68; g. ma=llon le/gein, opp. ou) safw=s, Arist.GA747a27.
familiarly, g. e)/xein tini/ to be on
friendly terms with one, D.53.4.—Rare in poetry.

gnwr-i^mo/ths, htos, h(,
acquaintance, Stob.2.7.51.

gnw/r-isis, ews, h(,
making known, Pl.Plt.257a. oi)keio/ths kai\ g. a)llh/lwn Id.Lg.771d, etc.
getting to know, gnwri/sews e(/neka tw=n to/pwn ib.763b;
cognition, Id.Sph.219c.

gnw/r-isma, to/,
that by which a thing is made known, mark, token, X.Cyr.2.1.27 (pl.), Arist.Phgn.806a15, etc.; i)/xnh kai\ g. Plu.2.855b: in pl.,
tokens by which a lost child
is recognized, Men.Epit.86, Plu.Thes.4, etc.: also in sg., Parth.1.5. in criminal trials,
corpus delicti, PMasp.143.16, al. (vi A. D.).

gnwr-ismo/s, o(,
making known, Arist.AP0.90b16.
identification, PTeb.288.15 (iii A. D.).
recognition, EM735.25, Suid.

gnwr-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one that takes cognizance of, di/khs Antipho 5.94.
diviner, LXX 4 Ki.23.24.

gnwr-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
capable of apprehending, cognitive, Pl.Def.414c; kinhtiko\n e)do/kei h( yuxh\ ei)=nai kai\ g. Arist.de An.404b28; tou= ei)/dous Id.Ph.194b4; h( dialektikh\ peirastikh\ peri\ w(=n h( filosofi/a g. Id.Metaph.1004b26; h( th=s g. grammh=s tomh/ title of work ascribed to Archytas, Iamb.Comm. Math.2;
capable of knowing, Plu.2.79d, Arr.Epict.2.20.21; g. tou= me/llontos Max.Tyr.1.5. Adv. -kw=s, zh=n Porph.Gaur.16.3.
corresponding with knowledge, i)dio/thtes tou= o)/ntos Porph.Sent.38.

gnwsi^-gra^fi/a, h(,
picturing of the effect of a verdict, as a Rhetorical device, Aps.p.304 H.

gnwsi^-di/ka [i^], h(,
judicial decision, IG5(2).262.15 (Mantinea, V B.C.).

gnwsi^-ma^xe/w,
fight with one's own opinion (th=| prote/ra| gnw/mh| ma/xesqai Phryn.PSp.59 B.), or
recognize one's own fighting power (as compared with the enemy): hence,
give way, submit, Hdt.3.25, 7.130, E.Heracl.706 (anap.), Ar.Av.555, D.H.3.57; g. mh\ ei)=nai o(moi=oi
give way and confess that . . , Hdt.8.29.
admit one's error, Isoc.5.7, POxy.1119.20 (iii A. D.), 71 ii 14 (iv A. D.). in later Prose,
contend obstinately, in argument, Ph.1.526, al.; gnwsimaxh/santes pro\s a)llh/lous D.H.9.1 (s. v. l.): abs.,
to be at variance, Hp.Ep.27.

gnwsi^-ma^xi/a, h(,
obstinate contention, Ph.1.693 (pl.).

gnw=sis, ews, h(,
seeking to know, inquiry, investigation, esp. judicial, ta\s tw=n dikasthri/wn g. D.18.224; th\n kata\ tou= diaithtou= g. Id.21.92, cf. 7.9, Lycurg.141; g. peri\ th=s di/khs PHib.1.92.13 (iii B. C.).
result of investigation, decision, PPetr.3p.118 (iii B. C.).
knowing, knowledge, Heraclit.56; opp. a)gnwsi/h, Hp. Vict.1.23 (dub.); opp. a)/gnoia, Pl.R.478c; h( ai)/sqhsis g. tis Arist.GA731a33: pl., *qeo\s gnw/sewn ku/rios LXX 1 Ki.2.3.
higher, esoteric knowledge, 1 Ep.Cor.8.7,10, Ep.Eph.3.19, etc.; xarisa/menos h(mi=n nou=n, lo/gon, gnw=sin PMag.Par.2.290.
acquaintance with a person, pro/s tina Test. ap.Aeschin.1.50; tw=n *sebastw=n IPE1.47.6 (Olbia).
recognizing, Th.7.44.
means of knowing, [ai( ai)sqh/seis] kuriw/tatai tw=n kaq' e(/kasta g. Arist.Metaph.981b11.
being known, gnw=sin e)/xei ti, = gnwsto/n e)sti, Pl.Tht.206b.
fame, credit, Hdn.7.5.5, Luc.Herod.3.
means of knowing: hence,
statement in writing, PLond.5.1708, etc. (vi A. D.). = gnw=ma, Hsch. s. h. v.

gnw=sma, atos, to/,
knowable object, Dam.Pr.81.

gnwst-ei/a, h(,
certification of identity, PFay.65.5 (ii A. D.).

gnwst-e/on,
one must know, Pl.R.396a. Adj. gnwste/a, ta/,
things that must be known, Gal.17(2).1.

gnwst-eu/w,
to be witness to identity for a person, BGU895 (ii A. D.):—Pass.,
to be certified, u(po/ tinos PFlor.382.80 (iii A. D.).

gnwst-h/r, h=ros, o(,
one that knows: surety, X.Cyr.6.2.39, BGU 1032.11:
witness to identity, POxy.496.16 (ii A. D.).
inspector, PAmh.2.139.23 (iv A. D.), PLond.3.1249.3 (iv A. D.).

gnw/st-hs, ou, o(,
one that knows, tw=n e)qw=n Act.Ap.26.3; tou= eu)aggeli/ou Sammelb.421.1 (iii A. D.): esp.
one who knows the future, diviner, LXX 1 Ki.28.3. = gnwsth/r,
surety, g. th=s pi/stews Plu.Flam.4;
expert witness or
valuer, PLips.106.10 (i A. D.).

gnwst-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for knowing, cognitive: h( -kh/ (sc. e)pisth/mh),
theoretical science (opp. praktikh/), Pl.Plt.258e, etc.; to\ g. ib.261b; e(/ceis g. Arist.AP0.100a11 (Comp.); g. ei)ko/nes Hierocl.in CA25p.475M.: c. gen.,
able to discern, Ocell. 2.7. Adv. -kw=s Procl.Inst.39, Dam.Pr.79, Phlp.in Ph.241.22.

gnwstopoio/s, o/n,
creating the knowable, Dam.Pr.80.

gnwsto/s, h/, o/n, collat. form of gnwto/s (q. v.),
known, A.Ch.702, S. OT361, Fr.203, Pl.Tht.205d, X.HG2.3.44, etc.; gnwsto/n, to/,
common knowledge, tino/s PAmh.145.9 (iv/v A. D.). Adv. -tw=s
clearly, LXX Pr.27.23, Eust.1540.1.
knowable, Arist.Metaph.1016b20, AP0.64b37, etc.; gnwsta\ sarko/s bodily
symptoms (of anger), Phld. Ir.p.24 W. pl., as Subst., = gnw/rimoi,
notables, Sm.Pr.31.23;
acquaintance, friend, Ev.Luc.2.44,al. Act.,
knowing, dub. in LXX Ge.2.9 (gnwstiko/s ap.Ph.1.37).
gnwte/ra, = ballwth/, Ps.-Dsc.3.103 (gnote/ra Wellm.).

gnwto/s (A), h/, o/n （o/s, o/n S.OT396), older and more correct form of gnwsto/s (Eust.400.26, 1450.62):—of things,
perceived, understood, known, Il.7.401, Od.24.182; gnwta\ kou)k a)/gnwta/ moi S.OT58; [mantei/an] e)k qew=n tou gnwto/n ib.396. of persons,
well-known, e)k ka/rta baiw=n g. a)\n ge/noit' a)nh/r Id.Fr.282.

gnwto/s (B), h/,
kinsman, kinswoman, gnwtoi/ te gnwtai/ te
brothers and
sisters, Il.15.350; qa/lamon gnwtou/s te lipou=sa 3.174, cf. 22.234; gnwto\n mhtruih=s 13.697;
brother, A.R.1.53;
sister, au)th\ . . gnwth/ Nicaenet.1.9, cf. Nonn.D.3.313, al.; also, = e)rwme/nh, Hsch. (Cf. Lett.
znuots 'son-in-law, brother-in-law', Skt.
jñātís 'relative'.)

gnwto-fo/nos, on,
murderer of another's brother, Nonn.D.26.82:— fem. gnwto-fo/ntis, idos, h(,
murderess of a brother, Lyc.1318.

goa/w, goa/ei Mosch.3.88, -a/ousi A.R.3.995, goo/wsi Q.S.2.648: Dor. 3pl. -a/onti Mosch.3.24; opt. goa/oimen Il.24.664; goa/oien Od. 24 190; Ep. inf. goh/menai Il.14.502; part. goo/wn, -o/wsa 6.373, etc.: Ep. impf. go/wn Od.10.567 (go/on Il.6.500 may be aor.), Ion. goa/asken Od.8.92: Ep. fut. goh/somai Il.21.124, later goh/sw AP7.638 (Crin.), Nonn.D.2.137: aor. 1 e)go/hsa IG12(7).445 (Amorgos), AP7.599 (Jul.), 611 (Eutolm.):—Med., Trag. (v. infr.) and once in Prose, X.Cyr.4.6.9:—Pass., v. infr.:—
groan, weep, Od.8.92, etc.: c. acc.,
bewail, Il.16.857, etc.; u(pe/r tinos Mosch.4.83:—Med. (never in Hom. exc. in fut.), goa=sqe A.Pers.1072, cf. Ch.632; o)du/rmata th\n *(hra/kleion e)/codon gowme/nhn S.Tr.51; a)mfi/ nin gow/menos ib.937:— Pass., goa=tai A.Ch.632; makra\ gohqei/s AP7.371 (Crin.).
gobri/ai: fanoi/, lampth=res, Hsch.; cf. gra/bion.
goggri/on, to/, Dim. of go/ggros, Sch.Opp.H.1.113.

goggro-eidh/s, e/s,
like a conger, Arist.HA505b9 (Comp.).

goggro-kto/nos, on,
conger-killing, Plu.2.966a.

go/ggros, o(,
conger-eel, Antiph.26.12, Alex.15.15, Arist.HA571a28, etc.
tubercular disease in olive-trees, Thphr.HP1.8.6.

goggru/zw,
grunt, Hsch., EM237.40.

goggrw/dhs, es,
like an excrescence, e)/kfusis Hsch. s.v. go/ggros.

goggrw/nh, h(,
excrescence on the neck, Hp.Epid.6.3.6, Gal.17 (2).38. (Cf. go/ggros 11.)

goggu/zw, Ion. (Phryn.336) and later Gr. for Att. tonqoru/zw,
mutter, murmur, grumble, e)pi/ tini LXX Nu.14.29, cf. 17.5; kata/ tinos Ev.Matt.20.11; peri/ tinos Ev.Jo.6.41, etc.: abs., PPetr.3p.130 (iii B. C.), LXX Nu.11.1, POxy.33 iii 14 (ii A. D.), Arr.Epict.1.29.55. of doves,
coo, Poll.5.89. (Cf. Skt.
ga[ndot ]gūyati 'utter cries of joy'.)

goggu^la/ths [a_], ou, o(, of Zeus,
hurling balls of fire, Lyc.435.

goggu/lh [u^], h(, = goggu^li/s, Poll.6.54; rejected by the Atticists, Phryn.81, but used in the jargon of a Scythian in Ar.Th.1185, also by Diocl.Frr.125, 141, Dsc.2.110, Gal.11.861, Str.5.4.10, POxy.1212.6 (ii A. D.). g. a)gri/a,
Eastern cress, Erucaria aleppica, Dsc.l.c.
goggu^li/dion, to/, = katapo/tion, Hp. ap. Erot. (gogguli/da codd.), Gal.19.91.
goggu^li/zw, v. goggu/llw.

goggu^li/s, i/dos, h(,
turnip, Brassica Rapa, Ar.Fr.569.6, Eub.4 (pl., Id.74), Speus. ap. Ath.9.369b, Thphr.HP7.4.3, PPetr.3p.152 (iii B. C.), Dsc.5.20, POxy.736.5 (i A. D.).

goggu/llw,
round (metastre/fei Suid.), Ar.Th.56 (Pors. for gogguli/zei); cf. goggulei=n: sustrefei=n (perh. sustre/yein), Hsch.

goggu^loeidh/s, e/s,
roundish, Sch.Nic.Th.855. Adv.-dw=s Dsc.5.18.

goggu^lo/-rugxos, on,
with round nozzle, PMag.Par.1.2183.

goggu^lo-spa/ra^gon [pa^], to/,
turnip-tops, Gp.12.1.8.

goggu/los [u^], h, on, = stroggu/los,
round, A.Fr.199.7, S.Ichn.297, Pl.Cra.427c; [ma=za] Ar.Pax28; li/qos a)/qetos IG12.372.22; e)lai=ai Plb. 12.2.4: Comp. -w/teros Ath.4.139a. = sklhro/s, Hsch. Subst. go/ggu^los, o(, (proparox. acc. to Hdn.Gr.1.164) = ko/ndulos, Sch.Lyc.435. = o)/lunqos, Nic.Th.855. (Redupl. form from root of gaulo/s, gu/lios, etc.)

goggu^l-w/dhs, es,
roundish, Sch.Ar.Pax788.
goggu^l-w/mata: strogguleu/mata, Hsch.

goggu^l-wpo/s, o/n,
round-faced, stout-looking, Id.
go/gg-u^sis, ews, h(, = sq., LXX Nu.14.27.

gogg-usmo/s, o(,
murmuring, muttering, grumbling, Anaxandr.31, M.Ant.9.37, LXXEx.16.79, Act.Ap.6.1, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.139.
go/gg-u^sos, o(, = goggusth/s, Thd. Pr.16.28, Hdn. Gr.1.213.

gogg-usth/s, ou=, o(,
murmurer, mutterer, grumbler, Ep.Jud.16, Thd.Pr.26.20.

gogg-ustiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to murmur, in Adv. -kw=s Erot. s.v. tru/zein, EM771.11.
go/ggwn: mwro/s, Hsch. go/da, ta/, = e)/ntera (Maced.), Id. goda=n: klai/ein (Cypr.), Id. go/datos: qh/ra, Id. godo/n: go/hta, Id. godou=los, v. goidou=los.
go-edno/s, h/, o/n, = sq.1., A.Pers.1057 (lyr.), Supp.73 (lyr.), 194. = sq.11, Id.Pers.1039 (lyr.).

go-ero/s, a/, o/n, (go/os) of things,
mournful, distressful, qrh=noi Erinna6.8 codd.; pa/qh A.Ag.1176 (lyr.); da/krua E.Ph.1567 (lyr.); to\ g. kai\ h(su/xion me/los Arist.Pr.922b19. of persons,
wailing, lamenting, h(/cei ti me/los goero\n goerai=s E.Hec.84; of the nightingale, Call.Lav.Pall.94. Adv. -rw=s D.T. 629.21, Eust. 1147.9.

-erost . . . . hnolalh/mwn, onos,
uttering plaintive . . . notes, a)hdw/n Lyr. in Philol.80.336.
go-h/menai, v. goa/w.
go-h/mwn, on, gen. onos, = goero/s *i, fwnh/ APl.4.101, Nonn.D.11.196. = g.11, ib.20.162; ku/nes ib.5.454.
go-hro/s, a/, o/n, poet. for goero/s, Lyc. 1057, Epigr.Gr.790.7 (Dyme).

go/hs, htos, o(,
sorcerer, wizard, Phoronis 2, Hdt.2.33,4.105, Pl.R. 380d, Phld.Ir.p.29 W.; g. e)pw|do\s *ludi/as a)po\ xqono/s E.Ba.234, cf. Hipp.1038; prob. f.l. for boh=|si Hdt.7.191.
juggler, cheat, deino\s g. kai\ farmakeu\s kai\ sofisth/s Pl.Smp.203d; deino\n kai\ g. kai\ sofisth\n . . o)noma/zwn D.18.276; a)/pistos g. ponhro/s Id.19.109; ma/gos kai\ g. Aeschin.3.137: Comp. gohto/teros Ach.Tat.6.7 (s. v. l.). (Cf. Lith.
žavēti 'incantare'.)
gohsi/odos: w)|do/s (leg. gohsiw|do/s）, a)patew/n, Hsch.

goht-ei/a, h(,
witchcraft, jugglery, g. kai\ magei/a Gorg.Hel.10, cf. Pl. Smp.203a: metaph., ou)de\n u(gie/s, a)lla\ g. tis Id.R.584a, Andronic. Rhod.p.573 M., etc.; a)pa/th kai\ g. Plb.4.20.5, cf. Luc.Nigr.15; g. th=s u(pokri/sews D.S.1.76; h(donh=s di' o)mma/twn Plu.2.961d: in a milder sense, '
finesse', Cic.Att.9.13.4; h( th=s fu/sews g. the
magic of Nature, Plot.4.4.44.

goh/t-euma, atos, to/,
spell, charm, Pl.Phlb.44c, Alciphr.3.17, Ael. NA3.17, Agath.Praef.; to\ g. th=s fu/sews Porph.Abst.1.43.

goh/t-eusis, ews, h(,
sorcery, Plot.4.4.43.
goht-eutiko/s, h/, o/n, = gohtiko/s, Porph.VP 39, Poll.4.48. Adv. -kw=s ib.51.

goht-eu/tria, h(,
sorceress, Eust.881.62.

goht-eu/w,
bewitch, beguile, Pl.Grg.483e, etc.:—Pass., Id.R.412e, 413b, D.19.102, etc.;
fascinate, as a snake, Plot.4.4.40. abs.,
play the wizard, D.L.8.59.

goht-h/s, ou=, o(,
wailer, gohtw=n no/mon A.Ch. 822 codd. (goata/n Herm.), cf. Tim.Pers.112.

goht-iko/s, h/, o/n, (go/hs)
skilled in witchcraft, juggling, h( g. magei/a Arist.Fr.36. Adv. -kw=s Poll.4.51:—pecul. fem. goh=tis morfh/
bewitching, AP12.192 (Strat.). gohto/s (sic) is prob.f.l.for foreg.in PHib.52.18 (iii B. C.).

goi=, goi=, to imitate the sound of pigs
grunting, AP11.327 (Antip. Thess.). goi/ (i.e. voi/）: au)tw=|, Hsch.
goi=da (i.e. voi=da）: oi)=da, Hsch. (prob.l.). goi/dhmi: e)pi/stamai, Id. goidou=los: lalio/s, oi( de\

godou=los, Id. goidu/es: r(uth=res, Id. goi/nakes: blastoi/, Id. goina/<r>utis (voi=nos, a)ru/tw）: oi)noxo/h, Id. goine/es: ko/rakes, Id. goi=nos: oi)=nos, Id. goi=sos: me/lan, platu/, Id., cf. EM238.45: goisou=tai: platu/netai ktl., EM237.51. goi=ta: oi)=s (leg. u(=s), Hsch.; cf. goi=. goitai/: kriqai/, gra/stis, Id. goi=tos: r(u/pos, pa/qos, Id., cf. EM51.17. *goito/suros, = *oi)to/suros (q. v.), Hsch. go/lamos: diwgmo/s, Id. go/lana: a)gku/lh, a)ntilabeu/s, Id. go/lhsis: kakodaimoni/a, Id. go/llaka: la/kkon, Id. go/lmis, = ya/ros, Id. golmoi/: stolmoi/, Id. goloina/: xlwra/, h)\

golona/, Id. golome/nh, name of a
plant, Id. golu/rion: ke/lufos (Tarent.), Id.
goma/rion, to/, Dim. of go/uos 2, PFlor.274.5 (iii A. D.).
go/mnh: o)ri/ganon, Hsch.

go/mos, o(, (ge/mw)
ship's freight, cargo, A.Supp.444 (dub.), D.32.4; pentakisxili/wn tala/ntwn go/mon e)/xein to be of 5,000 talents
burden, Hdt.1.194.
beast's load, Babr.7.11, LXXEx.23.5, al., PAmh.2.138.11 (pl., iv A. D.); g. kamhliko/s OGI629.87, al. (Palmyra, ii A. D.); g. karriko/s ib.16.
guild of transport-agents in Nubia, CIG4980, al. go(mos: zwmo/s, Hsch.

gomofo/ros, on,
bearing loads, Gloss.

gomo/w,
load, gomw/swn to\n o)/non Babr.111.9, cf. PFlor.129.5 (iii A. D.), etc.:—Pass., a(/maca cu/lwn gegomwme/nh Edict.Diocl.14.8.

gomf-algi/a, h(,
toothache, Dsc.4.164 (pl.).
gomf-a/rion, to/, = kestreu/s, Tz.ad Lyc.664, Sch. Opp.H.1.112,3.339.

gomfi-a/zw,
have pain in the back teeth or
gnash them, g. tou\s o)do/ntas LXX Si.30.10. of the teeth,
suffer pain, ib.Ez.18.2.

gomfi/-a^sis, ews, h(,
toothache or
gnashing of teeth, Dsc.2.59 (pl.).
gomfi-asmo/s, o(, LXXAm.4.6.

gomfio/doupos, on,
rattling in the teeth, xalino/s AP6.233 (Maec.).

gomf-i/os (sc. o)dou/s), o(, more Att. than mu/los, Moer.111: (go/mfos): —
grinder-tooth, molar, chiefly in pl., Hp.Epid.5.100, Hdt.9.83, Ar. Pax34, etc.; yofei= d' o( g. Epich.21; gomfi/ous sugkrou/wn with his
teeth chattering, Babr.92.8; opp. prosqi/os, X.Mem.1.4.6, Arist.PA 661b8.
tooth of a key, Ar.Th.423.
gomf-i/ths [i_], ou, o( (fort. sc. na/rdos), a kind of stu/rac, Aet.1.131, Steph.in Hp.2.460D.

gomfo/-detos, on,
nail-bound, do/rei A.Supp.846 (lyr.).

gomfo-pa^gh/s, e/s,
fastened with bolts: metaph.,
creaky, r(h/mata gomfopagh=, of the long compound words of Aeschylus, Ar.Ra.824.

go/mfos, o(,
bolt, for ship-building, Od.5.248; for other uses, Hes. Op.431, A.Th.542;
dowel, SIG246ii40 (Delph., iv B. C.); go/mfois kai\ pero/nh|sin a)rhro/te Parm.1.20; go/mfw| h)\ ko/llh| h)\ a(fh=| Arist.Ph.227a17, cf. Metaph.1052a24: generally,
bond, fastening, as of the
cross-ribs of Egyptian canoes, Hdt.2.96; of the ankle-joint, Arist.PA654b21; of the in visible
bonds uniting the partieles of the body, Pl.Ti.43a: metaph., g. kata/storgoi, of love, Emp.87; tw=nd' e)fh/lwtai . . go/mfos diampa/c these things are
determined, A.Supp.945:—acc. to EM238.4, g. were prop. of wood; but cf. g. xalkoi/ IG9 (1).691 (Corc.), g. sidhroi= Plb.13.7.9.
instrument for cautery, Hippiatr.97. = go/mfios, Hsch.
sea-fish, = gomfa/rion, Gloss. (Cf.Skt.
jámbhas 'tooth', Lith.
ža[mtilde]bas 'edge of a beam', etc.)

gomf-o/w,
fasten with bolts or
nails, esp. of ships, i)/kria gomfw/santes Nonn.D.40.447:—mostly in Pass., gego/mfwtai ska/fos the ship's hull
is ready built, A.Supp.440, cf.Ar.Eq.463, AP11.248 (Bianor). metaph.,
curdle, ga/la leuko\n e)go/mfwsen Emp.33.

go/mf-wma, atos, to/,
that which is fastened by bolts, frame-work, Plu.Marc.15. = go/mfos, Id.2.321d, Longus 2.26. metaph., kleidw=n a)xalkeu/twn g. Vett. Val.334.11 (pl.).

go/mf-wsis, ews, h(,
bolting together, Sch. Theoc.7.105. a mode of
articulation, Gal.2.738.
framework of the body, Eun.VSp.474B.

gomf-wth/r, h=ros, o(,
a ship-builder, AP9.31 (Zelot.).
surgical instrument for excising bone, Antyll. ap. Orib.44.23.15.

gomf-wth/rion, to/,
tenon, IG11 (2).163 A 14 (Delos, iii B. C.), Hero Aut.27.1; gloss on te/retra, Sch.Od.5.246.

gomf-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
fastening with nails: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh),
the jomer's art, carpentry, Pl.Plt.280d.

gomf-wto/s, h/, o/n,
fastened with bolts: ploi=a g. ships
slightly put together, so that they could be taken to pieces, Str.16.1.11, cf. Aristeas71.

go/mwsis, ews, h(,
loading, cu/lwn PFlor.203.4 (iii A. D.).
gona/r: mh/tra (Lacon.), Hsch.: gona/des: mh=trai, Id.

gona^t-i/zw,
thrust with the knee, Cratin.399.
bend the knee, Aq.Ge.24.11,41.43. sfugmo\s gonati/zwn, term coined by Archig. ap. Gal.8.665.

gona^/t-ion, to/, Dim. of go/nu, Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.66.3, Ruf. ap. eund.49.34.1, POxy.52.17 (iv A. D.).
hip-joint, groin, Luc.Asin.10, cf. Ph.2.479, Sch.Nic.Th.541, Ptol.Alm.8.1, etc. = gu/hs 1, Procl.ad Hes.Op.425, Et.Gud.
knot or
joint of a reed, Tz.H.7.741.

gona^to/desmos, o(,
knee-band, Gloss.

gona^t-o/omai, Pass.,
become or
be jointed, of grasses, reeds, etc., Thphr.HP8.2.4, Dsc.3.51.

gona^t-w/dhs, es,
with joints, Thphr.HP 1.5.3, Dsc.1.1,4.29.
gona/w, = genna/w, Hsch.
gon-ea/, Cret. = genea/, GDI5112 (Phaestus).

gon-ei/a, h(,
generation, Hdn.Epim.16.

gon-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
begetter, father, mostly in pl.,
parents, h.Cer.240, Hes.Op.235, Pi.P.6.27, Pl.Smp.178b, etc.: in sg., of a serpent, Hdt.3.109; of a man, Pl.R.457d; fra/ze ti/nos gone/ws IG12 (5).310: generally,
progenitor, ancestor, pe/mptos g.
ancestor in the fifth generation, Hdt.1.91, cf. Is.8.32; oi( a)/nwqen g. Arist.GA722a8. (Nom. pl. gonei=es Histria7.27: acc. pl. gone/a^s Antiph.261: dat. pl. gonei=si SIG1267.24 (Ios, iii A. D.).)

gon-eu/w,
produce, karpou/s Thphr. CP1.14.1; a)h\r [skw/lhkas] goneu/wn Id.HP8.10.5; of animals, Plu. 2.980d:—Pass., ib.981d.

gonh/, h(, (gene/sqai)
offspring, oi( ou)/ ti pai/dwn g. ge/neto kreio/ntwn Il. 24.539; g. *)arkeisia/dao Od.4.755; te/knwn di/ptuxos g. two
children, E.Med.1136: pl., ei)si\ xa(te/rois gonai\ kakai/ S.OC1192; g. kathko/ous fu/santes Id.Ant.641; of animals, tau/rwn gonai/ A.Fr.194; e)n . . tet raskelei= g., i. e. among quadrupeds, S.Fr.941.10;
fruits of the earth, Pl.Ax.371c.
race, stock, family, A.Ag.1565 (lyr.); w)= gonh=| gennai=e S.OT1469, cf.El.156 (lyr.); a( *darda/nou g. E.Tr.1290: pl., mhde\n w)\n gonai=si S.Aj.1094;
parentage, e)ceurei=n gona/s E.Ion328.
generation, tri/taisin e)n g. Pi.P.4.143; tri/tos . . pro\s de/k' a)/llaisin g. A.Pr.774; tritospo/rw| gonh=| Id.Pers.818.
that which engenders, seed, Hes.Op.733, Hdt.3.101, 109, Hp.Genit.3, Arist.GA726a18, etc.: pl., Pi.N.7.84, S.Ant.950 (lyr.).
organs of generation, generally, Hp.Art.45, Mochl.1 (also restricted to the
womb, Ruf.Onom.193, Gal.2.889); pri\n . . mhtro\s e)k gonh=s molei=n E.Ph.1597.
act of generation, Pi.I.7(6).7; kata\ fu/sin gona\s poiei=sqai Aeschin.3.111. of the mother,
child-birth, E.Ph.355, Theoc.17.44. of the child,
birth, e)k gonh=s Hp.Epid.4.31; gonh=| fu=nai geraite/ra| S. OC1294; gonai\ zw/|wn Arist.Mu.399a28. cure for sterility, Paul. Aeg.3.74. Pythag. name for
unity, Theol.Ar.6.
go/nhma, atos, to/, = ge/nhma, PLond.1.125.17.
gonh/s: na/rkissos, Hsch.
go/nqos, = ko/gxos, Hdn.Gr.1.144.

goniai=os,
molaris, Gloss. (leg. gomf-).

goni/as xeimw/n, in A.Ch.1067 (anap.), acc. to Hsch. eu)xerh/s, a
fair wind; but, acc. to the Sch., o(/tan e)c eu)di/as kinhqh=| xalepo\n pneu=ma.

goniko/qen, Adv.
by inheritance from parents, PMasp.151.182 (vi A. D.).

goniko/s, h/, o/n, (gonh/ 11.1)
of the seed, g. e)/kkrisis Arist.Pr.879b28.
ancestral, no/moi Tim.Lex. s.v. patronomou/menoi.

go/nimos, on, also h, on Hp. Vict.1.25, Isyll.53:—
productive, fertile, fruitful, spe/rma g., opp. a)/gonon, Arist.HA523a25; ku/hma g. Id.GA736a35; w)|a\ g., opp. u(phne/mia, ib.730a6; of women, Id.Pr.876b12; of the male, Id.HA546a2, al.; e)n th=|si h(liki/h|si th=|si goni/mh|si ei)=nai Hp.l.c.; g. me/lea a
parent's limbs, E.El.1209 (lyr.); g. fle/y AP6.218 (Alc.); g. me/rea
generative organs, Aret.SD2.5: hence (metaph.), a)po ti/ktein g. te kai\ a)lhqe/s Pl.Tht.150c; g. h)\ a)nemiai=on ib.151e; *nei=los g., opp. pe/lagos, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.32.6, cf.Sammelb.2074 (Sup.). Adv. -mws, spe/rma e)n th=| mh/tra| g. krathqh=nai Porph.Gaur.2.2. c. gen.rei, ne/fos
g. u(/datos Arist.Mu.394a27, cf. Thphr.Ign.44, Ael.NA7.5: metaph., phgai\ th=s u(yhgori/as gonimw/tatai Longin.8.1. metaph. of persons, poihth\s g. poet
