of true genius, Ar.Ra.96; gonimwte/ra gene/sqw h( glw=ssa Luc.Rh.Pr.23.
born in lawful wedlock, Man.6.56: metaph., a)gaqa\ g. th=| au(tw=n fu/sei Pl.R.367d; g. u(/dwr potamw=n, opp. no/qon, AP9.277 (Antiph.). = biw/simos,
viable, paidi/on Hp. Superf.4; e)/mbruon Arist.HA583b31; bre/fh Ph.1.45.
favourable to generation, of uneven days, Pythagorean term, Plu.2.288c; of days in illness (because critical for life or death, Erot.s.v.), Hp. Epid.2.6.8, 2.5.12; g. mh/n, e)/tos, ib.6.10.

gonimo/ths, htos, h(,
vitality, of the embryo, Theol.Ar.47, Simp.in Ph.503.31.
generative power, Dam.Pr.108.

gonimw/dhs, es,
fruitful, Orph.H.55.19.

gono-eidh/s, e/s,
like seed, Hp.Epid.2.3.11, Aret.SA2.12, SD2.11.

gono/-eis, essa, en,
fruitful, Nic.Al.101, Hymn.Is.1.

gono-ktone/w,
murder one's child, Ps.-Plu.Fluv.22.1.

gono-ktoni/a, h(,
murder of parents, Gloss.

gono-poii/+a,
production of offspring, Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.68.

gono-pw/ths, ou, o(,
qui semen bibit, Man.4.311 (pl.).

gono/-rroia, h(, (r(e/w)
spermatorrhoea, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.1.5, Aret. SD2.5, Sor. ap. Cael.Aur.CP3.18. in women,
blennorrhagia, Aret.SD2.11.

gono-rroi+ko/s, h/, o/n,
suffering from or
subject to, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.22.3, J.BJ6.9.3 (v.l. -oiois）; pa/qos Ruf.Sat.Gon. 15.

gono-rru^e/w,
to be subject to spermatorrhoea, LXX Le 22.4 (v.l.), Sch. Nic.Th.721.
gono-rru^h/s, e/s, = gonorroi+ko/s, LXX Le.15.4, al., Ph.1.88.
go/non: mi/ton, Hsch. (leg. to/non).

go/nos, o(, and (in signf.1), h(, E.IA793: late Ion. gou=nos Aret.CD2.5: —
that which is begotten, child, Il.5.635, 6.191;
offspring, 20.409, Hes. Th.919, etc.; a)/pais e)/rsenos go/nou Hdt.1.109; presbu/tatos panto\s tou= g. Id.7.2; au)to\n kai\ go/non Schwyzer 415 (Elis); o( *phle/ws g. his
son, S.Ph.333, cf. 366,416, etc.; of animals, g. o)rtali/xwn Id.Fr.793; of fish,
roe, Hegem.1, Archestr.Fr.9; of bees, Arist.HA554a18.
product, of plants, g. a)mpe/lou Anacreont.54.7; g. plouto/xqwn, of the silver mines at Laureion, A.Eu.946 (lyr.); tou= fo/rou to\n g. Ar.V.1116 codd. e)s e)/rsena go/non to any of the male
sex, Hdt.6.135.
race, stock, descent, ou)/ pw/ tis e(o\n g. au)to\s a)ne/gnw Od.1.216, cf. 11.234.
begetting, procreation, A.Supp.172 (lyr.); go/nw| path/r, opp. poihto/s, Lys.13.91; go/nw| gegonw/s D.44.49; g. ui(o/s Men.Sam. 131, D.C.40.51, cf.IG3.1445,al. of plants,
bearing, Thphr.CP3.15.3.
seed, Hp.Genit.7, Arist.GA748a22, LXX Le.15.3; spe/rma kai\ g. Ti.Locr.100b, cf. Gal.19.450.
genitals, Hp.Liqu. 2. g. *(ermou=, = bou/fqalmos, Ps.-Dsc.3.139.

gonotu/lh [u^], h(,
callus on the knee, Hsch.

go/nu^, to/, gen. go/natos, Ep. and Ion. gou/natos (for go/nvatos) Il.21.591, Hdt.2.80: pl. nom. gou/nata Il.5.176, Hes.Op.587, Hdt.1.199, Schwyzer694.7 (Chios, iv B. C.), gen. gouna/twn Hdt.9.76, dat. gou/nasi Il.9.455, Hdt.4.152 (also Pi.I.2.26), gona/tessi Theoc.16.11, Epigr.Gr. 782 (Halic.); also Ep. gen. gouno/s (expl. as for go/nuos by Hdn.Gr.2.768, A.D.Synt.342.9) Il.11.547: pl. gou=na 6.511; gou/nwn 1.407, al.: dat. gou/nessi 9.488, al. (v.l. gou/nassi):—Aeol. acc. pl. go/na Alc.39.7 (prob.), but go/nna acc. to St.Byz. s.v. *go/nnoi, Eust.335.39: gen. pl. go/nwn Alc.Supp.10: has gouna/twn Hec.752, 839, gou/nasi Supp.285 (lyr.), Andr.529 (lyr.), but not gouno/s （gou=n' acc. pl. was read by Sch. in Ph.852): gen. pl. geu/nwn, Hsch.:—
knee, go/nu gouno\s a)mei/bwn Il.11.547, etc.: freq. of
clasping the knees in earnest supplication, h(/yato gou/nwn 1.512; e(lei=n, labei=n gou/nwn 21.71, 1.407, etc.; tw=n gouna/twn labe/sqai Hdt.9.76; poti\ (v.l. peri\) or a)mfi\ gou/nasi/ tinos xei=ras balei=n Od.6.310, 7.142; peri\ go/nu xe/ras i(kesi/ous e)/balon E.Or.1414, cf. Ph.1622, etc.; ta\ sa\ gou/naq' i(ka/nomai Il.18.457, cf. Od.7.147, etc.; kixano/menoi ta\ sa\ gou=na i(ko/meq' 9.266; a)nti/os h)/luqe gou/nwn Il.20.463; go/nu so\n a)mpi/sxein xeri/ E.Supp.165; soi=s prosti/qhmi go/nasin w)le/nas Id.Andr.895; e)s gou/nata/ tini or tinos pesei=n Hdt.5.86, S.OC1607; a)mfi\ go/nu tino\s pi/ptein E.Hec.787; go/nu tino/s or pro\s go/nu prospi/ptein ib.339, HF79; go/nasi/ tinos prospi/ptein Id.Or.1332 (but prospi/tnw se go/nasin
on my knees, S.Ph.485); pi/ptein pro\s ta\ g. tinos, tini, Lys.1.19, D.19.198; also gou/nwn li/ssesqai Il.9.451; e)llitaneu/ein Od.10.481; gouna/zesqai Il.22.345; a)/ntesqai pro\s tw=n gona/twn E.Med.710; i(keteu=sai pro\s t. g. D.58.70. of a sitting posture, fhmi/ min a)spasi/ws g. ka/myein will be glad to bend
the knee so as to sit down and rest, Il.7.118, cf. 19.72; but also, bow
the knee in submission, e)moi\ ka/myei (intr.) pa=n g. LXX Is.45.23; g. o)kla/zein tini/ ib.3 Ki.19.18, v. sub ka/mptw: e)pi\ gou/nasi
on one's
knees, e)pi\ gou/nasi patro/s Il.22.500; poti\ g. 5.408; gou/nasin e)fe/ssesqai fi/lon ui(o/n 9.455; s' e)p' e)moi=si . . gou/nessi kaqi/ssas 9.488; to/n r(a/ oi( . . e)pi\ gou/nasi qh=ken Od.19.401; e)n toi=s go/nasi/ tinos stre/fesqai Pl.R. 617b; pe/plon . . qei=nai *)aqhnai/hs e)pi\ gou/nasin to lay it on her
lap (as an offering), Il.6.92, cf. Schwyzer l.c.: hence metaph., qew=n e)n gou/nasi kei=tai it rests
in the lap of . . , Il.17.514, Od.1.267, etc.; but e)n gou/nasin pi/tnonta *ni/kas victorious, Pi.I.2.26. of the knees as the seat of strength, e)n de\ bi/hn w)/moisi kai\ e)n gou/nessin e)/qhke Il.17.569; of swiftness, laiyhra/ g. 22.204, etc.; gou/nata/ tinos lu/ein disable, kill him, 5.176, etc.; u(po\ gou/nat' e)/lusen 11.579; bla/ptein g. tini, ka/matos d' u(po\ g. e)da/mna, 7.271, 21.52:—Pass., au)tou= lu/to gou/nata 21.114, etc. metaph., e)s go/nu ba/llein bring down upon
the knee, i. e. humble, conquer, Hdt.6.27; e)s g. r(i/ptein, kli/nein, App.BC3.20,30; e)s g. e)lqei=n Procop.Arc.14, Pers.1.17; *)asi/a de\ xqw\n . . e)pi\ go/nu ke/klitai A.Pers.931 (lyr.). prov., a)pwte/rw h)\ go/nu kna/ma 'blood is thicker than water', 'charity begins at home', Theoc.16.18; g. knh/mhs e)/ggion Arist.EN1168b8, Ath.9.383b.
joint of grasses or plants, Hdt.3.98, X.An.4.5.26, Thphr.HP8.2.4, Porph.Antr.19. (Cf. Skt.
jā´nu, Lat.
genu, etc.)

gonu^-algh/s, e/s,
suffering pain in the knee, Hp.Epid.6.4.11.

gonu^-kamyepi/kurtos, on,
twisting the knee awry, of the gout, Luc.Trag. 203.

gonu^-kausagru/pna, h(,
keeping awake by inflammation of the knee, ib.201.

gonu^-kli^ne/w,
bend the knee, Eust.669.32.

gonu^-kli^nh/s, e/s,
on bended knee, g. e)xo/meno/s tinos POxy.1089.31 (iii A. D.).
gonu^-kli^te/w, = gonukline/w, Simp.in Epict.p.107 D.

gonu^/-krotos, on,
knocking the knees together, of the gait of women, Arist.HA538b10 (Comp.); of effeminate men. Anacr.144, Arist.Phgn.808a13, 810a34.

gonu^-pete/w,
fall on the knee, Plb.15.29.9, etc.
fall down before one, tina/ Ev.Matt.17.14, cf. Ev.Marc.1.40: abs., Corn.ND12.

gonu^-peth/s, e/s, (pesei=n)
falling on the knee, Tim.Pers.189; e(/drai g. a
kneeling posture, E.Ph.293.

gonu^-plh/c,
ruscus, Gloss.
gonw/dhs, es, = gonoeidh/s, Hp.Coac.446.
gonw/nh: o)ri/ganos, Hsch. go/on, v. goa/w.

go/os, o(,
weeping, wailing, sxe/qe d' o)/sse go/oio Od.4.758; also of
louder signs of grief, ib.103; e)rikla/gktan go/on Pi.P.12.21; a)ri/dakrus g., polu/dakrus g., A.Pers.949 (lyr.), Ch.449 (lyr.); go/ous dakru/ein S. Aj.579; oi)ktra=s g. o)/rniqos, of the nightingale, ib.629 (lyr.); g. tino/s
grief for one, Q.S.3.644; so go/ous pro\s au)th\n [tou/twn] qhso/mesq', a(\ pa/sxomen
for our sufferings, E.Or.1121: in late Prose, LXX 3 Ma.1.18 (pl.), al.
gora/pies: r(a/fanoi, Hsch. gora/tou: h)fino/n, oi( de\ r(anw=, Id.

*gorga/s, a/dos, h(, = *gorgw/, Phot. s.v. plo/kion *gorga/dos: pl., E. Hyps.Fr.41 (64).77. h( pali/mfrwn *g., of Hera, Lyc.1349. in pl.,
sea-nymphs, S.Fr.163:—also *gorgi/des, Hsch.

*go/rgeios, a, on,
of or
belonging to the Gorgon, *gorgei/h kefalh/ Il.5.741, Od.11.634; *go/rgeion, to/,
a Tragic mask, EM238.46, Poll.10.167, etc.

gorgeu/w,
move rapidly, hasten, Sm.Ec.10.10, Hsch.
busy oneself, tini/ or meta/ tinos PPar.18.6.12 (ii A. D.).

gorgi/a,
agilitas, Gloss.

*gorgi^-a/zw,
speak like Gorgias, Philostr.VS1.16.2.

*gorgi^/-eios, on,
of Gorgias, Gorgias-like, r(h/mata X.Smp.2.26; sxh/mata D.H.Dem. 5; of vases,
called after one Gorgias, IG11(2).128.31, al. (Delos, iii B. C.).

*gorgolo/fas, ou, o(,
he of the Gorgon-crest, Ar.Ach.567:—fem. *gorgolo/fa, hs, h(, Id.Eq.1181.

*gorgonei/a (sc. li/qos), h(,
coral, Plin.HN37.164: *gorgonia\s bota/nh,
Gorgon-like plant, Dam.Isid.68.
*gorgo/nh, h(, = *gorgw/, Hdn.Epim.17, Suid.
*gorgo/nion, to/, = h)ru/ggh, Ps.-Dsc.3.21.

*gorgonw/dhs, es,
Gorgon-like, Sch.E.Ph.146.

*gorgo/nwtos a)spi/dos ku/klos, h(, a shield
with the Gorgon on it, Ar. Ach.1124.

gorgo/omai, Pass.,
to be spirited, of a horse, X.Eq.10.4.

gorgo/s, h/, o/n,
grim, fierce, terrible, g. o)/mm' e)/xwn, of Parthenopaeus, A.Th.537; o)/mmasi gorgo/s E.Ph.146 (lyr.); toi=s kertomou=si gorgo\n w(s a)nable/pei looks
fiercely at . . , dub. l. in Id.Supp.322; gorgo/teroi i)dei=n, o(ra=sqai,
terrible to behold, X.Cyr.4.4.3, Smp.1.10; gorgo\n ble/pein look
terrible, Ael.VH2.44; of horses, g. i)dei=n X.Eq.10.17; i(/ppou g. ble/mma Poll.1.192; in Ephebic Inscrr., fi/loi, gorgoi/, gnh/sioi, IG3.1079.
spirited, vigorous, of persons, Luc.DDeor.7.3, Asin.8; of animals, PRyl.238.9 (iii A. D.);
quick, c. inf., g. e)pinoei=n Procop. Arc.16. Adv. -gw=s, tre/xein Choerob.Rh.p.247 S. of literary style,
vehement, vigorous, v.l. in D.H.Comp.19 (Comp.), Hermog. Id.1.11,2.1 (Comp.). Adv. -gw=s Syrian. in Metaph.130.6, Eust.1082.5, etc.

gorgo/ths, htos, h(,
rapidity, Sm.Ec.2.21, Gloss. of style,
vehemence, vigour, Hermog.Id.2.1, Procl.in Prm.p.509 S., Sch.Od. 1.110, etc.

*gorgotomi/a, h(, (te/mnw)
cutting off the Gorgon's head, Str.8.6.2.
gorgo/fqalmos, on, = gorgwpo/s, Suid. s.v. gorgw=pis.

*gorgofo/nos, on,
Gorgon-killing, E.Fr.985: fem. *gorgofo/na, as a name of Athena, Id.Ion1478 (lyr.).

go/rgu_ra (Dor. ge/rg-), h(,
underground drain or
sewer, Alcm.132, cf. AB233, Hsch.: used as
a dungeon, Hdt.3.145, cf. Harp., etc.

*gorgw/, h(,
the Gorgon, i.e.
the Grim One (cf. gorgo/s), Hes.Sc.224, 230: acc. pl., *gorgou/s Id.Th.276.—Sg. *gorgw/ Il.11.36: gen. *gorgou=s 8.349, Hes.Sc.224, E.Or.1521, Ion1003, etc.; also *gorgw/n Id.Rh. 306: gen. *gorgo/nos Id.Fr.360.46, Ph.456 (s. v.l.): acc. *gorgo/na Id.Or.1520: pl. *gorgo/nes, acc. -as, are the regul. forms (but v. supr.), Hes.Sc.230, A.Pr.799, al.: gen. *gorgo/nwn Pi.P.12.7, E.Ba.990 (lyr.).

gorg-wpo/s, o/n,
fierce-eyed, grim-eyed, se/las A.Pr.358; ko/rai E.HF 868; i)/tus Id.Ion210 (lyr.); gorgwpa\ leu/sswn Id.Hyps.Fr.16(18); a)le/ktwr AP7.428 (Mel.); to\ g. Corn.ND20.
gorg-w/y, w=pos, o(, h(, = foreg., E.El.1257, Or.261:—fem. gorg-w=pis, idos, of Athena, S.Aj.450, Fr.844.
gorgw/yato: pikro\n e)/bleye, Hsch. gordeli/zein: a)dolesxei=n, Id.

*go/rillai, ai(, name of a tribe of hairy women (but prob.
gorilla), Hanno Peripl.18.
goro/s: kurto/s, Hsch., Cyr., Zonar. (Perh. f.l. for guro/s.)
*gorpiai=os, o( (sc. mh/n), name of a Macedonian month, J.BJ2.17.8, Plu. Thes.20, etc.; at Nysa, SIG781.4 (i B. C.).
go/rtuc: o)/rtuc, Hsch. go/runos: mu=s, ba/traxos, Id.; o( mikro\s ba/traxos, Zonar. (Cf. gu/rinos.)
goruni/as, Boeotian name for mursi/nh a)gri/a, Ps.-Dsc.2.110.

gorfi/a, ta/,
stocks from which olive-trees are struck (Aram.
gerōphīth), Gp.9.5.12.
gota/n: u(=n (Maced.), Hsch.
goubena/rion, to/, dub. in POxy.921 Intr. (iii A. D.).

goubiko/s, f.l. for kubiko/s, Hero
*Stereom.1.48.

gou=n or g' ou)=n, Ion. and Dor. gw=n (ge ou)=n); restrictive Particle with an inferential force,
at least then, freq. scarcely distinguishable from simple ge: twice in Hom. (with a second ge added), ei)/ g' ou)=n e(/tero/s ge fu/gh|sin Il.5.258; mh\ e)me/ g' ou)=n ou(=to/s ge 16.30 (so e)/oika gou=n tou/tou ge . . sofw/teros ei)=nai Pl.Ap.21d); freq. later, doke/wn pa/gxu deuterei=a gw=n oi)/sesqai Hdt.1.31; gnw/sei . . o)ye\ gou=n to\ swfronei=n A. Ag.1425, cf. 432 (lyr.), etc.; freq. in adducing an instance, or a fact giving rise to a presumption, Heraclit.58, Th.1.2, X.Cyr.1.5.8; to\n gou=n a)/llon xro/non in past time
at all events, D.20.16; emphasizing a personal or possessive pronoun, to\ g. e)mo/n S.OT626, cf. Ant.45; introducing an apodosis, Pl.Alc.1.112b; simply emphatic,
why yes, E.Ph.618, Pl.Sph.219d, etc.; each Particle has its full force in ta\s gou=n *)aqh/nas oi)=da
well (ou)=n), I know Athens (ge), S.OC24:—freq. separated by a word, pa/nu g' a)\n ou)=n Ar.Ec.806, cf. Th.1.76, etc.:— rarely ge ou)=n in full, D.H.2.56 codd. (The negat. form is ou)/koun . . ge.）
gou=na, gou/nwn, poet. pl. of go/nu (q. v.).

gouna/zomai, fut. -somai: aor. 1 gounasa/mesqa Orph.A.618, subj. gouna/sshai A.R.4.747, cf. Orph.A.943: (go/nu):—Ep. Verb,
clasp another's
knees (v. sub go/nu 1.2): hence,
implore, entreat, abs., Il. 11.130: c. inf., tw=n u(/per . . gouna/zomai ou) pareo/ntwn e(sta/menai kraterw=s in whose name . . I
implore you to stand your ground, 15.665; nu=n de/ se pro\s patro\s gouna/zomai Od.13.324; nu=n de/ se tw=n o)/piqen g., . . pro/s t' a)lo/xou kai\ patro/s 11.66; mh/ me . . gou/nwn gouna/zeo
entreat me not by [clasping] my knees, Il.22.345.

gou/n-asma, atos, to/,
supplication, Lyc.1243:—also goun-asmo/s, o(, Eust.627.9.
gou/nata, gou/nasi, Ep. gou/nessi, etc., v. go/nu.
gouniai=os to/pos, sine expl., Hsch. gounonni/a: sa/myuxos, Id.

gouno/omai (also -e/omai, Hsch.), contr. -ou=mai, = gouna/zomai, only pres. and impf., gounou=mai Il.21.74, Od.6.149, Archil.75, Anacr.1.1, etc.; gounou/mhn Od.11.29; gounou=sqai 10.521; gounou/menos 4.433, etc.

gouno-pa^xh/s, e/s,
thick-kneed, v. l. gouno-pa^gh/s,
cramping the knees, *)axlu/s Hes.Sc.266.

gouno/s, o(,
high ground, futo
 w(\s gounw=| a)lwh=s Il.18.57; a)na\ gouno
 a)lwh=s oi)nope/doio Od.1.193, etc.; e)k *krh/ths e)s gouno
 *)aqhna/wn 11.323; th=s *)attikh=s . . to
 g. to
 *souniako/n Hdt.4.99: pl., gounoi=sin *)eleuqh=ros mede/ousa Hes.Th.54; gounoi=sin kate/nasse *nemei/hs ib.329; e)n gounoi=s *)aqana=n Pi.I.4(3).25. (Expld. as to/pos gonimw/tatos by Sch.Il. l.c., but better as u(yhlo\s to/pos (cf. go/nu) Orion 38, EM239.5.)

gou/nth, h( (Lydian word),
tomb, Keil-Premerstein
Zweiter Bericht 255 (iii A. D.):—also gouta/rion, to/, Ramsay
Cities and Bishoprics No. 566.

gou=ros, o(, a kind of
cake, Sol.38.3.

goutta=ton, to/, a kind of
cake, Chrysipp. Tyan. ap. Ath.14.647c.

gow/dhs, es,
mournful, a(rmoni/ai Pl.Lg.800d (Sup.); fwnh/ Arist. HA615b5.
gra=, v. gra/w.

gra/a, h(, a kind of
serpent, Peripl.M.Rubr.38.
graba/n: ska/fion, bo/qron, Hsch. gra/batos, v. kra/batos.

gra/bdhn, Adv., (gra/fw)
grazing, scraping, Eust.852.8, EM781.27.
grabdi/s, h(, = sq., EM239.28 (acc. gra/bdis, Sch.D.T.p.197 H.).

gra/bion, to/,
torch, Strattis 50, Amerias ap.Ath.15.699e, prob. in S.Fr.177 (pl.).
gra/za, v. ghra/mwn. gra/qma, v. gra/mma.

grai=a, late Poet. nom. grai/h, Dor. grai/a (only gen. sg. in Hom.), h(,
old woman, Od.1.438, S.Tr.870, E.Tr.465, al.: as Adj., grai=ai dai/mones, of the Eumenides, A.Eu.150 (lyr.), cf. 69. as Adj., of things,
old, grai/as e)rei/khs Id.Ag.295; grai/as a)ka/nqhs S.Fr.868; grai=an w)le/nhn E.Ion1213; grai/a| xeri/ Id.Hec.877; graia=n phra=n Theoc.15.19; stafulh\ grai/h
raisins, AP6.231 (Phil.). *grai=ai, ai(,
the Graiae, with hair grey from their birth, Hes.Th.270, prob. in A.Fr.262. = grau=s 11,
scum or
skin which forms over boiled milk, etc., Arist.Pr.893b32.
folds of skin below the navel, Ruf. Onom.99, Poll.2.170. = grau=s 111,
sea-crab, Epich.61. = ka/rdopos, Hsch.
graibi/a or graiti/a (i. e. graivi/a）: panhguri/s (Tarent.), Hsch.

gra_i/+dion, to/, Dim. of grai/+s,
old hag, Ar.Pl.536:—elsewh. contr. gra/|dion, ib.674, Philyll.5, X.An.6.3.22, D.18.260, Men.Georg.54, etc.: barbarous form gra/|dio Ar.Th.1194.

grai/+zw (grau=s 11),
skim milk, etc., Ar.Fr.446.

*graiko/s, o(, Greek, *(/ellhnes w)noma/sqhsan to\ pro/teron *graikoi\ kalou/menoi Marm.Par.11 (iv B. C.), cf. Arist.Mete.352b2, Apollod.1.7.3, Call.Fr.104, Lyc.532, etc.; *grai=kes Alcm.134, S.Fr.518 is of doubtful meaning, cf. also *(raiko/s:—hence *graik-i/ths, ou, o(, Lyc.605:

gouno-i/zw,
speak Greek, Hdn.Epim.12:

gouno-isti/,
in Greek, EM239.19. (Local name for a tribe in West Greece, applied by the Italians to Greeks in general.)

grai/nw, = gra/w,
gnaw, Hsch. graiole/as: ponhra\s h)\ o)leqri/as grai/as, Id.

graio/omai, Pass.,
become aged, withered, of a vine, AP9.261 (Epigon.).
gra_i/+s, i/+dos, h(, = grau=s, grai=a, Charito 6.1, PMag.Lond.125.21 (v A. D.), Palch.in Cat.Cod.Astr.1.95.

graiwpi/as, ou, o(,
man like an old woman, Hsch. gramaitita/, grammateuta/, Hsch.

gra/mma, atos, to/, Dor. gra/qma, prob. in IG4.506 (Heraeum, vi/v B. C.), cf. An.Ox.1.102, but gra/ssma, IG4.554 (Argos, v B. C.): late Aeol. pl. gro/ppata, Epigr.Gr.990.11 (Balbilla): (gra/fw):—
that which is drawn: pl.,
lines of a drawing, picture, etc., E.Ion1146 (of tapestry), Theoc.15.81;
picture, *)ape/llew g. Herod.4.73, cf. AP 6.352 (Erinna): sg.,
drawing, picture, Pl.R.472d, Cra.430e, cf. 431c: pl.,
figures in a picture, Procop.Gaz.Ecphr.p.157B.
written character, letter, Hdt.1.139, 148, etc.: in pl.,
letters, characters, gramma/twn te sunqe/seis A.Pr.460; phli/kois g. Ep.Gal.6.11;
the letters, the alphabet, Hdt.5.58; ta\ g. kai\ ta\s sullaba/s Pl.Cra.390e; g. *foini/kia S.Fr.514; *)assu/ria, *(ellhnika/, Hdt.4.87; gra/mmata e)pi/stasqai Pl.Lg.689d; maqei=n to have learnt
to read, Id.Prt. 325e; g. mh\ ei)de/nai SIG2844.6; e)di/daskes gra/mmata, e)gw\ d' e)foi/twn you
kept school—I went there, D.18.265; h)/toi te/qnhken h)\ dida/skei g. Com.Adesp.20; paideu/ein gra/mmata Arist.Pol.1337b24; te/xnh h(mw=n g. our profession is that of the
scribe, PTeb.316.16 (i A. D.).
articulate sound, letter, Pl.Phlb.18c; ta\ g. pa/qh e)sti\ th=s fwnh=s Arist.Pr.895a12; gra/mmata fqe/ggesqai ib.8, cf. PA660a5. para\ gra/mma le/gonta . . skopei=n
etymologically, Id.MM1185b39; ta\ para\ g. skw/mmata puns, Id.Rh.1412a28; but a)reth\n para\ g. diw/kontes, with ref. to *nikare/th, the mistress of Stilpo, Crates Theb.1.
inscription, to\ *delfiko\n g. Pl.Phdr.229e, cf. Chrm.164d, X.Mem.4.2.24, etc., IG 2.2876, al.: prov., ei)s pe/lagos . . gra/mmata gra/yai Epigr.Gr.1038.8 (Attalia). in pl.,
notes in music, AP11.78 (Lucill.). mathematical
diagram, Epigr. ap. D.L.8.12.
letter inscribed on the lots which the dikastai/ drew, Ar.Pl.277, al., Arist.Ath.64.4; practically, =
division of dicasts, e)n o(poi/w| g. deipnei= Ar.Ec.683; a( kata\ gra/mma fulaka/ the
roster of guards, SIG569.21 (Cos, iii B. C.).
quarters of a town, PRein.49.2;
accent, EM240.42, Zonar. a small weight, 1/24
ounce, scruple, Androm. ap. Gal.13.114, Gp.7.13.2, PLips.62 ii 27 (iv A. D.). in pl.,
set of written characters, piece of writing, Hdt.1.124: hence,
letter, Id.5.14, IG22.103.8, etc.; gramma/twn ptuxai/ S.Fr.144, cf. E.IT594, al., Pl.Ep.347c;
inscription, epitaph, etc., e)ko/laye e)s to\n ta/fon gra/mmata le/gonta ta/de Hdt. 1.187, cf. 4.91, And.3.12, Theoc.18.47, IG3.751.
papers, documents, Antipho 1.30, D.36.21, etc. (sg., D.Chr.65.14); tou/twn ta\ g. the
documents to prove this, Lys.32.14; ta\ g. th=s di/khs Ar.Nu.772; ta\ dhmo/sia g. the public
records, Decr. ap. D.18.55;
title-deeds, D.C.65.14;
account of loans, D.49.59; e)pikarpi/an e)n gra/mmasin a)pofe/rein Pl. Lg.955d;
contract or
estimate, BCH46.323 (Teos);
catalogue, X.Cyr.7.4.12: in sg.,
bond, Ev. Luc.16.7;
note of hand, J.AJ18.6.3. a man's
writings, i.e.
book, treatise, ta\ tou= *zh/nwnos g. Pl.Prm.127c (but sg., ib.128a): pl.,
books, X.Mem.4.2.1; *pla/twnos to\ peri\ yuxh=s g. Call.Epigr.25, cf. AP9.63 (Asclep.), Gal.18(2).928; ta\ i(era\ g. the Holy Scriptures, OGI56.36 (iii B. C.), Ph.2.574, 2 Ep.Ti.3.15, J.Ap.1.10; i(era\ g., = Imperial
rescripts, IG12(5).132 (Paros, iii A. D.); =
hieroglyphics, OGI90.54 (Rosetta, ii B. C.): in sg., the Law of Moses, Ep.Rom.2.27, al.; opp. pneu=ma, ib.29: sg.,
article of a treaty, Th. 5.29.
laws or
rules, Pl.R.425b, Plt.292a, al., Ar.Ec.1050; kata\ gra/mmata a)/rxein, opp. a)/neu gramma/twn, Pl.Plt.293a; h( kata\ g. kai\ no/mous politei/a Arist.Pol.1286a15, cf. 1272a38: oi( kata\ g. no/moi, opp. oi( kata\ ta\ e)/qh, ib.1287b5, cf. Pl.Plt.299d; kata\ gra/mmata i)atreu/esqai Arist.Pol.1287a34; h( e)k tw=n g. qerapei/a ib.40. in pl., also,
letters, learning, a)pei/rous gramma/twn Pl.Ap.26d, etc.
grammaqe/pta: drape/ta, Hsch. (leg. gra/mmaq' e(pta/).

gramma/rion, to/,
weight of two obols, Aët.7.117.

gramma^t-ei/a, h(,
office of grammateu/s, PTeb.30.18 (ii B. C.), Plu. Comp.Eum.Sert.1, BGU587.11 (ii A. D.); the
term of such office, JRS2.243 (Phrygia).
learning, LXX Si.44.4.

gramma^t-eidiopoio/s, o(,
a maker of tablets, title of plays by Apollodorus of Carystus (Ath.7.280d) and Apollodorus of Gela (Poll.4.19).

gramma^t-ei=on, to/,
that on which one writes, tablets, Ar.Fr.157, Antipho 1.10, Pl.Prt.326d, prob. in Gorg.Pal.6;
tablet on which names, etc., are recorded, leleukwme/na g. Arist.Ath. 47.2, cf. D.46.11, IG12.91.11, etc.
bond, document, contract, Lys. 32.7; kata\ grammatei=on h(tairhke/nai Aeschin.1.165, cf.POxy.1012 Fr. 9 ii 15;
account-book, ledger, Ar.Nu.19, D.45.33: freq. written gramma/tion. to\ lhciarxiko\n g.
list in which Athenian citizens
were enrolled, IG12.79, Is.7.27, D.57.26.
will, testament, Is.6.29.
pass(?), PPetr.3p.130.
memorandum, D.22.23, Jul.
ad Ath. 283b;
petition, Luc.Peregr.16.
place where gra/mmata
were taught, a school, Anon. ap. Suid.
office of grammateu/s, Plb.4.87.8, Poll.9.41.
public dining-hall in Syria, Posidon.18.

gramma^t-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
secretary, registrar, title of officials at Athens and elsewhere,
IG12.15, etc.; o( g. o( th=s po/lews Th.7.10; g. tou= dh/mou OGI493.10 (Ephesus, ii A. D.), Act.Ap.19.35; g. a)ndrapo/dwn PHib.29.7; g. tw=n maxi/mwn UPZ110.145 (ii B. C.); g. tou= qeou= IG9(2).1109.21 (Magn. Thess.); also of subordinate officials,
clerk, sts. a term of contempt, o)/leqros g. D.18.127; qeoi=s e)xqro\s kai\ g. Id.19.95; h( g., in joke, Ar. Th.432. metaph.,
recorder, of memory, Pl.Phlb.39a.
scholar, g. safh/s A.Fr.358 (s. v. l.).
one who traces or
marks out, of Egyptian embalmers, D.S.1.91.
gramma^t-euta/, v. gramaitita/.

gramma^t-eu/w,
to be secretary, hold his office, IG12.392, Th.4.118, etc.: c. dat., IG12.352, etc.; later, c. gen., g. tou= sunedri/ou IG3.752.

gramma^t-hfo/ros, o(,
letter-carrier, D.H.20.4, Plu. Galb.8, al., PFlor. 39.6 (iv A. D.), etc.
gramma^t-i/as (sc. li/qos), ou, o(, precious stone like an emerald, v. l. in Plin.HN37.118:—Hsch. has grammati/as: periespasme/nous.
gramma^t-i/dion, v. grammatei/dion.

gramma^t-i/zw,
teach the spelling of a word, Herod.3.24:—Pass., pf.
to be skilled in gra/mmata, Hsch.; grammatisme/nos (sic)
man of education, Cat.Cod.Astr.6.65.8.
to be a secretary, sune/drois IG5(1).1432.19 (Messene); Boeot. grammati/ddontos IG7.1739 (Thespiae), al.

gramma^t-ikeu/omai, Dep.,
to be a grammarian, AP9.169 (Pall.).

grammatikoma/stic, i_gos, o(,
scourge of critics, title of Aus.Idyll.14.

gramma^t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
knowing one's letters, a good scholar, X.Mem. 4.2.20, Pl.Tht.207b, Arist.EN1105a21: Comp., Pl.Plt.285d, Ph.1.621; opp. a)gra/mmatos, Arr.Epict.3.19.6; a)nh\r g. Plu.2.582a. Adv. -kw=s Pl.Tht. l.c., etc. g. e)/kpwma a cup
engraved with the alphabet or
an inscription, Eub.69, cf. Ath.11.466d, Luc.Lex.7. g. a)na/gkai f.l. for grammikai/, Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.46. Subst., grammatiko/s, o(,
teacher of the rudiments, Hp.Epid.4.37, Plu.2.59f:—fem. -kh/, Sammelb.5753.
one who occupies himself with literary texts, grammarian, critic, Plb.32.2.5, D.L.3.61, D.Chr.53.1, IG14.1183, etc.; first used of Apollodorus of Cyrene, acc. to Clem.Al. Strom.1.16.79:—fem. -kh/, h(, Ath.1.14d.
concerned with textual criticism, e)ch/ghsis D.H.Th.51; grammatika/, title of work by Eratosthenes, Clem.Al. l.c. h( -kh/ (with or without te/xnh)
grammar, Pl.Cra.431e, Sph.253a, etc.; h( g. e)pisth/mh Arist.Top. 142b31.
faculty of scholarship, g. e)stin e(/cis pantelh\s e)n gra/mmasi Eratosth. ap. Sch. D.T.p.160 H., cf. Ph.1.502, AP7.588 (Paul. Sil.).
alphabet, script, Str.3.1.6, Plu.Arist.1, etc.; h( i(era\ g. hieroglyphic
writing, OGI56.64 (iii B. C.). grammatiko/n, to/,
fee paid to scribes in Egypt, PHib.1.110 (iii B. C.), PTeb.61b.89 (ii B. C.), etc.

gramma^/t-ion, to/, Dim. of gra/mma, Luc.Merc.Cond.36. = grammatei=on,
bond, contract, POxy.71.5 (iv A. D.).

gramma^t-isth/s, ou=, o(, = grammateu/s,
clerk, registrar, Hdt.2.28, 3.123, IG7.1745 (Thespiae), SIG 529.4 (Dyme, iii B. C.), etc.: metaph.,
recorder, of memory (cf. grammateu/s 2), Pl.Phlb.39b.
one who teaches gra/mmata,
elementary schoolmaster, X.Smp.4.27, Pl.Prt.312b, al., D.19.281, D.H.11.28, Diog.Oen.11, etc.

gramma^t-istikh/, h(,
elementary teaching, Phld.Rh. 1.70S., S.E.M.1.44, Them.Or.23.297d (also -ka/, ta/, Id.Or.21.251a): but distd. fr. grammatikh/ as more elementary, Ph.1.540.
gramma^to-di^daska^lei=on, to/, = grammatei=on11, Plu.2.712a, al.

gramma^to-di^da/ska^los, o(,
schoolmaster, SIG578.8 (Teos), Telesp.50 H., Phld. Acad.Ind.p.24 M., Plu.Alc.7, Porph.Plot.3,BGU1214.4; cf. grammodidaskali/dhs.

gramma^to-eidh/s, e/s,
line-like, diafu/seis Sch.Il.21.169.

gramma^to/-eis, essa, en,
inscribed, sth/lh Rev.Phil.46.127 (Miscamus).

gramma^to-eisagwgeu/s, o(,
schoolmaster: governor, LXX De.1.15, al.

gramma^to-ku/fwn [u_], wnos, nickname of a grammateu/s,
porer over records, D.18.209, Ph.2.536: pl., ib.520.

gramma^to-likri^fi/s, i/dos, o(,
puzzle-headed grammarian, AP11.140 (Lucill.).

gramma^to-pi/nac [i^], akos, o(,
map-maker, Sch.D.P.5.

gramma^to-fore/w,
carry or
deliver letters, Str.5.4.13.

gramma^to-fo/ros, o(,
letter-carrier, Plb. 2.61.4, al., Plu.Pel.10.
gramma^to-fu^la^kei=on, to/, = sq. 1, J.BJ2.17.6, Plu. 2.520c, S.E.M.2.27.

gramma^to-fu^la/kion [a^k], to/,
a place for keeping records, Plu.Arist.21, OGI669.23 (i A. D.), IG5(2).516 (Lycosura, i A. D.), 5(1).20 (Sparta, ii A. D.): in pl., ta\ th=s po/lews g. BGU913.4 (iii A. D.).
deed-box, EM412.38.

gramma^to-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
recorder, registrar, IG5(1).32B17 (Sparta), OGI229.51 (Smyrna), Test.Epict.8.27.

grammh/, h(, (gra/fw)
stroke or
line of a pen,
line, as in mathematical figures, grammh=s lo/gos o( tw=n du/o Pythagorei ap.Arist. Metaph. 1036b12, cf. Pl.Men.82c, R.509d, etc.; peri\ a)lo/gwn g. title of work by Democritus, peri\ a)to/mwn g., title of work ascribed to Arist.: hence grammai/, ai(,
astronomy, AP9.344 (Leon.); also in forming letters,
line traced by teacher, Pl.Prt.326d;
outline, opp. skia/, Metop. ap. Stob.3.1.116, cf. Plb.2.14.8; h( e)kto\s g. Hero Aut.27.2. = balbi/s,
line across the course, starting- or
winning-point, Pi.P.9.118, cf. Ar.Ach.483; eu)qu\s a)po\ g. Lib.Or.59.13: metaph. of life, pe/las grammh=s i(ke/sqai E.El.956; e)p' a)/kran h(/komen g. kakw=n Id.Fr.169; h( e)sxa/th tou= bi/ou g. D.S.17.118: hence,
boundary-line, edge, dub. l. in Hp.Art.80;
cutting edge of a knife, Gal.2.673.
line or
square on a chequer-board: hence prov., to\n a)po\ gramma=s kinei=n li/qon to move a piece from this line, i. e. try one's last chance, Theoc. 6.18 (usu. called h( i(era/ (sc. grammh/), cf. i(ero/s）; ai( g.
the board itself, Poll.9.99. dia\ grammh=s pai/zein to play at
tug-of-war (dielkusti/nda), Pl.Com.153.1, Pl.Tht.181a. h( makra/ (sc. grammh/), v. tima/w 111.1. Medic.,
linea alba, Gal.2.514. = ze/a, Hippiatr.1.

gramm-iai=os, a, on,
linear, sxh=ma Dam.Pr.262.
gramm-i/zw, prob. f.l. for dia-, of a game (cf. grammh/ 111.1), Eust.633.63.

gramm-iko/s, h/, o/n,
linear, geometrical, qewri/a Gal.UP10.12; a)po/deicis Plu.Marc.14, Theol.Ar.26; a)na/gkai Olymp.in Grg.p.260 J. Adv. -kw=s
by means of lines, geometrically, a)podei/knusqai S.E.M.3.92, cf. Ptol.Alm.2.12, Procl.
in R.2.27 K. g. a)riqmo/s
linear number, Nicom.Ar.2.7, cf. Speus. ap.Theol.Ar.61. = grammatiko/s, Plu.2.606c (s.v.l.).

gramm-isth/r, h=ros, o(,
a surgical instrument, Hermes38.281.

gramm-isto/s, h/, o/n,
chequered, Eust.852.11.
grammo-di^daska^li/dhs, = grammatodida/skalos, in contempt, Timo 51.

grammo-eidh/s, e/s,
slender as a line, fw=s Paul.Al.G.4. Adv. -dw=s
in wavy lines, Arist.Mu.395a27.

grammo-poi/ki^los, on,
striped, Arist.Fr. 295.

grammo/s, o(,
act of writing, Hdn.Gr.1.168.

grammoto/kos, on,
mother of lines, me/lasma, of the leaden plummet, AP6.63 (Damoch.).
granqe/wna: ge/ronta, Hsch.

gra_ologi/a, h(,
old wife's talk, gossip, grammatikh\ g. S.E.M.1.141: pl., Porph. Chr.34.

gra_o-so/bhs, ou, o(,
lover of old women, Ar.Pax812; cf. Sch.ad loc., and v. soba/s.

gra_o-sulle/ktria, h(,
gossip-monger, Suid. S. V. *ti/maios.

gra_o-trefh/s, e/s,
reared by an old woman, coddled, Eust.971.41.

gra_o/-fi^los, o(,
lover of old women, Sch.Ar.Pax812.
grapi/nhs: oi)=nos traxu/s, Hsch., EM239.32.

gra/pis, idos, h(,
cast slough of serpents, etc., Hsch.
wrinkled, S.Ichn.177, EM239.31. kind of
bird, Hsch.

grapt-e/on,
one must write or
describe, o(/pws . . X.Eq.2.1;
one must write, spell, Str.9.4.5, Gal.15.720. grapte/os, a, on,
to be written, described, Pl.Ep.341d, Luc.Im.17.
grapt-eu/s, e/ws, o(, = grafeu/s, Sch. Ar. Th.1103.

grapt-h/r, h=ros, o(,
writer, AP6.66 (Paul. Sil.), Man.1.132 (pl.).

gra/pt-hs, ou, o(,
wrinkled, Eust.633.56.

grapt-o/s, h/, o/n,
painted, zw=|a Emp.128.5; tu/poi E.Fr.764; ku/rbis Achae.19; ei)kw/n SIG 1068.21 (Patmos): grapta/, ta/,
paintings, opp. glupta/, D.H.Comp. 25.
marked as with letters, a( grapta\ u(a/kinqos Theoc.10.28; g. li/qos IG14.1089.
written, no/moi g. Gorg.Pal.30, cf. Pl.Lg.773e, etc.; a)sfa/leia PAmh.78.17 (ii A. D.): grapta/, ta/,
rescripts, proclamations, LXX 2Ma 11.15;
legal documents, bonds, Man.3.214.

gra/pt-ra, ta/,
fee for writing or
copying, PLond.ined.2110 (ii A. D.), BGU1062.20 (iii A. D.), POxy.895.12 (iv A. D.).

grapt-u/s, u/os, h(,
scratching, tearing, Od.24.229 (pl.). in pl.,
writings, A.R.4.279.
gra/sqi, v. gra/w.

gra/sos, o(, prop.,
smell of a goat: hence, of men, A. or Ar. ap. Phot. s.v. yo/, Eup.242, Arist.Pr.879a23, Plu.2.180c, M.Ant.9.36.
gra/ssma, atos, to/, Argive, = gra/mma, IG4.554 (pl.).

grast-i/zw,
feed at grass, i(/ppous Gp.16.1.11 (Pass.), Hippiatr. 98.

grast-ismo/s, o(,
feeding at grass, ib.10.

gra/st-is, ews, h(, (gra/w)
grass, green fodder, PPetr.2p.113 (corr. in 3p.333) (iii B. C.), etc.; g. puri/nh, kriqi/nh, Hippiatr.68,98, cf. Eust.633.47, Hsch.:—also gra/ssis, PHamb.39 ii (ii A. D.); cf. kra/stis.

gra/swn, wnos, o(, h(, (gra/sos)
smelling like a goat, M.Ant.11.15, Ath. 13.585e; a term of abuse, Hsch. = gra/sos, M.Ant.8.37 (s. v.l.).
graswni/a, h(, = gra/sos, Archig. ap. Aët.8.7 (pl.).
grau=is, idos, h(, Dor. for grhu=s, grau=s, Call.Fr.326.
grau/kalas: o)/rnis tefro/s, Hsch.

grau=s, gen. gra_o/s, h(: Ion. grhu=s, grho/s, voc. grhu=: poet. also grhu/+s, voc. grhu/+: barbarous voc. gra=o in Ar.Th.1222: nom. pl. gra=es Ar.Fr.350, Timocl.25: acc. grau=s E.Andr.612, etc.:—
old woman, Hom., esp. in Od., 1.191, al., A.Eu.38, etc.; g. palaih/ Od. 19.346: prov., graw=n u(/qlos
old wives' fables, Pl.Tht.176b: with Subst., g. gunh/ E.Tr.490, Ar. Th.345, D.19.283: Com., o( grau=s of
an old man, Ar.Th.1214 cod. R.
scum of boiled milk, Id.Pl. 1206, Arist.GA743b7.
sea-crab, Arist.HA601a18 (as v.l.), Artem.2.14. kind of
locust, g. se/rifos Zen.2.94.
gra^f-ei/dion (or -i/dion), to/, Dim. of sq., Isoc. ap. TheonProg.5, EM240.16, Suid.

gra^f-ei=on, to/,
pencil, Hp.Superf.8 (f.l.), Arist.Ph. 248b8, Macho ap.Ath.13.582c.
paint-brush, Plu.2.859e, S.E. P.1.28;
graving tool, chisel, Epigr.Gr.980.4 (Philae).
registry, record-office, Michel595.12 (Halic.), PRyl.65.4 (i B. C.), PAmh. 110.21 (i A. D.), etc.:—written gra/fion, PPetr.3p.155.
tax on writing-materials, BGU277 ii 11: but in pl.,
fees for copying, ib. 1214.12.

gra^f-h/, h(,
representation by means of lines: hence,
drawing, delineation, Hdt.4.36; kata\ grafh/n in
outline, cj. in Pl.Smp.193a; also of
painting, grafh=| kosme/ein Hdt.3.24; ei)kw\n grafh=| ei)kasme/nh Id.2.182;
the art of drawing or
painting, Pl.Plt.277c, Ti.19b.
that which is drawn or
painted, drawing, picture, o(/son grafh=| only
in a picture, Hdt.2.73; pre/pousa/ q' w(s e)n grafai=s A.Ag.242 (lyr.); spo/ggos w)/lesen grafh/n ib.1329; mh/te a)/galma mh/te g. Arist.Pol.1336b15; also of embroidery, A.Ch.232; grafai\ a)po\ kerki/dos Philostr.Im.2.5. g. pareiw=n
painting, rouging the cheeks, Id.Ep.22.
writing or
the art of writing, Pl.Phdr.274b, etc.: pl., ai( g. tw=n dikw=n
the registration of . . , Arist.Pol.1321b36; grafai\ peri\ summaxi/as, of treaties, ib.1280a40.
that which is written, writing, S.Tr.683, Agatho 4: hence, of various written documents,
letter, Th.1.129: also in pl., E.IT735; yeudei=s g. spurious
documents, ap.D.18.55 (but in E.Hipp.1311 false
statements); of published
writings, tw=n
filoso/fwn Phld.Ir.p.73 W., cf. D.H.Orat.Vett.4; e)n th=| prw/th| g. in the first
book, Epicur.Nat.Herc.1431.16;
written law, Pl.Lg.934c;
contract, PAmh.2.43.13 (ii B. C.): pl.,
copies of judgements delivered in court, IG12(2).526d8 (Eresos).
catalogue, list, return, i(erw=n PTeb.88.2 (ii B. C.); tou= kat' a)/ndra OGI179.21 (Egypt, i B. C.); ta\s kat' a)/ndra grafa/s PTeb.27.7 (ii B. C.), etc.;
price-list, D.S.1.91.
inscription, Th.1.134, IG12(5).679 (Syros), Epigr.Gr. 347 (Cios), D.C.37.21.
MS. reading, Str.1.2.25, Gal.15.430, Alex.Aphr.in Sens.9.29, Herm.in Phdr.p.154A., etc.
the Holy Scripture, Aristeas155, 2 Ep.Pet.1.20: pl., Ph.1.18, J.Ap.2.4, Ev.Matt.21.42, al.: also in sg., of a particular passage, Act.Ap.8.32, al. g. farma/kou medical
prescription, Gal.12.293, 13.638, 15.918.
record-office, archive, IG11(2).203B101 (Delos, iii B. C.). (gra/fomai) as law-term,
bill of indictment in a public prosecution, le/ge, th\n g. au)th\n labw/n D.18.53.
criminal prosecution in the interest of the state (cf. Poll.8.41), grafh\n u(/brews kai\ di/khn kakhgori/as i)di/an feu/cetai Id.21.32, cf. Lys.1.44, Is.11.28, etc.; grafh\n gra/fesqai Pl.Lg.929e, etc.; gr. g. tina/ Id.Euthphr.2b, etc.; g. a)penegkei=n Aeschin.3.217; grafh/n tinos diw/kein tina/ D.19.293; polla\s g. diw/cas ou)demi/an ei(=len Antipho 2.1.5; grafh\n a(lw=nai Id.2.2.9; g. kataskeua/zein kata/ tinos, e)pi/ tina, D.21.103, 22.2; g. ei)se/rxesqai, ei)sie/nai, appear before the court
in a public prosecution, either as prosecutor or prosecuted, Id.18.105. generally,
an ordinary public action, opp. to special forms (such as ei)saggeli/a, eu)/qunai, etc.), grafa/s, eu)qu/nas, ei)saggeli/as, pa/nta tau=t' e)pago/ntwn moi D.18.249, cf. X.Ath.3.2, Lys.16.12.
gra^/f-hma, atos, to/, = gra/mma, AB787.
gra^f-h/s, o(, = grafeu/s 11, IG5(2).8 (Tegea, iv B. C.),al.
gra^f-i/a, h(, = grafh/, Gloss.

gra^f-iko/s, h/, o/n,
capable of drawing or
painting, Pl.Tht.144e, Ael.VH14.37: Comp.,
a better judge of painting, ib.2.3: -kh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(,
the art of painting, Pl. Grg.450c, etc. of things,
as if painted, *)/erwtes Plu.Ant.26 (so Adv. -kw=s ibid., 2.747c, Luc.Im.15);
picturesque, pro/soyis D.S.2.53.
of or
for writing, suited for writing: -kh/, h(,
the art of writing, Hp.VM20; g. le/cis, opp. a)gwnistikh/, Arist.Rh.1413b8; du/namis Alcid.Soph.29; g. r(e/eqron, i.e. ink, AP6.63 (Damoch.); ka/lamos Gp.10.75.8, PGrenf.2.38.7 (i A. D.); me/lan Gal.6.565;
in writing, g. a(ma/rthma a
clerical error, Plb.34.3.11.
skilled in writing, Arr. Epict.2.18.2;
shorthand writer, IG14.1528.
able to describe, Plu.2.874b, Luc.Alex.3; of style,
graphic, lively, D.H.Amm.1.4; u(po/qesis g. a subject
for description, Plu.Alex.17.

gra^fio-eidh/s, e/s,
like a stylus, g. e)/kfusis
styloid process of the temporal bone, Gal.UP7.19, 11.4.

gra^fio-qh/kh, h(,
case for grafei=a, Gloss.

gra^fi/skos, o(,
surgical instrument for extracting arrows, etc., Cels.7.5.3.

gra^foeidh/s, e/s, a)po/fusis, of the
styloid process of the ulna, Gal.2.252,271.
gra/fos [a^], eos, to/, = gra/mma, ta\ gra/fea SIG9 (Olympia, vi B. C.), IG5(2).343 (Orchom. Arc., iv B. C.).

gra/fw [a^], fut. -yw Hdt.1.95, etc.: aor. e)/graya, Ep. gra/ya Il.17.599: pf. ge/grafa Cratin.124, Th.5.26, etc.; later gegra/fhka PHib. 1.78.2 (iii B. C.):—Med., fut. gra/yomai Ar.Pax 107, etc. (but in pass. sense, Gal.Protr.13): aor. e)graya/mhn Ar.V.894, etc.:—Pass., fut. gra^fh/somai Hp.Acut.26, Nicom.Com.1.39, (meteg-) Ar.Eq.1370; more freq. gegra/yomai S.OT411, Theoc.18.47, etc.: aor. e)gra/fhn [a^], Hdt.4.91, Pl.Prm.128c, etc.; e)gra/fqhn SIG57.5 (Milet., v B. C.), Archim.Fluit.2.4: pf. ge/grammai (also in med. sense, v. fin.), 3sg. e)/graptai Opp.C.3.274; part. e)gramme/nos or h)gr- SIG9 (Elis, dub.), Leg.Gort.1.45, al.; later gegra/fhmai Ph.2.637: 3pl. gegra/fatai IG 12.57.10, Dor. gegra/bantai Schwyzer 90.12 (Argos): plpf. e)ge/grapto X.Mem.1.2.64: 3pl. e)gegra/fato D.C.56.32. Used by Hom. only in aor. Act.:—
scratch, graze, ai)xmh\ gra/yen oi( o)ste/on a)/xris Il.17.599; gra/yas e)n pi/naki ptuktw=| qumofqo/ra polla/
having marked or
drawn signs thereon, 6.169: hence, later,
represent by lines, draw, paint, Hdt.2.41, A.Eu.50, Pl.R.377e; gh=s perio/dous g.
draw maps, Hdt.4.36; g. *)/erwq' u(po/pteron Eub.41.1; prospepattaleume/non g. to\n *promhqe/a Men.535.2; a)ndria/nta g. Pl.R.420c; zw=|a g., = zwgrafei=n (q. v.), Id.Grg.453c: metaph., o(po/sa tou\s leimw=nas ai( w(=rai gra/fousi Philostr.Im.Praef.:—Med., zw=|a gra/fesqai Hdt.4.88:—Pass., ei)kw\n gegramme/nh Ar.Ra.537; pi/nakes gegramme/noi ta\ *)aleca/ndrou e)/rga Philostr.VA2.20. Math.,
describe a figure, Euc.Post.3, al., Archim.Sph.Cyl.1.23, al., Gal.1.47. of a point or line in motion,
generate a figure, Arist.Mech.848b10, al.; to\ samei=on e(/lika gra/yei Archim.Sph.Cyl.1, cf.Apollon.Perg.Con.1.2, Hero Aut.8.1.
brand, mark, Opp.C.1.326:—Pass. in form gegra/fatai, ib.322.
express by written characters, write, ti Hdt.1.125, etc.; g. diaqh/khn Pl.Lg.923c, cf. X.Cyr.4.5.34 (Pass.); g. tini\ o(/ti . . Th.7.14; g. tini/, c. inf., SIG552.13 (Abae, iii B. C.); g. ti ei)s difqe/ras Hdt.5.58: prov., o(/rkous . . gunaiko\s ei)s u(/dwr gra/fw S.Fr.811, cf. Xenarch.6; ei)s te/fran g. Philonid.7; ei)s u(/dwr, e)n u(/dati, Men. Mon.25, Pl.Phdr.276c; e)n xrusw=| pi/naki Id.Criti.120c; e)n floiw=| Theoc.18.47; kaq' u(/datos Luc.Cat.21; ei)s pe/lagos gra/mmata gra/yai Epigr.Gr.1038.8 (Attalia):—Pass., po/qi freno\s ge/graptai in what leaf of memory
it is written, Pi.O.10(11).3.
inscribe, g. ei)s sku=la, ei)s sth/lhn, E.Ph.574, D.9.41:—Pass., gra/fesqai/ ti
to be inscribed with a thing, S.Tr.157; w(=de ge/grammai
have my name inscribed, IG12(7).3* (dub.); e)n tw=| prosw/pw| grafei\s th\n sumfora/n
having it
branded on his forehead, Pl.Lg.854d; gegramme/na kwku/ousan, of the hyacinth, Euph.40.
write down, g. tina\ ai)/tion
set him
down as the cause, Hdt.7.214; g. ti i(ero/n tini
register as . . , Pi.O.3.30; in magic,
invoke a curse upon, Tab.Defix.Aud.14A1; g. tina\ klhrono/mon, e)pi/tropon,
institute by a written document, Pl.Lg.923c, 924a;
register, enrol, e)me\ gra/fe tw=n i(ppeu/ein u(perepiqumou/ntwn X.Cyr. 4.3.21; ou) *kre/ontos prosta/tou gegra/yomai, as a dependent of Cr., S. OT411. g. tini/
write a letter to one, g. soi\ i(/na ei)dh=|s PGrenf. 1.11 ii 21 (ii B. C.), etc.; ei)/s tina Luc.Syr.D.23. g. peri/ ti/nos
write on a subject, X.Cyn.13.2, etc.; u(pe/r tinos Plb.1.1.4, etc.; ei)/s tina
against . . , Longin.4.3; pro/s tina
address a work to . . , Id.1.3;
describe, oi( u(f' h(mw=n grafo/menoi kairoi/ Plb.2.56.4; esp. of Prose, opp. poiei=n, Isoc.2.48: c. dupl. acc., ti/ . . gra/yeiein a)/n se mousopoio\s e)n ta/fw|
; E.Tr.1189.
write down a law to be proposed: hence,
propose, move, gnw/mhn, no/mon, yh/fisma, etc., X.HG1.7.34, Ar.Nu. 1429, etc.: abs. (sc. no/mon), D.18.179; g. kai\ nomoqetei=n peri/ tinos Id.24.48; g. po/lemon, ei)rh/nhn, Id.10.55, 19.55: c. inf., su\ gra/feis tau=t' ei)=nai stratiwtika/ Id.1.19; e)/graya . . a)poplei=n . . tou\s pre/sbeis Id.18.25;
enact, no/moi ou(\s to\ plh=qos sunelqo\n e)/graye X.Mem.1.2.42:—Pass., para\ ta\ grafe/nta dra=n Pl.Plt.295d; to\ gegramme/non u(po\ sou= yh/fis ma Din.1.70.
prescribe, ordain, po/tmos e)/graye Pi.N.6.7. o( gra/fwn to\n *)ocurugxi/thn (sc. nomo/n) the
secretary for the nome of Oxyrhynchus, POxy.239.1 (i A. D.); tw=| i)di/w| lo/gw| gra/fonti to\n nomo/n PFlor.358.5 (ii A. D.). Med.,
write for oneself or
for one's own use, note down, Hdt. 2.82, IG12.57.39, etc.; g. ti e)n fresi/n A.Ch.450 (lyr.); frenw=n e)/sw S.Ph.1325; e)graya/mhn u(pomnh/mata I
wrote me down some memoranda, Pl.Tht.143a;
cause to be written, suggrafh/n D.56.6, etc.; g. pro/sodon pro\s th\n boulh/n
petition for a hearing before the Council, Id.24.48.
enrol oneself, gra/yasqai fulh=s kai\ dh/mou kai\ fratri/as IG12.374.16, ib.2.115b21: abs., of colonists, Pl.Lg.850b; but also (cf. A.11.3), e(/na tw=n maqhtw=n e)me\ gra/fou
enrol me as one of
your disciples, Id.Cra.428b. as law-term, g. tina/
to indict one, tino/s
for some public offence, e.g. th=s ai)sxrokerdei/as, Pl.Lg. 754e; g. [tina\] parano/mwn D.18.13; in full, grafh\n gra/yasqai/ tina Ar.Nu.1482 (but in Pass., ei)/ soi gra/foito di/kh ib.758); gra/yasqai di/kas SIG344.38 (Teos): c. acc. et inf., g. tina\ a)dikei=n Ar.V.894, cf. Pax107: abs., oi( graya/menoi
the prosecutors, Id.V.881; e(te/rois ou)k h)=n gra/yasqai And.1.75; also gra/fesqai/ ti
indict an act, i. e. the doer of it, as criminal, e)gra/yato th\n *xabri/ou dwreia/n he
brought a grafh\ parano/mwn
against the person who proposed the grant to Chabrias, D.20.146, cf. 95; to\ xa/rin tou/twn a)podou=nai parano/mwn gra/fei (2sg.) Id.18.119. Pass.,
to be indicted, grafei\s a)pe/fugon D.18.103; tou=to to\ yh/fisma e)gra/fh parano/mwn
was indicted as illegal, Aeschin.3.62; yhfi/smata u(po\ tou/tou ou)de\ grafe/nta not even
indicted, D.18.222 (but in 18.28, ei) mh\ tou=t' e)gra/fh if this decree
had not
been proposed, as Pass. of A. 11.6); ta\ gegramme/na
the articles of the indictment, Id.18.56; to\ gegramme/non
the penalty named in the indiclment, Id.24.83:—but ge/grammai usu. takes the sense of the Med.,
indict, Id.18.59, 119, cf. Pl.Euthphr.2b, Tht.210d.

grayai=os, o(,
crab, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.3.106d.
grayei/w, Desiderat. of gra/fw, Gloss.

gra/w,
gnaw, eat, Call.Fr.200: hence gra/: fa/ge (Cypr.), Hsch.; gra/sqi (imper.), Inscr.Cypr.144 H.(Golgoi). (Cf. gra/stis, Skt.
grásati 'devour'?)
gra_w/dhs, es, = grai+ko/s, a)dolesxi/a Chrysipp.Stoic.2.255; muqologi/a Str.1.2.3; muqa/rion Cleom.2.1, cf. Iamb.VP23, 105, 1 Ep.Ti.4.7: Comp. -e/steros Gal.5.315.
greu=s, h(, collat. form of grau=s, Hdn.Gr.1.401.

grhgor-e/w, late pres., formed from pf. e)grh/gora (q. v.),
to be or
become fully awake, watch, LXX Ne.7.3, Ev.Matt.24.43, al., Ach.Tat. 4.17; e)pi/ tisi LXX Ba.2.9; e)pi\ ta\s po/leis ib.Je.5.6:—Pass., e)grhgorh/qh e)pi\ ta\ a)sebh/mata/ mou ib.La.1.14; opp. kaqeu/dw, of life opp. death, 1 Ep.Thess.5.10.

grhgo/r-hsis, ews, h(,
wakefulness, LXX Da.5.11.
grhgor-i/a, h(, = foreg., Gloss.

grhgor-iko/s, h/, o/n,
wakeful, watchful, Id.
grh/gor-sis, ews, h(, = grhgo/rhsis, Ph.1.510.
grh/i+os, on, Ion. for grai=os, Call.Fr.511.
grh/nh: a)/nqh su/mmikta, EM241.14, Hsch.
grh=nos or grh=nus, = a)grhno/n, Eratosth.Fr.33.
grhu=s, grhu/+s, Ion. and Ep. for grau=s.
gri=nos, o( and h(, Aeol. for r(ino/s (i.e. vri=nos), acc. to Eust.1926.56; cf. gri/nos: de/rma, Hsch., EM241.47.

gri/nths, ou, o(,
tanner, Hdn.Gr.2.429 (grhnti/s cod., Hsch.). = u(bristh/s, Cyr., Zonar. = ou)rano/s Cyr. (gri/ntis EM241.48).

gri_pa/omai,
to be contracted or
convulsed, Hsch.

gri_p-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
fisher, Sapph.120, Theoc.1.39, Mosch.Fr.1.9, AP7.305 (Addaeus), Procop.Pers.1.4.
maker of fishing-nets, Hsch.

gri_p-eu/w,
fish, Zonar.

gri_p-e/w,
catch: metaph.,
gain, ou)de\n e)gri/phsan LW2261 (Syria): pf. part. gegrifw/s, Hsch.

gri_p-hi\s te/xnh, h(, art
of fishing, AP6.223 (Antip.).

gri_p-i/zw, = gripeu/w, Hsch.: metaph., of
netting a profit, Lib.et Bas.Epp.14.1, cf.
Et. Gud.d s.v. grumei/a.

gri_/p-isma, atos, to/,
that which is caught, gain, EM241.22, Zonar.

gri=pos, o(, = gri=fos, AP6.23, Artem.2.14.
haul or
take of fish, D.L.1.32.

gri/pwn [i_], o(, （gri=pos)
fisherman, gri/pwnos gripeu\s . . e)/xwse ta/fon AP7.504.12 (Leon). (Prob. a pr. n.)

gri/swn, wnos, o(,
pig, Hdn.Gr.2.429.
grith/, h(, dub. sens. in Lib.et Bas.Epp.15.1, 16.2 (perh. f.l. for gru/th).

gri_fa=sqai, Lacon. = gra/fein, Hsch.; also,
scratch, Id.: a)lgh/mata grifo/mena (prob. -w/mena)
lancinating pains, Hp.Prorrh.1.100, cf. Gal.ad loc.

gri_feu/w,
ask riddles, Ath.10.451b (cf. Diph.50), Eust.884.10.

gri_fo-eidh/s, e/s,
enigmatical, Hsch.

gri_fo-plo/kos, on,
weaving riddles, Tz. ad Hes.Op.588.

gri=f-os, o(, = gri=pos,
fishing-basket, creel, Plu.2.47Id, Opp.H.3.80, PTeb.486 (ii/iii A. D.). metaph.,
anything intricate, dark saying, riddle, Ar.V.20, Demetr.Eloc.153, Ath.10.448b sqq.; g. proba/llein Antiph.74.5; le/gein gri/fous para\ po/ton Id.124.2; distd. fr. ai)/nigma, Poll.6.19.
forfeit paid for failing to guess a riddle, Hsch.

grif-o/ths, htos, h(,
obscurity, Hdn.Epim.6.

grif-w/dhs, es,
like a riddle, Luc.JTr.28, Ath.10.456c.

gromfa/zw,
grunt, Gloss.:—from gro/mfaina, h(,
old sow, Id.:— also gromfa/s, a/dos, h(, Hsch., and gro/mfis, ios, h(, acc. gro/mfin, Hippon.69.
gronqa/rion, to/, Dim. of gro/nqos 11, marginal gloss on xelw/nion, Apollod.Poliorc.178.4 codd.

gronqokopw=,
beat with fists, Gloss.
gronqoneu/etai: qumou=tai, brenqu/etai, Hsch.

gro/nqos, o(, = pugmh/,
fist, Gloss. Oxy.1099.18, Hsch., etc.; kate/kteinan gro/nqois kai\ lakti/smasi PAmh.2.141.10 (iv A. D.); gro/nqw| pai/sas Sch.Il.2.220; g. palastiai=os, = spiqamh/, Aq.Jd.3.16, al., cf. Hero
*Geom.4.11.
spoke on a machine, Ps.-Apollod.Poliorc. p.46 Thévenot.

gro/nqwn, wnos, o(,
first lessons on the flute, Poll.4.83, Hsch.
gro/ppa, v. gra/mma.
gro/ptos, Aeol. for grapto/s, Epigr.Gr.991.14 (Balbilla).
gro/sunon: ta/racon, Hsch. (cf. o)roqu/nw).

grosfoma/xos, on,
fighting with the gro/sfos, oi( g., = Lat.
velites, Plb.1.33.9, 6.21.7.

gro/sfos, o(, a kind of
javelin, Plb.6.22.4, Str.4.4.3, Plu.Sull.18.
grosfofo/ros, on, = grosfoma/xos, Plb.6.21.9.
grou=mos: stro/bilos, Hsch.

grouno/s, o(, = gruno/s, Call.
Fr.anon.84.
grou/ssetai: mhru/etai, e)ktei/netai, Hsch.

grofa/, Dor. for grafh/,
painting, IG4.1484.271 (Epid.).
grof-eu/s, e/ws, o(, Dor. and Arc. for grammateu/s, IG4.498 (Mycenae); g. bwla=s ib.12(3).1259.16 (Cimolus), 5(2).357.20 (Stymphalus). = zwgra/fos, Hsch.
grof-eu/w, Dor. = grammateu/w, IG 4.609.8 (Argos).
grofi/s, Dor. = grafi/s, IG4.1484.292 (Epid.).
gro/fw, Dor. = gra/fw, IG12(3).1075 (Melos), Schwyzer 209 (Melian, from Olympia).

gru=, used with negs., a)pokrinome/nw| . . ou)de\ gru= not
a syllable, Ar.Pl. 17, cf. D.19.39; mhde\ g. le/ge Men.521; o)/you mhde\n . . mhde\ g. not
a morsel, not
a bit, Antiph.190.13; diafe/rei *xairefw=ntos ou)de\ g. Men. 364, cf. Sam.310, Aristaenet.1.17, Jul.
ad Ath.273b. (Expld. of the noise of swine, not even
a grunt, by Sch.Ar. l.c.; also,
a small coin, Suid.; but prop., =
dirt under the nail, Hsch., who also explains it as = gru/th, cf. gru/c.)
grubo/s, o(, = gru/y, Hsch., EM242.2.

gru/zw, fut. gru/cw, Ar.Eq.294 codd., LXX Ex.11.7, gru/comai Alc. Com.22: aor. e)/gruca (v. infr.):—
say gru= (v. sub voc.),
grumble, mutter, gru/zein de\ kai\ tolma=ton . .
; Ar.Pl.454; paido\s fwnh\n gru/cantos Id.Nu.963; ei)/ ti gru/cei Id.Eq.294; mh\ flau=ron mhde\n gru/zein Id.Pax 97 (anap.); gru/zontas ou)de\ touti/ Id.Ra.913; ou)k e)to/lma gru/cai to\ para/pan prob. in Is.8.27: c. dupl. acc., e)gw\ me\n ou)/te xrhsto\n ou)/te se gru/zw a)phne\s ou)de/n Call.Iamb.1.257; later,
growl, of a dog, LXX l.c.;
grunt, of a pig, Alciphr.3.73;
grumble, murmur, pro/s tina Porph. Abst.1.27. fut. gru/sei, = th/cei
will liquefy, Arist.Pr.876b18.
gruh/lion: r(wsmh\n druo/s, Hsch.

grukto/s, h/, o/n, （gru/zw） a)=ra grukto/n e)stin u(mi=n
; will ye
dare to grumble? Ar.Lys.656.

gru_l-i/zw ( grulli/zw is incorrect acc. to Phryn.PSp.58 B.), Dor. fut. grulicei=te Ar.Ach. 746:—
grunt, of swine, Ar.l.c., Pl.307, D. Chr.7.74; of a person, Procop.Arc.17.

grof-ismo/s, o(,
grunting, Arist.HA535b17 (written grull- in Poll.).
grof-i/wn: xoi=ros, Hsch.
gru/llh: u(w=n fwnh/, Hsch.

grullismo/s, o(,
Egyptian dance, Phryn.PSp.58B.

grullogra^fe/w (gru/llos 2),
draw caricatures, opp. kalou\s dhmiourgei=n pi/nakas, Phld.Rh.2.297 S.

gru=los, later gru/llos, Hsch., o(,
pig, porker, Plu.2.986b, Zonar. = go/ggros, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.8.356a, Nic.Fr.122.

gru_me/a (in codd. freq. written grumai/a), h(,
bag or
chest for old clothes, etc., Diph.127, Poll.10.160, Phryn.PSp.60 B.:—also grumei=a or grof-ei/a, ibid.,
Et.Gud.d. = gru/th 1 (Hsch.),
trash, trumpery, Sotad. Com.1.3; of persons,
riff-raff, r(h/toras kai\ poihta\s kai\ pa=san th\n toiau/thn g. Phld.Ir.p.65 W., cf. Them.Or.21.257a; g. pantodapw=n bibli/wn Dam.Isid.293:—hence gru_meopw/lhs, ou, o(, Luc. Lex.3.
grumpa/nein, = gru/ptein, Hsch.
gru/nh: libanwto/s, Theognost. Can.108.
gruno/n, = si/kus a)/grios, Ps.-Dsc.4.150.

gru_no/s, o(,
fagot, firebrand, Hom.Fr.18, Lyc.86,294.
gru=nos, o(, = gru/y, Hsch.
gru/c: o( to/pos (leg. r(u/pos） tou= o)/nuxos, Hsch.

gru_pa/etos [a_], o(,
a kind of griffin or
wyvern, Ar.Ra.929.
gru_pai/nw, = grupo/omai, Dionys. ap. Harp., Hsch.

gru_pa^lw/phc, h(,
griffin-fox, nickname in Hp.Epid.6.8.29.

gru_pa^ni/zw,
become wrinkled, of the earth in earthquake, Antipho Soph. 31.

gru_p-a/nios, on,
wrinkled, of the earth, Antipho Soph. 30:—also gru_p-a/nion or gru_p-a/lion, to/,
old woman, Hsch.

gruph/, h(, in pl.,
vulture's nests, Hsch.
gru_p-no/n: stugno/n, kathfe/s, Hsch.; cf. gnu/pwn.

gru_p-o/omai, Pass.,
to become hooked, of the nails, Hp.Prog.17, Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.18, Gal.8.47.

gru_p-o/s, h/, o/n,
hook-nosed, aquiline, opp. simo/s, X.Cyr. 8.4.21, Pl.R.474d, etc.: generally,
hooked, o)/nuxes Aret.SA2.1, SD 1.8;
curved, gruph\ gasth/r a
round paunch, X. l. c.; g. ste/fanos Eub.105 (Sup.); to\ grupo/n, = grupo/ths, Arist.Pol.1309b24.

gru_p-o/ths, htos, h(,
hookedness, of the nose, opp. simo/ths, X.Cyr.8.4.21, Arist. Rh.1360a27; of a beak, Plu.2.994f; of talons, ib.641d.

gru_/p-tw,
become bent or
wrinkled, Hsch.: aor. 2 e)/grupon,
become wrinkled: metaph. of the earth in an earthquake, Melanth.Hist.1: in pf. part. Pass., ga=n e)grumme/nan Annuario 3.195 (Gortyn).

gru_/p-wsis, ews, h(,
crooking, hooking, of the nails, Cael.Aur.CP2.32, Steph.in Hp.1.187 D.

grusmo/s, o(, (gru/zw)
a grunting, Agathocl.2.
gru_ta/rion, to/, Dim. of gru/th, Zen.5.54, CPHerm.9.5 (pl., iii A. D.).
gruteu/etai: paraskeua/zetai, Hsch.

gru/th [u_], h( (also gru=ta, h(, Gloss.),
woman's dressing-case or
vanity-bag, Sapph.156; skeuw=n g. prob. a workman's
tool-bag, PPetr.3p.78.
frippery, Phryn.209, PSp.60 B.; cf. grith/: pl., = skeu/h, Hsch. of fish, lepth\ g. small
fry, Gp.20.12.2.
gru_to-do/kh, h(, = grume/a1, AP6.254 (Myrin.).

gru_to-pwlei=on, to/,
small-ware shop, Gloss.

gru_to-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
seller of small wares, Sch.Ar.Pl.17: written krut-, BGU9i12 (iii A. D.).

gru/y, gen. gru_po/s, o(,
griffin, Aristeasap. Hdt.3.116, cf. 4.13, A. Pr.804, IG12.280.80; tra/peza e)/xousa po/das a)naglu/ptous gru=pas SIG 996.10 (Smyrna). a bird, prob. the
Lämmergeier, LXX Le. 11.13, De.14.13. pl., part of a ship's
tackle, or
anchor, Hsch.

grwqu/loi: gwlioi/, sph/laia, Hsch. grwqw/nh: sapra\ grau=s, oi( de\ th\n palaia\n o)/nhsin, Id. grw/na (s. v. l.), h(,
sow (Lacon.), and pl. grwna/des, Id.

grw=nos, h, on, (gra/w)
eaten out, cavernous, Lyc.631,1280;
hollow, pelli/des Nic.Al.77. in pl.,
those who listen and do not speak, Hsch. as Subst. grw/nh (sc. pe/tra), h(,
hole, g. muodo/xoi Nic.Th.794 (pl.).
hollow vessel, kneading-trough, AP7.736 (Leon.).
gu/aia, ta/, (gu/hs 11) = prumnh/sia, AP10.1 (Leon.), Hsch.

gu^a/las [a^], o(,
a Megarian
cup, Philet. ap. Ath.11.467c, Parth.ibid.

gu^a^loqw/rac, a_kos, o(,
cuirass composed of front- and back-piece, Paus.10.26.2.

gu/a^lon [u^], to/,
hollow, in Il. always of the
breast- or
back-piece of the cuirass, [qw/rhka] gua/loisin a)rhro/ta Il.15.530: sg., usu. of the
front-piece, 5.99, al.
hollow of a vessel, krath/rwn g. E.IA1052 (lyr.);
hollow vessel, xrusou= ge/monta gu/ala qhsaurou\s brotw=n Id.Andr.1093 (v. infr. 4). koi/las pe/tras g.
hollow of a rock, S.Ph. 1081 (lyr.);
cavern, pe/trina [mu/xata] gu/ala E.Hel.189 (lyr.). pl., of
hollow ground, vales, dells, gua/lois u(/po *parnhsoi=o Hes.Th. 499, cf. h.Ap.396; *nu/shs h.Hom.26.5; g. *qera/pnas Pi.N.10.56 (but g. *puqw=nos, *foi/bou Id.P.8.63, E.Ph.237 (lyr.), cf. Ion 245, S.Fr.460, may perh. refer to the rock-chambers of Delphi, cf. gu/ala: qhsauroi/, tamiei=a, Hsch., and so perh. in E.Andr.1093 (v. supr.)); *lu/dia/ t' a)\g gu/ala throughout
the vales of Lydia, A.Supp.550 (lyr.); gu/ala xw/ras Ar.Th.110 (lyr.); ai)qe/ria gu/ala
the vault of heaven, Opp.C. 1.281, cf. Orph.H.19.16.

gu/a^los [u^], o(,
cubical stone, EM243.12; also oxyt. as Adj., gualo\n li/qon a)gka/ssasqai Call.
Fr.anon.331.
guba=|: kolumba=|, Hsch.
gu^bernh/ths, o(, = kub-, PGrenf.1.49.21 (iii A. D.).
gugai/: pa/ppoi, Hsch. gugai/h nu/c: h( skoteinh/, Id.

gu/ghs, ou, o(, a
bird, Dionys.Av.2.16.
gue/lion: ko/lpon, Hsch.

gu/hs [u^], ou, o(,
the curved piece of wood in a plough, to which the share was fitted,
the tree, Hes. Op.427,436.
a measure of land, rarely in sg., E.Heracl.839, v.l. in S.Fr.601;
field, PTeb.105.15 (ii B. C.); g. a)/nudros POxy.918ii 10 (ii A. D.): more freq. in pl.,
lands, *sikeli/as leurou\s gu/as A.Pr.371; a)nhro/tous gu/as ib.708; au)to/sporoi g. Id.Fr.196.5; oi( plhsi/oi g. S.OC58, cf. Tab.Heracl.2.13. metaph. of a wife, a)rw/simoi g. S.Ant.569. = a)straga/lwn, su/nqesis, Hsch. gu/ai: o(doi/, Id. (Fem. (cf. gu/h: me/tron ple/qrou, Hsch.), E.Hel.89, Ba.13 codd.: but tou/s, tou/sde Elmsl.)
guh/ths: xwlo/s, Hsch.; cf. a)mfiguh/eis.
guqi/sswn (prob. gnuq-）: dioru/sswn, Hsch.

gui-alqh/s, e/s,
nourishing the limbs, Nic.Th.529.

gui-alkh/s, e/s,
strong of limb, sw/mata B.8.38, cf. 11.8; h(/bh Opp.H.5.465; palaismosu/nh ib.2.277.

gui-arkh/s, e/s,
strengthening the limbs, nwduni/a Pi.P.3.6.

gui/zw,
take in the hand, coined by EM309.31, cf. Eust.250.36. guio-ba^rh/s, e/s,
weighing down the limbs, palai/smata, ka/matos, A. Ag.63 (lyr.), AP10.12.

gui-bo/ros, on,
gnawing the limbs, eating, meledw=nai (v.l. guioko/ros, dub. sens.) Hes.Op.66; pu=r AP9.443 (Paul. Sil.).

gui/-da^mos, h, on,
taming limbs, conquering, e)n guioda/mais . . xersi/n Pi.I.5(4).59: unless from Subst. -da/mas, o(,
athlete.

gui-do/nhtos, on,
with bruised limbs, Phryn.Trag.2.

gui/-kollos, on,
binding the limbs, Lyc.1202.

gui=on, to/,
limb, Hom., always pl., in phrases such as gui=a le/lunto Il.13.85; u(po\ tro/mos e)/llabe gui=a 14.506; o(/ppote/ ke/n min gui=a la/bh| ka/matos 4.230, etc., cf. A.Pers.913 (lyr.), Id.Eleg.3; gui=a podw=n
the feet, Il.13.512; mhtro\s gui=a
womb, h.Merc.20; gui=a
hands, Theoc. 22.81; gui=on, sg.,
the hand, ib.121 (so prob. as device on signet, Tab.Heracl.1.183); but gui=on
the whole body, Pi.N.7.73, Hp.Epid.6.4.26.—Not in Att. Prose: later, opp. ste/rna kai\ kefalh/, Plu.Arist.14.

guio-pa^gh/s, e/s,
stiffening the limbs, nifa/s AP6.219 (Antip.); ka/matoi IG3.779.6.

guio-pe/dh, h(,
fetter: in pl., Pi.P.2.41, A.Pr.169 (lyr.).

guio/s, h/, o/n,
lame, Call.Dian.177, Lyc.144, Aret.SD2.12; g. po/das AP6.203 (Lacon. or Phil.).

guiota^kh/s, e/s,
melting or
wasting the limbs, peni/h AP6.30 (Maced.). Pass.,
with pining limbs, ib.71 (Paul.Sil.).

guiou=xos, on,
fettering the limbs, Lyc.1076.

guio/xalkos, on,
of brasen limb, Dosiad.Ara6.
gula/rion, to/, = muci=nos, Sch.Opp.H.1.111.

gu^liau/xhn, enos, o(, h(,
long-necked, scraggy-necked, Ar.Pax789.

gulio/s (AB228, EM244.21; also gu/lios, gu/llion, Hsch.), o(,
long-shaped wallet, Ar.Ach.1097, Pax527 (ubiv. Sch.), Critias 34D., Philem.35, IG4.951.80 (Epid.), Lib.Decl.33.41.
hedgehog, Sophr.73.

guli/skos, o(, a
fish (cf. gula/rion,) Hsch. gu/llina: e)rei/smata, gei=soi, Id.

gulla/s, h(, kind of
cup (Maced.), Hsch.; cf. gua/las.

gullo/s, o(,
block of stone, Schwyzer 725 (Milet., vi B. C.), SIG57.25 (Milet., V B.C.); also gulloi/: stolmoi/, Hsch.
gumn-a/ddomai, Dor.for gumna/zomai, Ar.Lys.82.

gumn-a/zw, fut. -a/sw: aor. e)gu/mnasa A.Ag.540: pf. gegu/mnaka Id.Pr.586 (lyr.) :—Med., (v. infr.):—Pass., aor. e)gumna/sqhn [D.]61.43: pf. gegu/mnasmai (v. infr.): (gumno/s):—
train naked, train in gymnastic exercise: generally,
train, exercise, to\ sw=ma, th\n yuxh/n, Isoc.2.11; e(auto\n kai\ tou\s i(/ppous X.An.1.2.7; e(auto\n pro/s ti Arr.Epict.2.18.27: c. inf., g. tou\s pai=da/s ti poiei=n
train or
accustom them
to do a thing, X.Cyr.1.6.32; g. tina/ tini
accustom him
to it, ib.1.2.10; tina\ peri/ ti Isoc.10.5;
teach rhetoric, Phld.Rh.2.50S. :—Med.,
exercise for oneself, practise, gumna/sasqai te/xnhn Pl.Grg.514e; ta\ peri\ ta\s diai/tas Str.14.2.19; gumna/sion to\ ei)wqo/s Ael.VH5.6;
practise gymnastic exercises, Thgn. 1335, Hdt.7.208, Th.1.6. etc.; dro/mw| IG4.955.8 (ii A. D.), etc.; generally,
practise, nau=s -ome/nas X.HG1.1.16; of a disputer, Arist.Top. 108a13, etc.:—Pass., o( gegumnasme/nos
the trained or
practised orator, opp. o( eu)fuh/s, Id.Rh.1410b8; gegumna/sqai pro/s ti, e)/ntini,
be trained or
practised for or
in a thing, Pl.Lg.626b,635c; peri\ ta\ o(/pla gumna/zesqai X.HG6.5.23: c. acc., ta\ pro\s ta\s polemika\s pra/ceis gegumnasme/noi ta\s e(/ceis . . Arist.Pol.1319a22; qh/ran Philostr.VA3.9: c. gen., geg. qala/tths, pole/mwn, sofi/as, Id.Her.2.15,3.1,10.1; kardi/a geg. pleoneci/as tini/ 2 Ep.Pet.2.14; also u(/dwr u(po\ sunexw=n plhgw=n geg. kai\ kekaqarme/non J.AJ3.1.2.
prepare, bibli/dion PFlor.338.4 (iii A. D.). metaph.,
wear out, harass, a)/dhn me . . pla/nai gegumna/kasi A.Pr.586; e)/rws patrw/|as th=sde gh=s s' e)gu/mnase Id.Ag.540; krumo\s . . pleura\ gumna/zei xolh=s, of pleurisy, E.Fr.682:—Pass., tou\s u(permh/keis dro/mous . . gumna/zetai A.Pr.592.
investigate, Sammelb. 5941.12 (Pass., vi A. D.). = gumno/w, PSI1.70 (Pass., vi A. D.).

gumn-a/s, a/dos, prop. fem. of gumno/s,
naked, E.Tr.448: also with masc. Subst., g. sto/los a)ndrw=n Id.Fr.105.
trained, exercised, podi\ gumna/dos i(/ppou (restored for gumna/das i(/ppous) E.Hipp. 1134(lyr.): masc.,
trained, practised, a)mf' a)reth/n IG3.1322. Subst., = gumnasi/a or gumna/sion, gumna/dos e)n teme/nei IG12(7).447 (Amorg.), cf. 12(3).202 (Astypalaea); gumna/dos . . po/non e)ktele/santa Inscr.Cos419.5: pl., Orph.H.28.5.

gumn-a^si/a, h(,
right to use gumna/sion, Arist.Pol.1297a17 (s.v.l.);
exercise, swmatikh\ g. 1 Ep.Ti.4.8: pl., IG22.1006.65, SIG1073.19 (Olympia, ii A. D.); of
military exercises, h( e)n toi=s o(/plois g. Plb.4.7.6; generally,
struggle, Str.3.2.7; ai( kaq' h(me/ran g.
lessons, D.H.Comp.20: metaph. of
mental exercise, Iamb.Comm.Math.24; freq. of disputation, Pl.Tht.169c, Arist. Top.101a27, al.;
training, g. pro\s ta\s politika\s pra/ceis Plb.1.1.2. Rhet.,
practice: hence,
arrangement, disposition, tou= dihgh/matos Theo Prog.4, cf. Aphth.Prog.6.

gumna^siarx-e/w,
to be gymnasiarch, at Athens and elsewhere, IG 3.1104, al., 5(1).481, al. (Sparta), 7.1669 (Plataea), BGU184.3 (i A. D.), etc.; ei)s *promh/qeia Lys.21.3, Is.7.36; g. lampa/di (cf. lampadhfori/a) Id.6.60:—Med., gumnasiarxei=sqai e)n tai=s lampa/si X.Vect. 4.52. trans.,
provide for, supply as gymnasiarch, pa/nta ta\ gumna/sia Keil-Premerstein
Zweiter Bericht No.69 :—Pass.,
to be supplied with gymnasiarchs, gumnasiarxou=sin oi( plou/sioi . ., o( de\ dh=mos gumnasiarxei=tai X.Ath.1.13.
gumna^sia/rx-hs, ou, o(, = -arxos, IG3.1104, Lex ap.Aeschin.1.39. name of a throw at dice, Hsch.

gumna^siarx-i/a, h(,
office of gymnasiarch, X.Ath.1.13 (pl.), Arist.Pol.1323a1, Pl.Ax. 367a, IG12(2).82 (Mytilene), 5(1).531 (Sparta), PAmh.70.3 (ii A. D.), etc.

gumna^siarx-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a gymnasiarch, r(a/bdoi Plu.Ant.33; politei/a Iamb.VP27.130; no/mos IG12(7).515.82 (Amorg.); e)/klogos CPHerm.53.7 (iii A. D.).
gumna^siarx-i/s, i/dos, h(, fem. of -a/rxhs, CIG5132 (Cyren.), PAmh.64.6 (ii A. D.).

gumna^si/arx-os, o(,
gymnasiarch, superintendent of athletic training at Athens and elsewhere, And.1.132, D. 35.48, IG22.1227.4, 5(1).20A5 (Sparta), PAmh.2.130.1 (i A. D.), etc.: fem. h( -arxos, IGRom.3.802 (Pamphyl.).
director of a gumna/sion, Pl.Erx.399a, Phld.Herc.1040.
gumna^s-i/dion, to/, Dim. of sq., Arr.Epict.2.16.29.

gumna^/s-ion [a^], to/, in pl.,
bodily exercises, Pi.Fr.129.4, Hdt.9.33, Hp.Art.58, Pl.R.539d,etc. metaph., gumna/sion gra/fein write
an exercise or
essay, Gal.19.17.
gymnastic school, E.Ph.368, Antipho 3.2.3, Pl.Criti.117c(pl.),etc.; e)k qh)mete/rou gumnasi/ou from our
school, Ar.V. 526: pl., g. ta\ i(ppo/krota the
hippodrome, E.Hipp.229 (anap.). oi( a)po\ g. in Egypt,
those who have received training as e)/fhboi, i.e. the Hellenized inhabitants of the mhtropo/leis, PFlor.179.24 (i A. D.), etc. generally,
school, e)n gumnasi/ois *)akadhmi/as Epicr.11.11; e)n *(omhrei/w| g. Epigr.Gr.860 (Chios); g. a)reth=s Luc.Nigr.19; of a philosophic
school, e)k tou= au)tou= g. Pl.Grg.493d, cf. o( a)po\ tou= au)tou= g. Dam.Pr.399: metaph., gh= g. zwh=s Secund.Sent.15. in collective sense,
the youths who attend the school, IPE2.299.8 (Panticapaeum).

gu/mna^s-is, ews, h(,
exercise, Poll.3.153.

gumna^s-iw/dhs, es,
fit for a gumna/sion,
ornamenta Cic.Att.1.6.2.

gu/mna^s-ma, atos, to/,
an exercise, g. kai\ a)skh/mata th=s r(htorikh=s D.H.Rh.2.1, cf. J.Ap.1.10, Plu.2.1119d; g. th=s yuxh=s Ph.1.590: in pl., rhetorical
text-books, Theo Prog. 1. physical
exercises, Ruf. ap. Orib.inc.2.15, Luc.Anach.8,Ath. 10.413c.

gumna^s-te/on,
one must train, to\ sw=ma X.Mem.2.1.28; of disputation, Arist.Top.164b9. Adj. -te/os, a, on, Philostr.Gym.29, al.
gumna^s-th/rion, to/, = gumna/sion, Gal.6.186: metaph., dikw=n Aristaenet. 2.3.

gumna^s-th/s, ou=, o(,
trainer of professional athletes, X.Mem.2.1.20, Pl.Lg.720e, etc.; i)atro\s kai\ g. Arist.EN1180b14.

gumna^s-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
fond of athletic exercises, skilled in them, Hp.Aph.1.3; g. h)\ i)atro/s Pl. Prt.313d: Comp., Philostr.Gym.35: Sup., ib.11;
of the gymnastic master (opp. paidotri/bhs, q.v.), Arist.Pol.1288b18; g. [qerapei/a] Pl. Grg.464b: h(-kh/ (with or without te/xnh),
gymnastics, Id.Smp.187a, etc. Adv. -kw=s Ar.V.1212. g. lh=mma (opp. r(htoriko/n)
suited for dialectical discussion, Stoic.2.76. Adv. -kw=s
by means of testing, Simp.in Ph.139.3.

gumn-hlo/s, h/, o/n,
poor, needy, Hsch., EM243.14.

gumn-h/s, h=tos, o(, = gumno/s, bi/os D.S.3.8. Subst.,
light-armed foot-soldier, Tyrt.11.35, Hdt.9.63, E.Ph.1147, X.An.4.1.28, Hell.Oxy.6.5. in pl., gumnh=tes, oi(,
Argive serfs, Poll.3.83,
Et.Gud.; also gumnh/sioi, oi(, St.Byz.s.v.*xi/os, Eust.adD.P.533. = *gumnosofistai/, Str.15.1.70.

gumn-h/siai nh=soi, ai(, （gumnh/s) the Balearic islands, from the skill of the inhabitants
as light-armed troops, esp. slingers, Arist. Mir.837a30, Str.3.5.1, D.S.5.17, etc.
gumnh/sioi, v. gumnh/s.

gumnht-ei/a (v.l. -hti/a), h(,
light-armed troops, Th.7.37.
nakedness, Corn.ND15;
going unclothed, as a symptom of insanity, Ptol.Tetr.170.

gumnht-eu/w,
to be naked, 1 Ep.Cor.4.11, Demoph.Sent. 8.
to be lightly clad, D.Chr.25.3.
to be light-armed, Plu. Aem.16.

gumnh/t-hs, ou, o(, = f.l. for gumnh/s 11.1, X.An.4.1.6. Adj.,
naked, Lyc.388, Luc.Bacch.3.

gumnht-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a gumnh/s, o(/pla X.Cyr.1.2.4, Plu.Flam.4; to\g., = gumnhtei/a, Str.7.3.17.
gu/mnht-is, idos, h(, fem. of gumnh/ths, in signf. of gumnh/s 11.3, sofi/a, Plu.2.332b.

gumniko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for gymnastic exercises, g. a)gw/n
a gymnastic contest, Hdt.2.91, etc., opp. i(ppiko/s, Id.1.167; opp. mousiko/s, Th. 3.104, Pl.Lg.658a; ta\ g. e)pidei/knusqai POxy.42.5 (iv A. D.): Sup., Luc.Ner.2.

gumno-derke/omai, Pass.,
show oneself naked, Luc.Cyn.1.

gumno/-karpos, on,
huskless, of fruits, Thphr.CP1.17.8.

gumno-koxli/as,
snail, Gloss.

gumno-paidi/ai, ai(,
festival at Sparta,
at which naked boys danced and went through gymnastic exercises, Hdt.6.67, Th.5.82, etc.: later in sg., Plu.2.208d; h( tw=n *lukai/wn g., =
Lupercalia, D.C. 44.11.

gumno-paidikh/ (sc. o)/rxhsis), h(,
dance of naked boys, Ath.14.630d: pl., Phld Mus.p.15K.

gumno-peri/bolos, on,
bare of coverings, epith. of *gumnosofistai/, Ps.-Callisth.3.5.

gumno-pode/w,
go barefoot, Socr.Ep.13.
gumno-po/dhs, ou, o(, = gumno/pous, Suid.

gumno-po/dion, to/,
kind of sandal or
slipper, Poll.7.94.

gumno/-pous, o(, h(, gen. podos,
barefooted, Str.7.2.3, J.BJ2.15.1.

gumno-rru/pa^ros [u^], on,
naked and dirty, of Zeno, D.L.7.16.

gumno/s, h/, o/n,
naked, unclad, g. per e)w/n Od.6.136, etc.; ta\ g. Thphr.Char.4.4: Comp., *)/irou gumno/teros Procop.Gaz.Ep.122; gumno\n sta/dion, opp. o(plitodro/mos, Pi.P.11.49.
unarmed, ou)d' u(pe/meine *pa/troklon, gumno/n per e)o/nt' e)n dhi+oth=ti Il.16.815, etc.; gumna\ ta\ nw=ta pare/xein Plu.Fab.11; ta\ gumna/
parts not covered by armour, exposed parts, Th.3.23, X.HG4.4.12; esp.
right side (the left being covered by the shields), Th.5.10.71. of things
bare, g. to/con an
uncoveredbow,i.e. taken out of the case, Od.11.607; g.o)i+sto/s 21.417; g. ma/xairai Theoc.22.146; ci/fos A.R.1.1254; g. th=| kefalh=| Pl.Phdr.243b. c.gen.,
stripped of a thing, koleou= g. fa/sganon Pi. N.1.52, cf. X.Ages.2.14; ka=pos [de/ndrwn] g. Pi.O.3.24; g. o)stra/kwn A.Fr.337; g. propompw=n Id.Pers.1036 (lyr.); (but also g. tw=n a)ristei/wn a)/ter S.Aj.464): in Prose, g. o(/plwn Hdt.2.141 (v.l.); h( yuxh\ g. tou= sw/matos Pl.Cra.403b, cf. R.577b, Grg.523d: Comp. a)ndria/ntwn -o/teros D.Chr.34.3.
lightly clad, i.e.
in the undergarment only, Hes.Op.391, Ar.Nu.498, Pl.R.474a, Luc.Herm.23;
mikrou= g. e)n tw=| xitwni/skw| D.21.216; of horses,
without harness, Arr. Cyn.24.3. of facts,
naked, bald, gumnw=n tw=n pragma/twn qewroume/nwn D.S.1.76; g. to\ e)/rgon dihgh/sasqai Luc.Tox.42; gumnote/rois xrh/sasqai toi=s o)no/masin Ph.1.5; g. xrh=sqai th=| mimh/sei Demetr.Eloc. 112. Adv. -w=s
baldly, Sch.A.Pers.740.
destitute, PSI6.605.4(iii B.C.), etc.
bare, mere, ko/kkos 1 Ep.Cor.15.37.
beardless, A.R.2.707.
scalped, Archil.161. gumnh/: a)/nhbos, Hsch. prov. of impossibilities, gumnw=| fulakh\n e)pita/tteis Pherecr.144, Philem.12. (Akin to Skt.
nagnás, Lat.
nādus, etc.; cf. lugno/s.）

gumno-sa/nda^los, on,
without sandals, barefooted, PMag.Par.1.2481.

gumno-sofistai/, w=n, oi(,
naked philosophers of India,Arist.Fr.35, Str.16.2.39, Ph.2.27, Plu.Alex.64, Luc.Fug.7, Porph.Abst.4.17:— hence gumno-sofistei/a, h(,
their philosophy, Suid.s.v. *)ada/m.

gumno-spe/rmatos and gumno/-spermos, on,
having the seed with no apparent pericarp, Thphr.HP1.11.2 and 3.

gumno/ths, htos, h(,
nakedness, LXXDe.28.48,Ep.Rom.8.35,M.Ant. 10.27; g.yuxikh/ Ph.1.77.
bare statement, tw=n prota/sewn D.H. Rh.10.6.

gumno-fa^nh/s, e/s,
appearing naked, po/rnai Lyd.Mag.3.65.

gumno/-xrous, o(, h(,
having the body naked, Nonn.D.7.124.

gumn-o/w,
strip naked, ta\ o)ste/a tw=n krew=n g.
strip the bones of their flesh, Hdt.4.61; sw=ma gumnw/santes eu)= S.Ant.410:—Hom. only Med. and Pass.,
strip oneself or
be stripped naked, ai)de/omai ga\r gumnou=sqai Od.6.222; mostly of warriors,
to be exposed, o(/tew| strefqe/nti meta/frena gumnwqei/h Il.12.428; ou)=ta *qo/anta ste/rnon gumnwqe/nta par' a)spi/da 16.312, cf. Od.10.341, Call.
lamb.1.219; tei=xos e)gumnw/qh the wall
was left bare, i.e.
defenceless, Il.12.399: c. gen., gumnw/qh r(ake/wn he
stripped himself of his rags, Od.22.1; later gumnwqe\n ci/fos, do/ru, Hdt.3.64, A.Th.624: metaph.,
to be stripped or
deprived of a thing, Pl.R.601b; a)formh=s Antipho Soph.14. metaph.,
lay bare, fu/sin tw=| lo/gw| Ph.1.118:—Pass., Dam.Pr.400.
lay aside, sa/kkon LXXJu.9.1.

gu/mn-wsis, ews, h(,
stripping, parqe/nwn Plu. Lyc.14, cf. Cat.Ma.20, Dsc.2.173.
exposure, LXXGe.9.22; e)calla/ssein th\n e(autou= g. his
defenceless side (cf. gumno/s 2), Th.5.71.

gumn-wte/os, a, on,
to be stripped of, tino/s Pl.R.361c. gumnwte/on,
one must strip, Gal.10.448: pl., -te/a Them.Or.23.294c.

gu^naik-a/delfos [a^], o(,
wife's brother, PMasp.95.14 (vi A. D.), Sch. S.OT70, Sch.E.Hec.833.

gu^naik-a/nhr [a^], andros, o(,
woman-man: dat. pl., gunaika/ndressi Epich.218, cf. Eust.1132.32.
gu^naik-a/nqh, h(, = a)/mpelos me/laina, Plin.HN23.27.
gu^naik-a/rion, to/, Dim. of gunh/, Diocl. Com.11, Epict.Ench.7, 2 Ep.Ti.3.6, M.Ant.5.11.

gu^naik-ei=os, a, on A. Ch.630 (lyr.), also os, on ib.878, E.IA233 (lyr.): Ion. gu^naik-h/ios, h, on: (gunh/):—
of or
belonging to women, feminine, gunaikei=ai boulai/
a woman's designs, Od.11.437; loutro/n Hes.Op.753; e)/rga Hdt.4.114; ko/smos Pl.R.373c; skeu=os (i.e.
woman) 1 Ep.Pet.3.7; g.ai)doi=on, to/poi, xw=roi, Gal.UP15.3, Aret.SA2.11, CA2.10; ko/lpos ( = ai)doi=on) Sor.1.16; r(ou=s
leucorrhoea, Id.2.43; gono/rroia Aret.SD2.11; i)atro/s Sor.2.3; g. a)gora/ Thphr.Char.2.9; h(g. qeo/s, = Lat.
bona dea, Plu.Caes.9, Cic. 19; g. po/lemos war
with women, AP7.352 (Mel.(?)). in bad sense,
womanish, effeminate, pe/nqos Archil.9.10; dra/mata Ar.Th. 151; maqh/mata Pl.Alc.1.127a; g. kai\ smikra\ dia/noia Id.R.469d. Adv. -ei/ws, pikrai/nesqai Id.Lg.731d; e)mpikrai/nesqai Eus.Mynd.54; diakei=sqai D.C.38.18. as Subst., h( gunaikei/a, Ion. -hi/+h, = gunaikw/n,
part of the house reserved for the women, Hdt.5.20, LXX To.2.11. h( g. (sc. a)gora/), Thphr.Char.22.10. ta\ gunaikei=a
partes muliebres, Hp.Epid.1.26.e',Aret.SA2.11. = ta\ katamh/nia, Hp.Aph.5.28, Arist.PA648a31, al., LXX Ge.18.11.
lochia, Gal.17(2).817.
female disorders, title of works by Hp. and Sor., cf. Thphr.HP4.8.6, Aret.CA1.3. (sc. fa/rmaka)
remedies for female complaints, Hp.Mul.1.64.
women's garments, PSI 4.341.7 (iii B. C.). gunaikei=on, to/, = sti/bi, Dsc.5.84.

gu^naik-eraste/w,
to be a lover of women, and gu^naik-erasth/s, ou=, o(,
woman-lover, Poll. 3.68,70.
gu^naik-h/ios, h, on, Ion. for gunaikei=os (q. v.).
gu^naik-hro/s, a/, o/n, = gunaikei=os, Diocl.Com.4; g. tro/pos Phryn.PSp.55B.

gu^naik-i/as, ou, o(, = gu/nnis,
weakling, Eup.124 (dub.), Luc.Pisc.31, Lib.Or.64.64.

gu^naik-i/zw,
to be womanish, play the woman, Hp.
Aër.22, Ar.Th. 268:—Med., Plb.32.15.7, J.BJ4.9.10.
muliebria pati, Luc. Gall.19: = a)frodisia/zesqai, Hsch.

gu^naik-iko/s, h/,o/n,
womanish, Arist. Pr.895a32, GA766b32 (Comp.); gunaikikw/teroi gi/nontai oi( mastoi/
more like those of women, Id.HA582a13. Adv.gu^naik-kw=s Suid.
gu^nai/k-ion, to/, Dim. of gunh/, Longus3.6.15 (v.l. gu/naion).

gu^nai/k-isis, ews, h(,
womanish behaviour, Ar.Th.863, Lib.Or.64.74.

gu^naik-i/skion, to/,
young girl, Hsch.

gu^naik-ismo/s, o(,
womanish weakness, Plb.30.18.5, cf. Phld.Mus.p.16K., D.S.31.15, Plu.Caes.63.

gu^naik-isti/, Adv.
like a woman, Ath.12.528f.

gu^naiko/-boulos, on,
devised by a woman, mh/tides A.Ch.626 (lyr.).

gu^naiko-gh/ru_tos, on,
proclaimed by a woman, kle/os Id.Ag.487 (lyr.).

gu^naiko-di/daktos [i^], on,
taught by a woman, Olymp.in Alc. p.136C.
gu^naiko-eidh/s, e/s,—gunaikw/dhs, Sch.Ar.Nu.289.

gu^naiko-h/qhs, es,
of womanish disposition, Hsch. s.v. malako/s.

gu^naiko-qoi/nas, o(,
feasted by the women or
feaster of women, epith. of Ares at Tegea, Paus.8.48.4.

gu^naiko/-qu_mos, on,
of womanish mind, Ptol.Tetr.162. Adv. -mws Plb.2.8.12; xeiri/zein ti, of a man, Id.32.15.9.

gu^naiko-i+e/rac, a_kos, o(,
woman-hunter, Anon. ap. Suid.

gu^naiko/-klwy, wpos, o(,
stealer of women, Lyc.771.
gu^naiko/-kosmoi, oi(, = gunaikono/moi, Poll.8.112.

gu^naiko-kra_si/a, h(, (kra=sis)
womanish temper, Str.3.4.18, Plu. Cleom.33 (s.v.l.), 2.20a.

gu^naiko-kra^te/omai, Pass.,
to be ruled by women, Arist.Pol.1269b24, D.S.2.45, Plu.2.755c.

gu^naiko-kra/thtos [a^], on,
ruled by women, Sch.E.Or.742.

-kra^ti/a ( gu^naiko-kra/teia Procop.Arc.5), h(,
dominion of women, Arist.Pol.1313b33, Plu.Cat. Ma.8: title of plays by Amphis and Alexis.

gu^naiko-kto/nos, on,
murdering women, Ph.2.581, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).128.

gu^naiko-ma^ne/w,
to be mad for women, Ar.Th.576, J.BJ1.22.3.

gu^naiko-ma^nh/s, e/s,
mad for women, Chrysipp.Stoic.3.167, Ph.2.312, Gal.5.396, AP12.86（Mel.), Luc.Alex.11.

gu^naiko-ma^ni/a, h(,
madness for women, Chrysipp.Stoic.3.167.

gu^naiko/-masqos or gu^naiko/-mastos, on,
having breasts like a woman: -masqon, to/, abnormal development of the mamma, Gal.19.444, cf. Paul.Aeg.6.46.

gu^naiko/-mi_mos, on,
aping women, gunaikomi/mois u(ptia/smasin xerw=n A.Pr.1005; e)sqh/mata S.Fr.769; mo/rfwma E.Antiop. iiA 7 A.; stola/ Id.Ba.980 (lyr.).

gu^naiko/-morfos, on,
in woman's shape, ib.855, Ph.2.280.

gu^naiko-nome/w,
to be a gunaikono/mos, BCH47.376 (Notium), Artem.2.31.

gu^naiko-nomi/a, h(,
office of gunaikono/mos, Arist.Pol.1322b39.

gu^naiko-no/mos, o(,
supervisor of women, title of magistrate at Athens and elsewhere, Timocl.32.3, Men.272, Arist.Pol. 1299a22, Philoch.103, IG5(1).170 (Sparta, iii A.D.), 1390.26 (Andania, i B. C.), SIG1219.17 (Gambreion).

gu^naiko-pa^qe/w,
to be effeminate, Ath.12.523c.

gu^naiko-pi/phs [i_], ou, o(, (o)pipteu/w)
one who ogles women, Eust.851.54.

gu^naiko-plhqh/s, e/s,
composed of women, o(/milos A.Pers.122 (lyr.); cu/llogoi E.Alc.952.

gu^naiko/-poinos, on,
woman-avenging, po/lemoi A.Ag.225 (lyr.).

gu^naiko-preph/s, e/s,
befitting women, womanish, Plu.2.102e: Comp., Procl.Par.Ptol.203.
gu^naiko-prepw/dhs, es, = foreg., Ptol.Tetr.144 (Comp.).

gu^naiko-pro/swpos, on,
with woman's face, Mim.Oxy.465.203, Sch.Il.1.131.

gu^naiko/-trofos, on,
reared by a woman, Suid. s.v. thqalladou=s.

gu^naiko-u^fh/, h(,
women's weaving, texni=tai th=s kata\ th\n e)re/an pa=san gunaikuufh (sic), PSI4.341.2 (iii B. C.).

gu^naiko-fi/lhs [i^], ou, Dor. gu^nai/ko-as, a, o(,
woman-loving, Polyzel.10, Theoc.8.[60]: voc. -fi/la AP6.78（Eratosth.).

gu^naiko-fo/nos, on,
slaying women, i)xw/r Orph.L.488 (s. v.l.).

gu^naiko/-frwn, on, gen. onos,
of woman's mind, E.Fr.362.34.

gu^naiko-fu^h/s, e/s,
female by nature, Emp.61.4.

gu^naiko/-fwnos, on,
'speaking small like a woman', Ar.Th.192.

gu^naiko/-yu_xos, on,
of womanish soul, Procl.Par.Ptol. 228.

gu^naiko/w,
make effeminate, Ph.2.21 :—Pass., Hp.Epid.6.8.32; parqe/nos ou)de/pote gunaikoume/nh Ph.1.683.

gu^naik-w/dhs, es,
woman-like, womanish, to\ a)genne\s kai\ g. Plb.2.56.9, cf. D.S.2.24, Ph.1.366; a)/nandra kai\ g. pa/qh Plu.Sol.21: -w=des fqe/ggesqai Luc.Nigr.11. Adv. -dw=s Sch.Ar.Th.575.
gu^naik-w/n, w=nos, o(, = sq., X.Cyr.5.5.2.

gu^naik-wni=tis, idos, h(,
women's apartments in a house, opp. a)ndrw/n (cf. gunaikw/n), Lys.1.9, Men.519, Ph.1.107, etc.;
harem of an eastern prince, i.e.
the women, Plu.Cat.Mi.30,2.819d; at Jerusalem, the
women's court in the Temple, J.BJ5.5.2. as Adj., h( g. au)lh/ the court
of the women's apartments, D.S.17.50; e(sti/a Ph.1.312.

gu^nai-ma^nh/s, e/s, = gunaikomanh/s,
mad for women, Il.3.39, h.Bacch. 17, Ael.NA15.14, Q.S.1.726:—in late Ep. gu^nai-mane/wn, as if a part., ib. 735, Nonn.D.2.125, al.
making women mad, Hsch.

gu/naios [u^], a, on, = gunaikei=os, g. dw=ra presents
made to a woman, Od.11.521.15.247; fuh\ gunai/h Mosch.2.45. Subst. gu/naion, to/,
little woman, term of endearment for a wife, Ar.V.610, Th.792: more freq. in a contemptuous sense,
weak woman, And.1.130, etc.; gunai/ou pra=gu' e)poi/ei D.25.57, cf. Arist.EN1171b10: but simply, = gunh/, Aen.Tact.2.6, D.S.17.24, J.AJ1.12.4, al., Ph.1.99, al., Plu. Pel.9.

gu/nandros [u^], on,
of doubtful sex, womanish, S.Fr.963, Ael.Fr.10, 290. of a woman,
virago, Ph.1.183,2.379.

gu^nh/, Dor. guna/, Boeot. bana/ (v. sub voce), h(, gen. gunaiko/s, acc. gunai=ka, voc. gu/nai （gunh/ Alc.Com.32): dual gunai^ke S.Ant.61: pl. gunai=kes, gunaikw=n, etc. (as if from gu/naic wh. is only found in Gramm., cf. Hdn.Gr.2.643): gen. gunaikei/wn Phoc.3 (s. v.l.): Aeol. dat. pl. gunai/kessi Sapph.Supp.7.6: Com. acc. gunh/n Pherecr.91: pl. nom. gunai/ Philippid.2, Men.484, acc. guna/s Com.Adesp.1336, cf. EM243.24,AB86:—
woman, opp.
man,Il.15.683, etc.: with a second Subst., g. tami/h housekeeper, 6.390; de/spoina Od.7.347; grhu+/s (q. v.), a)letri/s (q. v.), dmw|ai\ gunai=kes Il.9.477,al.; *persi/des g. Hdt.3.3: voc., as a term of respect or affection,
mistress, lady, E.Med.290, Theoc.15.12, etc.; fanti\ gunai=kes
the lasses say, Id.20.30; pro\s gunaiko/s like
a woman, A.Ag.592: prov., g. monwqei=s' ou)de/n Id.Supp. 749; o(/rkous gunaiko\s ei)s u(/dwr gra/fw (cf. gra/fw 11) S.Fr.811; gunaici\ ko/smon h( sigh\ fe/rei Id.Aj.293.
wife, spouse, Il.6.160, Od.8.523, Hdt.1.34, etc.; g. kai\ parqe/noi X.An.3.2.25; opp. e(tai/ra, Is.3.13; g. gnhsi/a, PEleph.1.3 (iv B. C.); also,
concubine, Il.24.497.
mortal woman, opp.
goddess, 14.315, Od.10.228, etc.
female, mate of animals, Arist.Pol.1262a22 (dub. sens.), Xenarch.14, etc.— Not to be taken as Adj. in gunai=ka qh/sato mazo/n Il.24.58. (Cf. Ved.
gnā- (freq. disyll.), Skt.
janis.）

gu/nnis, idos, o(,
a womanish man, podapo\s o( g.; of Bacchus, A.Fr. 61, cf. Theoc.22.69 (s.v.l.), Ael.VH12.12, Lib.Or.64.49. = i(/ppouris, Ps.-Dsc.4.46,47.
gu/on, to/, = gu/hs, Sch.Od.18.374.
gu/os, o(, = gu/hs 11, PLips.106.16 (i A. D.), PTeb.373.7 (ii A. D.), etc.
gu_p-aieu/s, e/ws, o(, title of Apollo, Conon 35.5.

gu_p-a^le/ktwr, oros, o(,
vulture-cock, fabulous bird, PMag.Berol.2.18.

gu_p-a/rion, to/, Dim. of sq.,
nest, cranny, Ar.Eq.793.

gu/ph [u_], h(,
vulture's nest, Hsch.; koi/lwma gh=s, qala/mh, gwni/a, Id.
gu_piai=os, a, on, = gu/pinos, Tz.H.12 No.439tit.

gu_p-ia/s, a/dos, h(,
vulture-haunted, pe/tra A.Supp.796(lyr.).

gu_/p-inos, h, on,
of a vulture, pte/ruc Luc.Icar.11.
gu_po-gi/gas [i^], antos, o(, in pl., 'men of prey', Marin.Procl. 15.

gu_po-eidh/s, es,
vulture-like: to\ g. Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.12.

gu_pw/dhs, es, = gupoeidh/s,
hooknosed, Arist.Phgn.808b7.
gu/pwnes, oi(, dancers at Sparta, Poll.4.104.

gu_ra/leos [a^], a, on, = guro/s,
rounded, curved, Opp.C.1.57.

gurga^qi/on, to/, Dim. of sq., in Alchemy,
net for suspending substances in fluids, PHolm.18.17.

gurga^qo/s (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.145, but gu/rgaqos in Mss.), o(,
wicker-basket, creel, Ar.Fr.217, Aen.Tact.18.6, Timo38, Luc. DMeretr.14.2; of the
net woven by phalangia, Arist.HA555b10;
cage for insane patients, Paul.Aeg.3.14: prov., gurgaqo\n fusa=n, of labour in vain, Aristaen.2.20:—also gurgaqo/n, to/, BGU1092.29 (iv A. D.); cf. gergaqo/s.

gu_reu/w,
run round in a circle, Str.6.1.8: c. acc. cogn., kampth=ras Babr.29.4.

gu_rhto/mos, on,
tracing a circle, au)=lac AP9.274 (Phil.).

gu_ri/nh, h(, a kind of
cake, Luc.Trag.158.

gu^ri=nos (so Hdn.Gr.1.183) or gu/ri_nos, o(,
tadpole, [ba/traxos] g. Pl.Tht.161d, cf. Arat.947; xei/rous guri/nwn oi( r(h/tores Lib.Decl.26.36.

gu^ri_nw/dhs, es
like a tadpole, Arist.HA568a1.

gu/rios [u_], a, on, (guro/s)
circular, round, li/mnh Anon. ap. Suid.

gu=ris, ews, h(,
the finest meal, Dsc.2.85, Sor.1.118, Ath.3.115d, POxy.520.12 (ii A. D.):—also gu/rios, prob. in PSI4.428.44 (iii B.C.), cf.
girius, = farina, pollen, Gloss.

gu_r-isto/s, h/, o/n,
rounded, curved, Sch.Philostr.p.579B.

gu_r-i/ths [i_] (sc. a)/rtos), ou, o(,
bread of the finest meal, Gp.20.41, Hsch.

gu_ro-dro/mos, on,
running round in a circle, pe/tros a millstone, AP9.20.

gu_ro-eidh/s, e/s,
like a circle, round. Adv. -dw=s Dsc.2.173.

gu_ro/qen, Adv.
in a circle, [Lib.] Descr.30.14.
gu_ro/mantis, ews, o(, （gu=ris） = a)leuro/mantis, dub. l. in Artem.2.69.

gu_ro/s, a/, o/n,
rounded, curved, crooked, guro\s e)n w)/moisi
round- shouldered, Od.19.246, cf. D.H.14.10, Hymn.Is.29; ke/ras, a)/gkistra, AP6.255 (Eryc.), 28 (Jul.); ko/nis, of a tomb, ib.7.180 (Apollonid.); g. pa/lh, i.e. wrestling, Philostr.Gym.11: Comp. -o/teros Ael.NA4.34.

gu=r-os, o(,
ring, circle, Plb.29.11.5; g. ou)ranou=, gh=s, LXXJb.22.14, Is.40.22; perh. an
ornament, bangle, Men.334.
trench made round a tree, Thphr.CP3.4.1, Orph.Fr.280.4; gu/rous periska/yas Alciphr.3.13.
gurteu/s: a)nakrwto/fonos, Hsch. gurto/n: sku/fon, Id.

gu/r-wsis [u_], ews, h(,
making of a gu=ros, POxy.1631.11 (iii A.D.), Gp.2.46.4.

gur-wte/on,
one must surround with a gu=ros, tou\s o)fqalmou/s ib.5.21.2.
gu=s, written for gu/os, PLond.1.131r.82, al. (i A. D.).

gu/y, gu_po/s, o( （h( only as v.l. in Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.12), Ep. dat. gu/pessi Il.11.162:—
vulture, prob. including several species, 22.42, E.Tr.599, Arist.HA563a5, etc.
guy-emplasth/s, ou=, o(, = guywth/s, Zonar.

guy-emplastiko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to plasterers, Phlp.
inAPo.382.16.

guy-i/zw,
plaster with gypsum, PMag.Lond.46.360.

guy-ikh/, h(,
tax on plasterers, BGU471.15, PFay.23a.

gu/y-inos, h, on,
made of gypsum, a)galma/tion EM530.15. g., to/,
room plastered with gypsum, BGU 1028.88 (ii A. D.).
guy-i/on, to/, = gu/yos, Stud.Pal10.259 (vi A. D.).

guy-ismo/s, o(,
plastering with gypsum, BGU952.8 (pl., ii/iii A. D.).
guyoeidh/s, e/s, = guyw/dhs, Paul.Aeg.6.21.

gu/yos, h(,
chalk, Hdt.7.69, Pl.Phd.110c.
gypsum, Thphr. Lap.64, BGU952.8 (ii/iii A. D.).
cement, Thphr.Lap.65, Ph. Bel.79.5; e)n gu/yw| kei/menos embedded in
cement, D.S.2.10, Arr.An. 2.21.4.

guy-o/w,
rub with chalk, chalk over, Hdt.3.24,8.27, Polyaen.6.18.1.
plaster with gypsum, Gp.4.15.13.

guy-w/dhs, es,
chalky, ga/la Sor.1.91, cf. Eust.1304.27.

gu/y-wsis, ews, h(,
plastering, Gp. 6 Arg.18.

guy-wth/s, ou=, o(,
plasterer, EM811.36.

guy-wto/s, h/, o/n,
plastered, Hsch. s.v. titanwth/.
gw=, coined by Gramm., as etym. of xwrw=, gasth/r, gunh/, gwruto/s, etc., El.Gud. s.v. gegw=sa, cf. EM244.6, Philox. ap. Orion39.
gwgga/mh, = gagga/mh, Hsch. gwgw/nh: fa/rugc, Id.

gwleo/s, o(,
a hole, Arist.HA603a6 (v.l. fwleo/s);

gwlio/s, Hsch.: heterocl. pl., fwleiou= u(po\ gwlea/ Nic.Th.125; gwleia/ Lyc.376. (Cf. Lith.
guõlis 'lair'.)
gw=n, Ion. for gou=n,

gwni/a, h(,
corner, angle, Hdt.1.51, Pl.Men.84d, etc.; g. e)pi/pedos, sterea/,
plane, solid angle, Euc.1 Def.8,11Def.11; ai( pro\s th=| ba/sei g.
the angles at the base, Id.1.5; h( u(po\ *b*a*g or u(po\ tw=n *b*a*g g.
the angle *b*a*g, Id.1.9,al. metaph.,
corner, secluded spot, e)n gwni/a| yiquri/zein Pl.Grg.485d; e)n g. pepragme/non Act.Ap.26.26. of the four
quarters of the compass, Ptol.Tetr.29.
joint, Arist.PA 690a13.
joiner's square, Pl.Phlb.51c, Plu.Marc.19.
cutwater of a bridge, D.S.2.8. of persons,
leader, chief, LXX 1 Ki.14.38. (Akin to go/nu.）

gwni-a/zw,
place at an angle, Porph.
inCat.132.31.

gwni-ai=os, a, on,
on or
at the angle, li/qos LXXJb.38.6, cf. IG12.372.19; stuli/s D.H.3.22; me/ros tei/xous J.BJ5.3.5; also gwnih/i+os BCH26.64 (Delph.).
angular, g. r(h=ma, i. e. hard to pronounce, Pl.Com.67.

gwni-ako/s, h/, o/n,
angular, of, in or
at angles, sumbolai/ Procl. in Euc.p.129F.; ko/smoi Id.in Ti.1.454D.; o)dou/s Sch.Ar.Pl.1059. Adv. -kw=s, g. kai\ e)pipe/dws Procl.in Ti.2.217D.

gwni-asmo/s, o(,
squaring off corners, Lys.Fr.61; name of a
proposition in geometry, Hsch.: metaph., e)pw=n gw)niasmoi/
finishing of verses
by square and rule, Ar.Ra.956.
gwni/dion, to/, Dim. of gwni/a, Luc.Nec.17, M.Ant.3.10.

gwnio-bo/mbuc, u_kos, o(,
one that buzzes in a corner, nickname of Grammarians, Herodic. ap. Ath.5.222a.

gwnio-eidh/s, e/s,
angular, Arist.GC319b14, Thphr.HP1.10.1, al. (gwno- codd.). PHib.1.16.42 (Thphr.(?)).

gwnio/-omai, Pass.,
become angular, Dsc.3.7; gegwniwme/na sxh/mata Procl.in Euc.p.163F.

gwnio-poie/omai,
form into an angle:—Pass., Erot. s.v. e)ggw/nios ph=xus.
gwnio/-pous, o(, h(,

gwnio/-poun, to/, gen. podos,
crook-footed, D.L.9.116.

gw/nios, = gwniako/s, ei)/dh Theol.Ar.3 (s. v.l.);
angular, sfuri/dia PKlein.Form.321.4 (vi A. D.).

gwnio/fullos, on,
with pointed leaves, Thphr.HP1.10.5.
gwni/-wma, atos, to/, = gwni/a, Eust.1082.28.
gwni/-wsis, ews, h(, name for a pulse, coined by Archig. ap. Gal.9.324.

gwni-wto/s, h/, o/n,
angular, Paul.Aeg.6.88.
gwnoeidh/s, e/s, = gwnio-, Democr. ap. Thphr.Sens.65, freq. written in codd. of Thphr.

gw=nop, = gwni/a（Lacon.), Hsch. gwnori/smata: gnwri/smata, topoqesi/ai, Id. gw=nos: gouno/s, e(/dos, kai\ paidia/ tis palaistrikh/, oi( de\ kw/ph, Id. gw/numos: ferw/numos, Id. gw=os: mnhmei=on, Id. gwrou=tai: sarkoi= (Lacon.), Id.

gwru_to/s, o( （h( AP6.34 (Rhian.)),
quiver, a)po\ passa/lou ai)/nuto to/con au)tw=| gwrutw=| Od.21.54, cf. Lyc.458, AP6.34 (Rhian.), J.BJ3.5.5, Luc.Herc.1, Q.S.3.35; g. plh/reis o)i+stw=n Anon. ap. Suid., cf.EM244.7; wrongly expld. as
bow-case, Apollon.Lex., Eust.1898.21.
gw/y: koloio/s (Maced.), Hsch.
